NuFace has been on my radar for some time, and I have used galvanic response systems for years - the technology has evolved, but this has been used in motion picture/TV studios for decades (like a LOT of them, even before "my day" LOL).You can also find treatments in salons and spa places at around $85-120 per treatment, with a 7-12  treatment plan suggested. The equipment may look fancier, but NuFace is using the same FDA approved experience. And the SAME results, I might add.If you go to the gym regularly to tone your body, this is the same concept - I do think some instant ( but temporary) results can be seen, particularly in the brow area- but watch out Cinderella/Cinderfella - you DO need to use it regularly to see the long-lasting cumulative BEST results.  Trust me on this.You will feel your muscles twitch/tingle, but no real pain, this is a workout for your face. With regular use, you will find what is best for you. As a general rule, everything should go UP. (No training the face to go down, please!).The gel is important, and works well-- very high-quality, and I suggest you DO use it. In a pinch, in-between  gel orders, you may use 100% Aloe Vera Gel, but best results will be found with NuFace gel.I love the re-chargeable cordless feature, and when you get it, you will KNOW it is quality.  Not unlike a luxe cleanser machine that starts with a "C"- the knock offs do NOT really compare, or last.Perfect for women, but as I am a guy- I will address that.If you feel a bit down, looking good, but wanted to re-capture the look you had when you were younger, consider this.  Perhaps it is a audition, a job-interview, or a class-reunion.  A photo-op, a wedding or just some good feeling everyday luxury, which you deserve.  You don't need injections/fillers (yuck) you need to tone, and firm that face.Give yourself a two-week challenge: Take a photo on day one, and use it for a week, take another photo, then use it every other day for a week.Take yet another photo, and see the results.If you don't care for it ( but I think you WILL) simply return it to Amazon.  This will work, if you give it a try. The Studio Secret, brought home!

Okay, I have tried MANY self-tanners, some better than others, and this is about as close to perfect! The well designed mitt that comes with the product makes application a breeze. No more tell-tale "tan" between your fingers that you have to scrub off! Yeah!Some self- tanners can make your skin dry or tight, not this one. The color looks natural, NOTHING "orange" here. I suggest a light application for the first time, then go back and apply more if you crave a darker look. Another huge PLUS is the scent - It does not smell like any self-tanner I have ever used- this definitely brings to mind  mixed citrus and grapefruit, non of that typical fake-bake smell.Packaging is unisex, and I tested this on my fair skin, as well as on a lady friend in my apt. building with medium to fair skin. She agreed this was the best self-tanning product she had ever tried.I am on a health routine, and run every morning, but the white legs bugged me, a light application worked perfectly, a running buddy even said, you look toned! Ha ha, same legs with XEN-TAN, my friends.Well worth the consideration, and I know price may be a concern, but this is the gold standard.  I will order more!

I was not as familiar with this brand as I was with Roomba, which I bought several years ago.  I find the shape of the Neato to be superior, and YES it can very easily get the baseboard area's and corners that Roomba missed due to its circular shape.Set up was a breeze, and it navigated quite will in my apartment, which had obstacles that confuse the Roomba a bit - like under my coffee table which is glass - Neato took a look at it , scanned the area, and went to work, no problems!Nice weight and power to this unit too, and it is not particularly loud, or bump into things very frequently. I am very impressed! As with all the 'bot vacuums, they are good, but do NOT totally replace a nice corded upright unit for big jobs, but I like the notion that I can trust Neato to effortlessly give the apartment a once-over every three days or so, without me lifting a finger.

Superior recording ability in a very compact size!  This looks and feels like a regular flash drive,  but it can record sounds with amazing clarity. I was provided with a review sample, and am glad I was, as it is easy to operate and works well in most conditions.Great for taking voice notes and documenting a business meeting, so handy!  The charge time is quick and fast, and you can easily go for days before another fast re-charge is needed.Great for just about anyone from 6 to 96! How many times have you wished to record something quickly, but lacked an easy-to-use device? One button operation, it is either ON or it is NOT.  Ultra easy to use

This one comes in a nicely designed jar that almost looks like an energy drink.I LIKED the information on the bottle, clear and easy to understand, and research if you desire to do so. After about two weeks or so of use, I like it. I started with 1/2 the suggested dose, as I was concerned about feeling "jittery" - which some products do.I used it in a watermelon/celery/kale/strawberry drink that I  do each morning and afternoon in a blender, one of the loud ones, designed to extract/pulverize stuff into a smoothie.I had NO jitters in the first 3 days and  went to the suggested dose over 4 days.  I did feel an energy-lift, and focus, I felt better.  I did not crave cola's *with or without sugar* in the afternoons.As for weight loss, I am running, trying to eat in a healthier way, and average about losing 1lb per week ( okay, I have been known to cheat on food and drink, at times....LOL... can we say fried mozzarella and a glass of grape-juice, AKA wine...).After using this product, I am seeing 1.5 pounds a week in weight-loss, which is impressive, in my particular case.  As with any diet supplement, share the information with your health-care professional.  I did, and it is working!  Well worth your consideration.

Perfect hydrating mask!  I found the skin to be rejuvenated, and ready for HD make-up, as their is a lifting component. Great for on-camera work.The under-eye area is tightened after one use, and offers long term benefits, after a few weeks of use. All of the Phyto 5 products are good, and  are in pro-make-up kits.Used on it's own, you look better, and a bit younger- perfect for guys going to a reunion or social event.  Or a job interview.This a bit of every day luxury that works the 1st time, and gets better!

Nice and sleek looking and it is an upgrade from the previous model. Packaging is nice, and certainly SECURE.  If you are giving this as a gift, the ONLY instructions ( and I do mean ONLY) are to download the app.  Once you do that you are in business. I had no problem pairing to an HTC One running Lollipop.It seems pretty accurate, though in the first few day's it was choppy at best - I DO think the device "learns" how you move , sleep and such, far more accurate on day 3 than day one, in my case. I really LIKE the "Smart Coach" feature, after a few weeks it has yet to repeat anything.I am currently on a weight-loss/look better/ feel better program - and I do find this particular product to be motivational. I have found the battery life to be around 3 days, with my usage.As a rule, Jawbone makes quality products, and this is no exception. The key here, is the interaction with the app, if you do your part, it will do it's part.

Very nice product with a high-end, box and packaging  (including a case) that make this idealI had no problem paring this to an HTC One , iPad ,and even my laptop.  Sound quality is good to great. I like the selection of earbud sizes as well, a plus. So far, I like this better than some BEATS buds that I have, Very rich bass sound.Charging was simple, and FAST.  The controls are easy to use, and intuitive.  Sound quality for calls was better than expected. I was provided with this unit for review purposes, which are honest and genuine.As others have noted, opening the charging port can be a bit of a challenge the first time, but kind of self-corrects -not a huge issue for me.The ease of use and the quality make this a top choice for gifting, be it a teenager or senior ( or those in-between ). This WILL be a gift that will be used, for a bit of everyday luxury.

Very BRIGHT, and only 7 watts, giving the performance of a 60-75W bulb. I had some older style ( and ugly-ish) compact fluorescent units  for the chandelier, from 6 or more years ago, and never had particularly good crisp light.  They were NOT "dimmable" either-- just "off and on". And, It took them a while to "warm-up"!Flash-forward a few years, and you can have brilliant, dimmable LED's from LOHAS.  Smaller and far brighter than what I had ( I can now, ...ahem.. see CLEARLY that I need to dust the chandelier more!). It is over my glass dining table, and colors "pop" in a pleasing way - a green salad with beefsteak tomatoes, romaine lettuce, red onions and sourdough croutons looked like a magazine photo shoot!  Taco's looked great as well! ( and the Sangria, with fresh colorful fruit, home-made!)The lights are a significant "upgrade".  I was provided with a sample, for an honest review, and will be buying another set of three for my chandelier.  One note: The aluminum part of the light has a modern "industrial" look when viewed at a close distance - I like it, and think it adds to the look.High quality, caring packaging, and FAST Amazon Prime delivery is another plus. Depending upon use, the units are rated for 30K hours - that's probably years of energy-saving bright light for most people. Well worth your consideration, for a bit of every-day luxury.

Nice smaller unit, with more than enough power -- I was amazed ( and embarrassed) by the amount of dirt/dust on some curtains, and the furniture.  I mean they 'looked' clean, but the proof was in the cyclonic chamber - very enlightening!This is PERFECT for carpeted stairs, and well worth the price of admission, were one only to use it for that task. The wand is light, the cord is long, and you have continuous power to get the job done - unlike the nice enough hand-held rechargeable I had been using for that effort. There is a reason my carpeted stairs looked half-done: They were, as I always had to stop and re-charge.I like the simplicity of this unit, out of the box, it makes sense, no fooling around weird-o assembly. The instructions were well written, concise and easy to understand.Does well on bare floors and low-pile carpeting, as well.  The compact size make it ideal for apartments, dorm room's, or to clean out the car( admit, you probably need to, I sure did!).The filters are washable, and appear to be high-quality as well.  Of course, being bag-less is a plus, once the canister is getting full, you can easily empty it - just put the canister IN the trash bag, release the dirt and you are all set.A great complement to your "big" vacuum, or depending upon your living space and need's - this could easily be your main unit. Bissell is a brand that has been in my family for decades, and is a brand you can trust- I have had a Bissell carpet cleaner for over 5 years, and it is still going strong, and saving me money.If you are in gift giving mode, or perhaps want to reward yourself with a bit of everyday luxury, you will like this one. The ease of use and compact size might be of particular interest for student's going off to college, and certainly for seniors who may have some mobility issues that can preclude the use of the big machines. I like gifts that people actually USE, and the Bissell OptiClean is one of them.Well worth your consideration.

Terrific product, I have used it frequently.Nice for adults too, as you can freeze healthy all-natural pops using a good blender. Strawberry/Banana/Cream is terrific! Yum! If you are in themood for a bit more, try frozen sangria! Super easy to use, and the bright colors are festive in the freezer. The quality of the silicone is good and it does not "smell" like some products do.Might be fun as a "just because" gift item too-- packaging is high-end, and the product itself is superior to others-- remember the old hard plastic one's from the 70's? You DESERVE an upgrade!.

Comfortable for a run, but ( at least in my case), were a bit larger then expected. Probably will order again, but go down a size (or two) - Must have been swayed by some reviewers that said they ran small. Lots of "room" with the elastic waistband.  Pretty well made, quality material, with good solidly sewn seams.Comfortable to run in, somewhat reminds me of shorts that were common in the late 1970s' to the 80's - be aware you are wearing SHORT shorts.Should go without saying, but the material can be a bit transparent, which may or may not be an issue  > The liner is made of the same material as the short itself, and ..ahem.. offers no "support" if ya get me.

Pretty  much  of a life-saver.  Replaced a Comcast item, which saves money.Easy to install,  even with a call to Comcast (not as bad, as before).  Links with ease to  an HTC One, iPad, as well a preforming in a spectacular  way with the cable system. A bit bigger than expected, but  we are talking quality here. Without question, the fastest, and BEST  net connection I have ever had.I called Linksys customer service once, had a 1 minute hold time I would  give it  6 stars - GREAT customer service.I now have a faster connection , and am saving money. Best-in-class product, and I am far from an 'expert' in setting things up --  but did it.

Bought this on a whim, at a store , in the wine aisle ( hum, consider my mood!).I certainly should have shopped at Amazon, price wise, but... BIG MISTAKE!  The spheres are nice enough, average build, but one had the silicone "top" detached, and after 10 minutes of trying to get it back on, I gave up. Just filled it up, and put it in the freezer. It worked.End result was good, with or without the cap.  I just wanted them to work perfectly.  They do NOT leak as some do.  For that alone, I would support this brand.Kind of a novelty item, but people seem to like them with Whisky or in a BIG martini glass.  The build/hinge suggests this will be a replaceable item, but that is to be expected.

Just perfect, and I have tried a LOT of chargers.Many, if not MOST do not do a good job with an iPad, offering a limited charge - not the case with this charger. Perfect charge on the go, to 98% , and it probably would have gone to 100% had I not needed to use the iPad.As expected, it did a terrific job with my HTC One, and  several speakers.  This would be a terrific add-on, as a gift for most anyone, from teen's to seniors.The packaging is high-end, and the "feel" or "hand" of the product  suggests quality. Heavier than some low-quality chargers, but still perfect for the briefcase, back pack or purse.  An EXTREMELY popular item at airports/rail stations where outlets can be hard to find.  Want to meet people? Use THIS product!  You WILL have "new friends" -- trust me.Perfect add-on for a new tablet or cell phone purchase.  Though I was provided with one gratis, for review purposes, I can assure you I use this every other day or so, and find it to VITAL on-the-road, where it is used daily.  It works BETTER then some other chargers ( forget the "lipstick" case one's, other than in an emergency)It holds a full charge for days, which is nice.  Re-charge time is not bad either, and simple- several methods to do that.Style, form and function.  Really my go-to charger.

I really love this, for the bike, and it works well. Ease of use is key, it is pretty much snap-on, and go. Much higher quality  than expected.I use it most every day.  The stability of the unit is impressive - be it rain or mud it still works like a champion! I did get this as a review product for an honest review, but this is outstanding in form and function.  Great build, and sturdy.,

Great colors, and perfect fit! I plan to get more!They wash well, no color transfer, nor much shrinkage.  Ultra high quality, and just fine for wearing in the gym, unlike other brands, that can be a bit "much".Great under running or b-ball shorts. Just a nice well-made product.
Amazing product, so EASY to apply.  Very much unlike other versions.High end packaging, but bottom line, it worked-- no fooling around with "bubbles" , and making mistakes.  Ideal!

Perfect for a new cell phone for a senior parent -could not have been easier, and what an upgrade to a new pre-paid smart phone. I like this brand, and trust it, have used the brand for years, myself.Works like a charm, no weird re-formatting  issues.  It is NICE when things work , with NO problems!Update 4/18/15  Dad is LOVING this! What a terrific add-on.

Really (REALLY) nice area rug, lighter than in the pictures.  Ultra-soft, with a nice backing, no sliding around! Talk about an instant upgrade to a room! Big, but manageable by one person.Thick and soft, it covered my ancient beige wall to wall  by a coffee table and the TV with ease.  A delight to walk on.  Form, function and design are perfect. No horrible "new carpet scent" either, I know you will appreciate that.  No need to air out the place after you lay it down.Because I am inquisitive, and it is not "unknown" to spill things here - I thought I might test out the Stainmaster, even though it was brand new.I deliberately poured a glass of cola, and a glass grape juice on the carpet, let them sit there for 10 minutes, and waited to see what would happen.I am lucky enough to have a Bissell carpet cleaner, but hardly needed it.The cola came up (and out) with some microfiber towels, and shockingly, so did the grape juice!  Amazing!  Since I had it out, I did a quick pass or two with the Bissell to be sure, but it came out clear. Impressive.Stainmaster came through like a true champion.The colors are muted, classic, and probably would be a good fit  for most decors.I would not hesitate buying this as a gift for a 1st year college student, or a senior in need of an area rug to freshen-up a room. Really, most anyone would like this.  It is rare to find an item , that is so nice, and will be used, by most anyone.  Terrific quality. Well worth your consideration.Kind of nice as a bit of everyday luxury for yourself, if you are not in a gifting mode, too.

Judging by other reviews, I went up a size, and was pleased with the fit. Certainly not for anyone "shy" but fun for what they are, and lounge around in.  Much better quality than expected, considering the low price. Ultra-fast shipping, a full 28 days FASTER then the last expected arrival date.Though purchased for a funny shoot ( no, not "that" kind of film...LOL ) the shorts are best for guys that are slim and fit, to really wear out in the wild.  Very low rise, and certainly not baggy like some mesh shorts! I am 6ft, 170 and they actually looked okay with a t-shirt.Also very short, as expected, but comfortable.  For MOST guys, you will probably wear them under something.  The design has a bit of a shape-enhancing effect, for those who might want to know. The "jock" part inside tends to ..ahem... lift and create a noticeable bulge, which is probably part of the design/desire the manufacturer intended.They were okay in the wash, and then hang dry.  Could be your "Magic Mike Moment"...Enjoy, if you dare!

Better than expected, and a perfect fit. Ultra fast shipping, all components were high quality, and the screen protector was easy to apply.Easy to hold, and gives your phone a rugged style. Will add some weight, but also security. Perfectly designed product.

Really more of a coral color than say red-flame.Exceptional quality, I have never had a nicer set -- the dinner plates are huge, and can even be placed in the oven- which I did when making a frittata, with a perfect result.  The plates have a higher lip than traditional plates, giving you a non-traditional, yet attractive look.I know this is funny to say, but the weight, quality, form and function reminds me of what you might find in a trendy restaurant. The set is not "commercial" , but is special.The bowls work for soup, salad or perhaps fresh fruit. The salad plates could be used as dinner plates for many people. The cups/mugs are large too, and have substantial weight. Work perfectly with a Keurig or Tassimo, if you have one.Quite an upgrade to my current dinnerware, and impressive looking on the table.I could easily see this as an ideal wedding gift, to "empty nester" seniors, or even as some everyday luxury for yourself.  Really nice quality.

Super Selfie results with a remote!Better quality than some, with a remote Bluetooth that pairs easily with my HTC One, and iPad.  Pictures do  look better at an angle, and this works like a charm.Packaging and instructions are top-notch, making for a good gift, or a bit of luxury for yourself.  When I use this, people always say "Where did you get that"  I used today, in fact.I like the ease of use , as well as form and function, this is a good one. Easy to secure the phone ( about 15  seconds) , and then you are ready to shoot, in a semi-pro way. Shooting ABOVE the head tends to give a  flattering look--try it.  (Trust Me, I work in the industry).I like the remote, as well - you can frame your shot, and just "click" to shoot, so easy, and intuitive.This is a  very nice, well made product, and one that is easy to use.  I did receive this as review sample, but I plan to get more.  Even my senior parents  ( in their 70's) loved this- there are many "selfie sticks" out there , but this is one of the best.

How NICE to see this off Rx, and available to all!Flonase was prescribed to me many years ago, and kept me allergy-free. I did the Rx by mail thing, but still had to go to the Dr. for refill's - along with a co-pay. EXPENSIVE.I tend to use Flonase in the spring, summer and fall, rather than all year.  Without question, this product WORKS. The ease of use/results, compared to a pill or another spray is nice, and the end-result is sensational. Packaging and instructions are top-tier, as you might expect.Feeling good is an expectation with most allergy products, feeling GREAT is what you get with Flonase.From a strictly cosmetic angle, Flonase tends to diminish the "puffy eye" area, and make you look better. ( That has been my experience). This is one terrific product!

Really a lovely item, particularly if you are a hard-wired Waterford collector.The candlestick is weighty, and unique. This is one that some will say is over-the-top, either you love it or you don't. (I DO!).  This is not a piece that will be ignored by guests or friends , people gravitate towards this sparkler.Waterford has made the Seahorse candlesticks off and on over the years, and they are rare. I have seen them used on-set in movie and television productions - one TV show that I worked on recently centered on people of vast wealth, where being BAD never looked so GOOD! Yup they had the  Waterford Seahorse candlesticks!Of course, this would be a perfect gift, but after seeing the product you may well want to keep it for yourself.  High-end packaging completes the look.

Love the lime color, but I love the power more! Style, form and function at its best!The unit is quick to charge, and is a powerhouse. I have used this regularly to charge a Kindle FIRE HDX, and my trusty HTC One (M7) with power to spare.I have tried many chargers over the past couple of years, but this is truly one of the best. I think this would be a terrific gift for most anyone who might be hard to buy for - or perhaps just for yourself. Great packaging, instructions, and best of all, it WORKS!

Very nice collection of recipes for Nutribullet or similar products out there. A handy book to have around, at a very attractive price.What I like BEST about the book is the organization  of the chapters, and that the ingredients are things that real people might have in real homes, or find in a real/typical store!This book happens to focus on Weight Loss, Detox, and Anti-Aging - something for everyone!Every recipe I have tried is good, but I REALLY like "Wrinkle Fighting Smoothie" on page 57, and the "Aloe Vera Lemonade Smoothie" on page 94. Those ALONE are worth the price of admission!  Were you to be lucky enough to find either in a the local "smoothie store" you would easily spend MORE than the cost of this book!

Pretty amazing unit, one that works BETTER than expected. I was offered this product for review purposes, and I do like it.Over the past 2 weeks , it has come in handy to document the 1st snow ( in my area) of 2015, create a few video messages, and have some fun in the office, and even on a boat trip across the river ( yes, it performed well in cold conditions)Set up was a breeze, and the picture quality was far better than expected, particularly if you do not move it around too much - let your subjects move!Very quick to charge, and for those in secret-agent mode, it looks and feels exactly like a high-end pen. In daylight the picture was amazing, with true RICH colors, spot-on perfect. Audio quality far exceeded expectations, as well.Packaging is nice, and rather luxurious - the box is high quality, with a magnetic closure, which is a nice touch, particularly for travel.I like the convenience of having a camera that you can slip into a pocket with ease.  Easier, and far more discreet than a cellphone or tablet camera. This is the way to go, perhaps at a speech, or event. It is FUN to use!  And, the "wow" factor will be there, when you show it to others, they will ask you where you got it. Trust me!From a  gifting perspective, this is a slam-dunk - from teen's to seniors, pretty much anyone would have fun with this. The ease of use is key to me- this is uncomplicated. The look is top-notch.  Really well made, and unique.

I received this product as a sample, for an honest review.I admit, though I am pretty experienced in supplements, I took it s l o w.  One cap the 1st day, then two the next , then three. ( I admit, 4 a day is perfect for me, now, though the instructions suggest 3-6) .What an amazing, and positive difference after a few weeks! I really appreciated the documentation sent with the product, too.After just a few days, I felt BETTER.  After a couple of weeks, I feel GREAT! Better than I have in years, in fact!I take two in the morning, blending it into a iced coffee drink, and take two capsules before lunch. Works for me.The clarity, after a month or so, is quite remarkable, and to tell the truth, somewhat unexpected.  I feel sharper, and  significantly more relaxed in high-stress situations.  After reading the information on this product, and doing research, I think this is best-in-class - I felt an improvement on day 3, and the results appear to be cumulative.Packaging is high-end, and the documentation is science, which is proven.  Honestly, best of all, are the results -  you FEEL better. Priceless!A  happy "side-effect" ( for me, at least ) was the positive change in my skin - not only was I feeling better, I was LOOKING better!  Even skin tone, to go along with an even mood.There is a clarity at work ( and I work in a high-pressure environment) , a true-feeling of less STRESS, and greater FOCUS.While I will not call it a "Genie In A Bottle" , it has certainly worked for me!The looking better part, was a welcome, and "unexpected" PLUS!

Nice product, if used properly- a LITTLE  bit goes a long way.Very similar to some very high-end brands out there, as well as products used for professional TV and Movie shoots. Do keep in mind the results are pretty instant, they are temporary - there are other products out there that offer long-term results.This is for a photo-shoot, a job interview, a class reunion, an event - when you need to look GREAT and a bit younger this is the one to go to.Perfect for the guys as well, use it full strength, or mix it with a moisturizer, and you will be good to go. Think of this as a "studio-secret".

Really nice product, solid build, great connecting cord that is not flimsy or cheap. From the get go, you will notice the high-end packaging, and guess what? A terrific instruction booklet!I am primarily using this on a Lenovo UltraBook  U410, and love having a hub, one that works so very well.  I have used this pretty frequently with flash drives, wireless mouse, external DVD drive, an HTC One and assorted other products.  Worked to perfection!  The blue light indicating the unit was "on" was NOT distracting, either.This might work well as a gift ( perhaps to yourself, you have been GOOD) for those who are a bit short on ports, it just makes everything EASIER.  Just perfect for a teen, a college student - and most welcome to seniors, who will love the plug-and-go ease of operation. No drivers to install, nothing complicated to be worried about.It just works!One of the IT guys in my office swears by the KingWin brand, for consistent quality, and superior build factors.Unlike some other brands, the connection to your laptop/device fits perfectly - to me this is key - REPLACING a USB port on an expensive unit due to damage from an inferior external device can be costly, to say the least.KingWin clearly understands this, and has made a high-quality product, one that you can trust and feel safe when using it.

Got this item, and unfortunately it had been damaged in shipping. I contracted InterDesign via email and within two hours had a nice reply, and several emails sales and marketing. They were very helpful, and clearly stand behind the product.  They sent a replacement, and I was good to go!The tension rod is substantial, and has a high-end look to it.  A little tricky to get it sized properly and to "lock it" but if you read the instructions and maybe look at the video, you should be fine. Be patient, and give yourself some time. The 45-90 is large, and you need room to work with it, and measure your space.Once in place, it looked GREAT - like a custom piece! Nothing cheap looking here. Seems quite sturdy, though I would not hang anything too heavy on it ( nor would I with any tension rod ).  I was very pleased with the result.  When you consider the cost of a custom rod, installation  this is one DIY project that will save you 100's.Just give yourself enough time to do it right!This is easy enough to do by yourself, but having two people working with the install might be a consideration.

When only the BEST will do, this should be your 1st choice.To be fair ( or a bit crazy ) this is an expensive unit, no question - but it CERTAINLY offers results that rival, or exceed the product that you find in a premium coffee retail shop.After using it for 30 days or so, I have learned to USE the unit, and create the best coffee I have ever had, coffee house or not. The manual is detailed, and well worth reading.While not heavy-heavy, the unit is substantial, around 20 pounds. It fits into my kitchen, under the cabinet with ease.  (smallish apartment here).  Set-up  was pretty easy, though I was almost intimidated by this "Rolls Royce" of the coffee world.  Would I screw it up? Do I DARE turn it on?I got over myself, and showed it to a neighbor who is a Barista.  1st comment was : YOU have THIS? It's the BEST!  Yup.We tried several functions, including the coffee "profile" - sublime!  The grinder function was loud, but powerful, with perfect results. Brewing was a bit quieter, not unlike other units.The quality of the brew was outstanding, using whole beans.  Similar result with ground coffee.  I felt good as a novice.  I am a fan of espresso( particularly in the morning) and was not disappointed. Perfection.I used the unit to make espresso ice cream, and cookies - a hit!  ( Sent the cookies to mom, with broken up dark chocolate squares on top).I am not a coffee genius, by a long shot.  But, that being said, this unit has made me try new beans, settings, and DELIGHT others.  (and show-off a bit).And, yes, the unit has more than a bit of style, and exclusivity.  Sometimes, everyday luxury is just what you need. Many people do not even know this unit is on the market, or how good it is.Considering  the cost of visiting a coffee shop, even 5 times a week, at 6 bucks a pop +/-, this becomes a value, very quickly.

Certainly the platinum standard in humidifiers - I rarely use it on "high". I reside in a 870 SQFT apartment.What a difference from the normal units one finds in stores -- significantly higher power , and a better build.  Somewhat complex , as it has a demineralization cartridge , the hydro cell filter, and a descale cleaner.That being said, it performs wonderfully, with no "white dust" or smells that other units have. I suffer with allergies, and wear extended wear contacts - which can be an issue in a too dry environment, particularly at night. I like the blue light, which you  can adjust.My "sweet spot" is about 50% humidity, which the unit tracked, and handled with ease. When I ran it on "high" I had a 70% level, which was too much for me, but I was amazed by the products ability to reach this level, quickly. ( My plants LOVED it, however!)Without being too gross, some humidifiers REALLY can get a "moldy" or "mildew" feel, over a short time. Not to mention the "white dust". Air-O-Swiss solves this. This is huge to me.Over the years, I have bought and DISCARDED humidifiers, after a single-season of use.  No doubt, this is an investment, but over-time, I think it will be a value.A friend saw mine, and immediately ordered one for a family member who is in the early stages of COPD - while this is NOT a medical device, it might help in such situations. What a terrific gift!

Just a terrific Bread Maker! This is a replacement for a West-Bend I bought almost 16 years ago (which still works) but I wanted a smaller footprint - I will move the older unit to another house.I LOVE the TWO dough paddles, and feel this tends to make a superior bread to the single-paddle units. This unit is somewhat lighter, and certainly takes up less space, but offers the yummy quality bread that West-Bend is known for.I noticed that the Hi-Rise does live up to expectations, compared to the earlier unit - even with sourdough!You can make simple breads in a breeze or get more creative.  I am a bit on the lazy side, and tend to go with basics- with outstanding results.Guy's, there is NOT A BETTER GIFT out there, be it for yourself, or others. Just a perfect gift for seniors, and college age people- this will create a "comfort-food" option and delicious aroma, that will be so welcome.Operation is super-simple for basic breads (which become artisan, because you make them!) - water, butter, flower/mix and yeast.  Then turn it on. We are talking a 60 second prep time. I bought a unit for a vision impaired parent - suddenly, perfect bread baking was again an option. Priceless.If you pick this up, perhaps add in some sourdough bread machine mix, or if you are in the mood, sourdough starter, you will love the results.Great Amazon price, and sensational two-paddle results!

Guys ( and ladies, for that matter), this one works like a charm.  I was introduced to this on a commercial shoot, by the hair and make up people.I have fine, thin hair that can be hard to manage, unless you use a TON of products. This one creates a full look - within seconds -, and is NOT sticky, nor does it have  a bad aroma. I have actually used LESS product to hold the style after using this!There are similar products out there that "plump" the hair, at a variety of price points ( many of which are significantly HIGHER priced than this one), but the Head and Shoulders version is the BEST that I have used.After you use this, your hair is noticeably fuller, thicker and will have a sleek shine - the product is essentially weightless, and  undetectable to others, your hair just looks thicker, and nicer.I was so impressed with this, I went out and bought a bottle for a friend, who has BIG TIME thinning hair issues - he was a skeptic, but within a minute or so, he was convinced - dramatic results! He looked better, younger, and had more self-confidence.I know the price can be a concern, but sometimes you DO get what you pay for, this is a top-of-the-line product, and is well worth the price of admission.I think this would be a welcome gift, as everyone wants shiny, healthy, full hair.  Though marketed to guys, I see no reason why women could not benefit from this as well.Just outstanding!

Very nice unit, and rather high-end packaging, making it perfect as a gift. I have had several back-up "Power Banks" at a variety of price points- this one is easily a CHAMPION.I like the size, the ease of portability, and 5000mAh is just perfect for my regular needs. I have used this with a 3rd Gen iPad and my trusty HTC ONE (M7) and have had terrific results. I probably use it every other day or so.To tell the truth, this may well be the best Power Bank I have used. I would not hesitate in recommending this unit.Nothing is worse then running out of power, when you NEED to use a device, be it a cell phone or tablet.  I consider this to be a bit of "insurance" - you will be happy to have it!

Very nice unit, and is really has even heat.  I bought it to have an "extra" burner, but now find it is my go-to method of cooking everything from steaks, stir-fry to soups.Of course having the right cookware is essential, if a magnet sticks to the bottom of the pan, the pan will work with induction , if not, it is a no go.Perfect for singles, college students and induction can easily be a safer way for seniors to cook ( in my opinion).The Nuwave PIC is super portable too, and that can be handy for serving/cooking at the table, camping and vacation homes.On television and film production sets, induction is a preferred method of cooking, from the craft service (snacks) to the full service catering trucks and set-ups.Getting an induction range ( or insert ) can cost hundreds if not thousands.  This is a cost effective way to try induction cooking from a trusted and well known brand.  I have used this for over a year with outstanding results.Currently, the product is  being promoted by a celebrity chef on a leading television shopping network offering live demonstrations of the versatility of the product and induction cooking, in general.I gave one to some friends of mine who have a RV ( which I might NOTE, is NICER than my apartment!! Talk about "Glamping"!), and they liked it so well that they got another! Pretty high praise, they are picky.I truly love mine, and use it far more frequently that I had expected!

Like all Remington flat irons, this is an impressive unit, at an affordable price. think Remington makes some of the BEST flat irons on the market (I have several) , and meet or exceed units that can easily be quadruple the price.Ease of use is key here, as the option to select the heat level you can go from 300-450.  The 1 inch size is nice for those with shorter hair, so easy to use!And, yup, it is great for touching up a crease on a shirt sleeve or a pair of pants! ( or the tablecloth! )A brand well worth considering!  A most welcome gift for just about anyone!

I have had this one for over a year, and realized I neglected to review it! This is my go-to headset, and nicer than many models out there.The sound is crisp and clear, and the set it self is substantial enough so you probably will not lose it, nor will it "fall-off/out" of your ear, as some do.Plantronics continues to support and update this device, which is most welcome.  I LOVE the sensor that "knows" when it is on your ear or not.  Lesser models do NOT have this feature!  This , alone is worth the price of admission for me.Charging is quick, and it has a nice stand-by time. It has a multitude of features which you may or may not elect to use. Bottom line: it works flawlessly for calls!While it think it is designed for power-users, it also makes for a welcome gift to casual users - I know this as I gave 2 as gifts, one to a co-worker in his 20's and another to my mom, who is vision impaired and in her late 70's. They both love it, and use it each day!Mom in particular has made good use of the vocalist features - the ability to HEAR email is essential to her, as is the ability to pair the unit to iPad and other devices. All you need to do is spend some learning-time, and I promise you this is senior-friendly.Sometimes, you give gifts and wonder if it ever will be used - THIS one will be!

Lighter then the Nutrient Moisturizer ( which I like to use at night ) the Green Apple Age Defy just feels GTRAT on the skin, with visible results in just a few days.All of the Juice Beauty products that I have tried are good, but this is a particular favorite -- just light, hardly any fragrance, and you can read the back of the box to see everything in here is good for your skin.  This one has apple juice, white grape juice, lemon juice and (of course!) aloe juice, all organic.Nice complement of antioxidants -CoQ10, DMAE, and  alpha lipoic acid, along with other ingredients which encourage wrinkle reduction, and add a bit of firmness.  Skin texture appears to be improved after just a few days of use.The product absorbs into the skin quickly, and leaves no shine or the 'flaking' that can happen with other product lines. I wear contacts, and the very light fragrance does NOT irritate my eyes -- a big factor to me.I saw a noticeable reduction in forehead lines after using this product, and a firmer jawline - not bad!  As I have mentioned before , I was introduced to Juice Beauty product by on-set make-up pros on television production sets -  they know about what can enhance most anyone's look, and are un-biased.This is a terrific addition to the line, and one that I would not be without. As I write this, there is a chill in the air, another cold winter to follow - along with dry skin issues.  This would make a perfect gift for someone special, at most any age ( but particularly for those 30+).  A bit of everyday luxury that really works!

VERY nice Quesadilla maker, better than others I have used. Just ideal for a quick meal, after a long work day, or perhaps for a fast lunch/brunch with friends on the weekends.Some care and common sense must be used to resist the temptation to over-fill, DONT DO IT! Clean up is simple enough, but why risk it?I like this as a gift option for seniors and college age family members, who may not be eating in an ideal fashion. Intuitive to use, and you can be creative.I have done lots of things - from chicken/cheese filling, taco meat filling, pizza filling to sweet things like lemon filling and even a version of s'mores.Best of all, it is fast! By eliminating say 3 trips to a fast food/fast casual place you will have paid for the unit, and will enjoy knowing exactly what is in your food.  All of the George Foreman products are top-of-the-line, and have been beloved for decades. This one fits right in, and will not disappoint!

I sat down with this book the day it came and tore through it in just a couple of days, as it's an easy read, although there are painful parts.I have a specialty of reading books by (generally) female Asian expats, usually about women either in Asia, immigrating, or Asian-Americans, and while the central character here is male, the book definitely fits within this expertise.  It's about becoming a medical doctor, about transitioning from rural India to urban America without losing India, about finding a middle way.  There is romance, but abuse and a bit of sadism, which was distressing.It made me eager to reach this author's first book, and to encourage others to read this one.
Medium is *tiny*!  It must be meant for a very small shower stall, as it's lost on the bottom of my full-length tub.Not really satisfactory.

This sleek, smooth bottle holds a bit more liquid than my usual large portable coffee cups, and more securely.  I've used it for hot tea, whichit keeps hot indefinitely during chilly walks, and for cold beverages, for which it's also effective.  There's plenty to share with my partner.  The mouth is large enough to slip in cubes from my ice maker, and for easy cleaning.

As a lotion this is a little thin and watery.  It's not unpleasant smelling -- one would never guess that it has urea in it.I've been using it liberally on my feet, knees and elbows, especially, and it seems to make my feet and lowerlegs reddish for a few hours, which concerns me a bit.  Maybe it's just enhancing the circulation to those areas, as it hasno color effect on the rest of my body, so I don't think I'm having some kind of significant reaction to it.It soaks in pretty quickly, feels good, and after just a week or soof daily use my elbows are much less scaly and scratchy, which is remarkable.

I've generally had great luck with Clarks' shoes, but these just don't seem right.  They pull across the broad rounded toes very strangely, and just aren't very comfortable.  I'm hoping they'll grow more comfortable, but it's hard to face putting them on right now.  And I'm not as crazy about how they look as I thought I'd be.  It's not that they're too small or too large -- they just don't fit my feet right.

I bought this for a one year old's birthday, and was very pleased to see that it's okay for one-year-olds.  It's a great addition to any stuff animal collection as it's so different from all those bunnies and teddies.  Quite realistic, although of course soft and cuddly.  I think she'll love it.

4 1/2 starsI had a family party last night and got out my new, unopened toy for everybody to enjoy.  The 8-year-old niece loved these blocks, and immediately started building an amazing "kooky Japanese house".  We supervised the one-year-old, who just wanted to hold one of the ones with a hole in it, and made sure she didn't put it in her mouth.  The two senior citizens built 'temple gates" -- mine was meant to be Egyptian, and my partner's was in the Asian direction.  I found the multitude of colors off-putting -- I think of modern and post-modern architecture as glassy, shiny, or cream colored, not these supersaturated colors of yellow, blues, orange, green, purples, etc.  Not every piece comes in every color, and I would have liked to be able to have pairs of things in the same colors.  The colors distracted me from the shapes and figuring out what to build.  Some of the shapes were totally inscrutable to me.  There are pieces with cylindrical holes in them that cry out for a matching dowel that would fit through them, but there aren't any dowels.  But these are all minor start-up complaints.  The quality of my set seemed fine -- I didn't notice any rough spots or other defects.  I look forward to my next occasion to try my hand at building something more elaborate.  The book that came with the set tells about various famous modern and post-modern architects, and shows a few buildings.  It has a list of all the parts and a couple of examples of buildings built from them.  I would have appreciated more suggestions, but perhaps they're on the website, which I didn't want to access during my party.  http://www.tsshure.com/archiquest-modern-post-modern-architecture-building-blocks/ gives you a good idea of what a structure looks like.

I'm not sure how to review this.  It contains triclosan (check the other reviews for more info about this chemical) which is apparently dangerous.This product has the sort of "clay" feeling I associate with some facial mask products, which to me is a pleasant texture compared to lotions, etc.  It has a sort of waxy feel to it, too, reminding me slightly of that lovely post-paraffin feeling at the nail salon.  Using a small-to-moderate amount of it, I found it soaked into my skin quickly, not requiring a whole lot of rubbing.  My feet felt a bit better after the first use, and definitely improved significantly after a few days of daily application.So if you're not afraid of triclosan, this seems to be an effective product.  But why take risks?  We're all exposed to enough toxins every day.

For the price these are pretty good noise cancelling earphones.  I live in a fairly noisy apartment with lots of traffic, street noise, and eternal construction all around, and these definitely let me listen to quiet music without being aware of all the ambient sounds.  They're pretty comfortable, and the music sounds okay, if not perfect.

I love the scent, and the ease with which it rinses out, as that's always a problem for me as I rush through the shower.  Unfortunately my hair has been dyed many times, and perhaps that's why this product makes my hair feel like steel, and makes it look 'pouffy'.  For someone with differently-textured hair this would be an excellent product.  Even for me it's pleasant to use; it's just the result once my hair is dry that's a problem.

I used this product yesterday, and found it did the job.  It has that kind of vaguely minty smell characteristic of a lot of men's cleaning products, only a little too strong for my taste.  I like the three-in-one thing, as it means less to carry around to the gym.  It left my hair clean, and did a great job on my skin, and was easy to rinse off.  Usually these combined products fail as conditioners on me, as I need heavy conditioning and am looking for something to help me comb my very tangle-prone hair out in the shower.  This worked pretty well at that, but then was a bit hard to rinse out.  My hair has that minty smell pretty strongly, even dry.So I'll use it up, but I probably will keep looking for something that rinses out better and doesn't smell quite so strongly.

Twelve inches didn't sound super large, but this pan is much bigger than I expected.  It's not terribly heavy, like cast iron, but more substantial than my old teflon one.  I kind of like the cheerful and unusual color, although it doesn't really go with anything in my kitchen.  The handle is terrific -- very comfortable, easy to grip, and it didn't get hot at all while cooking pan after pan of French toast.  The heat seemed quite evenly distributed, with no burnt or raw spots on the bread. It rinsed clean with no scrubbing.  I can't say now how well it will wear, but it seems solid and well-made.

4.5 starsReally good, but there was too much thinking inside the box -- the main character has to make her "box of normal" but can't save other people with it.  Set in a magical version current day US, with people possessed of magic powers, some of whom can transform into animals like kittens, bunnies, and bears.  The main character is a troubled fourth grade girl who resolves some of her issues during the story.  I really hope this is the first of several books.  A quick and well-written read, but I got tired really quickly of a character turning into a rock.Alice, age 8

Just as high quality as my choice at the dive shop!  It fits me well, the tube works, at least in the pool.I love the color.  I wish I had an opportunity to go try it out doing real snorkeling, but that will have to wait.

It's much brighter and more colorful than the photo -- it's bright purple and blue, with shiny gold accents and some acqua.  It was afraid it might be a little small for me, from the measurements, but it's just fine!  It seems sturdy, with stout handles.

Seemed light, non-greasy, not smelly, not too tinted, and generally pleasant.  I only wish the SPF were higher, as 15 doesn't buy me much time outside.  I like carrying something like this in my purse for unexpected outside expeditions.

This product has way too much sugar -- 26 grams per serving, which means more than 50 grams per bottle!  It mostly tastes sweet, with a little fruity flavor, not strongly mango or orange.  I'd prefer something MUCH less sweet with lots of mango flavor.
I like the complex red color of the handle, and the two-sided file, with coarse and less coarse sides.  It seems easy to use and definitely works.

I like a product that is easy to rinse off, but I found this one a little 'sticky' so that it was hard to remove it quickly and feel that I'd done so thoroughtly.  With the foam format it's is hard to get a precise amount, too.  Other that that it seemed fine, and others might like it.

I'm not much for green tea, as I fear its caffeine and am not generally crazy about the taste.  But I like rose flavored tea, so I decided to try it.It's pretty good.  It comes in a nice cloth bag, in non-papery "sachets", and I didn't find the flavoring excessive.  It will never be my go-to tea, because of the caffeine, but green tea is supposed to be good for me, so I'll enjoy it sometimes.

I always work myself to the sides, top and bottom, and off my mat, so that I spend lots of time "scooching" myself back over, which is distracting.  I asked my instructor first, since my mat would clearly take more room than the others, and she agreed that it would be a good idea.  It seems about a third larger than a regular mat.  It's almost like having my own little padded yoga room.  It's certainly squishier than my old one had gotten, after many years.  The only downside is obvious:  it's heavy and more awkward.  Luckily I only have to carry it a hundred feet or so.  But I do spend less thought in class on where I am and getting back onto the mat.

My acne arrived at adolescence and never really left, so I'm always looking for something to keep my skin clear.  I used this today in the shower, right after a swim.  It's a bluish color with fine particles, not rough ones like some cleansers.  The scent was nice and not too strong, at least to me.  A small dab handled my face, neck and upper chest, and rinsed off fairly easily.  Since one is supposed to start by using it just once a day and "work up" to twice a day (how will I know my face is ready for twice a day?) it should last a long time.I'll come back to this review in a few weeks and report any changes in my skin.

I just used this product for the first time after my swim.  The texture was pleasant, a very small amount covered all of my long hair very well, and the smell was kind of tropical fruity, and not too strong, although definitely noticeable.  It was easy to comb my always-tangled hair out.  It was no more difficult to rinse out than other conditioners I use.  My hair definitely feels soft and looks smooth, not frizzy.  I plan to use this product frequently.

This is the kind of swim cap I prefer, not to keep my hair dry (the plastic ones pull and hurt and don't work completely anyway), but to keep it controlled.  I have sleep apnea, and I find that it works very well with my BiPap machine/mask, protecting my hair from the velcro straps and again, keeping it controlled.  This is the best cap I've ever found for these purposes.  I only wish it came in more colors, as black is hard to find, especially at night in the dark.I recommend it highly, but please understand that it's NOT meant to keep hair dry when swimming!

I didn't read this book as a memoir but as an emotional analysis ofElena's journey at 23 from St Petersberg to New Jersey.  It's emotionallycharged, with many realizations from looking back at her life and thecommitments she made to her mother, older sister, and friends. Her attemptto separate herself from Russian culture and make her American life feelnatural and real, which was very difficult for her.  At every stepof her new life there would be circumstances and events that would evokeparallel but conflicting reactions from her Russian perspective.  This was confusingand disorienting.Marrying a man who accepted her for who she was helped her to understandand learn American life and that was very lucky for her, as she found not just ahusband but a true friend who didn't expect her to shed all of herRussian emotional baggage as quickly or completely as other Americans she knewexpected her to do.The main point she was trying to make is to rationalize to herself whyyou can leave Russia, but Russia will always be there inside you forthe rest of your life, complicating assimilating into American lifeand achieving new relationships.  The author finally managed to stop looking ateverything from the point of view of Russian fears and to accept her new lifeas a challenge that she could meet by separating herself from her "Mother's"dominance.

WHY is this book, unlike ALL of the others, not available at all on audio???  The others in this series are read by the brilliant Mary Robinette Kowal.  It's just not the same.  We always listen to these books in the car on trips or while commuting, and our 8-year-old loves listening to them but won't be able to read them for years.Our whole family loves the October Day series on audio.  This was my first time actually reading one of the books, and it was quite a different experience, missing all the different voices and accents.  The structure of this book seems different -- I didn't like the way that Quentin disappears totally from the action half way through, after having had nothing much to do, and NEVER reappears.  The main action of the book was compressed right at the end, with a long, long buildup.But I love Toby and Tybalt and this amazing world of Faery.

Slow start, terrific finish.  It took me more than a week to push through the first third or so of the book, as we meet stacks of characters and start the copying process.  Clare is gradually revealed as less than upstanding -- succeeding at her art is what drives her, and sleeping with a married man and letting him use her painting as his forms the background of the story.  But once the copy is finished and she starts working, first painting her own series and then desperately researching the painting that she copied to save her lover, one likes her and the book better.  I read the last half very quickly, and enjoyed it.  The mystery of the Degas painting is solved, even as the mystery of the Gardner heist remains unknown.I admired the way the author put Clare into a rich and fairly detailed life, with friends, a loft studio, and a very real city of Boston.  I love reading books I know well.  By the end of the book I was hoping for a movie.

I really enjoyed reading this very chatty book.  I'd always been a bit suspicious of "Mumbles" Menino, wondering if he was corrupt.  But it seems that he was basically a nice guy, a good politician, whose worst failings may have been tendencies to micromanage.  The book is easy to read and moves right along.  I learned a lot about Boston and local poliics.
I ordered my usual size, and the shoe is definitely large in the heel.  They're fairly attractive and comfortable otherwise.
My seven-year-old niece enjoyed this book very much and wants to read others in the series.  She tells me she loved the characters, the story and the setting.
These are kind of fun to use, and cheerful.  The snaps should keep them together, which is convenient.I'd recommend them to anyone looking for a good set.

My seven-year-old niece loves this book and does not find it a stretch to read.  She wants to read more of them, right away!  It's about a normal girl who finds out she's an elf with mind-reading ability.  Her entire life changes as she goes to a new school, gets adopted by a new elf family, which means leaving her old family.

My niece has enjoyed these stories about a magic bunny and a girl, because she likes magic and bunnies.  At seven, I think she's a bit beyond this series, but she still enjoys reading them and wants to collect all of the series.

This book was completely appropriate for my seven-year-old niece, who found it "pretty interesting", especially that the heroine had never gone swimming until she was in the 7th grade!  She loved the mermaid parts best, and would recommend it to everybody who loves swimming and likes to imagine being a mermaid.  She didn't like it when Emily was compelled by a friend to do things she didn't really want to do.

The blue is a bit brighter than I expected or than the photo looks -- it's not far off royal blue, where I expected a medium navy.  I like the grey trim and the ring ornament okay.  The shoe feels nice and squishy, but fit is fine, the heel height is good, and I put it on for the first time and wore it to work all day with no problems.  So I'd recommend it.  In the past I've not found aerosoles to last terribly well, probably because they're so soft.  Nor are they supportive enough to be a real walking shoe for me.  But for office wear they're fine.

Luckily I like blue, and I like a very dim night light.  That's what these are.  If you wanted something bright enough to really see by, you wouldn't like these.  Mine are still working fine after 3 months.

I grew up reading the pulp SF and Fantasy magazines and love short stories.  I'd heard of Green but don't recall reading any of his works, so I wanted to try them.  These are taken from across his career, and gave me an idea of his work.  He won't be my favorite author, but I enjoyed the stories.  If you like this kind of thing, I think you'll like these.
We've always used the dark blue dawn, so this was  a little different for us.  It seemed to work just as well, and I liked the distinctive scent.
It's just a clear piece of plastic.  The antimicrobial stuff is indetectable, and it doesn't stick to my wooden desk well.There's really nothing artistic or interesting about it.

This pepper mill is a bit overwhelming.  It was appropriately packaged without excessive layers.  I hadn't realized it was an electric mill, powered by six AAA batteries, which were provided.  It also came with a small users' manual for installing the batteries and the pepper, in five languages.  I found the print size a bit small and required lots of light to read it clearly.  I was pleased that I had an MIT engineer handy for consulting as I tried to remove the motor from its cylinder (i used a pencil point to move the clips), install the batteries, and then put the motor back, which I did backwards the first time.  After I followed the directions and put it back together I discovered that I needed to take the motor cylinder off again to fill the pepper chamber.  The whole process took about 20 minutes.  We all enjoy "taking the Peugeot for a spin", with it's cute little light.  Being able to adjust the grind is nice.  The pepper seems to last a long time -- we've only refilled it once or twice in more than six months of daily use.The device is solid and of very high quality, and lights up softly when in use.  One should pulse it, not just push it on and keep holding it down.  I like that one can vary the grind size.I enjoyed reading on the box that the Peugeot Company started out making saws in 1814 and moved on to coffee and pepper mills, and was the first to make a mill designed for the table.  I felt at first that I would have preferred a regular hand-twist mill, but this one is very, very cool.  I can understand why it costs so much, even as I continue to wonder why I couldn't turn my own grinder handle.  For anyone who wants an elegant and elaborate way to grind pepper, this is pretty perfect.

Look, we love it! I will even pay for it, but of course I'd love it on Prime.A show where people have talent, enough time to complete the challenges, and no one screams! Ever! Americans don't only want to watch a bunch of psycho screaming jerks. The five stars here and on Netflix show it.Please get the original series and have them available from the beginning.

I bought this to replace the bad battery in my hp envy pro laptop. The guys at the computer repair place wanted $170 for parts and labor, but seeing as how my laptop is three years old already, it didn't seem worth it.I watched a two minute youtube video and thought it looked simple enough.It was pretty easy to install. The only problem I encountered was trying to decide which way to put the battery cable in. My original laptop battery had pins on both sides of the cable, while this replacement only has them on one. I posted a picture. The side with no pins goes up.I just installed it, and am charging the battery up for the first time now. I'll edit this later when I unplug and see what the battery life is like. The manufacture date is 12/2012 but it's a new battery so it should be fine.Love the one day shipping on this!

Works just like the Motorola turbo charger that came with my phone. It's just as fast, although slightly larger.It comes with a micro usb cable that you can swap out for your own if you want. My  Motorola charger doesn't have a removable usb cable so I can't use my 6 ft cables with it. This is definitely more convenient!In the first photo, I had just plugged it in. I wanted to capture it saying "turbo charging."  The second pic is after 5-7 minutes and gives a better representation of the "time to full."Five stars. Would definitely buy again. I did receive a discount for my honest review, but I can say that at full price, it's worth it! If your phone supports turbo charging 2, you should definitely pick one of these up!

Pretty good! I would definitely use this bracelet while hiking. It looks and feels good. It's unobtrusive and if it wasn't for the smell you could forget you're wearing it. It does smell strongly, but it's not unpleasant. It is too strong to wear indoors, though. I tried to wear it inside and ended up repelling my husband AND the mosquitoes. That said, it did work to repel the mosquitoes. They buzzed around my husband instead of me for a change!I would definitely recommend these if you're looking for a natural alternative to sprays. I will update after hiking with it on.I did receive a discount on this product but will definitely buy bracelet refills when mine run out.

I bought this bracelet because if there's a mosquito in a two mile radius, it will find me and bite me...usually multiple times. It's been hot where I live but we don't have air conditioners so we have to keep the windows open. The mosquitoes have been driving me crazy!The packaging is actually really nice. It's plastic but easy to open. No scissors required. The bracelet itself is lightweight, soft and very comfortable to wear.The mosquito repellent pack that fits inside the bracelet smells very strongly of citronella. I thought I might be able to wear it to bed because that's when I get bit the most, but it's definitely too strong a scent for that. I ended up wearing it for a bit then putting it on my nightstand next to me.The mosquito that made it into our bedroom left me alone completely. The bracelet did its job, but I'll save it for the hiking.It's nice to find something natural that works!I did receive a discount for my honest review of this product.
Does exactly what it says it does! Not the fastest way to charge but perfect for overnight charging and it's nice to not worry about messing up my charging port.

I have to give these three stars for now. I was really excited to try these out tonight. I work at a music venue and I always need ear plugs however this is the first pair of fancy earplugs I've tried. Tonight I worked the loudest concert I've worked yet. These were ok, but I ended up going with the squishy foam earplugs my work provides instead.I think these would work for a more mellow show, but they definitely didn't block enough sound for a metal show.I am going to give them another shot because I want to make sure I had them in right and that I'm not giving them too harsh a review just because tonight's show was extra loud.I do think they'd be ok for a normal concert and will update my review after I work one.Oh, and I absolutely love that they're on a key ring. Love love love that key ring canister.I received a discount for my honest review of these ear plugs.

I'd give this 4.5 stars if that was possible.I bought the purple floral dress, and I love it! I am very pleased with my purchase and will definitely buy more of these dresses in different fabrics.Speaking of fabric, it seems to be a cotton/poly blend but doesn't feel overly synthetic. It has a nice weight to it and a some stretch. I'd say it runs a bit small. I'm 36/30/38, a solid size 8 (U.S.) and the large fits me almost perfectly. There is some gaping at the neck. I'm not sure if buying a medium would fix that issue or make me look like I'm stuffed into the dress at the waist. That's the only reason I'd knock off half a star.I believe it's fitted this way so that it can fit a range of bust sizes.I am very very happy with this dress! I'm wearing it with a petticoat underneath. Perfect for the wedding in a conservatory of flowers I'm going to next month.
I love this. No more struggling with pizza cutters. Highly recommend this.I received a discount on this for my honest review, and I'm glad I did! It is worth it at full price.

TL;DR Get an Ipad instead.Buyer beware!! I loved my kindle until two weeks ago when it died ONE WEEK out of warranty. It seems to be a software issue and Amazon won't repair it.What they were willing to do is give me $50 off a new kindle but, here's the kicker, they wanted me to send back my broken kindle, presumably so they can refurb and resell it. Unreal!One year after purchase there is ZERO support and Amazon expects me to pay another $400 for a new device. All in all, if I bought the new device, they'd be getting the original $400 I spent, another $400 for the new tablet, PLUS whatever they'd be able to get for refurbing my tablet.I'm buying an Ipad. It's worth it to pay the extra $100 up front and know that a year down the road, if it fails, I can take it into an Apple Store and have it repaired.Amazon lost two customers- my husband and I will never ever buy or recommend another Amazon device. In fact, I'm now bummed that I bought my husband a kindle just two months ago. I feel like it's just waiting to die.For reference, I have three kindles (HDX, HD and e reader) and a firetv stick. I'm a Prime member for another month, but am reconsidering that too.

The part of the case that goes around the power button broke the first time I put the case on. Not the biggest deal and the rest of the case still works.The case comes put together and it doesn't look like two pieces. Be aware that it IS two pieces and you have to put them on one at a time. Otherwise the case won't cover both sides of the phone completely.Other than a small part breaking off right away, it seems like a good case. I really just wanted something to add a bumper around the sides and to give the phone a little lip so hopefully the glass won't break when I inevitably drop it. This seems like it will do the job without adding a lot of bulk. Looks and feels good. Definitely looks better than the normal s4 back door.

Ok, in reality, this only gets 4 stars. It would have deserved 5 if they would have gotten actual voice actors or singers. I realize that's hard in Hollywood because people only want to produce things with famous actor attached, so this is what we get.I digress. Really really cute movie! I loved it. Good looking and interesting and different. Really the only problem I had is that I would have liked to have real Latino/a actors voicing the characters.Other than that, it was fun, imaginative, colorful, and best of all, different! I will be buying it.

I bought a 2004 Prius a year ago and it looked like the headlights have never been changed or cleaned. They were super dim at night. Very very yellow. After using this restoration kit, I used my key fob to lock my doors and I was startled by how bright the lights looked when they flashed on and off.I did this as quickly as I could today, because I started late. I watched the video first, then referred to the instructions in the box during the restoration process. It was easy. I think some people really went nuts with the sanding. I didn't because I didn't start til 4:15 pm and I was worried I wouldn't finish before sundown. I did exactly 5 and a half minutes each headlight per the instructions, each step, using my phone's timer.Exactly one hour later, I was completely done and I swear to you, the headlights look like new. Very impressed. The Toyota dealer near me wanted $75 for headlight restoration. I did this in an hour for $20.Some people say the restoration lasts 9 months to a year... In my opinion, it is definitely worth $20 and an hour of my time once a year.For reference, I'm a woman in my mid thirties and this was easy. I did go through about 15 paper towels (because I'm messy) and a few squirt bottles worth of water. Definitely recommend using a squirt bottle for this if you're like me and don't have a garage/hose.

I LOVE this jacket. I wasn't sure about it at first as I'm not really the puffy jacket type.... but it's not very puffy. It IS very lightweight and very very warm. It has quickly become my favorite jacket. I love the inside pocket. I've washed it and air dried it and it went back to the original shape nicely.It runs true to size. I'm exactly the measurements of the med and it fits me perfectly. Wouldn't change a thing.It's a super warm low profile jacket. The logo is pretty unobtrusive, the fit is slim. It hugs the body, which I love.Great jacket!! It was a gift, but I'd definitely buy one if I needed another jacket!

I ended up loving this show and am sad it was cancelled. I read somewhere that they're talking to Netflix about picking it up. Here's hoping!! It would be even better if Amazon would swoop in and save it!In the meantime, I'm reading the books. I have to say, the tv adaptation is better than the books...the books are enjoyable if a little junior. I picture the Freya, Ingrid and Joanna as they are in the show, which says a lot for the actresses!

It definitely takes a few episodes for Matt Ryan to settle in as John Constantine, but once he does, it feels a lot like the comic books.I think every episode is better than the one before it.  I will definitely keep watching.

1/10 Final update- The phone is going back, and I hate it. I know no one will see this, but if you do, Amazon, fix your d@mned phone. No Bluetooth LE, no changing one of the least intuitive keyboards I've come across, no tapping a phone number on a web page to call it, no sending video mms, no otg, no escape from portrait mode with the carousel, atrocious battery life.... The keyboard was really the clincher for me. I don't do a ton with my phone, but I expect it to be good at texting, emails, pictures and sharing. It is good at none of these things. See ya later Fire Phone. The USED S4 (two year old tech?) will be far and away better than you. OH, and the S4 does that 3d stuff too and I can keep it out of a case and not worry that a slight bump is going to shatter the thing.1/7 Update- Changing my review to 3 stars.It's been a couple of weeks and the phone is ok. I still don't regret ditching my s3, but that's mainly because of the camera and the fact that I had been wanting to switch to tmobile for a while.Battery life is ok. Not great, not bad. I do not turn off dynamic perspective bc I like it.What really irritates me about this phone is that I don't get notifications from facebook, facebook messenger, whatsapp, and many of my games. OH, that AND that the phone has bluetooth 4 capabilities but it's not turned on in the phone, meaning your new fitness tracker or smart watch won't work with it. Bluetooth 4 came out in phones in 2011. 3 years ago. I have no idea why Amazon would put this top of the line phone out without bluetooth 4 enabled. It's insane.Overall, it's an ok phone. Like everyone else said, great hardware, not so great software. I have my fingers crossed that the software update in January will solve some problems. If they don't fix some of my (and others') major complaints, I won't buy a Fire Phone 2 if they go forward with one...if they do, I'd happily buy one!===============================================================================================================12/15 Very cool phone. I really like it and have no regrets about ditching my S3 for it!I understand people's concern about the "walled garden" style OS. I felt the same way about my HDX at first. Then I realized that everything it did, it did really really well. I choose it over my phone or computer all the time. This phone is close to the same.People are calling dynamic perspective a gimmick- and it is- but it's a VERY cool gimmick. I won't be turning it off! And the lenticular photo setting is great. I took "3d" pictures of my Christmas tree! When you email them, it gets turned into a gif. How cool is that?One of my issues with the phone is that you can't use the carousel in landscape mode. It's always in portrait (vertical). I love the carousel on my HDX, but that's because I always view it horizontally. I'm not sure why you'd make a carousel with big icons for a phone that's stuck in portrait mode.Battery life seems fine. I have a ton of backup batteries for my S3, carrying around a small powerbank if I need to is no different, but I'm not sure if I'll even need to yet.The camera on this phone is really good and I like the dedicated camera button.Two different Amazon Mayday tech people told me that a software update will be out in January to address some of the common complaints. My guess is that they're going to let people change the background on their phones and hopefully they'll give us something like Echo (or Siri), right now, there is a voice activated search, text, email feature, but it's pretty. basic. I hope we get Prime radio stations!Obviously, Amazon needs apps, asap. And driving/hands free needs to be easily accessible! Other than that, the phone is really great. I think the issues I have are minor and easily fixable.I super hope that Amazon makes a Fire Phone 2 for T-mobile with wifi calling. And that they keep supporting this device.You can use Jason Singleton's method to install the google play market. It takes about 3 minutes and so far is working for me perfectly.  http://www.yourbountyhunter.org/firephone/And you can make ringtones for your phone easily, you just need to use a 3rd party ringtone maker app. I used the first one in the Amazon app store and it worked fine.

This thing is so cool! Got it today and love it. If you're a Prime member, and/or have a Fire tablet, you shouldn't hesitate to get this.I had been watching Prime and Netflix with my PS3 but won't any more.The Fire Stick does so much more than just let you watch videos. Your cloud photos and videos are instantly accessible on your TV as well as your music and Prime playlists.The only negatives I can see so far is that there's no off switch, only sleep, and it needs to be plugged in.Oh, and the Prime radio stations haven't made it onto the fire tv yet. Hopefully they'll add those in soon.Everything I've started with it, music, videos, prime movies, etc. has started quickly and played back perfectly.The Fire TV remote app is pretty great too. The voice search was able to decipher everything I said on the first try. La Dolce Vita, Alice in Wonderland, Transparent, etc.Amazon did a great job with this one!I've been using mine all day now and haven't had any problems with the wifi dropping.

Works!I'm using it to hook my camera up to my phone (since my stupid kindle hdx doesn't support otg) so that I can view pictures on it. The lcd on my camera is really crappy. Once the pictures are on my phone, they go directly to my cloud storage and I don't have to lug my laptop around on vacation.

Waste of money. One out of three cartridges worked, but of course I didn't know the other two wouldn't work until it was too late to return these.The one that did work rendered the wireless printing option on my printer useless because when installed, my epson printer will give me a low ink warning.
