When it's physically plugged into my computer via usb, an error message comes up with the option to ignore and print anyway. This doesn't happen when I send something to the printer over wifi. In fact, nothing happens. It just doesn't print.Will never buy again.

Like many others, my fireplace didn't come with a remote or any manufacturer's information.I received this as a gift, it didn't come from Amazon.com but I thought I'd share my experience with the fireplace and customer service information in case someone else needs it.It took me about a half hour on the phone with a website who-shall-not-be-named's customer service  center to get the shipper's information for the fireplace. In my case, it was shipped through Wayfair. Here's their customer service number for those who need it: 800-584-4348. They were very friendly but it did take another half hour before my problem was (hopefully) solved. My remote and instruction manual should be on their way to me. We shall see.For those of you looking for manufacturer's info, this fireplace is manufactured in China and distributed here through at least one company.As for the fireplace itself- I like it!It's not the best space heater- the low setting is useless and I guess I expected something that looks like fire to get hot. It does do the job, but not nearly as quickly as I thought it would. I was hoping it would heat up the living room quickly so we could have it on less and save some $$.It's pretty quiet- it started rattling last night but stopped pretty quickly. Overall, it's quieter than other space heaters I've had.I like the look of the fake fire too. I mean, it's fake, so if you're expecting something that looks exactly like real fire, you may want to play the yule log on your tv. It's a fairly simple illusion that's been used to fake fires for quite some time and I like the way it looks.Three stars because I think it's a good fake fireplace and an ok space heater but customer service is a pain in the butt.

I love this product. Thanks to a few other reviewers, I bought this after purchasing a non-adjustable stick heater and reading reviews about it over heating tanks.Now, I have one of these controlling the temperature in two 5.5 gallon tanks with the identical adjustable heaters and just ordered another one to keep the temperature steady in a ten gallon tank I have with a couple of baby bettas in it that need a more constant temperature than my heater is providing.The controller has worked perfectly for three months. The temperature never fluctuates more than a degree and I check it against traditional thermometers regularly.

I had to send it back. I'm a size 8 normally- 36D, 5'6". According to their size chart I am a medium. In fact, their measurements are almost exactly what mine are, so I ordered a medium. It wasn't just large in the bust though, the length and sleeves were way too long and the waist and hip measurements were also waaaay too big.The other things I don't like about this hoodie are the grommets and size of the pockets. I saw them in the pictures but thought that maybe because my bust is larger, they wouldn't be all the way up to my breasts. Wrong. The pockets went all the way up to my breasts which means the grommets were also on my breasts. Really bizarre. I've never seen pockets like that before.I gave this hoodie two stars because the material was nice and warm and had it not been for the pockets, I probably would have exchanged it for a smaller size.

I deleted my original review because after a little over a month of owning this, I wish I just had a regular fish tank...OR that over at Back to the Roots they included information about fish in vs fishless cycling of tanks and more information overall. And there are a few problems with the design.Here's my experience with this tank so far.I started out with white cloud minnows in the tank. We had to get cold water fish unless we wanted to add a heater (another thing they don't tell you) because I live in San Francisco, and our house is usually 62-65 degrees inside.I changed out 20% of the water every other day while the tank was cycling because I was (rightly) concerned about the fish. These minnows are hardy, but fish in cycling can still damage their gills or kill them. They survived but after a couple of weeks I took them back and bought a betta instead because the minnows really should be in a bigger tank.So now I have a betta. And I love him.Unfortunately, the tank doesn't really live up to their self- cleaning claims. "Dump some sludge eradicator in the tank every couple of weeks or get a snail" they say. Having done both of those things, there's still a build up of "stuff" in the gravel at the bottom of the tank. I've just resigned myself to the fact that I might have to clean out the tank regularly, which would be fine if it wasn't a colossal pain in the butt because of the top, or throw this out and get a regular tank that's easier to clean (with or without a filter).Also, the plants sprouted really quickly and grew fast for about two weeks. After that, growth significantly slowed down. They are getting sunlight but obviously, this tank can't be directly in the sun because of the fish. I don't think we'll be able to eat anything that grows out of it because it will probably stay small and am doubting that it takes enough waste out of the tank.Problems with the design-- the pump! It really should not be housed in the top of the tank. It vibrates violently which is not good for any fish, plus it's really loud. I bought more airline tubing and moved the pump outside the tank- the entire top part of the tank. It completely warped within a week. They say it doesn't affect the functionality of the tank but the plant holder doesn't sit on the tray correctly.- the pump doesn't seem to take enough waste out of the tank. If there's waste floating about in the water, a lot of it gets pushed up to the top of the tank, but some of it doesn't and once it settles on the gravel, it's there to stay. Unless you clean the tank.I wish they would include a way to add a heater should you need one (bettas like warm water, around 78 degrees), and more information about cycling the tank including a fishless cycle option, however I do realize that most tanks don't come with this information.At this point, I'm not sure what I'll do with this tank. I'm obviously having issues with it that some others aren't having.I really really like the idea of this tank and I know aquaponics works, but I'm not sure this tank is really practical.Tip- If you want to take the top off without getting water everywhere, first take the plant tray off, then shove paper towels in the holes in the bottom tray and dump that water in the sink.FYI- if you want to see pictures of other tanks, check instagram, #aquafarm.
These earrings aren't bone or horn. They're plastic. I'm only writing this review so you don't order these thinking they're hand carved bone when they're not.
I have semi sensitive skin and these don't bother my skin at all. I use these every night. They're strong enough to take my makeup and leave my skin feeling refreshed. Great product.

This speaker is easy to use and set up. The sound is better than I thought it would be. I have some small 4 watt computer speakers, and this sounds similar to those. It paired with my phone and computer easily- the only negative is that the range isn't great. The range is about 10' and it can break up a bit if you move around.The battery life is great. It says three hours, but I think it was closer to six hours before I had to charge it again.Good inexpensive portable speaker. I would definitely buy again.
I bought this for my Samsung Galaxy S2. It fits snugly inside the charging port on my phone, as it should, and was shipped very quickly.

Like all the other people who left negative reviews, mine broke in a little over two months. The plastic part inside stripped after maybe using it six times. I've got an email into Cuisinart- we'll see what they say. I'm surprised anyone would continue to sell this, knowing it's going to fail within a couple of months.Avoid this hand blender!

I'm very happy with this shampoo. It left my hair soft and manageable. I shampooed with this product--and it does yield a rich lather-- and used Nexus Youth Renewal Plump and Lift Blow Dry spray with it along with Tigi Bed Head Totally Baked hair meringue to give my hair body. I dry and style my chin length bob with a blow dryer. This combination of products gives my very fine straight hair a lot of body, yet leaves it soft and manageable.

This is a versatile surge protector, but it's also pretty huge--not at all inconspicuous. It measures just over 11" x 4". Many electronic items continue to draw electricity when they are off. This surge protector has 3 standard non-contolled outlets, a master outlet, and four additional outlets that are controlled by the item plugged into the master outlet. When the item plugged into the master outlet it turned off, energy is completely cut off the the other four items in the controlled outlets. This enables you to save the cost of the electricty normally used by other items when they are on standby mode, which could be only a dollar a year for something that uses little power, but could be a great deal for something like a large screen which might use more than $35/year. So depending on how you use this item, it could be a significant money saver.

This is a very attractive and sturdy holder for shower products. My very significant concern, though, is that I'm not confident it will stay up. I have it in my guest bathroom with only one bottle of shampoo and a bar of soap and in less that a week, it has slipped down the shower head stem about a half an inch and the suction cups have become detached from the tile. Don't know if other reviewers have had this problem or not. At point I plan on periodically checking on it and hoping it doesn't come crashing down in the night. So I love the way this looks, but i'm concerned about it's staying power.

I honestly was not expecting these cups to be anything special, but the are significantly tougher than Hefty, Solo, or no name cups. The rim is  stronger, neither bending nor breaking easily, and the cup itself is less brittle and thicker than other cups I've used. I recommend this cup.

If you are super, super hard up for storage space, this Quilted Northern is tightly wound and comes presquished, supposedly taking up less storage space. Really? I'm not convinced. However it's quality, soft 2-ply paper, so if it was the cheapest brand the day I was shopping, I would live with the flattened tube, even though it is annoying when you unroll it because it doesn't unroll smoothly. Honestly, I'm not convinced a toilet paper truck didn't crash and they had to figure out a way to unload a truckload of smashed rolls. Meh...

The is one of the cheapest products on the market, but it compared favorably to products 6 times as expensive. This product let me style my hair, but left it light and fluffy. The instructions called for using a dime sized squirt of the product. I actually used a ittle more--a nickel-sized amount. The initial results were fantastic, and held up pretty well through out the day. The hold would be enhanced by a light spritz of hair spray.When my current supply of mousses, foams and gels is used up, I'm going to use this economical option which worked as well as anything else I've used. Recommended as a best buy among hair products!

I had trouble getting this product to work as directed. I applied it to strands of towel dried, damp hair and twisted it around my finger. When I let go of it, it fell back perfectly straight. So I then applied this all over my hair like a styling gel and blow dried my hair. I was pretty impressed that this product made it easy to put a wave in my hair as I styled. The basic style has lasted, but the wave didn't even make it through the morning. So this hair product functioned as an average-hold styling gel. However I do like the soft, silky feel of my hair after using it, so I would rate this product 4 stars. I would be interested to know if others were more successful creating an over all curly look working with one section at a time.

This is a nice quality canvas apron. The canvas is light-weight, but heavier than flat weave cotton fabric--a suitable weight for a kitchen apron. While I don't usually use pockets on my apron, it is handy to have them if you need them and these are nice and large. The style is such that it fits pretty much any size person--from slim to very large. So this is a nice apron for personal use or for a gift.

This mousse is the texture of thick shaving cream. I applied it to my chin-length, very fine hair and then blow-dried/styled it into a bob. I do not use hair spray It held the style fairly well initially and my hair remained light and soft, not stiff. I like it, but actually I think shorter styles need a little stiffness to hold, especially with the very fine texture of my hair. In fact this didn't hold the style throughout the day as I would have hoped, and certainly did not hold for a few days as I prefer. So those with very fine hair, need to use this with hair spray or with a different product.

This doll is soft and light weight--perhaps a good first baby doll. It is nicely packaged. Made in China, the head, legs and arms are soft, and the cloth body, also very soft. This baby doll is machine washable. The clothes are very nice. You can't see the little white bloomers under the dress, which appear well-made. Why only 4 stars? Currently priced at over $30, I don't see a huge difference--other than the clothing--between this baby doll and a $9.99 discount store baby doll. A nice baby doll, but consider waiting and seeing if the price drops below $20. That would put in in a range more comparable to other dolls available at brick and mortar stores.

This coffee tastes as good or better than any K-cup I've tasted and, put on auto delivery, these one cup pods cost about the same as coffee. They work with my Kuerig 2.0 brewer. What's more, these K-cups are 97 percent recyclable! Drink great coffee, save money, and be green. What's not to like!

I used this shampoo along with the anti-frizz moisturizing lotion in the same product group. My hair definitely feels lighter--it is amazing how much weight other styling products add to my fine hair, so the lighter feel is definitely nice. This shampoo is pleasantly and very mildly scented. It doesn't lather up as much as other shampoos; but more like a salon shampoo, it lathers slightly and leaves hair feeling super clean.

I'm a big fan of George Foreman grills and this one is no exception. This one has removable ceramic-coated grilling plates which is a huge improvement for me--no more awkward washing of the grill plates. They come out easily and go straight in the dishwasher. They then reattach effortlessly and securely. And with the ceramic coating, I have no more worries that I have had with other coatings that can leach chemicals into the food. I'm very happy with both of these improvements.This grill can easily accommodate 6 servings, which is nice for a family. The heat level is controlled by a slicing lever from low to high. Set on the low--or minimum--setting, it cooks at between 300 and 325 degrees. On high--or maximum--setting, it cooks at between 365-400 degrees.Overall, I am thrilled with the advantages of this product, but there are two things I don't like quite as well. The ceramic plates don't give a very crispy coating on the grilled food. To me that makes it not as flavorful and appealing. Also, the drip tray is only a quarter of an inch deep! I cooked one turkey burger and 2 lean burgers on this and the drippings got all over the counter. I wasn't too pleased with that. For this reason, I gave this grill 4 stars instead of 5.

I love these Calphalon Classic Stainless Steel 8 inch and 10 inch frying pans. They look fabulous and when used and maintained properly can easily be made non-stick by heating some oil in them to the smoking point and then wiping the pan out and cooking with a small amount of fresh oil. But, don't use spray oil on these pans as it will build up. I am giving up coated pans and ordered these to try. They have a thick bottom that conducts heat well and yet they are not overly heavy. This makes me want to get more pieces of this cookware. I'm very pleased.

Wow--what a bargain. I was replacing the handles in one bathroom and found I could do both bathrooms for same price and still save $15 over the big box hardware stores. This handles are stylish, functional and  economical. I couldn't ask for more! Don't even think about getting anything else, if you like this style of handle.

I got this to go under my kitchen sink for things I would later take out to my compost bin. Unfortunately this was not a good "fit" for my needs as the lid doesn't really seal so each time I used it I got a major attack of fruit flies. I'll need to get with one of the stainless steel counter top bins instead. The filter does do a great job of controlling odors though, which is a plus.

These handles are very plain and basic and look fabulous in my bathroom. I have found I prefer a plain handle that doesn't draw attention to itself, but is stylish and functional. These fill the bill and are economical too.

I have been using this  product and color for years. It gives a natural blush to my fair skin. I got it once when I ran out of my expensive department store blusher and found I love this product. The Brick Rose color gets away from the shades that are too pink. I sometimes put this on my eyelids, too, if they are looking too pale. This blends  well.

I see this book as a really solid choice for readers at the 5th to 7th grade levels. The layout is great, the photos gorgeous (I only wish I had the final copy instead of the uncorrected proof).I see this book as having multiple applications. It would be a fabulous gift for a horse lover. Also sometimes all reluctant readers need is a good non-fiction book to grab their interest. This would definitely fill the bill. Finally I see this book as ideal, too, for use in an ESL classroom. I wish I had 9 copies right now to use in my summer class next week.This is an all-around great book with high interest for the 5th to 7th grade level reader.

This is a very gentle shampoo that doesn't lather up as much as standard shampoo. It felt more like the brand used at my hair salon. My hair was left feeling light, soft and full. The day after the shampoo it looked and felt even better--smooth, silky and maintained its style well.I recommend this for "mature" hair. I will look for this shampoo again.

I have been using a glucosamine / Chondroitin supplement for years. I like that this also has MSM so that I don't have to supplement MSM seperately. Having used the whole bottle, I can say that it worked for me as well as the higher priced, more expensive best-known brand. I received a free sample of this product for my honest review, but believe me - I would have raised a stink if my knee pain increased after switching over to this brand! It did not, and I have had that experience when switching to cheaper brands in the past. This is definitely on my buy list for my future needs.
This vitamin D3 supplement is worked as designed. I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.
Love that I didn't have to soak this. Great quinoa taste. Super choice for quinoa lovers.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

I had never had goji betteries before being offered a free sample in exchange for my honest review, so I can't do any kind of comparison to other brands. However, they are a less sweet and also slightly tart berry with a chewy texture which I used as a salad topping to add some nutrition, and I was pleased by the taste. Were especially good with blue cheese and ranch dresssings.

I love caco powder and would never go back to using processed cocoa again. I don't get creative with it - I just use it for satisfying the chocolate craving as a low carber. You can make a really tasty cocoa with half water / half heavy whipping cream, cacao powder and your favorite low carb sweetener.This brand mixes easily (no slimy chocolate lumps at the bottom of the glass) and tastes great.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

Cacao nibs are the best thing ever. Viva Labs cacao nibs are fresh, tasty, and a great alternative to sugared chocolate. I discovered cacao nibs a while back and added them as regular items I pick up on Amazon. Because I'm always looking for a deal, I ended up buying a slightly cheaper brand and have something much less good to compare these to - that other brand? They weren't good - too old? I don't know. I actually ended up throwing them out. The Viva labs brand, on the other hand are fresh and flavorful. They are now my regular brand, and I have purchased additional bags on my own since I was given a free sample in exchange for my honest review.My favorite use of cacao nibs for a treat is to mix a small amount into a container of Dannon's Light and Fit Greek Yogurt. Very low calorie, and the addition of the nibs gives it some crunch and a wonderful hint of chocolate without all the sugar.

I like to use these chia seeds to add a little crunch on a salad, and I've also made a couple of nice lower carb puddings with them when I wanted to splurge. All of that worked out fine. Good product. I received a free sample in exchange for my honest review.
Worked out great for my bullet proof coffee. A high quality oil. I like the Viva products.I received a free sample of the product in exchange for my honest review.

This is a really nice, stylish bag. It's a high quality PU leather (looks just like leather and no chemical smell that you sometimes get with the cheaper PU leather). The tassles are such a nice touch!This went to a family friend with a 13" Macbook, and she loves it. In addition to being really smart-looking with the textured leather look and the gold hardware, she says it has just the right amount of padding to make her feel secure that if she drops it or clunks it against something her Macbook will be safe.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review (which is really my friend's honest review since I passed it along to her - but you get the point, right? She loves it!)

Huge jar of high quality coconut oil. I used it in cooking (it made a delicious low carb chocolate bark with cacao powder, a little peanut butter, and low carb sweetener) to good effect. It has a nice light coconut taste and scent. I also have been substituting it for the butter I normally make my morning eggs in, and it's an interesting and delicious change of pace.I received this product in exchange for my honest review, but I would recommend it anyway. It's really goo.

Lexi Sabado should have everything going for her. She's a newlywed. She's got brains, beauty, and an insane level of skill in all kinds of worthy things including hand to hand to hand combat and cooking. She's worked secretly for an agent of a group of operatives who get hired for the tough jobs since she was even younger than her twenty years. Plus, she's got some pretty strong psychic powers that help in investigating the bad guys. And yet with all this going for her, she can't get a break: her husband was deployed before they could have a honeymoon, and now a killer is stalking her.If you like a book with big action, you are going to love Weakest Lynx. Lexi and the group of operatives who are later assigned to keep her away from the killer who's been stalking her are well-drawn, interesting characters. Be ready for some graphic violence and a fast-paced ride through a suspenseful story.

I thoroughly enjoyed the first book about Winciette Jenkins and her crew, and I am so glad that the good guys and the bad guys were back for this tales. The stories are so well-crafted and the characters are wonderfully rich and real. The seaside setting in Britain is like an additional character.Just a fabulous cozy! Looking forward to the next one.

You  might not think a book about a minister's daughter who is stabbed to death and comes back to life after having experienced the white light would be funny and clever, but A Scrying Shame manages nicely to be both. Tthe main character of Arie is a fullly fleshed out young lady whose thoughts on what she's experiencing are great fun to share. Her job as a blood cleanup technician is fascinating, and you can tell that the author did her research. Plus, there's a satisfying mystery built in to the visions she sees when exposed to blood.I truly enjoyed this book and look forward to picking up any future additions to the series with my Kindle Unlimited subscription.

Great little camping lantern. I am very happy with how solidly made this is. It should hold up well to being stowed in the camping gear.The lantern is great once you figure out all of its compartments and functions. Sadly, the instructions aren't great. However, you operate the light by pulling up on the handles and the light slides out. The rechargeable batteries are in the bottom compartment, and they are replaceable if you ever need to exchange them. There is a compartment on the lid where you can put a set on non-rechargeable batteries if you ever need a backup. You access the different modes of the light (high, low, red, and red flashing) with the button that is over the charging light.I have charged it twice now and the batteries that came with it did the job. I forgot to time it the first time to see how long the light lasts, but on my second round on high, it is still going strong after 5.5 hours and it is still holding that charge two days later.Overall, this is a nifty camping accesory which puts out a low but very useable amount of light. If you are lighting a tent, you want to see without blinding yourself, and this will do it. Very happy with this. I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

This mic delivers improved quality of sound for Skype sessions on my laptop over the built in mic. The sound is clear and accurate and my Skype partners no longer ask me what that sound is when trains go by on the tracks near here. Definitely worth it for an  inexpensive ($25.00 at the time of this review) mic.I also tested it just by recording some audio, and while I wouldn't use it for recording a vocal line in my music, it would be great if I was still podcasting. No reason to lug the heavy boom mic and stand out anymore.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

When we first meet Coach Chance Benford, he's a man who is rapidly going off the rails. When fate intervenes with a second chance, he gets a shot at redemption. I'll let you judge how well he does :-)I really enjoyed this book (which I borrowed on Kindle Unlimited). The language sets you right down into the culture of Chance's small Kentucky town in an effortless way. The characters are alive, the plot twists are many, and there were only a few sections where the Biblical recitations by Chance went a little too long for me. I enjoyed being along for Chance's journey of discovery of himself although I still can't decide if I like the guy or not.Recommended for readers who don't mind questioning what they believe (whether believers or non-believers).

Very nice tote-style handbag with lots of space for all your stuff. A few pockets on the inside, and one on the outside. The PU leather doesn't have that chemical smell (nice bonus, because I've had a few purses where it took days to air them). It's a stiffer bag than some, but you need that when you're hauling a lot of gear, I think.Overall, a good bag for the price. Mine is they goldy-tan color, which is actually nicer than it sounds. I recieved a free sample of this item in exchange for my honest review.

This book was too much fun. I knew I had to pick it up on Kindle Unlimited when the sample made me laugh out loud. As hoped, the writing throughout was clever, witty, and the dialogue sparkled (even though the vampires didn't). The storytelling is closer to Christopher Moore than Twilight, and fans of the genre should be able to enjoy it even though it is not the typical paranormal romance because there's plenty of romance with the wry.I love it when a book's ending surprises me yet makes absolute sense at the same time. Few books manage it, but the twists and turns at the end of Four took me on a great ride!

Anyone who knows their way around tools knows that you need the right saw for the right job. This little pocket chainsaw is perfect for the jobs where you'd use a chainsaw but it's not worth it to get it out or if you're camping or doing something where you need something small and portable. I think mine is going to eventually find its way into my camping kit, but it has also been great for getting rid of the young junk trees that overpopulate my yard every year.This is also great for clearing low-hanging branches but be aware that it has the same problems as any chainsaw does and can bind if what you're sawing is going to fall in the direction you're cutting from.Overall, I am very satisfied with this saw and it's ready availability in a belt pouch.  (Mymale friend isn't--he has to have a real chainsaw for every job, but I think that's down to testosterone poisoning.)I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

Very nice little light strip. I like that it doesn't come on when there is already enough light to see by, and although the instructions aren't the greatest, it's a simple enough thing to operate and install. The instructions say not to install where the is high humidity and temperature, so don't do that. The adjustable hanging bracket is fairly difficult to get open with your fingers, but it does have a nock for prying it open with screw driver or some such, so that makes it much easier.I put this up in my laundry room, where it gets extremely dark at night because the light in there is a bare bulb on a pull string that is across the room from the door. More than once I've tripped over a forgotten laundry basket on the way to turning it on. This works great for lighting my way to it and once I've got the lamp on, the light strip turns off.I like that this lamp doesn't have a rechargeable battery because I prefer to have my own batteries which I charge rather than one that makes the unit useless if it stops charging. You will need to supply four AAAs, so you don't want to put it someplace where it's going to see a lot of heavy use. But, yeah...perfect for those dark corners and also a pleasant llooking, sturdy design.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

It's not like you can rave about a water bottle, but this is a nice one. It's soft and smooshy, so when it's not full of water it takes up very little space. After you've suirted all the water out, you can roll it up from the bottom like a tube of toothpaste and hold the roll together with the affixed wrap. Very nicely designed. I am now using it when walking because there's a clip you can use to hang it off a belt loop. and because it's soft, it isn't annoying to have it hanging there like a hard bottle is.I was given this product in exchange for my honest review, but I would recommend it to anyone who's in the market for a sports bottle that that is easy to carry, use, and store.

This is perfect for my car emergency kit for cold Ohio winters. I constantly leave my lights on and come walking out of work late at night with a dead battery and no one around. That just isn't going to be the problem it used to be. My brain isn't entirely seive-like yet, but with the ability to provide a jump up to 30 times on one charge, I won't have to worry for an entire winter.Plus, no need to carry an emergency light. This can be used as either a flashlight or a flasher. AND, to really put the icing on the cake, it comes with a whole bunch of different power tips for charging electronic devices.All of this is held very tidily in a well-made hard-shell case.Yes, I will have to remember to charge it a couple of times a year - it does discharge some even when not used. But that's normal, not a dig on the device.I was given a free sample of this product in exchange for an honest review, but I accepted the product because it looks great and is something I will use. And I'm using it, it's been charged, I've tested the lights and charging capability (phone and tablet), and I'm super-glad to have it. I have not been able to test the "jump" capability, but there's no reason it shouldn't work. That's the least complex of the jumper's function.

Nicely made backpack purse. It doesn't have the thick straps of a backpack, and it is smaller than a student backpack, which makes it just the right size for a purse (when you need to carry a lot but not the kitchen sink, too).There are generous compartments for stowing all your stuff. In addition to the two front pockets, there is a zippered flat pocket in the back just the right size for a flat wallet for easy access but where no one would be looking for it. There are an additional two small zippered compartments on the one side and another open compartment for easy access to. I'll probably toss my sunglass case in there.The purse backpack is made of high quality, pebble-textured PU Leather. It has no smell at all like some of the PU Leather purses I've had. Has a soft, flexible feel. The flap is lined with a faux velvety fabric and the inside with a satiny fabric that has a high quality feel - it's very flexible and not plasticy-feeling.The buckles on the pockets are fake and the pocket are actually held shut with magnetic snaps. However, the pockets are not just going to pop open on their own--it actually takes quite a bit of pressure to open them. I didn't like this at first, but it's a lot more convenient that buckles for getting in and out, so I like it now.This purse is going to see a lot of use from me on casual days when I don't need the heavy duty hauler! Recommended as a quality item with a nice look. I received this purse as a free sample in exchange for my honest review. However, I'd spend the money on it, so it gets a five star from me.

Here's the thing with this switcher: you plug it all in and it just works. No fiddling. No fussing. I had myself up and running with the three things I plugged into it (WI with adapter, DVD Player, and Fire TV Streaming Stick) with absolutely no bother at all. I did originally put the output cable in the wrong port, but a quick look at the picture in the manual got me fixed up in a jiffy. That was my problem, not the problem of the switcher!The quality of everything that plays through the switcher is the same as without the switcher (I was worry about the Fire TV stick, because that sees heavy use), but it wasn't a problem at all. The remote works as advertised. All in all, a nice product and no more switching things around in the on HDMI slot on my otherwise fantastic TV.I received this product in exchange for my honest review. But honestly, this is one I would have paid for (and should have bought one when I got my TV, since it makes using all my stuff a lot more convenient.)

Super-impressed with this portable light. I didn't know I could also use it as a portable charger for my iphone and other small electronics, so that was a bonus. This goes in my emergency / backwoods gear so that I can always have light and charging power if needed. At 3300 mAh, that would recharge my iphone 4s fully two times.First, it charged quickly from my PC (a few hours in the USB port) and then stayed lit overnight on high mode. So I can only imagine how much light you would get out of it on the medium or low lights. It would be perfect for camping or backpacking because it's small and easy to pack (with its own carrying case) but puts out a nice amount of useable light while. It also has a strobe function to use as an emergency signal.The final thing is that I am continually impressed with how well made Enko products are. You know how something just feels like quality when you're holding it in your hand? Yes, that. This is solid and well-made. You can just feel it. I really have become a fan of the Enko brand through being offered their products free in exchange for my honest review. This one was free, but I would absolutely not hesitate to buy the same product from them at full price. It really is good. Some of the stuff I get offered to review is crap (and I just ignore those requests because why get something free I wouldn't want?). Nothing from Enko has been.

Nice Apple certified charging cable. I have had a number of these (including the ones that came with my ipod and iphone), and this seems like a good sturdy cable. I find the biggest problem with all of the cables (including the Apple-manufactured cable) is that they eventually break where the cable and the plug head meet. This cable has a longer outer sheath, which I'm holding provides some additional reinforcement in those areas for a longer cable.Good, sturdy feel to the cable, so I am hoping for lots of error-free use for sync and charge, If not, I'll update my review. I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

I have been looking for a lighting solution for my outdoor shed, and now I've found it. This is pretty much perfect because not only will it light things up when enter the shed, but the globe that contains the set of lights pulls out and is portable. If I need to venture deep into the shop and haven't brought an extra flashlight along, no problem. I've got one right there hanging on the wall. I can just push it back into the holder easily on my way back out. That's just darn handy.The light is designed for brief bursts of activity, so while it goes on when motion is detected, it will turn off in 35 seconds. This makes it perfect for those spots where you need intermittent light but won't be hanging around in. And, of course, if you need to extend the lighting time, you can quickly pass your hand over the front of the light and the sensor will pick up the motion and flip the lights on again.The light takes three AAA batteries which don't come with the unit. Because the light only comes on when it's needed (meaning with motion and when it's dark outside), I expect to get a pretty long period of use out of the batteries I installed. To put the batteries in, just remove the light ball from the holder and twist to remove the back.All in all, a very nice light/flashlight.I received a free sample of this product for my honest review. And I honestly think it's really a nice little light!

First, the great things about this pot - It is the perfect size for making two cups of two, and the dispenser action is great and works as designed. Brew the tea, set the pot on your cup, and you've got a great cup of tea in no time. Or two or three, depending on the size of your cup and how much tea you decide to brew up. You want to make only as much as you'll be using immediately unless it's an herbal you can allow to steep without flavor consequences. You can't remove the tea leaves while leaving the tea in the pot.I really wanted to give this teapot a five star review, because I know I will be using it a lot for herbal teas, and I think the design is cool. Unfortunately, I think the pot is somewhat difficult to use only because you have to make sure that you don't jiggle the bottom or set it down wonky on the tray. If you do, you could end up with tea everywhere. I get that this is user error, but let's fact it, users frequently make errors. For this reason, I will have to use it only in the kitchen instead of having it sit with me at my desk where I'd want to use it because I know I'll bump and bobble it when I'm not paying attention.Another reviewer suggested that this could easily be remedied with a locking mechanism for the bottom of the pot, and I agree. If it had that, it would definitely be "Perfect"!Other than that, it's a great little pot and I had no problems with leaking when I was using it correctly. The first time you pull out the filter (which you pull out by the stem on the top), it can be difficult because it can be in there really tightly. I had a heck of a time with it, but it did eventually let go. subsequent removals have been painless.

Very nice little steamer. Doesn't drip or spit during steaming, which is always nice. Does what it needs to to--knocks out the wrinkles efficiently without leaving you with wet drops on the garment. The instructions are easy to read and there is a clear emphasis on how to use the steamer safely. I like to see this in my electronic items. It means the company cares about the details.The iron is a good size for traveling. You should be able to de-wrinkle an outfit quickly to be on your way without sacrificing too much valuable luggage space. The steamer won't even take up as much space as my hard-dryer does, so that's a bonus for me. The cord is long enough to be able to reach from low outlets all the way up to the top of a garment you've hung on a door without any problems. All in all, it's well designed.I was offered this item for free in exchange for my honest review. and I can't always say that I'd buy the item if I hadn't gotten it free, but I wouldn't hesitate on this steamer. I like the way it's made, and it gets the job down efficiently with no muss nor fuss.

This bluetooth headset is hands-down the most comfortable one that I have reviewed. The unique design gives you the comfort of wired earbuds (because I really don't like having all the extra pressure on my ears from the over the ear headsets) and the larger buttons are easier to manage and find. So, for design, this is a solid five stars!I find the sound quality to be pretty good. Since I've got about four different sets of bluetooth headsets now, I can actually say that I find the bass a little better with these than most of the others. No tinniness, etc. However, it's a small bluetooth speaker. Don't expect audiophile quality. However, the other headsets I've reviewed gave me a little more range before they started to skip. This is not to say that they are limited - I was over ten feet away and going around a second wall before they glitched, but I've been able to get farther than that with other sets. So, comparatively, this is a four star because of the slightly lower range.Paired immediately, no problems. Now, I personally will got for a little less range in order to have greater comfort, so overall, these are a 4.5 star for me and I am probably going to be using them more often then my cling-to-the-head bluetooth headsets.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review. Believe me, I'd tell you if they sucked :-)

You really could not do better than this on a budget for your kitchen measuring needs. Seriously, I threw out my other junk when I got a look at how heavy duty and solid feeling these are. My others were cheap plastic and aluminum that I've managed to collect at box stores over the years, but they're gone now. Although I received this measuring set free in exchange for an honest review, if the company said, "hey, you need to return those", I'd be like, "no way--here's your money". And I am seriously cheap!So, the liquids cup is a solid, heavy glass. It appears to be comparable to my old Pyrex measuring cup (one of the few things I'm keeping from my previous collection), but it is in a two cup size. Nice! It has both metric and ounces, but not the standard cup markings. However, it's easy enough to remember that 8 ounces is 1 cup and go from there.Both the solids measuring cups and the set of measuring spoons are simple in style and solidly made of stainless steel. Nothing fancy here. These guys were meant to go to work! However, I quite like the way they look because they have a vintage feel to them - like what my mother cooked with.The measuring cups are particularly nice because they have a longer handle than is typical. It not only looks good, but I can see instances when I might want a longer reach (to get more easily into a deep canister, for instance). It's also just got more gripping room.Overall, really nice. If you're looking for the basics for someone who is just moving out on their own, this would be a great set. They'll have it forever.

These are very attractive mugs, and despite being metallic, they don't draw the cold or hot through to the outside with any intensity (so they are comfortable to use). This may be because they have a stainless steel lining under the copper outer layer. Although Moscow Mule mugs are traditionally meant to be all copper, I'd think that in terms of standing up to use, a sturdier lining would actually be a benefit. It is for me, at least. Who's going to be checking my mugs for their metal content, anyway? :-)I thought about giving these to my son for his extensive collection of barware (he's a bartender), but in the end, they're too nice to give up. I really like they way they look, and they are lighter to hoist than my clay mugs.I received a free sample of the Moscow Mule mugs in exchange for my honest review. However, if I were shopping for something similar, these are good quality and I would go for them at the price. Like I said, my son's not getting them :-)

I'm not much of a whiskey drinker, so I enjoyed a a cold soft drink tonight while a friend of mine settled in with a whiskey. Both of us enjoyed our beverages (her a little bit more than me, I think). Very please with how the double-wall glass keeps the drink cold for longer than a single wall, but I don't end up with a cold, wet hand due to condensation on the glass.The set also looks very nice, and the glasses have just the right amount of weight to them to feel substantial without being too heavy to use. My friend offered to take my new set of glasses off my hands, which is quite a compliment because she likes her things nice. Failing going home with new glasses, she offered to continue to stop by and drink my whiskey.Overall, while I received this set of glasses free in exchange for my honest review, I can see spending the money on these, and they'd be a good gift as well. The packaging is excellent and very protective, so you shouldn't need to worry about breakage during shipping.

I've reviewed a lot of bluetooth headsets at this point, and in terms of comfort while working out, this one is at the top of the heap so far. The style of the headset really works for me. I've worn it to the gym and while cycling, and it was comfortable and very secure. The headset is much more stylish than the blocky ones I've had in the past, and they stick out less from your head. When my hair is down, they are completely hidden. Like most headsets, you get three sizes of rubber buds so that you can find the one that works for you.The controls are easy to work if you need to pause your music (or audiobooks in my case), and the volume control is also easy if you can remember whether it's a short or long press that changes the volume rather than skips the track. I have to remind myself before I use them, but it takes half a second to reread the extremely well-written instructions booklet. Woohoo! Grammatically correct instructions that are easy to follow!I find the sound to be comparable to other bluetooth headsets in this price range and about the same as my wired earbuds. I've gotten about 20 feet away and was in another room from my ipod before there were any drop outs in the audio, so the range is good for the wireless connection. Synched immediately without any hassle.I've been able to use them for about four hours now for audio listening, and I haven't had to recharge.The headset comes with a short mini-usb charging cable and a very nice hard-shell case for storage. The case is a really nice bonus. I can store them, toss them in my backpack, purse, or bike bag, and not be concerned that they'll get damaged by all the other junk that's in there :-)I received this product in exchange for my honest review.

Who would have thought that a video doorbell would be such a cool thing? I work from home and am frequently on the phone and can't just be putting people on hold willy-nilly while I'm working. I have a no solicitors sign, and still people beat on my door. How cool it has been to get an alert and see who it is so I don't have to respond unless it really is someone important (the gas company, a delivery, etc.)First things first: I read a lot of reviews with the doorbell that complained about this or that, but I had a really trouble-free experience. For me, the biggest problem was fitting the wire behind the doorbell so that it sat down tight against the wall. But it didn't take hours--it just took a couple of extra minutes.I strongly recommend that anyone who gets this doorbell pay attention to the minimum requirements for successful installation. If you do, I think you will be pleased.First, make sure you have an old transformer-powered doorbell which is what this can replace. You'll also need to make sure you router is up to snuff and that you broadcast your SSID (router name) so that doorbell can find it, then take your phone outside the front door to run a bandwidth test on speedtest.net to verify that your up bandwidth will be enough. If you get a couple of consistent tests that meet the speed requirement of 1.5 up (so it can upload the video through the internet and later back down to your phone), you should be good, Finally, you'll want to check that you have a compatible phone.  I accepted a sample of the doorbell in exchange for my honest review after making sure I met the system requirements. If I hadn't, I would have refused. I didn't want to be disappointed because I failed to follow instructions :-)Like I said, the installation was simple, although it does require mucking about with wires (and in my case, live ones, since I couldn't find the transformer to disconnect it while I replaced the old doorbell with my new, mucho cool one). And, of course, there are screws you'll be affixing to your house, so it takes a little bit of confidence with various tools as well as remembering not to electrocute onself. Always something to bear in mind.Installation took about an hour altogether, mostly because I put it flat against the wall the first time, waited for it to charge so I could test it, and then decided I probably needed the handy wedge to angle it up and over a bit. (The wedge was sent along with my package, but it wasn't inside the box, so it may be an additional accessory. What I'm saying is you may need to research that if you think you'll need it.)  So, anyway, I had to remove it and screw it down a second time. I think that's about the longest it would take anyone, and I wasn't working the whole time, I was waiting for it to charge up for the test.I've had it for about a week now, and I couldn't be happier with it. The video is adequate to the task (it's not cinema quality, obviously, but you should be able to make out who it is exactly at the door), and the two different lighting modes are very helpful. My front doorstep is extremely shady, and the ability to bring the exposure up a little is a big help. When someone rings the bell, I've got an alert within 2-3 seconds, and I can start the video, get on the intercom to tell whoever it is to go away, and be done with it without moving from my chair. While I haven't been away from the house much yet, I look forward to telling people to go away when I'm not even there!The sound quality is very clear, and the motion sensor doesn't go off at random stuff. Someone would need to linger around a bit to get it to respond, and that makes sense. You don't want it sending you an alert every time you go in and out. All in all, if you're looking for a video / intercom  at your front door (and, again I stress, have made sure that your situation meets the minimum requirements before installation), you'll like it. And wonder how you lived without it.

I've been getting a really nice assortment of Chinese teas lately, and not a single one of them has disappointed. My only experience with black teas (which, come to think, is probably why I've avoided them) has been with the kind that comes in the tea bag. Well, silly me. Black tea is great! Or, at least it is when you get a quality one like this nice Pu Erh.I have a tendency to brew teas strong, and this one works just fine either strong or a little weaker. Really delicious, and very smooth. I won't evaluate the health claims, but as far as the tastes--good stuff. In fact, I ran for a cup right after work to wind down after a tough day. I am the can of tea in the low humidity drawer of my fridge so it stays just as good for a long time.You should be able to get more than one cup out of the same batch of leaves. I always get a minimum of a second infusion that is just as strong and tasty as the first and sometimes a third, if I haven't let it sit too long in the previous go.I do like that the tea comes in a foil bag inside of the tin. It's cute as well as practical. You can leave it sitting around and it's decorative in addition to delicious.I was given a sample of this tea in exchange for my honest review.

I am super-thrilled with this charging unit. I've had my eye on a more expensive one for a while as my bike trips get longer and longer, but I didn't pull the trigger because of the cost. Although I received this product in exchange for my honest review, I wouldn't even bat an eyelash if I'd had to pay for it. Not only do I love the functionality, but I think the price (currently listed at $119.00) is excellent.If you get on and ride immediately after putting the charger on and try to power the lights or charge a phone, you will be unjustifiably disappointed. The reason is that to provide consistent power, you need to ride for a while to get the internal battery charged up. It's hard to wait when you get a new toy (I didn't, which is how I know this), but you need to do it, or you'll get charge drop outs and low lights. Once you get that first charging ride done, the light should be reasonably bright when on the high beam, and it is really effective in blinker mode. You switch between the three options--low, high, and blink--with the button you install on the handle bar. I have another headlight, but I don't always take it with me. Having the extra light option is a bonus since what I wanted it for is the charging power.If, like me, you ride far but slow, don't worry that you won't get enough charging power out of this. I average around 8-10 miles per hour over 1.5 to 3 hour rides while using an iPhone and the Map My Fitness app with GPS, GPS sucks up battery power like there's no tomorrow. Over a three hour ride, the battery would normally quit before I'm done. Now, when I end my rides, the phone is about as charged as when I left the house. I think that's remarkable. I'm stoked that my upcoming day-long rides aren't going to leave me without the ability to make an emergency call even if I track the entire ride with GPS.The charger gives priority to the lights, so you won't be able to charge and light your way at the same time. This makes sense, since it always has to be safety first. Who wants to take a chance on the lights dropping out on a dark road just to listen to tunes longer? So, if you're not getting powered in daylight, make sure the lights aren't on.Finally, the installation process was pretty painless. The most difficult part was finding my reading glasses for that tiny, tiny writing! You may need to try a couple of the different sized flanges to get the right fit for your bike, but it's only a couple minute fix to change them out. Overall, this is a great product, and I really recommend grabbing one if you ride with your electronics.

This oolong tea is delicious. It brews to a light color and has a smooth taste. Although I use only loose teas now (had no idea what tea could actually taste like back in the day when I thought tea always came in bags), I'm not a big tea gourmet. I can't talk about woody notes, etc, but I can say that the tea smells amazing when you open the bag, and it brews up delicious. The caffeine effect is mild for this one.You don't want to pack your infuser too tight because you need to give the leaves room to expand. And then, just enjoy!I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review. But you can believe that this is going on my "replace this with your own money" list when I run out.

Very pleased with this bike case. I've been kitting my bike out for longer trips over the past year, and when Gear Beast offered me a free sample of this one in exchange for my honest review, I obviously had to say yes, please send it!Could not be happier with this. I've used it on a couple of rides and it is sturdily made. You always worry when you've got your expensive electronic gear just hanging out where catastrophe can strike, but I am no longer worried that the case will be knocked off the bike by anything other than a major spill. Once you get it clicked into the brackets on the bottom, it stays in place. It was easy to put on the handlebar with no tools needed. Only takes a minute.The case comes with a set of scored padding that can be removed to accommodate the size of your phone. I put an iPhone 4s in it (that's what I use for the GPS for my rides), and it fit snuggly, but this can accommodate quite a large phone - you just remove another section of the padding. That's great because I can continue to use the case no matter what size phone I get in the future. Good planning on Gear Beast's part.The case can be oriented in either portrait or landscape, so no matter how you want to view your phone, you can do it.The other thing I like is that the two zippers used for closure allow my to stick the charging cable from my new bike usb charger into the case while still keeping it closed securely so that I can charge my phone as I ride. If it only had one zipper, I wouldn't be able to use it while charging because it would be open on one side instead of being able to just snug the zippers against the cable on each side.Overall, very happy with this case and it is going to see a lot of use.

I have purchased items in the past that were promoted as "over the door" items but when they arrived, they could only be used if you didn't want to close the door. What's the point of having a door at all if you can't close it, right?I am happy to report that I now have a cute, really shabby-chic rack hanger over the top of my bathroom door that I have been using to hang robes, wet towels, and various assortments of clothing items. Although it is a thin metal, it is sturdy. I wouldn't hang a full backpack on it, but it is more than adequate for everything I've used it for.And, yeah, best part, I can still close the bathroom door :-)I was sent a free sample of this item in exchange for my honest review. However, At the time of this review, it's selling for $8.50 with Prime shipping available, and that's a price I consider pretty reasonable. If I had another bathroom, I would definitely spring for another one.

This belt is excellent! You want something that can keep your valuable stuff with you when you're working out, but it also needs to be able to protect your stuff from the elements while being unobtrusive. I've been using the same old skool bum bag for years, but I knew that if this belt worked as well as it looks, I'd never do that again. When I went to the gym to lift tonight, it worked out great. I didn't worry about sweating on my phone with it so close to my body (I shorted one once during a bike ride), but it is also out of they way and non-bulky riding on my waist. I got the purple one, and it's pretty snazzy if you wear it on the outside, too.The second bag is perfect for the car keys. I'm going to love this on bike rides this summer, particularly that it's waterproof. Many thanks to Gear Beast for providing me a sample to review in exchange for my honest review. From the high quality of the materials involved, I think I am going to be enjoying the convenience of this belt for a long time.

As a fan of Mr. Tomlinson's Sendero series, I was happy to find that I like this one just as much as I liked those books. I'm glad that he didn't suddenly adopt a cheery world view and instead stuck with what he does so well--telling a story about female heroines trying to get by in a world that is stacked against them.This novel is once again peopled by characters who are morally ambiguous at best, is well researched for the time period and setting, and rolls along with lots of action. Quite suspenseful. There were times when I literally could not put it down.

Wow! I had another shower speaker that I liked, but this one is much better. It's attractive and solid-looking, and I don't worry about it getting wrecked if the suction lets loose when there's a tub full of water (not that it has, but stuff happens),The sound is good. You're obviously not going to get strong bass sound out of a small bluetooth speaker, but the treble and mid ranges are more than adequate to bathroom listening. I like that I can set up and audiobook or music and leave my phone well away from the steamy bathroom but still listen to whatever I want.The controls for the unit work well, and I had an easy time getting it to sync with my iphone. If you're one of those people who have to pick up a call wherever you are, you can now chat away from the shower, if you dare.Overall, a cool thing to have, and I would recommend it to a friend (in fact, I've already done just that to a friend who was looking for a gift for his music-loving brother). I got this product in exchange for my honest review.

I liked the way this mouse worked, and It was particularly good when I used it in situations where I always try to use a mouse and really shouldn't--on my pants leg, on the bed next to me over the folds of the sheet, etc. You know--those places where you just insist on using the laptop but don't want to use the touch pad. It's great for that! Very easy to hang onto and the lack of wiring is obviously a bonus.The mouse synced up easily with my laptop, so no problems there. I've had wireless mice in the past that were iffy at best. Not so for this one.My only caveat for this is that it would have been more comfortable to use if it was slightly smaller. I don't have tiny hands, but they also aren't what you could call big. I think the mouse is probably sized perfectly for a larger hand than I have. So, for me, this is just a four star and won't replace my mouse when I'm sitting at my desk, but it does now wait on the night stand for me to be mucking about on my laptop in bed.I got a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

Excellent money belt. The fabric and straps are well made and it is comfortable to wear--this is going to hold up to a lot of travel. I've used a money belt for travel for years, and this is an excellent replacement for my well-used previous one. This one is slightly larger, which allows just a little more width for items, something which I wished I had in my old one. Comfortable enough to sleep in if you frequent hostels and don't like to be parted from money and important papers because of that.I particularly appreciate that this money belt is a color that is unlikely to show dirt. My old flesh-toned one ended up looking pretty scroungy after a long trip of being sweated on and rummaged through. Although not many people see it, it matters to me. I received this item free in exchange for my honest review, but I asked for it because I needed a new one as good or better than the old one. This one is definitely a great pick! The RFID protection is a nice bonus, too.

Could not be more pleased with this backpack. It is very stylish and cute for a start. Also, while it has adequate padding for a laptop bag  it manages not to weigh a lot. I have a heavy duty laptop backpack I've been using for years and it weighs a ton. It just got replaced! Carrying a laptop is enough weight. The bag doesn't have to weigh a ton. It fits my 17" laptop snugly with room for additional books, etc.The bag has two small inner pockets where you can store small items, although they are open at the top, so you don't want to put in anything that could fall out and end up smashed. There is also a larger pocket against the back of the bag (against the padding) that would be perfect for a tablet or iPad. There are two external open side pockets perfect for holding a water bottle, and a larger zippable front pocket for pens, pencils, etc .The faux leather zipper pulls are a nice touch and the canvas fabric is sturdy. The straps are well padded, so it is comfortable to use. I use my backpack for a purse, and this is a stylish change from the heavier one I've been carrying. Love it!I received this item for free in exchange for my honest review.

This mat works brilliantly for hanging on to the litter and the little rejected bits of food that my cat insists on throwing out of the bowl. Vacuums up easily and leaves me with one less source of stuff getting tracked all over the house.I am less irritated with my dear one now when I walk down the hall by her things. Now, if only they could make a mat that collects all of the hair and dander as she wanders around the house making her presence know.

I really like this planner. I'm using it specifically for my writing goals for the year, and it provides some really interesting new ways for organizing myself around those goals. You'll need to put some time into really thinking about why you want to the goals you want and alternate ways of thinking about them. I really enjoyed setting my goals up for the year and this month for that reason. I think it is keeping me a little more focused than just a regular calendar where I'd keep a list of what I want to accomplish without really looking at why I want to accomplish it.Now, if it could only give me the extra five or so hours per day I need to accomplish all those things I've set as my goals :-)

If you are looking for an inexpensive shower/bath speaker solution so that you can keep your electronics well away from water sources, this is a really good option.First, it paired easily with my iPhone. That's the most critical thing taken care of right there.Second, very acceptable sound quality. Bluetooth sound quality is never going to be amazing and match your big wired speakers, so understand what you're getting. Additionally, small speakers are not going to give you good bass and depth of sound. But these do a good job for the price and technology.The instructions that come with the speakers are good (but tiny,tiny!), and tell you have to control the volume, advance songs, pick up a call, etc. They're even a little easier to understand than some I've had with foreign manufacturers, so there's a bonus there.My biggest criticism of the unit is that the first time I charged it, the cover for the charging port broke off. It is attached by a very slender thread. That tiny cover is now gone for good because I didn't notice it was lost and I probably swept it up at some point and threw it away. So, you will need to take care that you also don't lose that peice. I don't know how well the unit will do if it nose dives into the tub while I'm taking a bath, so I am now putting it on the top of the tub railing instead of on the wall.

I was very impressed with this from the minute I took it out of the package. I mean, let's face it, it's a plastic USB drive--but it feels substantial. The plastic cutout for putting it on a keychain is solid and won't break off in five minutes like some of the previous thumb drives I've had.Surprisingly, the recording quality is very good for something so tiny. The biggest thing is that it has to be clear, and it it. I tested it from several feet away, and it picked up the sound really well. I used it to record a story outline and then plugged it in and it worked great for transcription with my Dragon Naturally Speaking.This little guy is a no-brainer for anyone who needs to be able to quickly record notes no matter where you are. I know many people use their phone for that, but the phone uses up a lot more juice to do it, whereas this device will do a lot of hours of recording before needing recharging (which you can do easily by plugging it in to the usb port on your PC). by lots, up to 15 or so. Which is nice.You do need to wait a few seconds when you turn it on before it is ready to record, but you can easily tell when it's time to talk because the light on the drive changes from red to blue. The on/off button is easy to find by sight or by feel. Overall, a simple but very useable recorder.Here is my only problem with it--it's wonderfully compact. So compact that I have already misplaced it. When I find it, it's going on the keychain immediately!

I was surprised by a lot of things about these earphones. Bearing in mind that this is a small blueteeth headset, I was pleased with both the sound quality and the battery life. Since my primary use would definitely be for working out / walking, etc., they more than adequately serve that purposeFirst, using them only for music, I got 4 hours run time from the initial charge. Definitely not bad. If I had been talking on the phone, I would have expected a short period of use, because the two-way audio is more power intensive.Second, the sound quality was definitely acceptable. I've certainly had worse, even from some cheap wired earbuds. While I'm not an audiophile, it will make me crazy if the audio ends up overcompressed, and this wasn't. Obviously, you're not going to get any kind of bass range out of such a tiny speaker, but the sound wasn't tinny or excessively degraded.Call quality was acceptable. I could understand the caller, and the caller could understand me. So, there's that all important clarity factor when you're talking on the phone taken care of. The caller did say that the sound was "boomy" but it wasn't awful. I talk to a lot of people on the phone for my job, and I swear that half of them are calling from a tin can on a string. This didn't sound like that, apparently.The earbuds come with three different sizes of earplugs that you can try for comfort. If you find that you need it (I did), they also have a plastic loop that attaches to the earphones to help keep them on your ears. I find any kind of ear bud just the slightest bit annoying, and these were no more annoying than my normal ear buds, so if you don't find ear buds annoying, you should be just fine with these.I was able to get about 15 or so feet away from my phone without skips and drop outs, which is what I would expect from bluetooth. It doesn't have a big range, and it doesn't go through walls well. Then again, these are for excercising, so you will normally be keeping your phone or mp3 player on you or near you while you work out.Since these appear to often be on sale (currently at $11.00-18.00 depending on color), you really can't beat the price. I got mine free for an honest review, but I would recommend these. If you are an audiophile or extremely picky about your sound quality, you won't want them, but the chances of finding bluetooth audio you do like is pretty small. The technology just doesn't support really good sound quality.

I have the Idylc Kona French press found here:http://www.amazon.com/Premium-Espresso-34-Ounce-Resistant-Stainless/dp/B00FMJDJ5C/ref=pd_bxgy_k_text_yThese newer replacement screens are really excellent. Although I had very little problem with the first set of screens, screens do wear out and need replacing over time, often because the fit against the side of the press is no longer tight enough to prevent solids escaping. I also make loose tea with my other French press and find that after I replaced the screen with one of these. Due to the tighter fit at the sides, even the smallest particles of those teas tend to stay on the right side of the filter.The screens just have a much more sturdy feel to them, and I expect them to last a good long time. So what more can you ask for?

I was unsure how I was going to feel about this book, because I can be a real priss when it comes to steamy, sexy stuff in my reading material. I am also much more of an old adult than I am a New Adult, which is the correct genre for this one, but I've enjoyed the author's "voice" before and wanted to give it a go. I'm glad that I did.I love it when a book can make me laugh out loud! And I did that several times during Min's internal pissing and moaning about the state of her life when the solution was right there in front of her. The author has created a fun book full of good-humored angst about the pursuit of/retreat from a hot guy. The characters are really well drawn and come to life.Although it was a novella, it was exactly the right length for the story it told. Nothing was missing, and nothing was padded to try to get the length to go into novel range. If you are looking for a shortish, light read, you could do worse than give this one a a tryOverall, it was quite good fun. Too steamy for me, but the sexy parts are well-written--they didn't make me cringe or skip several pages like sexy parts often do. Ladies who are younger and juicier than I am will most likely appreciate them very much.Assuming that the few hormones I have left are still intact AND if there is another book in the series, I look forward to reading it.

I received the New Born Baby candle set free in exchange for my honest review, and I have to say that this is a really nice little set. If you like the smells associated with a (clean) infant, you'll be in heaven with these. The baby powder scent is great--subtle and extremely pleasant. The baby shampoo scent is also spot on, and I was actually surprised how nice it is to have it available in a scented candle. The baby blanket one also has that new baby smell, but it's hard to pin down the scent exactly--like lightly scented detergent? Whatever it is, it's a nice smell, and also subtle.Very clean burning--you don't get any soot in the flame. As far as I can tell at this stage, they are going to be very long-burning as well. I burned one for a couple of hours and the candle level barely went down.I was particularly excited that it is very easy to remove the labels. I prefer not to have the branding front and center when I have candles out for company, and some brands of candles have the label affixed so tight that you can't get them off without scrubbing. Not the case here. They are obviously designed to peel away without leaving glue. Nice.

Overall, this disc is very solidly made of thick, durable plastic. No complaints there. Unless you plan on using it over broken glass, it's going to hold up. The spines are also great, because they prevent the disc from wandering out from under you while it's in use. That in itself is an excellent feature to improve safety when using the disc.The hand pump was a nice addition (it would have been depressing to be unable to inflate it when it arrived since I don't have a ball pump), but it is definitely not the best choice for inflation.  The pump is as solidly made as the disc, and it includes the needle to add to the pump for filling the disc. However, it takes a hugely long period of time to fill the disc with this pump. So, be aware that really, you're going to want to use a basketball pump. If you've got one, this disc will be great for you right out of box.I received a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

Love this! It's my new desk chair. I've thought about getting a medicine ball to use as a replacement for my desk chair for years. I spend most of my day at one or the other of my computers, and while I also have a standing station and cycle while I work on a fitdesk, I still log way too much time sitting.The ball is nice and firm, and it's bearing up well under long periods of use under a substantial amount of weight. It is keeping my back and neck nice and destressed as I hoped it would, so I couldn't be happier. There are a number of medicine balls sold as chairs that have a base to set on, but I like that mine can roll a bit. You certainly don't need the base for stability (unless your balance is atrocious), and I think it might even negate some of the benefit to your core muscles if you immobilize the ball that.I was also happy with the foot pump included with the ball. Although it does look a bit flimsy, it got the job done just fine. The ball also came with an extra plug for the fill hole. The manufacturer is apparently planning ahead for when you lose the first one :-)I was offered this product in exchange for my honest review, but I wouldn't hesitate to purchase it after having had the opportunity to check it out. If it stays at such a good price, there's a very strong possibility my best friend will be the proud owner of one come the holiday gifting season.

Very pleased with this radar detector. I have never used one before, so I forced an expert to come along with me during my first drive and he advised me on the ins and outs of different kinds of radar and what they probably mean. With the K band, which the C1 and C2 city settings mostly filter out, I was never able to identify what set it off. My expert advised me that it was likely to be garage doors but that some smaller cities still use the K band radar for other things (like those signs that tell you how fast you are going).Overall, I've had a good time using this detector. It has a nice sleek look which is only spoiled by the 360 laser detector on the top. It's small, though, and I want to know when there's laser nearby, so no problem at all, really. The instructions that come with the detector have everything you need to know about how to use the detector, and they are in easy to read. The buttons are well-placed, and the display is easy to read. You even have the option to dim it for night driving, which would be a handy feature.I was a little surprised by how this caused me to be more aware of my overall driving. I do have a tendency to space out, and when it beeped, I had to check out the kind of radar/laser detected and check my speed. Awareness when driving is a good thing!Overall, I'd say if you're looking for a solid, useable radar detector, you probably can't go wrong with this one.I got a free sample of this product in exchange for my honest review.

A while ago, I read a nicely written short story by K M Weiland, so I didn't hesitate at the opportunity to receive a free copy of Behold The Dawn in exchange for an honest review. What I didn't pay attention to before grabbing it was that it's marked as a Christian book. I was looking forward to reading something set during the time of King Richard's crusade, but I'm not a Christian. I seldom enjoy Christian literature because it is often more intent on converting me than entertaining or educating me.I was pleasantly surprised when I ended up really enjoying the book. It kept usurping the place of the other four or so books I'm reading. While the main conflict of the book is an internal one between a man and his god, there was an action-packed story framed around that conflict, and the book didn't preach.The protagonist, Marcus Annan, is a well-drawn character with a way of thinking and a need for forgiveness that fits well with history.
