Still, 3.0 can be found for about the price of the original release. If you're going to pick one, go with 3.0 as long as you can get it for the price of the original.

Multi-Dimensional Warrior is a pretty good Santana collection combining songs from Abraxas to Shaman with the emphasis on later post Gregg Rolie and Tom Coster era for the most part. The collection was picked by Carlos himself and five of the songs have been slightly modified with a new overdub or two. The 14 songs on disc one all have vocals while disc two are instrumentals with the idea being "to create an engaging journey through a soundscape of moods and feelings." Both the discs could've fit an extra song so it's a bit of a shame that nothing from an album like Caravanserai is included. Still, a very good collection that makes it a really nice listen especially disc two late at night.

This release contains the lion's share of two shows. The first is from Wednesday May 10, 1978 at the New Haven Coliseum in Connecticut and the second from Thursday May 11, 1978 at the Springfield Civic Center Arena in Massachusetts. Many people seem to really like these two shows but I find them to just be okay. The sound quality suffers from a "Boom Box" feel and has a heavy thud. I have a hard time getting this to sound good on my stereo and it's hard to adjust the volume just right. Add to that, the mix isn't very good and really feels off. Bob's slide playing is way loud in the mix while Keith is nearly non existent. All in all, I've only played this a handful of times since it was first released in 2002.Some of the performances are very good such as Cassidy, Peggy-O, Let It Grow->Deal, Stella Blue and a few others but some of the jams I find a little flat. The Other One intro starts off nice but by the time they get around to actually playing to song, it's lost it's energy. Scarlet->Fire doesn't really have any jamming and is kept short unlike quite a few from this era that are nicely stretched out. Most of the jamming on these shows is confined to the Drums segments. The vocals are also off sometimes badly during these shows. I understand that the band was tripping heavily the second night anyway and these shows have achieved somewhat legendary status in Dead lore. Ironic, considering that this showcases what a lot of people consider to be some of the worst traits of '78 with Bob's slide, rough vocals, Donna screeching, sometimes sloppy transitions, little Keith and somewhat flat playing. If you like it, great but for me there are moments of greatness to be found but there's so much better from this era widely available elsewhere.

Kate Wolf & The Wildwood Flower produced their first album originally released on Owl Records in 1976. Kate was living in Sonoma County and was well known in the area being a DJ as well as performing in the area with her band The Wildwood Flower. The cover shot was taken at Goat Rock Beach in Jenner. Back Roads has a very intimate feel being recorded mostly live in a living room over 5 days in front of a roaring fire. The album is filled with great songs starting off with Kate's lovely Lately and also includes a great cover of The Redtail Hawk. When all is said and done, there isn't a weak song on the album. It's a shame that the album isn't better known because it's a masterpiece.

This was first released in 1989 or so and was a "nice price" cd compilation on Pickwick Records. The band were still having hits on the radio and MTV at the time while cds were relatively new. This was even released on record. Moody Blues comps hadn't flooded the cd market yet. The nice thing about this release, which runs just under an hour, is that it tends to focus on more obscure songs. There's no Tuesday Afternoon or Nights In White Satin on here which made it a nice companion to Greatest Hits. However, adding Melancholy Man, Legend Of A Mind, Dear Diary and The Tide Rushes In would've made it even better. This Is The Moody Blues hadn't even been issued on cd yet although the version of Question here is that version. The songs are also somewhat evenly divided among the band members here: Justin gets 5, Mike gets 4, John gets 3, while both Graeme and Ray get two apiece.The set list is:Voices In The SkyOut And InCandle Of LifeAfter You CameFor My LadyCitiesA Simple GameFly Me HighSteppin' In A Slide ZoneSo Deep Within YouI'll Be Level With YouLeave This Man AloneDr. Livingston, I PresumeGimmie A Little Somethin'Please Think About ItQuestion

A cool little item that does what it's suppose to do. You may need a VGA chord because this doesn't come with one. I think you might also need a separate chord for sound. All in all, it's very nice and Belkin did a good job with this one.

This is a pretty great Ray Charles collection with all 3 discs clocking in at about 75 minutes apiece and the mastering is great. This can currently be had for about $7.00 new from good third party sellers. The music is great and shouldn't be missed. I just wish that there was another 3 disc volume featuring the stuff that didn't make this one that also included later stuff.

In a Word: Yes (1969-) was first released in July 2002 (remastered in 2008) by Warner Bros./Rhino and includes stuff up to 2001's Magnification. Rhino was getting ready to release remastered and expanded versions of the band's studio catalog from 1969 to 1984. All of Yes' albums from 1969's Yes through 1987's Big Generator were released on Atlantic Records (later Atco) which is owned by Warner Brothers.This five disc set is a pretty good overview except for the fact that there are no live songs. I also think the unreleased songs should've been released as bonus songs elsewhere or released on their own cd. The ones here are noting more than unfinished ideas or complete throw aways for the most part. The sound quality isn't all that good as well on most of them. I'm also surprised that the Grammy nominated Masquerade isn't included as well as And You and I, Into the Lens and Walls which received a fair amount of radio play at the time. I think that this should have been expanded to 7 discs to include the above to the box.I also would have added songs like I See You, Yesterday and Today, Looking Around, Something's Coming (stereo version), No Opportunity Necessary, Everydays (live), Mood For a Day, Long Distance Runaround/The Fish (replace studio with live version), Siberian Khatru (replace studio with live version), Your Move/I've Seen All Good People (replace studio with live version), The Remembering, Ritual (live), Parallels (live), Madrigal, On the Silent Wings of Freedom, Hearts, I'm Running, Birthright, The Meeting (replacing Fists of Fire), Quartet, Saving My Heart, Without Hope You Cannot Start the Day, Take the Water to the Mountain, Where Will You Be, The Revealing Science of God (replace studio with live version), Awaken (live) Onward (live), Foot Prints, Sign Language, Children of the Light (Keystudio version), From the Balcony, It Will Be a Good Day (The River), Lightning Strikes, Magnification, Don't Go and Time Is Time. I would have also included something from Jon's Olias, Chris' Fish Out of Water, Beginnings and The Steve Howe album. This could have been a great place to find a good overview of Yes all in one place but falls somewhat short.

Badfinger's third album was released in time for Christmas 1971 here in the States and many Badfinger fans (myself included) tend to find it one of their best, if not their best. The band started work on it shortly after the release of their second album, No Dice. The production dragged on going through a couple of different producers for about a year before Todd Rundgren was brought in to finish the album. During Todd's time, new songs were recorded as well as others having new parts re-recorded for the final album.Both Todd and the band did an amazing job with this album. The songs are keepers and the production is very tight. Both Baby Blue and Day After Day would become massive hits for the album and band. The album, like the other three Apple Badfinger albums became somewhat hard to find after Apple folded. The only real three drawbacks to all these 2010 remasters are the somewhat flimsy packaging and no sleeves for the discs. Add to that, some of the bonus content being only available as downloadable content when there was still enough room to fit it all on the discs. The Name of the Game indeed EMI!

Ah, Easter 1987. Easter weekend I saw the Grateful Dead perform three nights at Irvine, The Simpsons premiered on Tracy Ullman and by the end of the week, this album was released. I had been a Tom Petty & The Heartbreakers fan for years already and seen them live a few times. However, this may be my favorite album of theirs. There's more of a stripped down rock feel with this record without all the guest appearances that popped up on Southern Accents and is back to a more group record. All the songs on here are 100 perfect with absolutely no filler whatsoever.I remember back when this was released, Tom said something like that there was enough songs left over to have made this a 2 record set. I'd LOVE to hear those songs! I've noticed that some people refer to this as a "forgotten" album but I've never really understood that. The album was a big fairly big seller, the band made the rounds on a few tv shows and there was even a tv special of the band in Egypt supporting this album. Granted, Jammin' Me wasn't as widely played as Don't Come Around Here No More and the sales were higher for Full Moon Fever a couple of years later. Stiil, forgotten or not, a true masterpiece.

Long After Dark was first released in November 1982 and was the first album to feature Howie Epstein. The overall feel of the album has basic power chord/New Wavy feel to it. Whereas, previous albums tend to mix rockers with songs like Insider, the feel on this one doesn't change that much. Admittedly, I didn't care for this album as much as the other ones when first released. That being said, it actually has quite a few great songs with my personal favorite standouts being: You Got Lucky, Deliver Me, Change Of Heart, Finding Out, We Stand A Chance and Straight into Darkness. The other songs aren't really bad either.

Ass made it's American debut at the end of 1973 and would be the band's last for Apple Records. Badfinger's then manager Stan Polley was already causing problems for the band. Todd Rundgren who had produced Straight Up had originally been hired to produce Ass but had a falling out about a week into production. The band then tried to produce the album themselves but had little success. Finally, Chris Thomas was brought in to produce the record. The album features two songs each by Pete and Tom, one by Mike and a full five by Joey. This is the most that Joey would have on any original Badfinger album. Highlights are many with Apple Of My Eye and Timeless by Pete, Blind Owl and When I Say by Tom. Joey's best are Icicles, Constitution, Get Away and The Winner. The other two songs on the album are okay. This edition features some nice bonus songs but I'm a little disappointed. Only some of the bonus songs make it to the disc while the rest are bonus digital tracks that are only downloadable in lossy quality. There's enough room to have fit them all on the disc but this is what Apple has done with all four Badfinger albums.

The Live Anthology: Ultimate Collector's Box was released in time for Christmas in 2009 and runs from 1978 through 2007. This deluxe version includes: 5 live discs, 1 blu ray including high definition versions of the 5 discs, 2 dvds: 1978 New Year's Eve concert from Santa Monica, California, 400 Days, a documentary shot during the recording and tour for the 1994 album Wildflowers, and a repressing of the very rare Official Live 'Leg short lp.It's a bummer that they didn't include Official Live 'Leg on the blu ray. The discs are very well picked and the performances are top notch but each one runs about 15 to 20 minutes short of full playing time. There are quite a few classic songs and rarities that were played during the 30 year era that don't show up on here (Change Of Heart, It'll All Work Out, I Fought The Law, Blue Moon Of Kentucky, King's Road, Yer So Bad and so on). I should also point out that that a few of the songs on here are also already available on other releases like Runnin' Down a Dream - 4 Disc Limited Edition Set - Cd & DVD Box Set - DVD. I would've been a bit happier if they'd geared those songs to unreleased versions.
This is a very nice ottoman that goes great with the chairs that we have in out house and we really like the color. It's very well made.
This is a fantastic looking table!!! We're in the process of moving and this table looks wonderful in our new fenced yard. I can't wait to get chairs that go with it!
Awesome set and well worth the money! Comes with all the important mini figs from the movie.

Installed this on a regular full size shower. Gives SO MUCH more room than a standard curtain and is very sturdy. Happy with my purchase.My only word of caution is that once you install it, you cannot flip it around. In our case, the edge between the 2 adjoining rods is close to the front of the shower, so the rings catch and come off. To fix this, we attempted to pop the bar out flip the bar around, but it did not fit properly in the brackets going the other direction.
Adorable shirt and my daughter LOVES it. Seems to wash/wear well. Will probably also order the seal version for her. The pictures are very vibrant and fun.

I had high hopes for this product, and I did feel clarity and a boost when taking it. However, it was confirmed with 2 separate doctor visits - while taking this product, my very normal and reliable blood pressure of 120/70 (ish) went as high as 165/85. I am a 41 year old woman in otherwise good health. Within a short time of taking the drops, I'd get a headache, which I assumed was due to my body flushing out.Nine days after stopping these meds, today my blood pressure was back to the normal numbers. Bummer, because I did like how I felt while taking the drops.Perhaps they will work for you, but for me, I cannot continue taking them. My sudden rise in blood pressure really concerned my doctor.

My tank is almost done cycling but I added this because I figured it would help complete the cycle faster and add beneficial bacteria to my tank since my tank was started with dead rock and sand.I added this yesterday afternoon. It made my tank cloudy, which was fine. What makes me upset is that my 2 healthy clownfish, who were vibrant and eating and happy, took an almost instant turn for the worse. One died within hours of adding this to my tank. The other, I found almost dead this morning. I scooped it and moved it to QT. Not sure if she'll make it.So there goes $40 worth of fish... oh, and the cost of this stuff. Wouldn't buy again.

I found this book on a Must Reas list and as the book went on, I trudged thru it, expecting it would get better, deeper and more interesting.The first half of the book are things that would upset anyone but, in my opinion, only the most troubled person who is looking for a reason would pinpoint those situations as a reason to kill themselves.As the book wears on, our sweating, twitching, so full of drama I can hardly stand it, male character Clay unravels this "mystery".All in all the book is about a girl who blames everyone for her sadness, starting with piddly things that happen to many teens and working its way up to a "rape" that I'm not even sure is called a rape since she disrobed, put herself in a hot tub and didnt say no.If anything this book is about mental illness. A girl blaming everyone in her life for her unhappiness, while doing nothing to help it, in fact, almost trying to make things worse.I don't like that the theme of this book is that other teens are responsible for the choices of someone who doesn't seem to want help.Lastly, it was poorly written fluff with zero character development. The use of italics combined with regular text felt like I was reading a discussion between a split personality person.I want the 3 hours of my life back that I wasted reading this.
Who makes a paper doll book where the items aren't perforated? It will take hours to cut them all out.Love Grumpy Cat and the pics and items are cute but its all a waste since they hav to be cut out.

First off -- ants love this stuff. It will attract them and attract them like crazy. The problem is it never gets rid of the colony. You will see ants. Put down the terro. See 10x as many ants. And then the numbers will dwindle down. Then no ants. Then a few weeks later, ants again. Only this time, more than you used to have, because they will have left a happy scent trail for their buddies to follow.How do I know this? 3 years ago I started using this stuff. Sadly, we have a worse ant problem than we did before, because now the ants are attracted to the Terro and every year we get more than we ever did before we use this stuff.We should have just killed the few ants we got every spring and left it alone. Now we get way more ants because they're looking for the delicious bait...

I got this as a Christmas gift for a friend who'd recently purchased herself a uke. She was carrying it around town wrapped in a sweatshirt because she didn't have a case. This was perfect for her uke and now she can confidently take it with her without worrying it will get dinged or bumped.Just make sure you get the right size for whatever ukelele you have. They definitely come in different sizes and these cases are made to fit each type.

I have a just turned 3 year old mixed dog (shih tzu, poodle, chihuahua). She never had skin problems until about 6 months after we changed her food, due to chicken/gluten intolerance. She's doing well on her new food (no vomiting, yay!), but over time she started itching, and scratching more and more. Her normally whitish pink skin was turning brown, everywhere, even on her face! She was starting to get bald spots on her rear flanks from chewing on herself.I wish I'd taken a before photo of her before I started her on this product. Within 1.5-2 days, the itching slowed down, after another day, it stopped. By the end of the week, her skin was visibly improving. She's now been on it for 2 months and her entire body skin is back to it's regular color. No bald spots, no scratching herself, nothing. It's been a miracle product for us.Also, because my dog is only 11 lbs and because the bag only lasts 3 months, I gave half of it to my mom. Her Chi/Jack Russell mix was having itchy/dry skin. Since using this product on him, he has stopped scratching.Also, we both use the recommended amount and neither of our dogs have had diarrhea or gas problems as a result.

It's amazing to me that a company that sells bubbles would sell a product that doesn't produce bubbles.This solution didn't work for small bubble wands, nor our large bubble wand. The solution was just too thin. Unfortunately, we bought the gallon size.Would not recommend.

My daughter loves pink and I liked that this backpack is highly visible. No one else has one in this eye-blinding pink color.What I don't like is that one of the 2 main zippers repeatedly gets the fabric of the backpack edge stuck inside it. My husband has to fix it, it's difficult for even me to fix. This is some type of a design flaw, as the simple back and forth use of the zipper causes this to happen.

This is a great toy! My 6 year old can really get going fast on it and my almost 4 year old is just getting big enough to be able to pedal. This is not a toddler toy -- my (tall) 6 year old will fit on this for a long time to come.Assembly was pretty quick and easy and the flag is a nice safety addition for visibility.This is one of the few toys where the current version is pretty comparable to the original version as far as durability, how well it works, and how fun it is.
My girls love this car. Easy to use and have had no problems with it, at all. Seems durable, and it doesn't eat thru batteries.
Great bathroom book, but many of the stories are out-dated and younger folks might not understand how some of the cases were solved.
Very happy with these heavy duty mugs. Big enough to heat soup in.We are avoiding any dishware with a glaze (lead) and these are perfect.

Two of the 12 plates had rough scratches and marks on them. Every plate has a sticker on the bottom, which is difficult to get off. (I recommend peeling it from the blue part downward, as they seemed to come off easier that way.)I love these plates, though and would order them again.
Great bags at a great price. Other bags will smell quickly but I like how my vacuum has no smell when I use these.For some reason, I also noticed increased suction when I switched to these bags.
I like this cleanser. Good smell and leaves our laminate floors looking clean and nice.
Junk! Switches between inputs on it's own for no apparent reason. Also, frequently get snow and audio interference while using this.

Bumping this down to 1 star review.We pulled this out of winter storage, after very light use last year.After second day of using it, it won't stay upright when the kids are on it. I think the base is somehow bent. Odd since my  heaviest kid is just 60 lbs.------------------------------------I wasn't sure how this would work for my kids, ages just turning 6 and almost 4. The description says ages 3 and up, but I saw a reviewer mention that her older kids love to play on it too.My daughter turned 6 just when we bought this see saw. At it's highest, her feet still touch the ground. This is the perfect size for my 3 year old.I wish now we'd spent more and got the one that's so obviously larger.As a side note, the tool that's included with the see saw is not enough. My husband used it to assemble the see saw but parts were still wobbly. It was so bad we contacted the seller asking if it was defective. Then my husband tried some other tools and they were able to get the parts tight and flush. Bonus points to Hearthsong - they replied very quickly via email and were willing to help us if the see saw was defective.

This adorable little owl is the perfect size for slipping a tooth (and some tooth fairy money) into.What I like most is that the fabric on the front pocket will vary in its placement (not print) so even though I bought one of these for each of my girls, we can still tell whose is whose by the fabric on the pocket.

I left a low review for this product and 0 of 7 people found it helpful. Odd. Then, I went thru the other reviews. Same thing. Anyone not leaving 'good' reviews are being voted down. Worth mentioning.So this thing has been nothing but problems. Needs to be unplugged and reset constantly, sound issues, disc issues. What a disappointment. Returned the first box to Costco after 1 month, and now, will likely be returning this one after 3 months. They just don't work well or last long.
People have used the N word on me my whole life. It's hurtful.I'm hoping this shirt will give them an alternative idea.

Simple toy that kids really love. These are great for building coordination, too.I had a set like these as a kid and remember playing with them for hours, stomping around, pretending I was a dinosaur.

If you're like me and love to work out, you want a pair of Zumba pants that lets everyone know you are the Zumba Queen.I'll be honest - I was a bit nervous about doing Zumba, and more than anything, I didn't want to look silly. So I came to Amazon looking for some hip pants that said, "Hey world, I came here to do Zumba and chew bubble gum, and I'm all outta gum". So I got these pants.These pants practically shout from the rooftops, "HEY WORLD - I'M HERE TO ZUMBA AND YOU BETTER BELIEVE IT!"These are also great for lounging around the house, DSHS appointments, clubbing, and going to PTA meetings -- and don't forget casual Fridays at work. They really are that versatile.

If you're like me and love to work out, you want a pair of Zumba pants that lets everyone know you are the Zumba Queen.I'll be honest - I was a bit nervous about doing Zumba, and more than anything, I didn't want to look silly. So I came to Amazon looking for some hip pants that said, "Hey world, I came here to do Zumba and chew bubble gum, and I'm all outta gum". So I got these pants.These pants practically shout from the rooftops, "HEY WORLD - I'M HERE TO ZUMBA AND YOU BETTER BELIEVE IT!"These are also great for lounging around the house, DSHS appointments, clubbing, and going to PTA meetings -- and don't forget casual Fridays at work. They really are that versatile.

I ordered this item when I saw it for a mere $7. My local Lowe's had the exact same one for over $30.It arrived, and it was put together in just a couple minutes. I went to put it on my washer and, oops, there's the problem.Despite the photo and despite the reviews that claim otherwise, your washer/dryer must be at least 10 or more inches away from the wall for this to work properly. Unfortunately, my laundry room is a long narrow room so I really can't pull my machines out any more than they are.That said, I balanced this on top of my dryer and against the wall and although it's a bit less sturdy than it's meant to be (because the front hooks hang over the machine vs hooking down like they should), it does actually hold everything I needed it to.

Each year my sister goes to Hallmark and buys my kids an annual ornament. In 2011, she bought each of them a Toy Story ornament.I particularly loved this ornament. It's so cute and fun.The ornaments are hung on the tree for a few weeks each year and then placed back into their boxes until next Christmas.I pulled this particular ornament out this year and was shocked. The plastic is literally splintering and cracking apart. I don't know if this is a flaw with my particular ornament, but it is troubling, since the ornament seemed ok last year. It's obviously not aging well.Very disappointed, so beware.
Inexpensive and fit my phone like a glove. Was a bit nervous since a few reviews have said it was poor-fitting. Not the case for my 3g -- it fit great.

After buying a used SNES on Ebay and having it arrive DOA, I wanted something reliable to play my games.This system has fit the bill. I got it for about $37 and using Amazon Prime, it was at my doorstep in 2 days.I can't attest to how it plays NES cartidges, since I own none, but the SNES side works great and reliably. I have yet to have a game crash or not work properly.The controllers that come with this won't last long. However, this system is compatible with actual Nintendo controllers, so I bought some originals and have used those and been very happy with the performance.I'm thrilled I could find a new system for my old games.

Great handcuffs, but just know that these will scratch the surface of furniture.My bedpost got all messed up. I thought it was a fluke but then my boyfriend's desk at work got nicked too. Then, my parents' headboard got scratched to heck. Boy do I have some explaining to do.

Ignore the bad review from other person. This has got to be, hands down, the best dinorotica I've ever read.The story follows young Kate, as her job at the museum takes her on a clavicle pounding, ischium throbbing adventure.I don't want to give away all the details, but trust me, you will be dinosatisfied at the conclusion.

I've read a number of books by these authors, and must say: when it comes to dinosaur erotica, they are in a class by themselves.No one else can muster the heart pounding, claw-throbbing excitement of woman on theropod action. They make it so lifelike and believable.If only the authors could do a Gallimimus/Brachiosaurus/Woman love triangle story, my life would be complete.

After waiting in line for the midnight release of 50 Shades of Triceratops and then staying up all night reading it, I was so disappointed. I logged on to Amazon, hoping to find a book that could quench my dino fantasies, when I stumbled across this gem.I don't want to give away any spoilers, but this book is everything you'd expect it to be. It was the best 19 pages of my life.
Pretty cool Lego set, but completely unable to make the Kessel Run in less than twelve parsecs, so I was a bit disappointed.

I've had this coffee maker for about 3 years now, and it's worked reliably. I haven't had a problem with weak coffee as some have suggested, but I think it's because I tend to use more coffee than you're supposed to.As far as features go, this has none. It turns on and off and that's about it. For a simple coffeemaker, it works.I have a few big problems with this coffeemaker, which is how I stumbled upon this page. I'm looking for a new one. My biggest complaints about this coffeemaker are the following:- When making large pots of coffee (such as using maximum capacity) the coffee grounds basket will not drain quickly enough because it is almost full of the necessary grounds needed to make such a big pot of coffee. I usually have to switch the maker off mid-brew to allow it to drain for a moment, otherwise the grounds will overflow into the basket.- This is my biggest complaint: MESSY! Any time I pour, it leaks and drips out the spout. If I pour water into the maker, I have a puddle next to it where the water didn't cleanly pour from the carafe into the coffeemaker. When I go to pour my coffee into my cup, same problem: a puddle of coffee. I'm not sure why it does this -- perhaps mine has some type of malformation of the spout, but after 3 years of wiping up water and coffee, I'm looking for a new machine.

Love this thermos. My kid will sometimes bring uneaten food home from school and it's still warm inside at the end of the day. Doesn't hold a lot, but plenty for my kindergartner and will be for at least a few more years.

Purchased mine at Costco on sale for $79.99 a few months ago. Out of the box, the first week, we had regular crashes when accessing Netflix or Amazon streaming services.  We watch perhaps 1 DVD or Bu Ray a week. After the few months we've had it, the player will no longer play either type of discs. It loads but will go back to the home menu instead of playing. It also crashes much more frequently when using the streaming services -- probably half the time we use it.Taking it back tomorrow. Really disappointed in Sony.

I love everything about this bottle, except it's difficult for me, even as an adult, to open it. It takes less effort to close it, but still, teachers/helpers at my daughter's school have closed it only 3/4 of the way, leading to huge messes in her lunchbox and backpack. Unfortunately, this one negative outweighs all the other positives.My daughter is 5 and still needs help to open and close it. I will put it away for a few years and I can imagine this being great for her when she's a bit older and can hopefully do it herself.

I got these for half of what they cost in the pet store. I'm not sure why they're the same price as the much larger filters that have twice the materials and carbon in them.Either way, the filters keep my tank clean, and only need to be replaced about once a month. I will buy them again from here and save big.

My daughter used her allowance to purchase this doll. At 5 years old, this is the first time she cashed in her piggy bank money to buy something, so there was a lot riding on it. Overall, she LOVES the singing Ariel doll, and that she can transform her from a mermaid to a princess -- without mommy's help no less (so I'm thrilled she can work it herself to transform Ariel from fishy to fabulous).The only real disappointment is that Ariel has no legs. From the pictures, I assumed she had plastic Barbie legs that were crammed into a mermaid tail. Remove the tail, pull down the pink skirt, and there's your Princess Ariel.Instead, Ariel has a plastic square base. When you pull the pink skirt, the mermaid tail is pulled up inside her base and the skirt lowers to cover what would be her leg area. My daughter was hoping to be able to dress her in Barbie clothes. That situation aside, my daughter adores this doll and has been singing along with her.

We don't have a large family so I ordered the medium Seahawks decal set. The decals are cute, visible and don't peel off during inclement weather or when going thru the car wash. Yet, it's easy to tell they'd come off quickly if I myself peeled them off the rear window.Would buy this set again.

I purchased this item from Elegant Baby via Amazon just over 5 years ago.My daughter was swaddled in this from the day she came home from the hospital. It's a large size blanket and perfect for swaddling newborns. Once she outgrew swaddling in it, she slept with it and it has since become her lovey. This blanket held up thru nightly snuggling, drooling, biting (teething) and endless washing. After about 3.5 years the edges started to fray. My mom was able to salvage it and add new fabric around the edging, making it as good as new again.Overall I am very happy with this blanket. It's certainly stood the test of time and abuse.

I purchased this booster seat to take with us on a trip, as it would be easy to carry thru the airport and gate check once we were on the plane. It served it's purpose well, but it definitely wouldn't be one I'd use daily. It has very little padding for your child's rear end and I can't imagine it would be comfortable for any trip of a decent length.Additionally, the booster seat I ordered from Amazon had a manufacture date that was several years ago (seats have a limited number of years lifespan). They quickly shipped out a replacement, but it had the identical manufacture date.

I thoroughly read the reviews and descriptions on this product so I was well aware that the dinosaurs were smaller. I didn't think that would be a problem but it is. My child is very uninterested in this set due to the small size. Put a larger dino in front of her and she's VERY interested. I wish I'd used the same amount of $ and just purchased 2 individual, but larger Schleich dinos.The quality and details are excellent, but the size is unfortunately a big fun killer. I'll save them and hope as she gets older she will like them more.

I rarely read books in this genre, but like the Harry Potter series, this book drew me in and didn't let me go till the last pages. I thoroughly enjoyed every page in this world created by author Steven Leff.This book is what got me back into D&D. I've been disappointed that the second book the series was never released.BTW I bought this book back in 2006 but didn't realize I'd never left a review for it.
The lube works great and all but only giving it 4 stars because I was hoping for at least a 60 gallon barrel.

I randomly found this CD in a bin at a neighborhood garage sale and couldn't resist it -- with its 25 cent price tag. Once I got home, I popped it into my CD player and my ears were treated to a fun mix of feel-good pop.Whoever said men rule the world never heard of the sisters Hanson. These 3 young women are poised to take over the world with their beautiful harmonies which will surely delight any listener.The oldest Hanson is in her mid-teens but has a nice alto voice reminiscent of a teenaged boy. Middle sister Taylor Hanson is on the verge of puberty, but you can tell she's going to be a looker someday and her soulful crooning leads most of the tracks on this album. The youngest Hanson, well, not so cute but her spunky personality overcomes all and shines thru on songs like Lucy and Man from Milwaukee.Truly, these teen girls will go far in the world of music in the coming years. I can't wait to hear their next album.

This set has 15 different "happy" stamps and a small ink pad. I was a bit surprised at how small the package was, but upon inspection, I think they're all decent size stamps - about an inch across. Got this as a present for my daughter's friend and I think she'll get good use out of it. Will likely buy other sets for my own kids.
I've had this frame for probably 8 years and it's as good as the day I bought it. It's really durable and easy to hang.The frames give a nice assortment of horizontal and vertical photo holders.

We got this along with some other sticker pads for a friend's 4th Birthday. She was thrilled, opened it up and started playing with it immediately.Each page has a large face background and the back of the book has all the body parts and jewelry to decorate the face. Good for hours of fun and a great gift for a girl from 3-7.

I got this from Best Buy for under $50. What a score!This printer was a snap to add to our network, and is intuitive and easy to use.I had a Dell AIO printer that cost $300 that was always getting paper jams and having problems. This printer has worked perfectly with mild use.I like that's it's really compact, too. It fits well into our cabinets in the computer room.Unlike some other printers, the ink for this one is well priced. Some brands really jack up the price of ink.EDITING THIS REVIEW AS OF 9/12/2012This printer stinks in every way possible. My review was based on a very short usage time. Now that we've had this printer a while the biggest issues are that it goes to sleep automatically after a while, which means, when you go to print over the network, it doesn't wake up and print. Pressing the power button does nothing. Also, turning it off and back on doesn't reconnect it to the network. Usually we have to completely unplug it for 30 seconds and then plug it back in to get it to connect. What's the point of being wireless if you have to stand over it and dink around with it?Second big problem is the ink. It self cleans all the time. I've printed about 4 pages in color and the yellow and magenta cartridges are now out of ink. The printer refuses to print in black and white because the color cartridges are empty. What a ripoff! ZERO STARS!

I got this book when my firstborn was a tiny baby. Even at a young age, she loved books, so this one has been in our collection for a long time. My daughter is almost 4 now and we still read this book almost every day. The words are beautiful and the heartfelt pictures that go with them are engaging to babies and children of all ages.I like that this book shows families made up of all genders, ages and races - any person should be able to pick out a scene that resembles their family situation.I don't know that I've ever come across a child's book that has this many individual illustrations. The artist truly captures the joy, love, and happiness of the human spirit.

I got a different version of this book when my firstborn was a tiny baby. Even at a young age, she loved books, so this one has been in our collection for a long time. My daughter is almost 4 now and we still read this book almost every day. The words are beautiful and the heartfelt pictures that go with them are engaging to babies and children of all ages.I like that this book shows families made up of all genders, ages and races - any person should be able to pick out a scene that resembles their family situation.I don't know that I've ever come across a child's book that has this many individual illustrations. The artist truly captures the joy, love, and happiness of the human spirit.

I purchased one of these 4 years ago, just before my first child was born.It's still in use in our SUV. I have a 1.5 year old also and did not put one of these under her car seat. Needless to say - it's a lot harder to get her car seat installed evenly, and I recently removed both kids' car seats and was surprised at how deep the indentation was on the side that didn't have one of these installed, so I went ahead and bought another.I love that these protect the seats, not just from dust and debris, but from deep indentations caused by car seats. They hold up really well to use. Ours has been used for the last 3.5 years and it still looks almost like new.It's a small price to pay for what you get. Don't hesitate to buy this.

I recently bought this railroad crossing for my kids' train table set. It gets a lot of use and my 20 month old and 3.5 year just love it.It can be used as both a railway crossing and if you open the swinging arms, vehicles can pass thru it.My kids enjoy that it makes a sound, but it's not overly loud or annoying.It seems to be holding up well to lots of use.

These are an inexpensive way to add to your wooden train set. They're compatible with Thomas Trains and Ikea sets as well.The pieces are sturdy and well made. Why spend 4x as much for official Thomas brand tracks when you don't have to?Buy these instead and put your $ on the trains and buildings that your child wants the most.

These are an inexpensive way to add to your wooden train set. They're compatible with Thomas Trains and Ikea sets as well.The pieces are sturdy and well made. Why spend 4x as much for official Thomas brand tracks when you don't have to?Buy these instead and put your $ on the trains and buildings that your child wants the most.

I saw these in my local Target the other day and thought they were just adorable. It can be hard to find horse sheets that don't look western themed. These are cute but not too cutesy.The threadcount is 225 - not great but not as bad as some kid's sheets out there.You can get these for half this price if you buy them locally.

My hair stylist recommended this after she noticed my hair was like straw due to coloring it a few months back. I could hardly brush through it anymore and it looked like a bird's nest about 20 minutes after I'd brush it.I have really fine hair so conditioners can be a problem for me. I decided to try it and it really worked! After just one use my hair became soft, silky, and most importantly - not weighed down whatsoever. My hair looks great.I will continue using this product - my straw hair is gone!

We have purchased 3 of these balls (2 as gifts and one for our 3 year old). All of them were easy to inflate and have lasted despite plenty of use. You can't beat the price, either.This is great as an indoor or outdoor toy. We use ours in the playroom and the backyard.It's a great inexpensive gift that a child will be thrilled to receive. I haven't seen a kid yet who can resist this fun toy.

If you're like me and love to work out, you want a pair of Zumba pants that lets everyone know you are the Zumba Queen.I'll be honest - I was a bit nervous about doing Zumba, and more than anything, I didn't want to look silly. So I came to Amazon looking for some hip pants that said, "Hey world, I came here to do Zumba and chew bubble gum, and I'm all outta gum". So I got these pants.These pants practically shout from the rooftops, "HEY WORLD - I'M HERE TO ZUMBA AND YOU BETTER BELIEVE IT!"These are also great for lounging around the house, DSHS appointments, clubbing, and going to PTA meetings -- and don't forget casual Fridays at work. They really are that versatile.

A friend gave me this cookbook, and I've learned so much by reading it.Not everyone is gluten sensitive, but there's so much more to glean from this book. There's a ton of information about healthy eating, and whole foods (imagine that!). The book is a great resource on eating healthfully and truly nourishing your body. I've learned a lot about nutrition and types of foods I'd never even heard of. I feel a lot more confident walking into the local co-op now. The book has a rundown of basics to stock your pantry with - as a beginner to this lifestyle, I found that really helpful.Even if you want to still eat gluten and/or dairy -- if you're at all interested in healthy recipes and eating foods in their pure form, this is a great book.

This was an excellent bed frame - inexpensive, easy to assemble and completely silent -- for a few months.After that it slowly became worse and worse. Now, even my 1 year old moving on the mattress makes a lot of noise.It squeaks constantly. I hate it.One positive thing about it is that it is very sturdy. My husband, myself and our 1 and 3 year old pile into bed together and it feels very sturdy and solid. It's just really hard to forgive the horrible squeaking.

This was an excellent bed frame - inexpensive, easy to assemble and completely silent -- for a few months.After that it slowly became worse and worse. Now, even my 1 year old moving on the mattress makes a lot of noise.It squeaks constantly. I hate it.One positive thing about it is that it is very sturdy. My husband, myself and our 1 and 3 year old pile into bed together and it feels very sturdy and solid. It's just really hard to forgive the horrible squeaking.

Trader Joe's cornbread mix makes the most delicious, hearty cornbread I've ever tasted. It's got a slightly sweet, savory flavor, with delicious chunks of corn mixed in for the most perfect texture.You'll need to add an egg, 1/2 cup of oil and 3/4 cup milk to the mix, but you'll end up with a thick, delicious corn bread that can't be beat on a chilly, rainy day. Pair it with some split pea soup or chili for the perfect meal.Yes, it's very expensive on Amazon.com (so buy it locally if you can), but this review is for the item, not the price here.

It would be called Trader Joe's Roasted Seaweed Snack.These dried pieces of seaweed are lightly coated in sesame oil and salt for a crisp, delicious snack. I'd never tried roasted seaweed before but I decided to give them a try. Needless to say, I now consider myself a seaweed addict.Seaweed has many healthy things in it that we most likely don't get from other sources of food we eat. The best thing about this snack is that you can eat the whole bag (and trust me, you will) and it's only 60 calories.You will pay a lot lower price if you buy it in the store rather than from Amazon. Not everyone has a local store to them so at least you have somewhere to buy this yummy treat!

If you're like me and love to work out, you want a pair of Zumba pants that lets everyone know you are the Zumba Queen.I'll be honest - I was a bit nervous about doing Zumba, and more than anything, I didn't want to look silly. So I came to Amazon looking for some hip pants that said, "Hey world, I came here to do Zumba and chew bubble gum, and I'm all outta gum". So I got these pants.These pants practically shout from the rooftops, "HEY WORLD - I'M HERE TO ZUMBA AND YOU BETTER BELIEVE IT!"These are also great for lounging around the house, DSHS appointments, clubbing, and going to PTA meetings -- and don't forget casual Fridays at work. They really are that versatile.

They really are that versatile.

This is a great set of monkeys.It's made of lightweight polyresin and the detailing isn't great, but it gets the point across.I have mine up on top of my kitchen cupboards, hidden amongst houseplants and my wine racks. Everyone comments on them, especially since the monkeys are surrounded by wine, which seems fitting.

I didn't know who Sandra Boynton was until we saw the Doggies book at a friend's house, and my young daughter liked it so much I came online and ordered this set the same afternoon.There are no dud books in this grouping - Blue Hat, Green Hat is my 3.5 year old's favorite (she reads it to me, now). Moo, Baa, La La La and Doggies are beloved by my 18 month old. A-Z is the most "boring" of the books, but we keep it in the car and my kids enjoy reading it to themselves on trips.I can't imagine any child wouldn't be equally pleased with these books.

I ordered this set several years ago and my 3.5 and 18 month old play with it daily.The paint has chipped on some of the pieces, but overall, they are in excellent condition. My kids love to pretend cook with these, as well as stock their play fridge with all their nummies.The ice cream is the most popular of the pretend food items, as well as the OJ.

I recorded this to VHS tape on HBO in 1992 when it originally aired.I was amazed by Michael's energy and his ability to sing, dance and command the stage. I'd been a fan for a long time, but this performance really sealed the deal for me.When I saw the DVD available on Amazon I snatched it up. Watching it again, many years later - he's still just as impressive as he always was.RIP Michael Jackson. Truly one of the most talented people to ever walk the planet.

We own many of these types picture books. Both my children started reading them by 8 months and by 10 months old, will sit and "read" them by themselves. My oldest is 3 and still likes to look at these books on a daily basis.The photos are vibrant and interesting and give you lots to talk about with your baby. I like to point out objects/items, name them in English and Spanish and them tell my baby a little bit about them. It gives me something to say to my baby, since I often run out of things to talk about. Research suggests that it's important to speak to your child as many words as possible when they're young to help them learn to speak. I find these books help with that quite a bit.

This is what I call a 2 minute toy. That's about how long your child(ren) will play with it before they lose interest.I do think the Sing-A-Ma-Jigs are cute and unique in that they all can be used together and they harmonize.However, their appeal is short-lived.Their tummy must be squeezed for each individual note you want them to sing which makes it repetitive and not very fun since you just sit there squeezing over and over. My 3.5 year old has a difficult time squeezing the tummy enough to make it sing.

I got this over a year ago and have been very happy with the performance of this Hand Blender. So far, it's holding up to frequent use with no problems.It's great for pureeing soups (such as black bean soups, where you take out half the soup, puree and add back to the rest) and also for making baby food at home.I got it for $12 and it's something I find myself using a lot more than I thought I would. I would buy it again.

We own many of these types of picture books. Both my children started reading them by 8 months and by 10 months old, will sit and "read" them by themselves. My oldest is 3 and still likes to look at these books on a daily basis.The photos are vibrant and interesting and give you lots to talk about with your baby. I like to point out objects/items and them tell my baby a little bit about them. It gives me something to say to my baby, since I often run out of things to talk about. Research suggests that it's important to speak to your child as many words as possible when they're young to help them learn to speak. I find these books help with that quite a bit.

We bought this book while our 2 year old was potty training. Not so much to teach her how to potty (there are plenty of books that help with that, such as: Potty Book for Girls, The and Toilet Training in Less Than A Day).The reason I like this book so much is that it teaches your child that EVERYONE and EVERYTHING poops. When my daughter was feeling shy about her body functions, I'd remind her that everyone poops. This book really is helpful and educational.

For only a few dollars, you can bring the Handy Manny world to your child's View-Master in 3D.Most kids, ages 1-6 find the View-Master intriguing and fun to play with. The reels can be a bit flimsy but they're surprisingly durable.Grab up the reel sets at this price - many comparable ones are 2-3 times the cost. Even if your child isn't the biggest Handy Manny fan, they will enjoy the 3-D aspect of the pictures.

We bought this because we are pet sitters, and we often have multiple dogs barking in our home at once.  The sound gets their attention and distracts them enough to get them to listen to me to tell them to calm down.  It works better on some dogs than others.  We also have 2 neighbor dogs that are often left in the backyard while the owners go out for the evening.  The dogs bark incessantly while the owners are away.  We placed this on the fence, and it does calm them at first, however, over time they seem to become resistant to it, and begin barking away again.Because we use this outside, we have accidentally left it out in the rain, and it still works after the exposure.I can say it does work with some dogs, but may not be the be-all, end-all solution you are looking for.
Arrived as described.  No spillage--well packaged.  Fresh scent that I love.  Would recommend.

My dogs love this toy and I think it's so cute.  This is the small version, which was perfect for my 17 lb dogs.  We were able to take small beanie babies and stick them in the "stump" as well, which they enjoyed pulling out.  They also liked the size of the squirrels and will be found carrying them around in their mouth after they free them.  Very cute toy!
Great alternative to paper filters.  Easy to clean and lasts a long time.  Fit my machine perfectly--just as described!
Smells great!  Love the boost it gives the laundry.  Keeps everything smelling fresh for days after laundry day!

These are great for my husband's cooler for work.  Keeps everything cool in his truck until lunchtime.  While they say "weekender" pack, they do not make it through a day.  On a long car trip, they were thawed by the time we made it to the hotel 10 hours later even inside the cooler.  They are nice and handy though.

Great accessory for my Food Saver.  I use these for my leftovers and cut avocados.  Keeps everything fresh and delicious.  My avocado stays green for 3-5 days when I seal it in the containers after cutting!

This was purchased for our guest room.  It is a nice, thin, duvet cover that goes on and off easily.  It looks comfy and nice on the bed.  Not luxury quality, but perfect for what we needed it for, and very affordable.  Would recommend if you need something that looks nice, easy to wash, and affordable.

Arrived on time and fit as expected.  Very nice skates.  My step-daughter received them for Christmas, and she used them regularly until the ice rink closed for the season.  She was very happy with them.
Love the scent.  Packaged perfectly.  Arrived as expected.  I will buy again!
I'm addicted to this game!  So much fun!

I bought this cup to take with me on vacation to an all-inclusive.  It was filled with cocktails throughout the vacation, and I was HIGHLY disappointed with the silicone straws.  At first I thought it was my imagination, but the straws DEFINITELY absorb the flavor of any drink you put in them.  After washing thoroughly, I could till taste the Bahama Mama that was previously in the glass.  I have had the hardest time getting the flavor removed, and have since gone to using only water in the glass.  Very disappointed with the limitations on the use of the mug. Would not recommend!
Great solution when our original lid broke!
Was given these as a gift and we use them all the time.  Bought them for a gift for a friend.  So practical!
Bought these as a gift, so I didn't get to use them, but they are a cute package and arrived as described.

We love Kong products, and normally they are incredibly durable.  I bought this squeaker toy for my dog thinking that it would hold up to his squeaking and playing.  He ABSOLUTELY LOVED THIS!  He wouldn't put it down from the time it arrived.  He would squeak it, toss it in the air and let it bounce around, and then chase after it.  I was so happy to see him loving it so much and thought about immediately ordering more.  It has now been 4 hours since it arrive, and he just came to me with the head torn off.  No more squeaker, and the toy is ripping apart pretty easily now.  Very disappointed that it didn't last longer.Also, I have a medium dog (about 20 lbs) and ordered the medium sized toy for him.  It was smaller than I'd hoped.  So for those still considering purchasing, you might want to consider ordering a size larger than you think you'll need.

I really like the coverage I get with the new Neutrogena Long Wear Liquid Make-up.  It's very smooth and even, and feels light on your skin while providing really great coverage.  The downfall is the poor packaging.  The glass bottle has a very small opening to get the product out--you can't dip in your finger or makeup brush.  The product is so thick that it doesn't easily pour out of the opening, and you spend some time trying to coax the foundation out of the bottle.  This product needs to be in a squeeze tube or jar with a larger opening to be really useful.  I would definitely buy again, but will continue to curse the packaging! #GotItFree
I wasn't sure how much I would like it , but this is a fun game!  have to tell my sister about it.

I just bought this for a friend who is having a baby.  It's not really a baby book, but it is a great book to start her children's library at home.  The story is so sweet and heartwarming, and I remember reading it over and over as a child.  Love!

Admittedly, I've only used this product once, so my opinion could change, but I'm thinking it will only get easier to use!I read other reviews on here that talked about this tool cutting the drying time in half-- I didn't find that to be the case.  Because you're creating curl at the same time, I erred on the side of smaller chunks at a time, which ended up taking just as long.  The benefit however, comes with the end result!My hair looks like I had a  blow-out at the salon.  It is smooth and full and smooth.  My hair naturally has this really tight curl in the back and a straight front, which makes it difficult to style.  This product smoothed out everything so that you can't even tell that it has a tendancy to curl in the back.  Previously I would have to blowdry, then sometimes flatten with a straight-iron the back portion, then curl with a fat curling iron to get everything uniform.  I was able to style with just this tool today.Additionally, it was a lot simpler to use this tool.  I didn't have to juggle the blowdryer and my round brush back and forth.  I simply rolled each chunk up on the barrel and hit it with the hot air.  At the end I stuck the barrel under the top chunks (so they just draped over the barrel,) hit is with hot, then hit it with cool, and the end result was a lot more volume on top.  Love it!I will definitely be using this tool daily, and can tell it will be less stressful on both me and my hair!

My husband broke the handle of these scissors 2 months after we got them by trying to trim the ends of a bouquet of stargazer lillies.  Didn't take much for the plastic to crack!  I expected more from Fiskars!
My puppy loved these, but they go quick!  Definitely made for YOUNG puppies and not older puppies or dogs that have more chewing abilities.  She burned through these like treats.

It's a nice addition to the collection of books I have for lawschool, but since buying it, I wish I would have put it off.  I tend to use the Black's Law search in WestLaw way more and I have friends that use digital version.  The desktop version is just taking up space.
I love the Lysol toilet bowl cleaner.  Does such a good job with minimal effort.  This is a good value as well.

I like the pump feature, but the shampoo is so thick that it dries in the pump and creates a gooey chunk with the first pump each time.  Sometimes it leaks down the side of the bottle as well, which looks messy.  The convenience makes up for it though.
Smells great and looks good too.  Long lasting, which makes it a great value.  Plus Lysol is a great name for germ killing power!

I love being able to try all of the KIND flavors--so yummy!  So far my favorite by far is the coconu almond!  I'm looking forward to digging into this box for snacks over the next several weeks.  I got this as a lightning deal which was a great value!  Wish I could have bought two!

The brown is not as dark brown as is pictured here, it is more khaki colored, which was disappointing.  There is a rubber grip around the edge of the clip though, which really helps keep hair in place and keeps strands from falling out.  I'm very happy with the purchase overall.

I love this hummingbird feeder!  It's so much prettier in my landscape than the standard red feeders you typically see.  It's good quality, and we already have a hummingbird "regular" who stops by frequently in just a couple days. So happy with this purchase.

My family is a Starbucks family, but the Sanfrancisco Bay K cups are a nice, affordable substitution.  I like that there is minimal packaging used for these K-cups, as the unneccesary plastic cup around the bottom is removed.  The flavor of the coffee is good, and does the trick, but isn't our favorite choice.  For the price, it makes a nice substitution.

I am on the fence about whether this is a must read for ketogenic fanatics. I adore both the authors and their presentations, but  this volume is really geared toward convincing healthcare professionals who need a more scholarly explanations of why ketogenic diets work.  It even sometimes turns into a hard sell.  It was still mildly helpful to my semi advanced ketogenic state. Was it worth the rather expensive Kindle edition,  Aahhh, I'm not sure....?

I am a big Cordain fan,  very much like what he preaches and teaches. And he has the scientific background to be taken very seriously.HOWEVER--this book was a real disappointment. It is really geared towards the beginners to the Paleo world,  and in particular the diet shopping crowd looking for information on Paleo.  The endless personal testimonials  throughout the book really got on my nerves; I wasn't shopping for Paleo, I am already committed to it, and so the testimonials were a waste of my time (and money).If your experienced in Paleo at all,this book will not provide very much new information

This is a must read for all diabetics, and in particular Type 1 diabetic's. There is information in this book that you will not find anywhere else. However, think of Dr. Bernstein's plan as a rough guide to finding your own way. Yes, perhaps you are among the few that can follow such an extremely low carb (not  even onions or tomatoes are allowed) diet, and  for whom small, small doses of insulin are effective. For myself and a lot of other advanced Type 2  diabetics, one or two units of insulin before a meal, even an extremely low carb meal, is not going to do anything in terms of dramatic lowering of BS levels (as it does for the doc). This book has been accused of being geared towards Type 1 diabetic's, which is a little bit true, but it still is a great guide, and only that--A GUIDE for most Type 2s. Perhaps you are one of the few that will be able to follow the doctor's rules, and keep your BS levels around the recommended 83 mg/dl (or an A1C of 4.6 or lower). I was not without injecting moderate--50 units a day--amounts of insulin. And I do eat  extremely low carb. Instead I have a BS LEVEL OF 95-150 (A1C of 5.4), and take no medications or insulins. Once a month I have 2 cups of popcorn, my only carb splurge. Again, this book can really teach you a lot and is an invaluable guide for the low amount it costs; but I think it's important to view it as a guide and not gospel, at least for many of us anyway... Dr. Bernstein also has an extensive video presence on YouTube that is well worth checking out .

Another reviewer that thinks this doesn't even deserve one single star! It's badder than bad, and worse than worse.  I paid $13 for a single loaf at a local store, and tried to taste it, but I had to spit it out--it was truly horrid and unbearable! Then I tried toasting it and buttering it, and it was still disgusting, and I still had to spit it out into the sink .  Thankfully my local store has an excellent customer satisfaction policy and I promptly took this ghastly bread back and got my money refunded. I cannot stress highly enough that you need to steer clear of this coconut bread!

Classic and a must read if your'e serious about low carbohydrate, high fat diets. Can be a little bit shocking at first, and then angry provoking as you read that so much of what we have been taught about healthy diets that is wrong is actually right. How many egg white omelettes and low-fat muffins that we had to do endure, and these actually do us no good...! Taubes is also a brilliant writer, technically. The book is a joy to read for those of us that love the English language in it's simplistic and straightforward best.

Great book, a real eye-opener if you're ready for it. Was also a real springboard for me into a lot of other avenues to research, such as Gary Taubes, Stephen Phinney and Jeff Volek; all of these people also have books and YouTube videos, for plenty more reading and research. In particularly, if you enjoyed this book then "Good Calories, Bad Calories", by Gary Taubes is a must read to explore in more detail how much our public health has been manipulated and how much that is wrong that we've been taught is right

I like this a lot, in that I don't have to put the regular erythritol in the Vitamix and powder it down, and make a mess. Expensive, but worth it for the time saving. I also think that this has much less of the proprietary floral flavor that for me predominates in the regular crystal Swerve (I prefer to make my own regular sweetener with erythritol and pure stevia extract).

I use this mayonnaise first and foremost because of the ingredient list; it is by far the most healthy mayo out there for the those of us trying to avoid highly processed seed oils.  No doubt about that, and I shopped everywhere from local gourmet health food stores  to Whole Foods-- nobody carries a mayonnaise made entirely of olive or avocado oil, with no added processed seed oils. No one!  Ordering this rather expensive Primal Kitchen mayonnaise (in tiny jars) by Internet mail  order is the only option for a mayo free of highly processed seed oils BUT I have to say that this is not the best tasting mayonnaise I've ever used, that's for sure.  You can taste the avocado oil, but there is also a more "Jeez, this is different" taste that is just a little offputting, a little too tangy, at first. The texture is good, and  the emulsion is perfect, and you do soon get used to the tang and hint of avocado; and in many ways that you will be using this, such as in salads or deviled eggs, you won't notice it all that much, but it is much less neutral and easy going in flavor than traditional mayonaisses. I guess it's really not that bad, but again, it is not the best tasting mayonnaise that this foodie has tested.  But for me, the optimal, ideal ingredient list wins out.

I think this is an amazing blender, and I just adore it. However for some people it could be a disappointment. For starters, it's really for a single person, or perhaps two people who are light eaters. But for two people with healthy appetites, this blender really is a bit too small, even for just smoothies--and you'd probably be much better off with a full-size Vitamix. Biggest problem I have with this model is the size of the small single serving cup.  It's cute and it's double insulated, but unless you're making a very small smoothie, it's just too small. And if you try to overfill it, this smaller Vitamix just can't handle it, particularity if any of the ingredients are frozen; and unlike the larger container that has a lid that that features an open feed hole, you can't use the tamper to force the ingredients into the blades. In fact even when using the larger 40 ounce container, you very often have to use the tamper-- for thick smoothies with frozen ingredients, for seed butters, for ice cream made with frozen bananas and soy milk ice cubes--you will have to use the tamper, and work (force) the  ingredients down into the vortex of the blender (plenty of videos on YouTube to see this Vitamix tampering action if  you are not familiar with it). The larger Vitamixs with stronger motors, can often handle things like thick frozen smoothies, and you don't have to use the tamper, but not so  with this lower powered, smaller model . Once you use the tamper to assist the blender to get a hold of everything, however, the blender works great and gets things perfectly smooth and wonderful. For me, this blender really has changed my life. My goal was to get more fresh vegetables and fruits down into my gut, and now I can do this with either smoothies, or juices (strain the smoothie through a nut milk bag), or I can make fresh creamy soups with all kinds of different vegetables, right in the blender ( my current favorite is cauliflower cheddar cheese ); I think it's great that after seven minutes, the S30 gets soups piping hot and satiny smooth . I bought my unit refurbished, and it was just like new and operated flawlessly. I recommend the refurbished units for those trying to save money on these expensive and wonderfully made  American  blenders. You really can see the quality of these Vitamixs as opposed to the Chinese made Nutribullet for instance.  After living with this blender for a month now, I would never give it up, and I can see why people have raved over these machines over the years.  If you are single, or part of a healthy fit skinny couple that doesn't eat too much, I can't recommend this unit enough.

For starters, it's really for a single person, or perhaps two people who are light eaters. But for two people with healthy appetites, this blender really is a bit too small, even for just smoothies--and you'd probably be much better off with a full-size Vitamix. Biggest problem I have with this model is the size of the small single serving cup.  It's cute and it's double insulated, but unless you're making a very small smoothie, it's just too small. And if you try to overfill it, this smaller Vitamix just can't handle it, particularity if any of the ingredients are frozen; and unlike the larger container that has a lid that that features an open feed hole, you can't use the tamper to force the ingredients into the blades. In fact even when using the larger 40 ounce container, you very often have to use the tamper-- for thick smoothies with frozen ingredients, for seed butters, for ice cream made with frozen bananas and soy milk ice cubes--you will have to use the tamper, and work (force) the  ingredients down into the vortex of the blender (plenty of videos on YouTube to see this Vitamix tampering action if  you are not familiar with it). The larger Vitamixs with stronger motors, can often handle things like thick frozen smoothies, and you don't have to use the tamper, but not so  with this lower powered, smaller model . Once you use the tamper to assist the blender to get a hold of everything, however, the blender works great and gets things perfectly smooth and wonderful. For me, this blender really has changed my life. My goal was to get more fresh vegetables and fruits down into my gut, and now I can do this with either smoothies, or juices (strain the smoothie through a nut milk bag), or I can make fresh creamy soups with all kinds of different vegetables, right in the blender ( my current favorite is cauliflower cheddar cheese ); I think it's great that after seven minutes, the S30 gets soups piping hot and satiny smooth . I bought my unit refurbished, and it was just like new and operated flawlessly. I recommend the refurbished units for those trying to save money on these expensive and wonderfully made  American  blenders. You really can see the quality of these Vitamixs as opposed to the Chinese made Nutribullet for instance.  After living with this blender for a month now, I would never give it up, and I can see why people have raved over these machines over the years.  If you are single, or part of a healthy fit skinny couple that doesn't eat too much, I can't recommend this unit enough.
