I can't say that giving up wheat made for dramatic differences in my life, such as Dr. Davis talks about in his book. However,  as a diabetic it has greatly improved my blood sugar numbers, and cut much prescription insulin out of my life. And I really do think that I feel better and see less depression in my outlook on life. Is this all a dramatic difference? No, it really isn't dramatic (blood sugar aside) but I do feel better off of wheat and this book helped guide me towards this big change in my life. The recipes are great! They've really helped me a lot. Things like the flax seed wraps totally fulfill that need to have a wheat-like product (think of a cross between tortilla and pita bread )  for sandwiches, or I have even made quesadillas with the  flax seed wraps .  Many of the other recipes are great too and for me the price of the book was worth it alone just for the recipes and food ideas; mind you there are not a lot of recipes, but they are all very well done and thought out, and very effective for replicating the wheat and high carbo foods that we miss.

I am a big fan of erythritol,  and so I really wanted to like Swerve.  However, their proprietary taste isn't to my liking. This sweetener  tastes a little bit almost "floral", for lack of a better description.  It's fairly strong, and something I just could not get used to. The sweet, sweet real sugar-like taste of erythritol is gone, and instead Swerve's proprietary taste dominates.  On the plus side they did a very good job of making this product sweet enough to measure like real sugar, cup for cup. Erythritol is generally not  as sweet as sugar and it usually takes a bit more product to compensate (or it's commonly mixed with much stronger stevia); but this is not the case with Swerve which does measure just like sugar, cup for cup. But for me, I will take pure unadulterated erythritol, mix it with Trader Joes pure Stevia extract ( 2 teaspoons per 1 cup of  erythritol); a combo that which is cheaper then Swerve, and tastes much cleaner, more natural, like cane sugar... This home made combo is everything that Truvia wants to be but is not due to  it's bitter taste .

I am crazy about the taste of this spread, and thought it was perfect for getting a way to get a little coconut fat every day. However, it contains CANOLA OIL! This is not good for those of us trying to avoid processed oils, and who are often trying to replace said oils with coconut oil.  So the whole point of using this coconut spread is MOOT because it contains overly processed canola oil. Big, big disappointment! I wasn't crazy over the palm oil either, but palm oil is not nearly as bad as canola oil!

UPDATE : Bag RIPPED after only a few weeks, about half a dozen uses. Not much use at all. This is probably a decent bag long as you do light and very gentle filtering. If you are looking for a true kitchen appliance, this bag is NOT it! Overall, I would not recommend for the price it is selling for.--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I have only used this bag a few times, so I can't comment on long-term durability. I mainly use it to strain an occasional Nutribullet smoothie, giving me a nice pulp and fiber-free fruit juice. This bag works great for that, and is very easy to clean up. I like it!

By far, far, the best vegan protein powder I have ever used. Has the best taste and smoothest texture of all the vegan protein powders.  Yes, the ingredients are not raw or organic, and other products, such as Garden Of Life's popular Raw Protien, have much better ingredient lists. But they also have a much more earthy, dried plant-esque flavor, and often have a gritty texture. Plus GOL's Raw Protien upset my stomach.Vegan Sport on the other hand tastes much more neutral, and has a sweet kick due to the stevia. It's as close to a sweeter milkshake  tasting flavor as you are going to get in a vegan protein source. However, for hard-core vegans, and those that eat a lot of raw foods, and consume no sugars or sweeteners, this might be too sweet tasting of a choice. But for those of us who are semi vegetarians, and are looking for a vegetable-based protein supplement (and who are not overly concerned with raw or organic or sprouted ingredients ), and don't mind a little bit of sweet in our diet, Vegan Sport is a great tasting, and very smooth in texture, choice.  Plus the added supplements (BCAAs, enzymes)  can be a big plus as well.I have only tried the vanilla flavor, and it is much better with almond milk, particularly when mixed with an immersion blender; though it's tolerable when spooned mixed with cold water. I prefer the vanilla flavor, as I can add  cacao powder for a chocolate shake, or berries and fresh fruit for a thick fruit smoothie--that's the elegance of the plain vanilla, being able to use it as the base for any flavor I choose, or just on its own as plain and un-obtrusive vanilla.

I am a big fan of Cacoon's amber--green mirrored polarized lenses. They really do help to enhance detail, and I much prefer them over gray lenses. And while the MX shape is very sleek, modern and sexy, it lets in too much light with my wide Ray Ban eyeglass frames, and allows too much reflection off of the face. I have instead gone with Cacoon's Aviator model, which is much more "sealed in"  and has much less reflection onto  the back of the lenses from my skin. However the Aviator model is much larger and goggle-like and not nearly as sleek as the MX style. I guess I chose function over style....

These are the best fit-over style sunglasses I've tried, and I've tried many, including Jonathon Paul Fitovers (which has the most stylish frame styles,  but optically inferior lenses compared to Cacoons). The Amber Cacoon  lenses honestly increase contrast and help with vision under both sun and overcast, particularly helping with distance vision. I have the green mirrored lenses and they help to block even more light, but they are still not as dark and drab as some gray lenses I've tried. I had to get these in the BIG XL aviator style as they were the only ones to fit over my large Ray Ban eyeglass frames, and they are indeed big and a little goggle-like. However the green mirror lenses combined with the flat black matte frames really helps to jive them up, and cut back on the oversized, old-geezer  effect. The green mirrors really are attractive and youthful.There is always some reflection off of the face with fit-overs in bright sun, that you can see in the lens, but these reflections are not too bad with this XL Cacoon model.I have expensive Maui Jim prescription sunglasses, but hate switching back and forth between the prescriptions of them versus my regular (and superior) eyeglasses. I rarely wear them, and prefer to just slip on the Cacoons instead--as oversized as they are...!
By far the best of all the plastic tubed ring sizer's. These--unlike the others--stay put  and do not move around at all. These really are the best and I highly recommend them!

I've used this cleaner off and on for over 20 years, and it really is the best, most gentle overall cleaner. The grocery store cleaners with ammonia clean extremely well too--for diamonds, sapphires or rubies, even CZs, that are set in gold or unplated gold and sterling (including white rhodium plating over white gold and sterling). But as good as ammonia based cleaners are on sturdy jewlery, they are harsh for most other jewelry. Caribbean Gem is not harsh at all--you can even use it on pearls and doublets. Though I never soak things like pearls and doublets--such delicates only get a dunking and then a scrubbing. In fact if you are cleaning every week or more, you only need to soak for a minute or less, and then scrub. Soaking is really for DIRTY pieces that haven't been cleaned in months or longer...!For a long time, I was cleaning my jewelry In a very strong mix of Palmolive (or Dawn) and water, thinking it was cheap and effective and saved me from making special online orders for this stuff. And strong, strong soapy water is a good cleanser, but I decided to give Caribbean Gem yet another try, and I'm glad I did, as it is much better than soapy water. The soapy water seems to leave a slight film, and Caribbean Gem does not--everything out of the Caribbean Gem just sparkles more. Plus the jewlery isn't slippery as heck as with the soapy water (always scared my diamond studs would shoot out of my wet hands and across the room with the slippery Palmolive cleaner!)First I could only buy this cleaner at gem shows, and now it's only over the Net--I know, it's a hassle. But I really have come to see it's worth it for such an effective product. Highly recommend!

Wow--best deal I've got in years! For under $10: a nice quality, thickly padded case in a fashionable color/pattern? No-brainier! This was such a nice product at such a good price I was literally shocked (and it makes me rethink supporting and  critizing "cheap" Chinese manufacturing too!)

Works perfectly, just like you hoped, as others reviewers have said. I just adore this stuff! Not gunky or gooey on the face at all--in fact leaves no residue whatsover. I have some thin, thin rimless frames that not just slide, but go flying off my face--a BIG PITA! But with Nerdwax on their notepads they are now well behaved and stay put for hours before needing a small push up--such a transformation, I like wearing them now! For my already tight Ray Bans with only sporadic slippage, they never move now, all day! I ordered Nerdwax along side Wedgees, and have since sent the Wedgees back; yes Wedgees are highly rated and loved, but they are such an eye-sore for those of us that are fashion hounds that care about how our eyeglass frames look--I mean "fins" of neoprene?! Yecch! I MUCH prefer putting invisible coats of Nerdwax on the nose pads/bridge...!IME, Nerdwax really kicks in after a few base coats are applied. I recommend cleaning your pads/bridge with Q-tips and alcohol and then apply a few good coats of the wax--maybe a coat every hour for the first few hours. It then works really well, and stays on, even after washing with soap (I wash my glasses daily). I only have to touch up with single coats every 3-4 days now.Love this Nerdwax and I HIGHLY recommend it!
Nice and thick--my popover recipe rose nicely, and it is new, but the non-stick is great--they power-slided right out!

Waste of money--this was written for ego-gratification or just for the money, by the author. No real information of even a sense of spirituality here! NONE! It reads more like poor fiction and even made me uncomfortable...

Nice case, but prefer it in the other colors, aside from black. The black one had almost a patent shiny finish and it had a HOT pink lining. This may be appopriate for women, but as a gentleman I sent it back. Very girly in the black!
Very nice--the texture is great, more on the realistic side than the colorful clown side. Very elegant and stately and appropriate for men as well. Nice neutral beige lining. A+!

The Kuhn Rikon Vase grinder is the best I have used, and converted me over from my beloved Magnum Pro pepper grinder after it broke. I decided to try this grinder after reading all of the raves for it on Amazon. This KR grinder is HUGE (I can't stress that enough). It is by far the largest ceramic grinder I have ever seen--and it grinds at a speed about 2/3 of what the Magnum can. BUT, it's grinding mechanism is smoother and quieter than the Magnum. It also far easier to adjust the grind size via a knob on the top of the grinder, and the size you select stays put (I had it change every so often on the Magnum); and the KR can grind MUCH finer than either the Magnum or any other ceramic grinder I have used (small Kuhn Rikon high output ratchet grinder, small Kyocera grinder). You can get almost a fine pepper powder with the KR. The Magnum got no where near this fine.As I said this grinder is HUGE--the reservoir holds a full cup of peppercorns, the same as my former beloved Magnum Plus. A full cup! Will last a long, long time. And filling it up is easy and a breeze. Much faster and easier than on the Magnum. No longer a patient Zen process as with the Magnum--with the KR I can now easily whip the top off, and fill it up while I am actually cooking and not get a single peppercorn on the counter top.Plus it sits upright, and like most other ceramic grinders, you turn it over to grind out your spice. So no more pepper on the counters as with the Magnum...!I am thrilled to have found a grinder/mill that meets all my needs--the only drawback is that the output is about a third less than the Magnum, but since the movement is smoother and easier and quieter, to me the less output is a null point. The output of the Kuhn Rikon Vase grinder is none the less hefty, and far and away enough for almost all users. Okay, if you were cooking for a few hundred every night, in a restaurant or commercial kitchen, yes, the Magnum's higher output could be a time saver.I got mine on Amazon for less than half the cost of the Magnum --$22 with tax and free shipping. I had it shipped along side a new Magnum Pro, with the intention that the loser would be returned. So I have printed out the return label and back the Magnum Pro is going.Happy to post this rave for the KR Vase grinder--this former Magnum fan is happily converted. If this mill is half as durable as my Kuhn Rikon pressure cooker, I'll continue to be thrilled.Plus it comes in a few colors so you can use them to grind everything from pepper to flax to whatever pleases you...And here's a YouTube video of the grinder: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A5yPQ...

This supplement is small in size and coated for easy swallowing. No after-taste, but I always make sure to take Biotin after i've eaten so I don't upset my stomach. I like this brand of Biotin because in addition to a multitude of energetic B Vitamins, vitamins C & E are included in the formula. I take vitamins everyday and have noticed that Biotin is good for my hair and makes my nails grow quicker.  While my skin doesn't clear up completely, I have observed that my pores are clearer when i'm on this. Though I have received this item for testing purposes, this review has been written based on my unbiased opinion.

This is a durable and sturdy case that protects my phone in its entirety. There's a built in screen protector, which can be removed depending on your preference. The case is not that difficult to put on. Simply remove the rubber black portion from the center and it becomes dislodged, take the plastic off of the screen protector, click your phone in and snap the back of the case back into place.Be sure to wipe the screen protector and your screen prior to attaching the case. Dust can be easily wiped off of the screen protector and it can be used multiple times. Other screen protectors are a pain because they're a one and done.There are flaps that cover the headphone and USB jacks to prevent dust and other debris from entering. The S pen is easily accessible, as are the front and back camera lens. The rubber bumper works well if my phone is dropped, and while the screen protector isn't Gorilla Glass, it does prevent scratches and makes me feel a little safer. The Tough Case prevents against scratches on my phone and allows me to toss it in my purse without worrying about my keys tearing up the screen.Though I have received this case for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

Though I have received this item for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion. This toiletry bag is medium in size. It is spacious enough to accommodate a variety of hygiene products such as shampoo, brushes, toothpaste, etc. Ideal for travel, for tossing into a suitcase or small enough to throw into a larger purse or suitcase. The exterior zipper is strong and features a woven design that makes it easy to grip and zip.The bag is indeed waterproof, which in itself is rather impressive. So, if anything happens to spill inside of the bag, all of the surrounding contents are safe from damage. Unfortunately, the bag does not provide much room for organization. I am a big fan of organizing, especially when packing. I think it makes more room when belongings are properly organized. The Zero Grid Bag has one pocket zipper on the interior, for smaller items like tweezers or tubes of toothpaste and your toothbrush. There are four loops on the exterior that can be utilized for extra storage for larger items, or can be used as handles.Pros-WaterproofNice SizeZipper is designed to lastCons-Lacks the ability to organize

Keep in mind that this is a shortened version of "A Brief History of Time", which ironically is not so brief. This novel tackles life's big questions and contains issues we have all thought about. Some of us believe in a higher power, others believe that the big bang theory played some part in our creation. My thoughts align with the latter theory, so this book resonated with me. It kind of bridges the gap between an average Joe's level of understanding and Einsteins technical scientific terminology. I enjoyed reading this and wrapping my mind around black holes and other theories pondered by Hawking. I have read that some of Hawkings theories have been proven wrong over the years, but there is still enough information in this book to keep me wondering. Though I have received this ebook for review, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

Input: DC 5V-2AOutput: DC 5V-1ABefore buying this, make sure your phone is compatible with Qi Technology.This charger is very cool looking, I love the aesthetics. It's relative to the size of a drink coaster and is the shape of a disc. The contents of the box are- 1 Charger, Instruction Manual and a USB cord. I had to provide my own wall charger piece to make this work. It's pretty simple to set up. I just place my phone on the unit and the charger turns from a red dot to a blue light. My Note 5 charges well on it as long as it's already somewhat charged. I have not experienced any overheating.I like this charger because I can simply set my phone on the pod and it charges. No annoying scratches around my phones charging port. This is great because at night sometimes i'm half asleep and can't seem to find the phone's charging hole for the life of me. If the charger worked a little quicker it'd be worth 5 stars. Though I have received this unit for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

Though I have received this product for testing purposes, my review is based on my unbiased opinion. This 7 pack of wash-cloths are designed for children, but can be used for anyone really. They are ultra-soft and unlike other baby rags, they are an accommodating size. Large enough to comfortably hold and apply a decent amount of soap to, they easily provide a nice lather. The washcloths feel nice dry, very soft on your skin when wet. These are machine washable and contain no dyes or harmful chemicals. The Father Son rag collection comes in a biodegradable box that can be recycled.

While this book is very informative, it isn't preachy. There are thousands of parenting books out there, and while a book can never fully prepare you for caring for a child, this offers a candid look at doing so. Becoming a Father offers a first time dad's look at raising an infant while teetering around a sometimes unhappy partner and still looking forward to the slightly easier years to come. There are a lot of tips regarding money saving and budget friendly ideas. For example, if trusted family members or friends offer childcare assistance, take them up on it. You will thank yourself when you save an arm and a leg on day care! In addition to suggestions, this book covers sleep-training, breast-feeding and beginning your baby on pureed foods.Geoffreys does not hold back, he takes an honest approach at introducing parenting to those new to the game. One of my favorite ideas is the idea that the father should be putting in just as much effort as the mother is. Just because there's an ideology of "Maternal Instinct" does not mean that Mom should be stuck doing all of the work! For anyone confused, or looking for ideas on how to care for and entertain your baby, this book offers step by step solutions and then some. I think this is a must-read for anyone who has a large role in a child's life, or who plans on having a baby in the future. Though I have received a copy of this book for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

This review is based on my unbiased opinion, I have received a copy of the ebook for testing purposes. Prior to reading, be sure you know that this is simply a condensed version of the book. For the women that fantasize about being perfectionists, this is a good read for you. I like the highlighted points, they get down to the heart of the matter without dancing around the subject. Women don't need to be perfect, just because we may feel self-conscious at times doesn't necessarily mean we are not good enough.Takeaway Point #1- "The idea that women can do it all, perfect it all, and have it all is a farce that destroys happiness. Women need to choose to do the things they love and excel at, delegate the rest and let go of the guilt that comes from thinking they have to be perfect in every area of their lives."This is a good way for not only women, but all of humanity to live their lives. Sometimes living with the idea of perfection does the opposite and spirals us downward.

This is a much shorter version of a lengthy book regarding investment. The abridged version is much simpler, but does go into a few key-takeaway points. For anyone interested in investing or the stock-market, this is a good read for beginners. I can't picture myself reading the full version of The Intelligent Investor, but I do think this one covers the basics well enough to start making smart decisions about where to invest your money and time. While I received a sample of this ebook for review purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

Though I have received these socks for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion. This colorful variety of socks comes in a 5 pack. The pairs reach a little above the ankle and are very comfortable. No annoying toe seams or pulled stitches in the fabric. These are pretty warm, good for the fall and winter months. I am a size 8, but the size 9-11 pack fits me comfortably. Fun designs that keep my toes nice and cozy in bed and outside. They stand up to frequent use and withstand wear & tear. The colors are fun and unique, I love the patterns :)These are machine washable, I wash them in cold water and toss them in the dryer for laundering.

0:10 MinsThough I have received a sample of this product for testing, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion. This is the first drone I have had the experience of playing around with, and it is pretty fun! Though the instructional guide is a little unclear, it was rather simple to put together with the screws and screwdriver included. The remote control takes batteries that are not included, but it is also easy to use to pilot the drone around.I had a little trouble flying the machine due to my own flight issues, but I am learning as time goes on. While this drone is fun to use, I think it could use a few improvements.Pros-*SD Card is included*Two batteries are included*Easy to put together*Flying is fun!Cons-*The charger is difficult to snap in, I think it should be placed differently.*The camera has no on/off switch, I couldn't get it to turn on

This material is soft and stretchy, allowing me to safely and securely wrap it around my baby cousin without irritating her sensitive skin. She looks really adorable with this on, and the headband is a perfect accessory to top off the picture. I think this makes a nice photography prop and is easiest to wrap around babies when they are sleeping. This wrap is good quality and though its stretchy it doesn't tear or rip. My review is based on my unbiased opinion of this product, I did receive a sample for reviewing purposes.

This is a nice design, like the blue colors and the ease of inserting my phone into it. I think that the quality of the case is decent, but can be improved. The stand allows you to view your phone vertically or horizontally, but seems a tad bit unsteady to me. I would feel more comfortable if there were rubber grips on the bottom of the kick-stand. Otherwise, this case provides protection against drops and is fairly easy to grip with the side grips. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion, I received a complimentary sample of this product to review.

This pair of earrings is cute and simple, they are a little on the heavy side but are attractive. They seem well made and don't look cheesy or cheap, but are reasonably priced. These would make a cute gift for an older woman and would look nice worn to a dressier event, or could be worn casually. These are comfortable to wear, my ears haven't turned green yet. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion.Pros-*Cute*Well-Made*Good for any occasionCons-*A little weighty

This pack includes 4 Apple chargers that act as extras in case your charging cord happens to stop working. The cords are durable and charge iPhones quickly, but seem to give issues when paired with certain charging units. These cords seem to work the best when plugged into the wall as opposed to car lighter jacks. I received these cords in return for my unbiased opinion.

This little pumpkin outfit is well-made, very cute and stretches to fit the baby comfortably. The outfit when warm with a onsie is warm and can either be used as an outfit or photography prop. The crocheted material is really soft, not scratchy. I dressed up my 4 month old little cousin in this for Halloween pictures and they came out adorable! I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion, I received a complimentary sample of this product.

These pills are small, coated and easy to swallow. I take Biotin everyday and find that it makes my hair and nails stronger. My nails do not bend when I push them down, they are strong and healthy. I have problems with acne, but I find that when I take Biotin my pores seem a little clearer. I take this in the morning after I eat and make sure to drink plenty of water throughout the day so it circulates throughout my system. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion.

These bags are ideal for carry-ons, over night trips or even organizational tools. There is adequate space, enough to neatly pack a few outfits and the mesh allows you to see what's in the bag. The bags are 4 inches in height, so there is quite a bit of space for traveling. There's a convenient handle on each cube that makes for simple carrying. One of my favorite features is that the zippers are secure and do not seem to be in danger of becoming unhinged. These cubes flatten out to throw into your suitcase or closet and expand for everyday use. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion and received a complimentary sample of this product.

This set is adorable, knitted from soft yarn that doesn't irritate or itch baby's sensitive skin. The overall outfit can be used as photography prop and the hat can be worn as is. This adorable set fits my 4 month old little cousin well and though it is designed for boys, I think it can be unisex, it looks so cute on babies. This review was written based on my unbiased opinion.

These pads are fairly large and do an adequate job of absorbing urine, but are not as thick as pads I have used in the past. Dogs seem to be prone to use them to do their business. The training pads do a great job at absorbing odor and pee, essentially protecting the floor from damage. I think they work great for small dogs or for shorter periods of time. This review was written based on my unbiased opinion.

Though I have received a pair for testing purposes, this review is written based on my unbiased opinion. This is quite an impressive set of headphones. If you're a big fan of earbuds, you might find these a tad bit bulky, but it's worth the extra material. Each side folds in on itself and they are easily stored in the protective case that comes along with them. The headband adjusts to fit different shaped and sized heads with ease.I found the ear piece to be plushy and very comfortable to wear, they don't slip off my ears and don't cause sweating like other headphones tend to.While these may seem bulky, they are very light-weight and the case is convenient for carrying them around.The cord pops into the jack and is tangle-free. While the cord is not permanently attached to the headphones, it easily inserts. You will want to make sure the part with the volume adjuster is closest to the headphones.These headphones provide clear and full sound quality. I use these with my tablet to watch shows, listen to music and use them with my cell-phone to make calls. While earbuds are certainly more convenient for running, these are great for sitting at home and enjoying my favorite shows with full audio and action packed sound.While these headphones do produce a nice sound, they are not noise restrictive, so be mindful of others while you're rocking out ;)

Our egos are an essential part of our beings,but can often get in the way of success. This book teaches different ways to bypass your ego as not to let it overpower you and interupt your goals in life. Sometimes to get a little further, we need to push our pride to the back burner and swallow our ego. Think of ego like a wall, in order to get past it we need to knock it down for a bit. At a little over 100 pages, this book was a light-read with a few interesting points and solutions to a big problem. I reviewed this book based on my unbiased opinion.

The Blue African is full of theories and observations regarding the government, with science fiction and bits of religion tossed in. The main character Porter Tellez sees a world thats in serious disarray with little hope for a peaceful solution. There are many moral questions raised and adventures to be had as Porter Tellez tries to cope with life on Earth. Earth is a planet that has been destroyed by wars and our neglectful ways toward nature, its insightful to read an aliens perspective on the subject. This is different than most other stories I have read, but it was quite an interesting read- nonetheless. I received this ebook in return for my unbiased opinion.

These e-books are informative travel guides that help you learn things like where to eat and what the best sights to see are. Some of the phrases might need a little practice, but it's a step in the right direction if I ever decided to visit Beijing. There is a guide to follow that tells you good places to eat, visit and get the most fun out of your trip. I loved seeing the photos included, makes me want to go visit. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

This book covers the basics and more for anyone visiting, or just interested in China. There are photos, a travel itinerary, the best food choices and some transit options for travelers. My favorite parts of the book were the cheat sheets on Chinese language and pronunciation, I also liked the pictures in the book. I found this manual to be written in an engaging manner, it's decent airplane material. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

This short version of a much longer book gives a general idea of what the book is about. It analyzes the evolution of the human species while taking a look at what's going on now and what might happen in the years to come. The book is written in a decent manner and takes an interesting look at aspects of evolution, I found this book easy to understand. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion after testing this set of Waterproof Fairy Lights.These violet purple Fairy Lights are whimsical, appearing delicate without threatening to break. After unraveling these, they look nice in my front yard or around the door frame. By clicking one of the gray buttons on the back of the panel, two options are presented. You can either choose a blinking display, or solid color. The panel charges via solar power and works as long as it's facing down (button side up).I love the way these lights look, they are not too bright and put off a gentle amount of purple light. They charge during the day with no need to put money out for batteries. I would like to see the ability to connect these with other light sets, and some correction on the button/solar panel so that it looks a little nicer and things are spelled out more clearly.

These pills are simple to swallow and have no after-taste. They do help me mellow out a little, but don't knock me out like other pills do. One of the ingredients may not react well with my body. I tend to feel drowsy/down the next day after taking them. These are all natural, which I am all for, but unfortunately my chemistry does not react well with them. I feel better the next day after finally falling asleep naturally, after exercise or reading. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

This car garbage bag easily slides over the seat with a handy adjustable clasp. The sides expand so garbage can be packed in and the top Velcros, but doesn't zip. I wouldn't suggest putting anything too smelly in here, because it is going to be open and the odor will leak out. This bag is light-weight, the inside wipes out easily, but does not remove for washing purposes. There is Velcro on the bottom which allows you to latch the bag onto the floor's carpeting. There are two convenient mesh pockets, one on each side to hold drinks and snacks? I wouldn't want to put my food next to the trash can though. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.Pros-Easy to hang over seatExpandable sidesInside is simple to wipe outWaterproofCons-Doesn't seal completelyInside is not removable

This unit does little in the way of providing instructions, so I had to do a little detective work and play around with the lantern. There are 5 different modes which range from Ultra Bright to Dim and include a strobe light feature. The lantern has a carabiner on the back that allows you to attach it to a lanyard or key-chain. The charging port is USB compatible and protected from dust and dirt by a rubber stopper. This light is ideal for camping, reading or general usage at night. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion.Pros-Very Bright LightRechargeable BatteriesLightweightEasy to UseCons-Clip seems flimsy, like it might break after a long period of use

Something I really enjoyed about this book is that it isn't preachy, rather set in a conversational tone. This book explains how to feel a little more at ease when talking to the opposite sex, and confidence really does attract interest. There are a few spots in this book that made me giggle, I like when the author speaks candidly about a situation or subject matter. I am a bit awkward at times when communicating with people in general, so this book definitely gave me points to think about and try to improve on. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

This fishing kit is about the size of a half dollar coin and is filled to the gills! There is everything you would need in a jam or for a spur of the moment fishing trip. Included in the miniature tin is fishing line, hooks, lures and sinkers to attach to the line. It takes a bit of expertise to effectively stick all of the lures and fishing tools back into the small container, but once you are able to pop the top back on, you're good to go. This compact set is small enough to toss in your box, pocket or purse and great for anyone to have on hand. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.

Let me start off by saying that though this is a series, I jumped in at this chapter and was not left in the dark, this operates somewhat as a stand alone version. The author has a way of connecting the characters to the reader that is somewhat inviting and that's what kept me reading. Each character is complex and has something to add to the book. There are moments that are bittersweet and I really enjoyed the story line. This is one of those books that keeps you wrapped up in everything that's going on.One of the only downfalls for me, being that i'm a word nerd, is there are a lot of grammatical errors. Reading and having misspellings pop out at me kind of drives me crazy and takes away from the story a little bit. Aside from the errors, this is a decent book with a good story line and I am intrigued, looking forward to reading the series from the beginning when I have time. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion.

It's a Match! by Natalie Moore is indeed a match making guide, but doesn't take your average pie in the sky look at love. She has a therapists approach at making yourself work before trying to find someone that you think will complete you. There are 5 steps at attempting to find love, and most of these include working on yourself first. Finding your flaws and ironing them out before bringing someone else into the mix is a viable solution. Everything is broken down into steps that really help you take a good look at who you are as a person and a partner. These steps are an effective way of helping you realize who a good partner would be for yourself.I thought this book was well written, detailed and includes advice and chains of action that can be easily applied to someone looking for their ideal partner. This is really an insightful guide at looking at yourself and what needs to be fixed to create the best version of yourself BEFORE making a commitment to someone else. I think we could all use a little fixing, and this guide can certainly help with that. This book is written in an instructional tone, but is friendly and not preachy. This review was written based on my unbiased opinion.

I have been introduced to the world of Foraging little by little over the past year or so. With actors like Shailene Woodley talking about it, I decided to find out a little more about it. This book details some of the medicinal properties of certain plants, what's safe to eat and what's not. I would have liked to see more pictures in the book because from what i've heard a lot of the plants look very similar. Humans should know what to do if they find themselves lost with no manufactured food sources, this book is a good place to start. I have written this review based on my unbiased opinion.

This eye mask is beneficial for migraines, neck pains and pure relaxation. I am impressed with how nice this feels to lay down with, no hard edges or plastic odor. This mask feels silky, is simple to warm in the microwave and smells great. I get a lot of migraines, and while this is no miracle solution, it certainly makes me feel better and soothes the pain. It's great at blocking annoying light out, and helping me doze off when i'm not feeling so well. No harmful chemicals and easy to use. This review is written based on my unbiased opinion.Pros-* Easy to cool, does not harden* Smells great, fresh lavender scent* Feels soft, Silky to Touch* Soothes headaches and pains* Promotes relaxation

We all fall from time to time, it's part of life. And unless you're living under a rock, you're going to experience disappointment. This shorter version of a much longer book provides insights and an analysis on takeaway points that the original author suggests. Briefly learn how to pick yourself back up after a personal disaster without reading the entire book. While the takeaway points are useful, they are simply a summary and I think readers could get more out of reading the whole book. This review was written based on my unbiased opinion.

This is a detailed summary of what is a much longer book, but I finished this feeling a bit inspired. There are key takeaway points, quotes and an analysis that struck a few chords with me and really sparked my interest. Many of these quotes are honest, and comical in their honesty. This short book gives a few ideas on how to be more creative and stop letting things stand in the way. These tips can be applied to everyday life, I think I would be interested in reading the whole self help book when I have a little more free time on my hands. I received this ebook in return for my unbiased opinion.

This wood-grain diffuser has a simple, elegant look and is fairly easy to setup. After removing from the box, insert water to the fill line (the bump in the middle) add your favorite oils, place the plastic pieces back on and then screw the top on. There are two rectangular, gray buttons on the back labeled "M" and "L". The first is the power on button, with a "Pause" and off mode, and the second I am not sure what function it provides.This diffuser puts off a nice, clean smell, but I wish it were simpler to take apart to refill. Right now I am using Mandarin Essential Oil and it smells like an orange grove. I received this item in return for my unbiased opinion.Pros-Love the styleEasy to cleanSetup is quickPleasant aromaCons-No nightlight feature as instruction manual suggestsIt takes a little bit of extra work to refill this diffuser

This 2 port USB charger fits into the car's cigarette lighter, allowing for two devices to be charged at once. It is simple to use, and successfully charges tablets and phones allowing you to play on them while they charge. There is a durable USB cord included in the package making it convenient to charge your device on the go. The USB cords fit snugly into the ports without falling out or feeling loose. This small device seems pretty well built and successfully serves its purpose. I received this item in return for my unbiased opinion.

This summary of Larson's novel provides the reader with a significantly shorter version that's easier to swallow. There's a detailed character reference section to show how everyone is connected and what purpose they serve in the story. I found it interesting to read about Holmes and his self serving, serial killing ways. I would like to learn more about what was going on in his mind. Aside from a few typps, this synopsis is well written and introduced me to a historical landscape, the first Ferris wheel invented and a mad man. I received this book in return for my honest opinion.

Garlic is an essential ingredient in about 80% of my meals, I come from a big Italian family. I normally chop garlic by hand, or press it and smell like garlic for all of eternity. This is a quick and easy way to chop garlic while keeping clean up to a minimum. The garlic press comes apart for simple cleaning. This gadget is durable and comes in handy quite often in the kitchen. I received this unit in return for my honest opinion.

We are all familiar with the traditional plastic ice cube trays, the ones that crack and spill and hog up the whole freezer. I have come to appreciate using silicone trays such as this one. It make ice in the shape of neat spheres, or balls and freezes water really quickly. The flexible silicone allows you to pop the ice out of the holder, no banging the tray on the counter top in frustration. This medium sized tray can be securely placed under or on top of something else in the freezer without having to worry about spillage. This is one of the best ways to keep drinks cool for a decent amount of time. I received this unit in return for my unbiased opinion.

I received a pack of 2 teethers, a cool shark and a cute teddy bear. These teethers are flexible and comfortable on my little cousin's gums. She loves chewing on them and they help to calm her down when she's cranky from cutting teeth. The heart shaped nubs on the back act as a massager for sore gums and the silicone make is much gentler than hard plastic. There is a necklace string attached to one, I use it to affix the teether to the diaper bag. They are much easier to clean than traditional teething rings and can be laid flat to dry. Overall the one thing I would suggest is that the teething toys be made more colorful, as I believe small children are excited by bright colors. I received this set in return for my honest opinion.

Circling The Sun relays the story of a stong woman who wants to do well for herself and her family. I appreciate how adequately the novel was explained in this much shorter version. I have a great deal of respect for this strong woman, but unfortunately non fiction and documentaries are not really my type. This offered me a glimpse into the story, showed me the important parts of the book and eliminated the need for excess. I was able to broaden my horizon without spending too much time reading a long novel. I received this read in return for my honest opinion.

This grinder is sleek and easy to use. It's separate compartments allow for storage, herb grinding and portability. There's a small scraper included to remove loose residue from the screen and clean the device. This grinder is durable, but it's lightweight and not super heavy like a lot of other grinders on the market. It's simple to use and offers options. I received this grinder in return for my unbiased opinion.

This system is small and discreet, it duplicates the sound of vibration that a cell phone would produce. The intensity is impressive for such a compact vibrator, it is excellent for clitoral stimulation. The glossy surface wipes off nicely with a soapy rag. I received this product at a discounted rate in return for my unbiased opinion.

This bottle of lavender oil goes along way. It's scent works well with my diffuser and helps soothe me as I drift off into a relaxing night of sleep. The eye dropper that's included comes in handy when making natural face masks and lotion serums. I have tried a few different oils and this is one of my favorites, it is noticeably more pure and smells cleaner. I received this product in return for my unbiased opinion.

I read a lot and sometimes I invest hours or even days into a book and am disappointed in the outcome. 50 Shades of Grey is a series that captured my attention for almost a month, as I quickly turned page after page. I was interested in reading Grey's perspective, but unsure of whether to take the plunge or not. This cliffnoted version helps to break down the idea of the popular book while significantly shrinking it's size. It doesn't give everything away though, it leaves me wanting more, and I can't wait to read the original book! I received this book in return for my unbiased opinion.

This short collection of poetry might contain something in it for everyone to enjoy. I liked some of the poems and could see what the author was hinting at, but others were a little confusing to me.I understand everyone interprets things differently, perspective and what not, but a few of these poems didnt really lead my mind anywhere. The poetry contained in this book is inspirational and highly influenced by the authors strong sense of religion and love of god. I am not a religious person, but enjoy reading about different belief systems.

I bought this book purely out of nostalgia. I don't have kids, but this was my very favorite book as a little girl and I never forgot it. After treating my childhood rag doll to a new dress recently, a one-armed doll with tattered toes that I've loved for over 40 years, I remembered this book and was thrilled to find it still available. It tells the story of a little girl who gets invited to a party where there will be a doll contest. She has antique dolls, fancy dolls, dolls that do things, and then she has her favorite doll, who is a bit ragged and worn from years of love. Her loyalty to her beloved doll is rewarded at the party and there is a wonderful moral about staying true to yourself and being proud of who you are, even when you might feel inferior. The story is full of simple dialogue, and near the beginning the dolls themselves have secret conversations with each other when "their" little girl is out of the room, and I always loved the idea of that.Originally written in 1962, the book itself is somewhat dated on one hand, in that there is some slightly outdated wording like "I shall", "your dress is a fright", etc. But on the other hand it's a truly timeless story that outshines any slightly dated language. I actually like the older-style wording, it makes it fun to read. It's a classic! The illustrations are simple, using only the colors of lavender, black and gray. But they're still very expressive, showing that sometimes the simplest of drawings can portray a whole lot of emotion. Personally, I was very relieved to see the original artwork being used in this newer edition, it wouldn't have been the same with updated drawings, but again, I come from the perspective of nostalgia.I absolutely loved books as a kid and had hundreds of them, donating boxes full to the library every year as I accumulated new ones. But this one stands out by far as my favorite, even after all these years. I am very pleased to have found it again.

Wow, what a difference. I only really started listening to podcasts a couple years ago. I heard about the Stitcher app, it was referenced on NPR, so I assumed it was probably one of the best out there, for free at least. So I downloaded it to my Kindle Fire and have been using it exclusively for about a year or more. Before that I had only listened to podcasts online or on my desktop computer so Stitcher was the only podcast app I had ever used. I really love listening to podcasts at night, as I fall asleep. But two big things were making me crazy with Stitcher: One; that it has a glaring white screen, which is bothersome when I'm trying to get into 'sleepy mode' in bed. And two; it had a 'continuous play' feature that I could never manage to find a way to turn off. So I'd choose one podcast episode to play, start to fall asleep, and just when I was asleep it would start playing the next podcast. This was very annoying because I would deliberately choose some subdued, quiet-type podcast to fall asleep to, and then suddenly some other loud obnoxious podcast would wake me up. It got to the point where I rarely listened at bedtime anymore, and started listening to audiobooks instead. Their website shows an option to turn off continuous play, but I could never find the setting options they referred to on my Kindle, I just don't think my version offered a way to disable it.SO: My point in all that history is to say that I have neither problem with Podcast Addict, Hooray! It has a nice dark interface which is much more soothing on my eyes while in bed. Additionally, it has the option to stop playing once the current podcast is over, which I LOVE. Now I can fall asleep to the chosen episode and only the chosen episode, and as I drift off it eventually shuts up! The option is a little quirky however, there's a box to check "Stop playing after current episode", which in theory should stop at the end of the episode *no matter what*. But under that is a timer to select whether to stop playing after a selected period of time, anything to one minute to many hours. Strangely, the 'stop playing after current episode' box being checked does NOT override the timer IF the timer is set to a time that's shorter than the episode. So in addition to checking the 'stop after current episode' box, I have to also make sure the timer is set for a very long period of time (say three hours for example) in order for a shorter episode (say 30-60 minutes) to stop when it should - without cutting it off too early. So it's a little glitch but not a big deal now that I've figured out that I can just keep the timer set for several hours at all times and then check the 'end after episode' box before bed, since everything I listen to is never more than 3 hours. I would have deducted a star for this flaw but since I figured out how to work around it I'm happy. The bottom line is that I am thrilled to be able to have a sleep option even though it's not perfect.Another thing I've discovered which surprised me is that when I searched for my regular podcasts, this app pulled up many more available episodes in several cases than were offered on Stitcher. I just assumed the number of available episodes were set by the podcast itself, it never occurred to me that a different app might offer more episodes, so that's very exciting. Additionally, I've also found a few podcasts on Podcast Addict that I searched for on Stitcher but could never find.There are a lot of settings and options, some a bit confusing, some not, and I'm still learning my way around. I haven't utilized half of the features yet, but already this is a BIG improvement from Stitcher. It's more visually appealing and offers more customization options. I am really enjoying it. There is a banner ad across the bottom of the screen, but I don't really mind it and the overall improvement over Stitcher is totally worth it.

Full disclaimer, I am extremely slipper picky. I am home all day and I wear slippers all day long inside the house and often outside in the yard if I am running outside for a brief chore. I prefer the 'bootie' style for ankle warmth, and outdoor soles are a must, especially in the winter when I often step outside onto the snowy deck to grab firewood. So I saw these, and while they're a little more expensive than I would prefer, they seemed to fit the bill.They are very comfortable. Soft inner sole, not overly cushy but not hard either. The furry lining is extremely soft, as is the outer material. One thing I love is the outer sole. It's genuinely outdoor-friendly, in that the rubber portion covers the entire bottom of the slipper and also wraps up around the edges. Too many times I've bought cheap slippers that have what appears to be an outdoor sole but it doesn't extend all the way to the very edges of the foot and I end up with damp feet if I run outside. So the soles get an A++ in that regard. Additionally, they are lightweight, the sole and the overall slipper, which I like. I've purchased some with good outdoor soles, but they often feel like winter boots and are just too heavy to be lounging around the house in. These feel light as slippers should, but still have a good sole.One thing I don't like however, is that the split on the outer side of the ankle portion is too wide/open. The split is cut way too low, so that they essentially hang open, which defeats the purpose of keeping my ankles warm. So the result is drafty ankles! The wide open cut also catches on pant legs too causing my pant leg to lift up, which is mildly annoying. I've been pondering sewing the flap shut, it doesn't look as 'wide-open' in the photo as it is in person. The toggle button is at the bottom of the opening, making it useless; it would be nice if that were higher so I could actually close the gap around my ankles! Also, when I walk I notice my heels lift up inside the slipper quite a bit. They don't fall off and it's not uncomfortable, but it's a loose feeling in the heel and I'm quite sure it's because of the wide-open cut at the sides. The actual foot size is perfect, so they aren't too big.Speaking of size: I wear a 7.5 in most shoes and boots, and occasionally a 7.0 in dress shoes or sandals. However, I had a weird feeling that I should order these in an 8, especially since I always wear socks with slippers, and I am glad I did because the 8 fits perfectly, with no room to spare. Comfortable, but anything less would be tight. I only have one other pair of shoes (out of dozens of boots, shoes and slippers) that's a size 8 and that's a pair of rain boots. So I can safely say these run slightly small. The width however is perfect, I got a medium width as I usually do in other shoes.They go on and off easily and are generally very comfortable. Like I said, I love that the sole is genuinely outdoor-friendly while still being lightweight and slipper-like. The actual foot portion is very nice, I only wish the side vents weren't cut so low, my ankles are chilly even as I type, no joke. I may have to attach large safety pins or something to hold them closed.EDITED TO ADD: I did add safety pins to close the side gaps, a full two inches up from the button, and there's still nearly two more inches of open split above the pins. Still plenty of room to get them on and off, but it's an improvement. I only hope the material doesn't rip from being pinned, time will tell.

I received this item at a special promotional price, and was anxious to try it out. I had a Bodum brand french press many years ago when I was young and hip and living in New York City, and my roommates and I had some wonderful deep talks sitting around a pot of coffee in our Brooklyn apartment. But alas; time has passed, I'm not so young and I've long since lost my dear old Bodum (one of those roommates probably stole it), so this offer reminded me how much I enjoyed my first french press. Unlike the Bodum I had, this Kona french press has a plastic design surrounding the glass so that it won't break easily, and also for aesthetics I assume. It has a nice roomy handle that would fit all hands. The lid (which the coffee/tea comes in contact with) is made of BPA-free plastic, so no worries there, and the carafe is borosilicate glass, which is both lightweight and durable, within reason. This is still an item you want to treat carefully however. I personally hand wash mine, just rinsing it out immediately after use with warm water. It comes with a handy little scoop and basic but clear directions. It was also very well packaged, wrapped in bubble wrap inside the box, which eliminated my concern that it might break in transit. It arrived safe and sound.These days I only drink one cup of coffee in the morning, and sometimes a second later in the day, so a full carafe isn't desired for my routine. However, I have become a big fan of loose tea, so I was curious how it would work for tea. I do drink a few cups of tea at a time, especially in the cold winter months, so this makes the perfect amount. Additionally, I often become impatient waiting for loose tea to fully steep, so now I can pour a cup after waiting just a few minutes, and the remaining portion becomes stronger while I am enjoying the first cup, which is perfect. So while most of the reviews seem to praise it for coffee making, I personally find it most useful for loose tea.The only thing I don't care for is the construction of the fragile screen. It's nice and has an ultra fine mesh, but there is no grommet in the center, so it may become frayed around the center cut-out after some use. I would highly recommend that the manufacturer add a grommet! So I had to deduct one star based on that. Otherwise I have no complaints and am very happy to be a french presser hipster once again after so many years without one. :-)

I don't do a whole lot of driving, so I'm still learning my way around this unit. This is my first GPS unit of any kind, I don't even have a smart phone. I moved several years ago and have yet to really learn my way around beyond the basic errands I do, so I thought this might help me explore a little more with less apprehension about getting lost, and it's great for that. I borrowed my neighbor's vehicle once and used his TomTom and liked it. He said he never had any issues with his so I saved myself a lot of brand-comparing and ordered the same thing he has. I don't use a lot of the features, but it's great for getting me where I need to go. Setup was less than stellar, it kept alerting me that there were more updates than what initially downloaded, but couldn't seem to finish the updates. I just plugged it into my vehicle at that point to see how it worked and it's been there ever since.Some things I like are: The view is clear and easy to follow, it shows where I should turn right where I am on the road, no misleading distances, etc. It saves my place if I stop mid-route and when I restart it asks if I want to resume to the original destination that I had interrupted, so that's handy. I love the ETA feature, I hate trying to guess when I'll arrive somewhere. Another thing I like is that if I know of a better route, or one that I just prefer, I can go off course and after a brief reminder to 'turn around', it will re-calculate the route and pick up on my new course.Some things I don't love so much are: The speed it shows I'm driving is off, it shows I'm going about 5 mph slower than I actually am. This is annoying because I find it so much easier to refer to the screen than to my vehicle's speedometer (due to my steering wheel position of choice), but I keep having to remember that I'm going faster than I think. One other thing I find mildly annoying is that it constantly tries to avoid dirt roads. That might be great for some people, but I live in a very rural area where there are tons of dirt roads that I rely on, plus I drive a Jeep, so I dislike that it tries to avoid them. There may be a way fix that, I'm not sure yet. It will re-calculate the route after a couple minutes however, so it's not a big deal.Like I said, I know I'm not using this device to its full potential, but it does what I want: Gets me where I want to go. And it's very user friendly, prompting me through simple steps to enter a destination. And then it remembers my recent destinations making them easy to recall from a list so I don't need to re-enter it each time. It also has a "Home" button which is great to get back from anywhere with a single touch of a button. I'll add more to this review if I discover anything important to mention, but already I'm glad I purchased it. Totally worth the price.

What a bummer, seemed like a good price, I should have known it was too good to be true. I am typically a size 8 in clothes, so a Medium would be my usual choice. But I read in the description that they "fit snug" and to order one size up "for a looser fit", which in theory should have been a Large but they were out of Large so I ordered XL, not minding if they were a bit big since I figured they'd shrink some being 100% cotton. The size chart shows XL being about a size 14, so these should have been plenty big! Well, they're tiny! Like TINY, they might fit a 12 year old child. They were extremely short in the arms and the legs. The legs stopped at my calf, like Capris. And the seams were strange, they felt twisted and weird no matter how much I tried to adjust them on my body, it was just ridiculous. I couldn't even figure out which was front or back on the pants because they felt strange and uncomfortable either way. And there was also a very strong chemical odor that still lingered after I repacked them and washed my hands. The only good thing I can report is that the colors (tan and blue, I ordered two sets) were accurate. Complete waste of money, I very rarely bother returning anything and I immediately packed these back up to send back.

I've been using Claritin for years. Well, I should say until I discovered generic versions of Loratadine 10mg. For the last five or six years I've been using a lesser known brand called Ohm, which was a good price at $10 for a bottle of 100 pills on Prime. I ran out and went to reorder and couldn't find the Ohm brand on Prime this time around, and I really prefer Prime delivery. So I searched around and saw this Kirkland brand - 365 pills for only a couple bucks more than I have been paying for 100 pills! Great deal! I've used Kirkland products before, I use their acetaminophen (generic Tylenol) and it works just fine. I believe it's Costco's "house brand", as I've seen Kirkland products there quite often. Kirkland's brand of these are oval as opposed to the usual round pill, but they're still tiny and easy to swallow. I've never had any issues with generic medications, they all seem to work the same, so I ordered this and I'm very happy with the price. I take 10mg of Loratadine every day for general pet/dust allergies as well as to prevent chronic hives and have never experienced any side effects, although Loratadine in general is a type that needs to get and stay into your system for the best ongoing effect, it's not really meant as a quick fix for immediate relief, just an FYI. I'm thrilled to have found a year's supply at an even better price than I was paying for the Ohm brand.

I was a little unsure about trying this brand, I've been buying "Ecotools" brand in local stores for several years and love them. I decided to check online prices this time and should have known there would be cheaper brands. I was really hoping the quality and texture would be close to Ecotools brand and it is. The size is the same as Ecotools brand. The texture is actually slightly rougher, only very slightly, but to me that's a good thing because I like the exfoliating effect.I use these primarily on my face, they're more convenient than a wash cloth, I can just rinse it and leave it to dry. I also keep a second one handy to use under my arms to freshen up between showers. And when they finally get old I even use them on my bathroom sink and faucets before finally tossing them, just to get as much use out of them as possible. Hopefully these will last as long as the Ecotools brand did, I don't see any major difference in them, so they should work out fine. One thing I do miss is the individual wrapping that Ecotools brand has, since they're preserved to stay moist, I think the single wrappers were better than one bag that doesn't reseal. I'll just keep them in a large ziplock bag and on the plus side it wastes less packaging.By the way, a couple other reviews mentioned this as a package of 12, but as of my purchase and review it's TWO packages of 12, so that's 24 sponges total for the price, which is what I read in the title at the time of my order and what I received. So it was a pretty good deal and I'll be stocked up for a while.

I'm really mad. I was looking forward to receiving this after reading a bunch of nice reviews. I received it today and it's cheap junk. There are no dovetail joint corners as shown (they're just glued together with straight, rough edges), the top doesn't have the nice rounded edges as shown, instead rough angular edges. The inside divider unit is misaligned so that some of the compartments are warped, and there are actual splintered edges all over this box - to the point that you can't wipe it down with a rag without it catching all over the place. I can literally run my hands along and get splintered or just pull loose pieces of wood slivers right off. I re-checked both the listing photo and other customer photos and it is absolutely NOT the same box. Then I noticed just in the last few days a couple of other brand new reviews saying the same thing, so they are obviously sending out cheap substitutes now instead of the nicer ones that the older reviews are referring to. I needed this as a display for an event so I didn't return it, I'll cut my losses and stick it in the cabinet until it breaks which won't be long, but it certainly is not the nice display box that is shown. I feel genuinely cheated.**Update July 31 2015** I kept getting emails from the seller saying the item was delivered but I didn't leave feedback, even though I posted this review on the very day I received the item. So I finally wrote back so they would stop emailing me and said I had in fact left a review and that I was not happy at all, that it was not as shown, no dovetail joints, splintering in places, etc and they wrote back and said: "Ok thanks". That's it, no "gee, sorry to hear that", no "that's not how they should be", nothing. Granted, I didn't ask for a refund, but they don't seem the least bit concerned with customer satisfaction so I felt it was important to add that to this review. The only thing worse than a poor quality product is a company who obviously doesn't care that you are unhappy.

This is perfect for my needs! I live in the woods with little direct sun so I try to grow herbs and tomatoes in containers on my deck, which gets the best amount of sun. But the tomatoes still struggle, they really need sun all day. I don't know why I didn't think of getting one of these sooner; now I can roll my tomato plant around the deck throughout the day to always be in the best sun. This is well made and I really like the natural wood look. Came out of the box as seen here, wheels attached. I hope it weathers well spending summers on the deck, time will tell. It's 12" square, which fits my 5 gallon bucket perfectly. I don't use a planter, I use a big ol' regular 5 gallon bucket to get the most root depth possible. I was a little worried when I ordered because the bucket full of soil is heavy, but it seems fine on this. It rolls right over my spaced deck boards with no trouble at all. It has a lovely wood-burned tree detail in the corner, the tree on mine is larger than the one in the photo which I barely noticed when ordering, but I like it, it's a nice touch. This is perfect for my needs and I'm really glad I got this. Why get junk plastic from China when you get can this nice cedar one Made in the USA?

Well, these aren't as big as I thought they would be from reading the other reviews, I was hoping for a jumbo size, but they are slightly bigger than the regular size that they seem to be making these days. I've attached a photo of my old regular one next to this size for comparison. Not a big difference, but it's still an improvement and they are easier to handle. The finish is a bit rough on many of them, I hope they'll smooth out with use. Some of them are sort of twisted- meaning not lined up, and I'm wondering if they'll start coming apart, but so far they've worked fine. Notice in my comparison photo that the spring is much higher: that seemed weird at first but the advantage is that there is more to fit down over the line and clothes. However, I have chronic pain in my hands so I was hoping the size difference would have been in the part that I squeeze at the top, which is not any bigger. They aren't quite the size and quality I expected based on reading other reviews, but they'll do.

When my clothesline broke after five years, I made the mistake of researching different types of clothesline materials, which nearly drove me bonkers. I wasn't sure what my original one was, but it seemed mostly synthetic. I checked out my neighbor's and he had cotton. So many pros and cons, cotton holds knots better but sags more, synthetic is harder to knot but might last longer, plastic coated metal seemed sturdy but how easy would that be to put up, would I need extra hardware to clasp it or would the coating crack? WAY too many factors for what should have been a simple purchase. After reading 8 million reviews on Amazon and other various articles, I decided on this one: Cotton but with a "synthetic core". Seemed like a good compromise, would knot well and yet hopefully sag less. Only time will tell, and I will update this if anything drastic happens, but so far it seems like a good choice.It was wound well, so unraveling was pain-free, no crazy tangles. I restrung it to my existing pulleys with ease and in only a few minutes. It knotted very easily much to my relief. Hung a full line of clothes and it does sag somewhat but so did my old one, I can't say it sags any unusual amount and I add a "spreader" to decrease sagging. I HIGHLY recommend a tensioner for clotheslines, it makes it so easy, you only have to make one knot to the one end of the tensioner, then you can just feed the other end of the line through the other end of the tensioner. Tightening is easier later with one too, just pull it a little tighter, no untying anything. It's slightly thicker than the synthetic one I had, but fits my pins fine and seems sturdy. I do notice the weave is looser than what I'm used to though, so I'm hoping it won't fray very quickly, but only time will tell. The price was great. If I can get another five years from this one, I'll be perfectly happy.

My bunny is five years old and I have religiously bought the same brand food (Blue Seal) from my local feed store, because it's good quality and much cheaper than small(er) brand name bags like this. But I found myself in a pickle when my car was in the shop longer than expected and I ran out of food, so I ordered this on 2 day delivery to hold him over. Because I'm used to larger quantity feed store prices, this wasn't any bargain for me, but among the choices on Amazon it seemed like the best deal for a 10 pound bag. I fed it to my bunny and at first he didn't eat it, which made me nervous because he always dives right into his food. He waited awhile, and finally gave it a try. I guess the change took him aback a little, given that he's eaten the same brand for five years. In any case he took to it well enough after the initial hesitation. The pellets are slightly longer in length and also harder than what I normally get, but he doesn't seem to object. I would buy this again in a pinch, but prefer the price of my local feed store for regular purchases.

My clothesline is the pulley type, about 40 or so feet long, but I'd say about 35 feet of usable space since one end is under a tree so I don't hang anything on that end. I had a plastic 'clothespin with a hook thingie' that I was using to lift the gap when the laundry hung too low; I'd clip it to the lower line and hook it to the top line. That worked well enough for a few years. This year my clothesline finally broke, and while I was researching what type of new line to get (cotton, synthetic, etc) I discovered this gadget, that much to my surprise was designed specifically for what I had been using my clip thingie for. Not sure how I got through 40-something years not knowing these existed, but I ordered it along with my new line.I was, and still am, slightly confused about how the design is supposed to work, since some of these only have one wheel and others like this model have two. I imagine it's supposed to slide along as I hang laundry. It does technically do that, but I find it creates a drag on the movement of the line and my line pulleys along much quicker and smoother without it. I'm also never really sure where the line will droop at it's lowest, depending on what type of items I hang and where - it's not always lowest in the center. So I use it differently than I think it's meant to be used: I hang all my clothes, then find the lowest point, walk over and put this wherever that lowest point is. It works fine that way, so I'm satisfied even though I'm not really utilizing it in the way it's intended - it could essentially have no wheels and still suit the way I am using it, but who cares, it does the job of eliminating the sag. For my length line, two of these would have been ideal, but one is JUST good enough. I like that it's sturdy metal so it should last a long time.

I was very hopeful about this product because earlier this year I ordered their Puracy Dish Liquid and absolutely love it, it works great. So I was anxious to try this stain remover. However, upon opening the box I discovered the screw top cap had come loose and it had leaked all over the place, I removed the bagged bottle from the box and the bag was dripping everywhere and it had also leaked out of the bag and got all over another product that came in the same box. This is especially aggravating because this **same exact thing** happened with their dish liquid, one of the pop-tops had popped up and one of the three bottles had leaked and made a mess. At that time I typed in my review for the dish liquid that it was probably an unfortunate shipping accident but having happened TWICE now I blame Puracy for not having seals on their bottles. It's crazy to just screw on a lid, ship liquid and hope for the best. So I lost a good portion of product, and that makes me angry because with my tight budget, this is a lot of money to spend on a bottle that isn't even full upon arrival - not to mention the mess.So once I cleaned everything up I tested it out on several stained items, marking the stains with pins. The pins turned out to be unnecessary since all of the stains were clearly still there after washing. One stain on an apron had faded slightly, and two other stains on a kitchen towel and on a shirt were both still there, although to be fair all three stains are old stains so I don't expect miracles. I left them for about 45 minutes to an hour respraying a couple times to keep it wet, but I did not scrub the stains with a brush, so for now I'll say the jury is still out on how it works - I will try it again with fresh stains, and I will also try scrubbing the stain next time. I'll be sure to update this review if my next load produces better results. However, due to the fact that I have ordered Puracy products twice now and BOTH times they leaked all over the place, I'm thinking I will not likely order again until they come to their senses and start adding seals to the bottles. I hate to be harsh, but I also hate wasting my money. It's a shame too, because I really am a big fan of their dish washing soap.

This was a fun purchase. I started out searching for a couple of specific stones for my personal meditation & healing use, and was surprised at how expensive they are individually. I ended up seeing this Chakra Set, and the price worked out to be much better value. Plus, I am new to Chakras and have always wanted to learn more, so this seemed like a nice, all-inclusive kit to start me off with.To get my only real "complaint" out of the way first: The tip of the Pendulum was broken off and missing, so that was a bummer. However, I am not deducting any stars out of fairness to the seller because they clearly state in the CD literature to contact them if disappointed before leaving a bad review. I don't want to return the broken pendulum because there is a section on the CD that talks about the stones 'choosing us' and finding their way into our lives. I don't want my perfectionism to cloud what is perhaps meant to be mine, however flawed. So I can't fairly deduct a star, I'm sure they would have exchanged it if I asked.On to more positive things! It was very exciting to open (this would be an awesome gift), all stones are separated into the chakras, 3 for each chakra in a plastic zip bag along with a satin pouch and and an ID/info card. A few seemed a bit small, but most were a good variety of sizes. There were substitutions on a few stones, so that's something to be aware of. One of the substitutions turned out to be my favorite of the set, so it's not necessarily a bad thing! I did a fun thing, going though each one and jotting down my feelings from each, without looking at the descriptions first. Then I looked up the properties and was amazed at how accurately my feelings matched the property descriptions!The stones in the travel pouch are smaller, presumably on purpose to make them lighter to travel with. There is lots of stuff on the CD, although to be honest the majority of it has little-to-nothing to do with stones or chakras; it's a variety of random things from 'living green' advice, poems, and self-improvement stuff. Sort of a positive-vibe Grab-Bag of PDF files. Be aware it only works on a PC. There IS info on the stones and chakras on the CD as well, enough to give me a beginner orientation on the chakras and stones. Just enough info to save me from buying separate beginner books on Chakras and/or stones/crystals.
