All in all I feel like this package was very thoughtfully put together, and it's a fantastic starter kit for someone like myself, who is new to Chakras and healing stones. I am excited to begin using them.

Prices on Amazon products fluctuate frequently, but at the time I placed my order this listing had an Amazon instant coupon that made it cheaper than buying large boxes, so although I didn't require the snack size bags, it was actually more cost effective. It might also help with portion control this way, which would be good. These arrived on time and in good condition. Inside the shipping box was another sturdy box which was a Cheez-it manufacturer box with a punch-out opening so it can be used as a dispensing box which is handy. The expiration isn't until 6 months from now, and they'll be long since devoured by then. They taste fresh and how Cheez-its normally taste when I buy them from the store. They're a bit crammed into the box, so some may be broken up as I get deeper into the box, but so far they've been fine. No loose ones or opened bags as others have reported. Exactly 36 bags. These will also be good for throwing in a purse to take with me on errand days for a quick snack without wasting more money at a store. I'm happy!

I often use cheap little notebooks in my bags and purses for lists, errands, price shopping, etc., but I use them so much that I've become picky, spiral bound ones get caught on things, top bound ones offer no privacy when writing notes to myself close to others, and some are just so cheap that the pages fall out. I saw my neighbor with one of these and I loved it. His was very beat up too, yet still in one piece so I was sold. He said he gets them at Staples so I went on the website ready to order and found them going for $11.00 EACH - forget that! I am so glad I decided to check the price here on Amazon, where I found this pack of 6 for less than the price of one at Staples. I read another review saying the quality was comparable to Staples and I immediately ordered. The other reviewer was right, these are absolutely identical to the ones Staples offers, durable flexible covers, good paper, and fabric covered, threaded bindings.The pages have four columns, small on the left, medium center and two more small ones on the right. I don't care about the columns actually, I usually just get lined pages with no columns, but the columns might come in handy for adding up smaller shopping lists or keeping track of errand spending. These books are a great size, a little bigger than a checkbook, so I can easily find it in my larger bags but it's still small enough to tuck into a coat pocket or small purse. These came in perfect condition, packaged in a sturdy manufacturer's box, so the extras can be conveniently stored without getting separated or beat up. Now that I have six of them, I'm thinking of other uses too; I might use one as a birding/nature log for hikes, they'd be useful for all sorts of things; a great buy!

I have Eczema and use a body lotion constantly during the winter months. But I was looking for a treatment lotion or ointment to use on specific itchy areas that were especially bad. I read that Hydrocortisone cream is actually bad to use on a regular basis as it thins the skin membranes and make you itchier with prolonged use, so I wanted something to replace that. This had great reviews and I saw several mentions of people using it for Eczema so I thought I'd give it a try. I've done quite a bit of reading on Eczema and medicated products like this aren't generally recommended for the record, but when you get desperate you'll try anything to stop an itch.Anyway, this seems like a decent product and it will be nice to have on hand, but it didn't do much for my itch; the effect was very mild. It's better to have on hand for insect bites and that sort of thing. Incidentally, I put it away after a few uses and thought to review it today when I took it back out to use for a bug bite. It "helps" but doesn't stop the itch, both on the eczema and the bug bite. I will use this as needed and it's certainly better than nothing, but I probably would not buy it again. Oh, It does have a strong menthol scent, so be aware of that.

I am in my early 40's and purchased this for occasional use because I suffered a knee injury a few years ago that periodically acts up and I'm forced to take my weight off it for about a week each time until it heals. Ultimately I need surgery, but this will have to do for now in addition to my knee brace. So I'm new to canes and have nothing to compare this to in that regard. I knew I definitely wanted something that folded up since I only use it once or twice a year. The handle is wood and although that sounded nice in the description I didn't anticipate how uncomfortable that would be on my hand, it really digs in. It's smooth and well-shaped, but with the injury I'm forced to really lean on it and it's a bit uncomfortable. It could also be that I'm just not used to a cane.The color is pretty, feminine and a blend of peach and pink tones and the handle is a very dark brownish-red that appears black at a glance. It folds and unfolds easily, although a rubber band is needed to keep it folded up. It's adjustable, although I would warn prospective buyers to pay attention to the adjustment span of 33"-37". According to the instructions, you should take your height in inches and divide by two and the resulting number should match the height of the cane. I'm 5'5" and when I divide 65" by two I get 32.5" which is actually shorter than this cane goes. In my case it's "close enough" at it's lowest, but I've never considered myself to be short and yet I'm apparently at the very minimum height to use this cane properly, which surprises me, so just be sure to check your needed measurements.I was disappointed to discover the "carrying case" is a disposable piece of junk; I saw similar canes with nylon drawstring bags here on Amazon but this came with a junky clear plastic thing that I would not consider a proper case. It has sharp edges and I expect it will tear apart easily. It will do since I only take it out a couple times a year, but if I used this more regularly I would have to go find some sort of real case for sure because this one is a joke. Even with my complaints however, this cane will still suit my particular needs for occasional use and I feel the price was mostly fair.

My Eczema recently came back after 30 years of being in remission much to my surprise and horror. But because it's been so long I had no clue what's currently out there for eczema products. I found the NEA website (National Eczema Association) and it's been very helpful. I was on their Facebook page one day and saw a couple of people recommended this Curel 'Itch Defense' formula. I have to be honest, Curel is one of the last companies I would ever think to turn to for this type of product; I know they're a fairly popular brand, but I just didn't think of them as making "serious" products for skin conditions. But I went to Curel's website and checked it out.Sure enough, it's a fragrance-free formula designed for eczema and with ingredients I was told to look for and none of the ingredients I was told to avoid. Two things sold me on trying it: 1. It had the NEA Seal of Acceptance. That's a big deal, that means they went through vigorous tests and reformulating in order to meet the criteria of the NEA's standards, including avoiding all ingredients on the NEA's known list of irritants. 2. The price! I had spent hours comparing labels on some very expensive eczema-friendly moisturizers and here was one that seemed to fit the bill AND came in a huge 20 ounce bottle for a very fair price.The lotion is thicker than I expected, somewhere between a lotion and a cream in thickness. It's white but slightly translucent which reflects the highly emollient ingredients like petrolatum and dimethicone. Both are said to be excellent for eczema but many eczema moisturizers will have one or the other, this has both. It goes on thick but spreads VERY nicely. It's definitely on the heavy side, you can really feel that "barrier" on the skin. That's exactly what eczema patients need, a moisture barrier on their skin - not a lotion that disappears/evaporates, but the downside to that is that I personally find it an annoying feeling, a slight tackiness on the skin that lingers for a long time, but I'll live.I did get immediate (albeit not total) relief of my INSANE itching. It didn't disappear entirely, but I got relief of the worst of it and some areas have stopped itching, so it's still a huge improvement. I've started using it in two ways: Putting it all over my body morning and night and after showers, and also "spot treating" areas, spreading a small amount like an ointment on an area that starts itching out of the blue - it soothes the itch enough for me to leave it alone and I repeat that as needed. I've decided this: I do still need to find a specific treatment cream or ointment to put on the worst areas during flare-ups, but this Curel formula is excellent for after showers to seal in moisture and for general use all over my body on a daily basis during dry winter months. I have to admit I've misjudged Curel; it turns out this is an excellent quality formula that I probably would not have tried if it weren't for the NEA Seal on the bottle.

Recently diagnosed with Eczema, I've been on a non-stop mission to find 'all things non-irrating' to replace all my personal and household products which aggravate my eczema. This said it's suitable for "hands, face and body", and is free of a whole bunch of common irritants and is fragrance-free so I gave it a try. I bought one for my bathroom sink and one for the kitchen sink, and will probably add it to my shower too if I can't find a suitable body wash. It makes my hands feel nice and clean: not stripped but not moisturized from extra crap, just CLEAN. I almost forgot what plain ol' clean feels like because most hand soaps have added garbage that moisturize, exfoliate, etc. This does nothing fancy, it just gives you an honest, simple clean.I washed my face with it and I always have to moisturize immediately afterward because my skin is very dry, but just for the sake of testing this product, I didn't moisturize right away. My skin didn't have that tight and itchy feeling, which was refreshing indeed. I do still need to moisturize my face, but my test showed that it's at least not harsh in any way. It has a nice lather, semi-low lathering but still enough to satisfy the senses and feels silky in the hands.My only complaint is the price. These are small bottles. There is a larger refill bottle but I still feel it's a bit on the pricey side in my opinion. I will continue to buy it, but like I said above, if I can find a less expensive eczema-friendly product for body wash I will, and reserve this for face and hands. On the plus side, a little goes a long way, I only need a very small amount for hand washing, not a full pump - maybe not even half a pump, so that helps take the some of the sting out of the price. Overall I'm very happy with this so far and I think my poor, irritated skin will thank me.

No babies here, I bought this for myself because I was recently diagnosed with Eczema and have been searching for something gentle and non-irritating but also natural and a shampoo/body wash combo for quickie showers. I was leaning toward something entirely unscented and marketed toward adult skin conditions, but I happened upon this, did some reading on their website and it actually looked pretty good, so I ordered.I was very curious how it would smell since some reviews say "it stinks" or it smells like men's cologne, etc. yet others say they loved the smell. It really shows how different preferences are, because to ME, I think perfumey mainstream shampoos "stink". I really like the scent of this but to try and help others I'll describe it as best as I can: It's an "earthy" first of all. Someone mentioned patchouli and while it's not nearly as strong as that, it is along the same lines as far as smelling sort of "woody". In the hair it smells a little like Sandalwood for those who know that smell. I have a good nose (and use a lot of essential oils) so right off the bat I picked up both bergamot and cedarwood and sure enough, checked the label and there they are. I could absolutely understand some people thinking of it as somewhat masculine, but it definitely doesn't smell like cologne in my opinion. I'm a little bit of a hippie/earthy type so it's right up my alley but if you prefer flowery, more mainstream scents from a drugstore shampoo you may not care for it. Seems like an unusual scent for a baby product I'll admit, but I like the scent nonetheless and would use it my baby if I had one. The scent remains after my hair is dry but only very lightly. If I lift my long hair to my nose and breathe in it's there but I don't think it's strong enough for anyone else to smell unless they're hugging me or something. I'm sensitive to most scents in bath/body products and this isn't at all overwhelming for me.It worked great, a little thin for my taste but I think all baby shampoos are that way, I can't remember. It made my hair feel soft even while still wet in the shower, and it felt nice and soft after it dried. It doesn't lather a whole lot, but I don't care about lather as long as it works. People tend to be fooled into thinking lather somehow equals effectiveness and that's not true. I've only used it once, but so far it has not aggravated my eczema which was my main reason for buying it, so that's good.My only complaint, and for me it's enough to stop me from buying it again, is the price! Now this is my own fault I realize, but I bought this not fully paying attention to the fact that it's 8 ounces. I saw the size, but it didn't register in my head how small that is. Now, I know nothing about bathing babies and how long a small bottle would last so maybe it's a fine size for that, but this little bottle won't last long at all using it as both shampoo and body wash for an adult, and there's no way I'll pay that much again now that I realize how small it actually is for the price. I saw a 16 ounces size, but it's still too pricey for my budget, I'll just opt for a natural sulfate-free shampoo for grownups when this bottle is done. Too bad too, because I do love the scent.

This was the best deal I could find by far, in stores or online. Kirkland is Costco's "house brand", and always seems to be good quality. I don't shop in person at Costco but have picked up various Kirkland items here on Amazon and have always been happy. Last time around was a large bottle of Acetaminophen (generic Tylenol) which was a good deal, and this time is Hydrocortisone cream. I recently developed some sort of allergic/histamine reaction to something - not sure what yet - medication, food, who knows, and I've have had an awful itchy rash all over my arms and legs for a couple weeks now. The itching is driving me insane and I've gone through the entire tube of Hydrocortisone cream that I had on hand. I'm still trying to narrow down the cause of the reaction, but in the meantime I needed more anti-itch cream immediately.This package is a quantity of FOUR 2-ounce tubes, totaling 8 ounces in all. Each one of these tubes is twice as large as the small tube I got at the drug store. Now I can keep a tube at my office desk, in my bedroom, in the bathroom, and in my purse until I figure out the cause of the reaction. The tubes have a good-sized flip-top cap which is very handy and SO much better than fumbling around in the middle of the night trying to screw back on a tiny cap with lotion covered hands when I'm already annoyed enough from the itching waking me up, so that's a big plus. The tube says "Plus 10 moisturizers" - not too sure about that claim; aloe is listed, but the other inactive ingredients are a bit less recognizable. Regardless, it's a great deal for 1% hydrocortisone cream and it feels and works the same as the generic tube I've always used from the drug store. I'm glad to have a larger quantity on hand and really like the easy flip-tops.

I've suffered from chronic sleep problems my entire life, and recently discovered I have DSPD (Delayed Sleep Phase Disorder), so I have made several changes to attempt to improve my sleep pattern. First I bought a Light Therapy light (which I'll review separately after a little more use), and then I downloaded software that reduces the blue light glow from my computer's monitor. I also stopped sitting under a bright lamp every evening and now have a dim mini-lamp/nightlight that I turn on in the evening instead. And finally I bought these orange blue-blocking glasses. So now every morning I use the Therapy Light, and every evening I put on the glasses, and dim the both the room light and the PC monitor. I've only been doing this new routine for a few days so it's too early to speak for sure of results, although I can already report that I've fallen asleep and woken up almost exactly one hour earlier each day since I started all the above things, which in and of itself is a bit of a miracle for me. I'm still about 6 hours off a "normal" sleep schedule, but it's a great start.The glasses themselves are better than I expected in both quality and usability. They are true safety glasses, Z87 rated with polycarbonate lenses, although that doesn't matter much for my use. I was testing out a yellow-lensed pair of shooting goggles that I happened to already have when I first learned about this sleep/blue-light thing, but I read that orange was really ideal for blocking blue light so I ordered these. I was expecting the orange to be much darker than the yellow, but it's actually not bad at all. I find that it enhances the colors and tones of most things and I've actually come to really like how things on the screen look through them. Screen images with a lot of bright blue colors are now a rich, deep green and things look generally warmer and richer. They definitely block blue light too, my proof was that my blue modem light completely disappears when I look at it with these on, which is kind of strange but impressive. The modem light was altered but still visible through the yellow lenses, so orange is clearly better for this usage.The temple length (arms) is adjustable as well as the tilt. For example when I first put them on the bottom of the lenses were pushing into my cheeks but I realized I could adjust the angle outward a little and now they're perfect, so that's a handy feature. There is a full wrap to these, so I'm not getting any peripheral light coming in. I put these on at night mainly for my computer use but I'm quickly developing the habit of wearing them all around the house in the evenings right up until bedtime to avoid exposure to any bright lighting before bed, kitchen and bathroom lights for example. It was a little awkward at first but they've become quite agreeable and I feel good knowing I'm taking these steps toward a better night's sleep. I feel much more relaxed at night now too, wearing these combined with dimmer room lighting; it really helps me get into "winding down mode". I bought two pairs, one for my computer room and another for my nightstand for when I use my Kindle in bed (which I now try to avoid). Very glad I learned about these. I do wish they came with a little draw-string case however, but for the price I can't complain.

This is a must-have for Hull Collectors. This is my second purchase of this book, I regretfully lost my first copy in a move a few years back. This is dated 2006 on the copyright page, and as I write this review in 2014, it's the most recent edition by Brenda Roberts that I am aware of. I had her 1980 and 1992 edition of this book as well.It's a pricey book but pays for itself with the values and the info provided. There are plenty of color photos, some of them a little dated looking and not the finest clarity, but plenty clear and large enough to properly ID the pieces. This edition has the values directly next to the pottery item name, mark, and size. This is an improvement from the earlier editions which had a separate stapled insert for the values which could be misplaced. This newer edition also has color coded page edges, which makes thumbing to the section you need easier.I am slightly disappointed to see some important pieces not included in this edition which were in earlier editions, but it's a small complaint compared to the overall value of this book. While it doesn't include all the pieces ever made, it's by far the most comprehensive collection in one book on the market. I've collected Hull pottery for over 20 years and this is my go-to book for values and info. It's ordered from earliest to latest, and divided into individual lines that were made. At the beginning of each section is helpful info, such as a brief history of that line and special notations and exceptions. There's also a section showing various markings Hull used over the years, and a nice pictorial history of the company. This is a large, heavy book and makes a lovely coffee table book or a great way to show friends and family your collection without dragging out all your pieces.Joan Gray Hull also publishes a ID/Value book with several editions called "Hull The Heavenly Pottery". I recommend that as well, it's small and unlike this book you can easily take it along with you to shows or shops. It also fills in some of the gaps and is good for comparison of values, but this encyclopedia by Brenda Robert's can't be beat. If you have to choose only one book on Hull Pottery, this is it.

Even though this is petite and I don't normally wear petite sizes, I can usually get away with petite tops if that's the only choice so I ordered it anyway since others reported that the sleeves were long. I'm 5'5" and 125 lbs and this is BIG. I ordered a size petite-medium and it looks more like a Large or even an Extra Large! I recently lost 65 pounds and this shirt would have fit me nicely before the weight loss, but at my size now it's too big. I can still wear it under things to layer, but as a stand-alone top it's too baggy. Especially under the arms, you can see it a little in the photo but it's more baggy there in person. It's also longer than I'd prefer, nearly covering my butt. I washed and dried it extra long on the hottest setting but it only shrank a little.I know monitors vary, but on my screen this looked like a Rust-ish Red but in person it's a true Christmas red. Not screaming bright, but not earthy like I expected, it's RED red. And my last complaint is the cuffs. The buttons line up on the front top of my hand!! They should be at the back side of my hand, like in the photo. It's so far off that I think it's defective. The tag included some extra thread and I can't help but to wonder if it's so I can rip the buttons off and re-sew them where they belong. The cuffs aren't prominent either, like they look in the picture, it's just the same thickness all the way down, the cuffs don't stand out like it looks in the photo.That's a lot of complaints, but there are a few good things: The material is wonderfully soft and stretchy, the shirt is extremely comfortable and the overall quality feels nice, with the exception of the misplaced buttons. The neck is comfortable also, not constricting like some turtlenecks and the edge of the collar is finished so you can fold it or wear it scrunched. I will definitely wear this shirt, but it will be under clothes in the winter as a plain old turtleneck, as opposed to a nicely fitted fashionable top as I had hoped it to be, and as it looks in the photo.

This is just what I've been needing for my daily and special practices. This is the second of two volumes, both basic Tibetan Buddhist Prayers and Practices. The first volume is aimed more at beginners in Tibetan Buddhism, and this second volume is a bit more advanced and would be most useful for practitioners who have teachers to assist them or have a basic understanding already of the material. I have all of the prayers in these two volumes already, but they're on various PDF's, printed in notebooks or in thicker books as a part of additional content. These volumes are thin, small in size and spiral bound, making them perfect for travel and quick reference. I can open it, fold the cover behind the book and lean it up against something so I can recite as I practice using my hands.Contents include: Vajrasattva Purification, Medicine Buddha meditation, White Tara Meditation, a few mantras and more. Thubten Chodron offers some basic instruction before most of the practices for general mindset and orientation, and there are some simple line drawings for visualizations. Well worth the price to have these prayers and practices compiled in a simple and convenient format as far as I'm concerned.

This is just what I've been needing for my daily and special practices. This is one of two volumes, both basic Tibetan Buddhist Prayers and Practices. The first volume; this volume, is aimed more at beginners in Tibetan Buddhism (who already have a general understanding of Buddhism) and is based on basic prayers and offerings, and the second edition is a bit more advanced. I have all of the prayers in these two volumes already, but they're on various PDF's, printed in notebooks or in thicker books as a part of additional content. These volumes are thin, small in size and spiral bound, making them perfect for travel and quick reference. I can open it, fold the cover behind the book and lean it up against something so I can recite as I practice using my hands.Contents include: Recitations for before and after teachings, mandala offerings, meditation on Shakyamuni Buddha, The 37 Practices of Bodhisattvas, evening chants, purification practices and more. Thubten Chodron offers some basic instruction before most of the practices for general mindset and orientation, and there are some simple line drawings for visualizations. Well worth the price to have these prayers and practices compiled in a simple and convenient format.

I recently started seeing a new dentist who told me I should be using a fluoride rinse every day. No other dentist ever told me this in my adulthood, and I guess I never really put much thought into it, but it seemed like a good idea since I have ongoing dental issues despite my best efforts. He said to make sure it's both fluoride and antimicrobial. But when I started shopping around I couldn't believe the garbage I was seeing, most of them had blue and/or green coloring added, which I hate, and many were full of all kinds of artificial sweeteners, and hardly any were actually antimicrobial, with the exception of rinses containing alcohol, which I prefer to avoid. Finally I found this and it looked great, no crazy colors, no alcohol and is antimicrobial. Score!I did some research on the product and learned about "Stannous Fluoride" as opposed to "Sodium Fluoride", the latter of which is in most over-the-counter rinses. While there is some differences in opinions, the gist seems to be that stannous fluoride and sodium fluoride both fight cavities, but stannous fluoride has the additional benefits of improving gingivitis and reducing sensitivity. But many online articles also warn of potential teeth staining with stannous fluoride, which scared the heck out of me at first. So I emailed my dentist, told him the name of this product and my concerns, and asked if he would recommend it. He said for someone like myself with advanced gingivitis/periodontitis he would absolutely recommend my using this regularly. He also said the staining only occurs with some people, and that if it does happen, I can easily manage it by adding baking soda to my toothpaste, which as it happens I already do. So I felt much better and ordered it.The flavor is very agreeable to my taste buds, not overly 'hot' or minty, but a nice mild mint. It leaves my mouth feeling clean, although it's certainly not intended to be a mouthwash for breath. It's important to note that this is a concentrate, it comes with a little cup and you add 2 full pumps to the 1 oz cup (included) and add water and mix. I personally find the full cup a bit difficult to swish around without swallowing some but I'm getting the hang of it (you of course never want to swallow any kind of fluoride). My teeth look and feel great after use and in the short amount of time I've been using it I've seen no sign of staining. If your overall dental health is good, a product like this probably isn't necessary, but it you have ongoing decay problems and/or gum disease, this seems like a superior option. I'm looking forward to seeing the long term results.

First off, there are things I love about this cream and there are things I absolutely hate about it. This cream looks like the consistency of a yellowish green sludge reminiscent of finely purred pea soup.  This is not appetizing, but then again you won't have to worry about a child trying to eat it.  Secondly it smells like cannabis, which to me is sickly sweet.  People might like that smell, but I do not enjoy it.  Of all the things in this cream (and its packed full of goodness), nothing overpowers this scent and it dominates the entire cream. That's a bonus as well.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

We have three vehicles at home and because of the constantly changing weather in the northwest, we have constantly changing tire pressure. Its' so simple and easy.  We don't have to worry about using the old fashioned one that doesn't read that accurately to begin with.  With this device, my husband has significantly cut down his time spent maintaining tires and airing them up.  We also go through less rubber because when you maintain correct pressure, you get the best possible wear out of your tires.  Why wear them out prematurely when you spend so much for them to begin with?  I also love the fact this gauge lets you easily read it in the dark. This Travelsafer Digital Tire Pressure Gauge is just a fantastic addition to our familys toolbox.I received this item at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

I have had a life long battle with Interstitial cystitis which gets worse with an acidic system. This book taught me so much about how to use fruit and vegetables to not only help my painful condition but also to aid in losing those stubborn pounds that have been hanging on forever! The recipes are delicious, I think my favorite is the Yummy Cucumber Pineapple, so refreshing and truly yummy!Great book, you don’t want to miss this one!  Highly recommend!

I can’t wait to read the next book and I highly recommend this one!

I am a side sleeper and never had a problem with them coming out at all as a few other reviewers stated.  They stay in all night and do exactly as they promised!  For the very first time in my life I am waking up well rested rather than feeling like I didn't sleep at all.  I used to have to nap several times a day to play catch up on the sleep I missed at night due to snoring but now I have energy like never before because I'm actually getting rest at night!  I love this product so much I'm buying another set just to have a back up because I never want to be with out them again.I am starting to believe I have Sleep Apnea but was never properly diagnosed. I ordered some Chamomile (found here: http://amzn.to/1EVyW6X) and Bergamot oils (found here: http://amzn.to/1EVyGEX) and love them both with this!  I choose the setting where the lights gradually change colors and the mister goes on and off for giving it a break every few minutes. I lay in bed, watching the colors change and taking in the aroma while listening to a meditation video online and before I know I am passed out and sleep like a baby. It also relaxes my two dogs like crazy!  This is the best little item I could have received and I highly recommend it!

As someone who works on my laptop full-time, if not longer, I am always on the lookout for products that will make my life easier, are quality, and will stand up the daily “beating” that I dish out while working.My computer is an established point but accessories, such as my mouse, are up to me to optimize and thanks to my Acctrend Wireless Mouse, I’ve been able to do just that. The problem with a smaller mouse is by the end of the day, I am barely able to move my hand; especially my fingers. The length of my Acctrend means I am able to work steady for over eight hours, get up, and go about my business with the use of my hand and fingers intact.I’ve been a huge fan of wireless mouse since they hit the market so for me, this is the only way to go. I work at home and on different surfaces every day. Be it from my desk, the kitchen table, couch, or bed I need something that will work with my schedule and location and a wireless mouse; especially one that works on any surface (like my Acctrend) is a must.The life expectancy of my new mouse is 8,000,000 clicks and I plan to put it to the test. I have no idea how many clicks I make a day but it is A LOT. I’ve gone through three mouse in the nearly 2 years I have been working at home and I am hoping my new Acctrend outlasts the others. Needless to say, I am in love and hope this little guy sticks with me through the years!Three things. First, the mouse takes 2 AAA which are not included. Third, I am NOT a gamer so I have no idea how the mouse would hold up for such purposes. I have been reinventing my love for cooking by trying to introduce new flavor profiles into our home. While this is easy and exciting on a multitude of levels; it can quickly become more difficult (at least for me) when I try to integrate ethnic foods that I am not familiar cooking.  I am decent when it comes to Italian food and I have a few Chinese recipes in my repertoire but my husband loves Mexican food so I need to up my game.Of course I am capable of cooking our rather “Americanized” version of things like tacos, a few sauces, and a few dips but when it comes to true Mexican cooking I admit that I need a hand and think I may have found the right one courtesy of this Mexican Slow Cooker Cookbook.Now, generally I prefer hardcover cookbooks because … well … that is what I grew up with BUT I was able to get this cookbook in the Kindle format. The first thing that I noticed that is different about this cookbook versus others in my collection is that it provides history on Mexican cooking. It gives information on foods, origins, uses, and provides a list of ingredients that are common in Mexican cuisine. I love this because it allows me to grocery shop early and have essentials on hand when I want to play around with a recipe to make it my own. After providing a wealth of knowledge, the book moves into the good stuff … RECIPES!First, the pictures are absolutely beautiful. We’re talking lick the page pretty and they make you want to eat the food. As someone who searches out recipes on the Internet almost daily, I can honestly say there are recipes that I have passed because the pictures don’t make the food look good. We eat with our eyes first and this cookbook definitely kept that in mind!As far as the recipes are concerned, I love that they offer something for everyone. Of course there are main dishes but they also provide recipes for soups, dips, and desserts. Um yeah, you have to check out the dessert section! Seriously, I can’t say enough about the recipes. Once you see the pictures you will completely understand.The other thing that I really like about this book is that it has a section that talks about the dos and don’ts when it comes to slow cooker cooking and how to handle your slow cooker. I am sad to say that I am breaking one of the rules as I type this. Last night I was tired and I put my slow cooker in the fridge knowing that I would change it out this morning … I didn’t. You aren’t supposed to store food in a slow cooker so that means I need to pitch the leftovers from last night. I seriously feel as though I learn something new every day when it comes to cooking!I know that I am rambling but this book has opened up a whole new world to me and not just in the realm of Mexican cooking. I now better understand how to handle my slow cooker too! This is a great read and one that I encourage you to add to your collection as well!Disclaimer: I received complimentary product to facilitate this review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I love to cook and I love to experiment with flavor profiles but when it comes to herbs and spices I get a little nervous. Why? Because seasoning foods is the easiest way to enhance a recipe or destroy it entirely. I’m often either too heavy handed when added spice/herbs or I don’t add enough and the food ends up tasting bland. Thanks to the Essential Spices and Herbs book, I am hoping this will no longer be a problem … at least after a short period of trial and error.What I love about this book is that it features 50 herbs and spices that the author finds essential for cooking. The author starts by explaining the difference between an herb and a spice and then she provides background information on each herb and spice and how they can be used to improve our lives and recipes. For me, this educational portion of the book was extremely helpful because it gives me a better feel for the flavor profile and what to expect from each addition.The book also contains recipes that are pictured beautifully and give a rustic feel. Then again when I think of herbs and spices I think rustic so I guess the two go hand in hand; at least for me!We have been working on cooking at home more often and whenever possible, cooking from scratch. My hope is that as we venture through the fall months and holiday season that we will put this book to good use and better understand a multitude of herbs and spices by the new year. I’m excited to share this book with my sister who went to culinary school and my husband can’t wait to try a few of the recipes listed, after visiting a local whole food grocer, this weekend! This is a great addition to our kitchen and is perfect for cooks that deem themselves beginners or advanced.Disclaimer: I received complimentary product to facilitate this review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I love cooking and do it as often as possible; however, how I cook varies based on the day. Like everyone, we have a very busy, on-the-go lifestyle during the week so I like simple. During the weekend I like to roll up my sleeves, break out all the pots and pans, and go to town. To please both needs, I have started preparing our weekly meals during the weekend, placing the ingredients in a container, and then keeping it simple during the week. My favorite is one pot meals or more specifically, crock pot meals. Using a crock pot allows me toss everything in one pot first thing in the morning, then I give it a mix, and head off for my day. Upon our return in the evening, dinner is either ready or just about ready and then we have time to relax as a family.The problem is I only own one crock pot so that limits me a bit … at least until now. We recently became the proud owners of a Crock-Pot Cook & Carry 6-Quart Manual Slow Cooker and we love it!After giving it a quick wash in warm soapy water yesterday morning, I added my ingredients to make a pot roast, gave it a couple of stirs, and then headed off for a day of work. By the time we arrived home we had time to change our clothes, get our little one a bath, run a load of laundry, and then sit down to eat. It was perfect!What I love about this crock pot is that it is larger than the one that I have owned for nearly 10 years. Now I am able to prepare larger meals, which is extremely helpful for nights when I have my mom over for dinner or my sister and brother, and I don’t feel like have to settle on smaller portion sizes. I also love the simplicity of this slow cooker. It doesn’t have fancy bells and whistles but I am okay with that. This Crock-Pot has four settings: Off, Low, High, and Warm. I turned my Crock-Pot on high, left for the day, and the meat was fork tender by the time we were ready to eat. In addition, I love that this crock pot comes with a lid-mounted locking system which will allow me to cook at home and then take the pot with me during the upcoming holiday months when we all bring something for the table.I didn’t put my hand on the outside of the pot to see how hot it was but I could feel the heat coming off of it as I was dishing out dinner. Seriously, I don’t recommend putting your hand on a stainless steel surface that is heated; you are just asking for problems. My 6-quart pot has the ability to serve at least 7 people, the interior pot is made of stoneware, and as an added bonus … it is dishwasher safe! I admit that I always wash my crock pot by hand and will likely continue to do so. Cleanup was easy and the pot looks like new after being washed.I haven’t found anything that I dislike about my Crock-Pot to date but we have only used it twice in the past week since we received it. If something changes, I will update my review.This is a must have item for any household!Disclaimer: I received complimentary product in exchange for an unbiased review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I have a love/hate relationship with sleep. I love to sleep but it has been difficult to find a pillow that is comfortable and holds its shape. This results in tossing and turning at night, punching my pillow, fluffing my pillow, and sometimes throwing it off the bed and sleeping on my arm.Over the years I have tried a variety of pillows made from different materials but I always end up back with my old trusty big and fluffy. Unfortunately, not all pillows are created equal a.k.a. they flatten in a matter of days and bye, bye Mr. Fluffy Pillow. I’ve been on the hunt for new pillows for a few weeks. I have been eyeballing the pillows from Exceptional Sheets but having a difficult time justifying the price. My husband put it this way … we have always had good luck with Exceptional Sheets and their products AND if these pillows hold up longer than others then we won’t be spending more money in the end because we will be repurchasing less frequently. Makes sense … click … purchase!Our new King Size Pillows arrived quickly and, as always, with a personalized note thanking us for our business. I opened the box and had them on our bed within a matter of minutes. Perfect size for our king size bed with a little extra pillow to spare; WIN! That night I could barely wait to go to bed and see if they held up to the ES standard that I have set over the years. I didn’t toss and turn and I didn’t spend half the night trying to fluff the pillow. In fact, I don’t remember waking up at all. That isn’t a big deal though because I am big on keeping things clean and plan on washing and drying my pillows; this will clean them and re-up the fluff factor!Overall, I am extremely pleased with our new pillows and now I go to bed ready to rest, not fluff. Once again, a great transaction with ES!Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I am new to the essential oils scene but after a few issues, I fell in love. A friend suggested that I purchase a diffuser to keep my home “oily” so I picked up a cheap unit, gave it a whirl, and received compliment after compliment about how amazing our home smells. Thanks to the oils that we use, it also helps keep this busy momma calm; which is definitely an added bonus!Now, while I love the first diffuser I purchased, I’m not IN love with it. Since I have been housing it in my family room, I have been looking for something more striking and found it!Enter the ZAQ Paradise Glass Litemist Aromatherapy Essential Oil Diffuser.Our new diffuser is beautiful and I have no problem with it being on display in the most commonly visited room in our house. I admit that I was shocked with how large it is, about the size of a small-medium sized pumpkin, but still love the unit. I especially love the color changing LED lighting. At night, I like to turn off all of the lights, snuggle up on the couch, and watch the diffuser; it’s definitely relaxing. There is a “favorite color” and no light mode as well but I like watching the shift. I also like that there is a large water chamber on this diffuser which allows it to run for a longer period of time. I can fill up the diffuser before I start dinner and it turns off right before bedtime, about 5 to 6 hours later. It just seems like a large amount to me. Perhaps I am doing something wrong or using the wrong oil? My sister has been all a tizzy about eating healthier since she found out she is pregnant. She decided that since I TRY to eat a healthier diet that this would be a great way for us to bond since I am attempting to re-up my efforts. Her husband brought home quinoa a couple of weeks ago and this “superfood” is all that I have been hearing about ever since. I admit that I have been avoiding the topic since I know nothing about quinoa but when your brother-in-law drops some off at the house and tells you to get cooking, that means it is time to learn. The best way to do that is with someone else’s recipes … at least to start.What I love about this cookbook is not only does it provide me with 150 Gluten-Free (a must have for me) recipes, it also gives me background on quinoa, the health benefits, and a ton of information on why I NEED this superfood in my daily life.More importantly, this cookbook shows me the diversity within this specific product. From breakfast foods to dinner, smoothies, and even desserts, quinoa can become a part of every meal offering a different taste and texture while providing the same benefits. Did I mention there is a slow cooker recipe? I love this because it allows me to get my side dish ready early in the afternoon while I debate what our main course is going to be. This doesn’t leave me grabbing for less healthier options when I am rushing to finalize dinner and get the meal on the table. Hmm, did I mention desserts too?I love the tips attached to a number of the recipes, the “resources” section which provides additional outlets to obtain more recipes, and the conversion tables and glossary; which this new quinoa-ian (I totally just made that up) found very useful.This cookbook is a great resource and I’m thrilled to have added quinoa to our meal planning!Disclaimer: I received this book for free in exchange for an unbiased review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

Per my doctor’s request, I try to follow a low-carb, high protein lifestyle. The problem with this is there is only so much “meat and cheese” that an individual can handle before they start craving carbs; at least, that is what happens to me. Thankfully, Jennifer Koslo’s cookbook covers the cravings and much, much more in a carb friendly way!“Low-Carb Cravings Cookbook: Your Favorite Foods Made Low-Carb” covers just about everyone. Specifically: breakfast, sides, snacks, soups (stews and chilies), sandwiches and wraps, pizzas and pastas (yes, you read that right), desserts and more. In other words, she has created recipes that will not only keep the entire family fed but also healthier and perhaps even happier. We’re talking Cheese Sticks with Marinara, Bacon Cheeseburgers, Chili Dogs, Fettuccine Alfredo, Peanut Butter Cups, and even Ice Cream! Are you drooling? Yeah, I understand!What I love about this cookbook is Koslo introduces well-known foods, foods that we all love to indulge in, in a healthier way. I love that the recipes are family friendly so I don’t feel like I will have to beg my 5-year-old to eat “diet” food and I don’t have to stare my husband down and tell him to “enjoy” a tasteless plate in an effort to create a good example. These are awesome recipes for things that we already love to eat.Koslo’s cookbook also takes a more realistic approach which I love. She clearly states that the best way to satisfy a craving is to give in a little. She notes that it is all about moderation and choices. This is the right way to look at things. We can still enjoy things, just in moderation. As someone that has problems with gluten, I also like that the book offers gluten-free, vegetarian, and dairy-free options. In other words, this cookbook has something for everyone and that is a must have in my world.If there is one negative, I would say the book is a bit longer/wordier than it needs to be. You are likely thinking the same about me right now! If you are looking for a straightforward cookbook then this may not be the cookbook for you. Koslo includes “educational” portions in the book before ever reaching the recipe section. I really liked this but can see how others may not. Personally, I like that she gives tips, breaks down ingredients, discusses spices, and gives me more to think about in the realm of food and choices! Again, this is just me and may not be for everyone.Overall, if you are interested in following a low-carb diet and would like to get your family, including pickier eaters, to jump on the bandwagon, this book is a great place to start!Disclaimer: I received this book for free in exchange for an unbiased review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

Now that summer is winding down and school is back in session I knew I was going to need something to keep me on track when it comes to staying on the move. My sister is a huge advocate of Fitbit so I figured I would give one a try as well. I’m not a huge fan of wearing anything on my wrists so I opted for the Zip which hooks on to an article of clothing.What I love about my Zip is that it isn’t intrusive. I clip it to my pants and head out for a walk, evening out, or trip to the park and nobody is the wiser. It keeps track of my steps, the distance, and the numbers of calories burned. I also like that I am able to sync it to my smartphone so I can keep better track of what I’m actually doing and where I need to improve. As an added bonus, I love that there are tools that allow me to log my food intake, workouts, and any weight loss so I can make note of trends. This allows me to make the best choices about not only my workout routines but eating habits.Unfortunately, there are a couple of negatives. First, the Zip is almost too small. There have been a few occasions when I have changed my clothes and forgot about the Zip entirely. This resulted in my freaking out thinking I washed it but so far, I have been lucky and found it in my laundry hamper. The wrist Fitbit may be more realistic for me. Second, I have noticed that there are times when my Zip tracks steps when I am sitting in a car. It is detecting movement and logging it; unfortunately, it isn’t the right kind of movement. This could really throw off my numbers, targets, and tracking. Third, my Zip has fallen off my clip and I’ve almost lost it. I’ve actually defaulted to sliding the Zip inside my pocket which is not what I was hoping for. I like the clipping concept which is why I bought this specific Fitbit to begin with. The Zip is sweat, rain, and splash proof; however, it isn’t “don’t get lost” proof. If I drop my Zip at the park, in the middle of the grocery store, or when I am climbing Kilimanjaro (okay, that isn’t really going to happen), I am kinda SOL and that defeats the purpose. I think some design tweaks are needed but that is just me.Overall, I still really like my Fitbit and the concept behind it, I am just not certain this is the right one for me.Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

Mosquito bites are annoying and unfortunately, it is the perfect time of year for them. My most recent experience with them was at my daughter’s first soccer practice of the season. I arrived home with 9 fresh bites and 3 of them were on my head. It was then and there that I decided that I was going to have to fight back or succumb to the idea that I was going to be local mosquitoes’ appetizer for the season. I decided to fight back with Premium Mosquito Repellent Bracelets from Cravengreens.When the package arrived, the first thing that I noticed is that it is simple yet adequate. Each order contains 10 individually packaged bracelets, in a variety of 5 colors, and arrives in a large zipper bag. Each bracelet is housed in a re-sealable pack which is important as the “life” of one bracelet is 250 hours (nearly 11 days). I like the re-sealable packaging as it allows the bracelet to hold its effectiveness when not in use and it makes it easy for me to leave the bracelet in my car and keep track of it between practices and games.My daughter selected my color for the night (purple), I took it to the field with me, opened it up, and slid the bracelet on my wrist before even getting out of the car. The first thing that I noticed was I did not spend the entire practice swatting away and smacking at bugs; I was actually able to watch my little one practice. I admit that as I sat there I was a bit worried and wondered if maybe I should have worn one on my ankle as well; as the packaging does not indicate the circumference of protection. I didn’t feel as though I was being eaten alive while on the field so I had hope. I’m pleased to share that I arrived home with one bug bite. I’m embarrassed to share that it was on my bottom; a place that the bracelet couldn’t possibly protect as I was sitting on it. That means that the bracelet was able to protect my 5 ft. 4 inch circumference with ease. Hey, I can’t fault the bracelet for not protecting my bum … it did its duty!I find it important to note that I have extremely sensitive skin so I was a little leery and concerned about wearing the bracelet to begin with. I feared that it would cause itching, agitation, swelling, or even a rash of sorts. IT DIDN’T! The bracelet isn’t covered with liquids or DEET. It isn’t messy or sticky and I didn’t feel as though I was sitting inhaling chemicals throughout my daughter’s practice. Does the bracelet smell at all? Yes! I actually held it up to my nose when I pulled it out of the package and smelled a little repellent but that was it. I had to search for the “smell” in order to find it. That’s a win!I don’t know exactly why it works or how but it does. I’m thankful to have 9 unopened packages and a bracelet to wear a few more times before breaking in to the next 9. I also plan on ordering more! ;) This is a great product.Disclaimer: I received complimentary product in exchange for an unbiased review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I already knew that probiotics are linked to decreased Yeast and Urinary Tract Infections but what I learned more recently is that probiotics are able to help in other ways. Taking two pills can benefit women. For me, these benefits alone are enough to have me hooked and vested in continuing to take a probiotic daily. BUT here are other reasons why they are great for any woman’s daily regimen. Probiotics have been shown to: reduce allergies, lower cholesterol, reduce diarrhea, reduce chronic bad breath, and reduce tooth decay. Mothers that take probiotics during pregnancy and while breast-feeding have found that it reduces colic and alleviates bloating, constipation, and gas in their babies; I’ll keep this in mind if we are lucky enough to have another baby.A daily dose of Number One Nutrition Advanced Probiotic consists of two pills. The pills aren’t small (a picture is included); however, I find them easy to swallow and they are a lot smaller than the multivitamins that I take daily. If you have difficulty taking pills, this may not be the supplement for you. The probiotic does not result in abdominal discomfort; which is good since part of their job is to aid in such occurrences. Due to the type of capsule this is, it does NOT start dissolving as soon as it hits your tongue which is great.The bottle says the product may be kept refrigerated to maximize shelf-life and potency; however, if you take the recommended dose daily that should not be necessary as this is a one month supply. At $19.99 for 60 capsules I think this is a great value for the product.Due to my past experience with Number One Nutrition and my current experience with the Advanced Probiotic I am comfortable in recommending this to anyone who is looking to achieve “gut health” and bring “balance” to other areas of their life.Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate to facilitate this review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own. Please note that I am not a medical professional, as with any medication or supplement it is recommended that you consult your doctor and use as directed.

If we were to use this backpack for school it would be perfect for a folder and notebook; all “book sized” items. The next zipper compartment down in size is suitable to hold her iPad mini. What I love about this compartment is that this is where the Frozen family is highlighted with a picture of Elsa, Anna, Kristoff, Sven, and Olaf and it is “puffy” which will hopefully provide a bit of added protection when my little one bounces it around. The third zipper compartment is for carrying colored pencils, pencils, pens, erasers, and I am sure a few other trinkets that she will gather along the way while packing up. There is then a compartment that consists of netting to hold a water bottle or another form of drink and finally a compartment that has a fold over closure with Velcro that can be used to hold a small snack.The backpack is well made from a heavy canvas and after inspection I am able to confirm that it has great stitching. The detail is fantastic including a raised/sewn on pink flower. My daughter loves vibrant colors that are definitely ‘girly girl’ and the addition of the sparkly blue overtones around the zippered compartment areas. Her absolute favorite though is the eye catching main picture of the Frozen family. What I love about this backpack is the wide, adjustable straps that will allow the backpack to grow with her over the years while still providing comfort during wear.In other words, the backpack is perfect and we all love it. As for my little one, she can’t wait to pack it up for our trip and has been “practicing” every night. Two thumbs up from our house.Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate to facilitate this review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

This is my first time trying Organic Matcha and I have to admit, I have been really nervous about it. The tea that I drink normally comes out of a tea bag or bottle so the thought of a tea in powder from that I can mix into smoothies, cookies, cakes, ice cream, and other recipes make me a little nervous. In my world, tea is just tea and now it is green, powdery, and complicated.After reading the front and back of the bag and trying to figure out why anyone would add tea to their cookies I opened up the bag and inhaled deeply. I know this will be shocking but it smells like tea. It has an earthy aroma and I really like it. The powder is fine and an absolutely beautiful emerald green color. In other words, the Organic Matcha Green Tea Powder that I received consists of green tea leaves that have been milled into a powdered form. It’s beautiful, smells like tea, and the bag was already open so I figured it was time indulge my curiosity.Before I tried anything, two people told me that when it comes to Matcha Tea, less is more. I kind of shrugged my shoulders at this, having no idea what they were talking about, and even commented that I prefer my tea strong. Famous last words, right? Clearly I was the one that I had no idea what I was talking about as I added a heaping scoop to a morning smoothie, took a big drink, and literally spit it out in the sink because it was way too bitter. Don’t fret, I lessened the amount, a great deal, the second time around and all was well. I could still taste the tea in the background and it added a touch of bitterness but it wasn’t overpowering and I actually liked it.Here is what I can tell you. As I was informed, less is definitely more when it comes to Matcha Green Tea. The bag that I received for review is 4 oz which I originally thought was a bit small for the money; however, I have since changed my mind. With the amount of product I will use each time, this bag will last me for a lengthy period of time which makes the price more than competitive. The packaging indicates that the recommended daily dose is 1 teaspoon once or twice a day.The product comes in an easy to reseal bag; however, I suggest keeping it in an airtight container. Why? There are two reasons. First, I am not a huge fan of products in bags that reseal as the seal often fails and I keep my tea bags in an air tight canister so it was a natural progression for me to place my Matcha Tea in an airtight canister. The packaging says the product should be stored in a cool, dry place away from heat. For it to last 12 months, it should be stored properly at room temperature and for 18 months if kept under cold storage.Now, down to the details, if you do not like tea … this product is not for you. In all actuality, even if you like tea, this product may not be for you. Organic Matcha is a concentrated formula and that is why I mentioned earlier that a little goes a long way. This is not a sweet product and has undertones of bitterness and that is why you should start with less and add more to taste. I recommend using a blender, frother, mixer, etc… when working with this product as a spoon may not fully incorporate the power into the other ingredients in your food or drink. Last but not least, have fun with it! As with anything, there are going to be things that we do and do not like. The only way to know what we enjoy is to put ourselves out there and try new things. That is what I did and even thought I started by spitting in the sink, I ended up really enjoying this new introduction.Are you interested in trying Organic Matcha Green Tea but nervous about what to do with the product once it arrives? No worries, a recipe eBook containing 50 recipes is included free with every purchase, and emailed after purchase, courtesy of uVernal.I have been experimenting with my Matcha Green Tea Powder for about a week and while I have not noticed a change in my memory, I have noticed that my energy is on point, and I am more willing to get up and go; especially outside, in the morning. The energy boost alone is enough reason for me to continue adding this product to smoothies but the other potential benefits such as a metabolism stimulant and fat blockers makes this a must have in my pantry; especially during the spring and summer months.Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I love that my Moroccan Argan Oil is multifunctional!First, my hair! I have thick, combination hair that is naturally wavy/curly. Sounds great, right? It is but since I have combination hair I have to be careful about the products that I use or my hair will look oil a few hours after washing it. In the same respect, if I don’t use product, my curls can frizz and make my hair look atrocious. I don’t use my Argan Oil on my hair daily; however, there are days that absolutely call for it. The past two days are great examples as it has been rainy which causes my hair to curl more and inevitably frizz more. On days like this or days when my hair is being unruly, I spritz some Argan Oil on and gently run my fingers through my hair. This adds a little extra bounce to my curl, keeps the frizz at bay, and leaves my hair feeling soft, and smelling great without unnecessary chemicals.Second, my skin! This two involves the world combination. I definitely have combination skin and the funny part about that is different parts of my body have different types of skin. It is important to note that I also have extremely sensitive skin. The real “combination” part applies to my face. Depending on the day, hour, minute, I can have dry skin, oily skin, red skin … you name it and I have had it. Then, there are parts of my body that are dry. Argan Oil is used as an anti-aging product; however, it is so much more. I have been applying the Argan Oil to the dry zones of my body and have noticed that the area is starting to look and feel a bit more supple. Is this an overnight fix? No, nothing in life really is but the essential fatty acids within the oil work to repair and my hope is that is exactly what it will do. Until then, I will enjoy the feel of the oil on my skin, the feeling that is left behind as I feel softer and more feminine, and the pleasant scent is an added bonus.Treat your hair and skin in the comfort of your home. Two big benefits in one little bottle.Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate to facilitate this review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I have really gotten into makeup over the last 3 or 4 years. What I mean by that is, more than just foundation and powder. I have worked with blending shades; I even figured out that I wear two different shades of foundation and I have pink undertones. Crazy, I know! One of the things that I strive to better is blending. I started out by using my fingers but quickly realized that not only does it not really even out the tones but it seems to take forever and it is bad for your skin. I then went to those cheap foam things that look like a mini bike ramp. The problem with the mini ramps is that I feel like I lose a lot of my products and I can’t figure out how to actually clean them. So, I changed my tactic and went with brushes. I like the brushes, I really do, but I literally feel as though I am painting my makeup on. Yeah, end in the end I am really not as big of a fan as I thought that I was. A few people have mentioned using a makeup blender sponge so I figured I would give them a try. They all really seem to like them and they love that you simply rinse them out between uses and let them dry. Read that to mean, you rinse it in water, squeeze it gently to get the water out, and then store the sponge in a cool, dry place. Sounds pretty simple, easy cleanup, I’m definitely game.I was recently introduced to the Beautyfullness Makeup Blender Sponge and I absolutely LOVE it. This is a non-streaking makeup application sponge that allows me to blend my bronzers, powders, and foundations so I am able to achieve a more evenly distributed and natural look. With the makeup sponge I am able to get in the crease of my nose and right to my hair line, without caking it into the crease as well as all over my hair. What’s even better is it is made of a non-latex, anti microbial foam, which is great for me since I have sensitive skin and have the comfort of knowing that my makeup sponge does not contain anything that will agitate my skin or get hidden and irritate it later on.Since I am kind of strange when it comes to my makeup products, I wasn’t a huge fan of the color of my Beautyfullness Makeup Blender Sponge when I first opened the box. My initial thought was that the sponge looked a little bland but I then quickly reminded myself that there are no added chemicals to bother my skin so I’ll give the color a pass.A product that is packaged simply, user friendly, and at a great price point is a definite win in my book. You can’t go wrong trying the Beautyfullness Makeup Blender Sponge!Disclaimer: I received this product at a discounted rate in exchange for an honest review. Regardless, all opinions expressed are still 100% my own.

I'm usually a sucker for time-travel stories, and was very into dinosaurs back about 1971, but I can't say this book is any better than "OK."Before ordering this book, I had understood the author wrote a previous book titled "Chronal Engine" but I did not know that this was a sequel to it. That became more apparent as I read into it, and I kept wondering how much I had missed.The book is super-heavy with Latin or whatever scientific names for a zillion dinosaurs. These names mean absolutely nothing to me, so they only tended to trip up the story.The story is told in alternating viewpoints, part is first-person style for one of the characters, and part is third-person following a different character. I never saw a book written this way, and it seemed a bit odd. Why not two first-person perspectives?When two generations of youthful family members meet together in the prehistoric past, talk about "Dad" and "Grampa" and "Great-grampa" starts getting mighty confusing. In fact I'm quite sure even the author was mixed up at one or two points, at least in my advanced copy.The characters seemed to blurt out oblique lines every so often, leaving me unsure if the conversation was somehow over my head or just redundant to what had just already been said.Warning: possible minor spoilers ahead.If a 25-foot-long critter like is pictured on the book cover once gets ahold of your leg while you are swimming, I'm skeptical that a swift kick from your free foot is going to send it fleeing the area.It is my understanding that one of the characters purposely hid a time-travel device for a couple of the other characters to find so they would unwittingly be transported back in time. Then later that same character warns the father of these two unfortunates that he needs to provide his kids with a time-travel device to allow them to return. Why the father was not simply warned about the first time-travel device and how to safely disarm it -- thereby preventing the whole problem before it started -- was never made clear to me.One of the characters is torn about telling another one about his future. What he finally does seems like the worst possible thing he could have done.Ah, then we have the obligatory girl with a bow and arrows.Well there was quite a bit of adventure in this book, but in my opinion too much of the story did not make sense. I sorta liked the characters, yet never really felt like I knew them.

This stapler staples fine using some generic standard staples I've had kicking around in my desk for years. The upper body seems to be formed sheet steel, while the base is probably die-cast zinc alloy. I had no problems stapling through some thin 75-page tool catalogs I had laying around. I suppose there must be NFL licensing fees to pay, but the price is pretty high for a stapler and as another reviewer said I don't think the decals will last forever. It is good I guess if you are a football fan, but honestly I hate sports and would no way pay so much for this stapler myself.

Like other Vine reviewers, I only received one beef stick and one honey/brown sugar turkey stick. I guess our time is not worth much.The beef stick tastes just like summer sausage to me. That is not actually a bad thing; I sometimes (usually around Christmas) spend money to buy summer sausage to eat on crackers with smoked cheese. But frankly, as a snack stick to be eaten bare, this cannot compare to much tastier products such as Jack Link's Hot Squatch sticks, or the good old Slim Jims. If I'm going to eat something this unhealthy and this expensive, I want a more special/intense taste experience.The turkey stick actually appealed to me more, though hovering somewhere between ham and hot dog in flavor.
These pants seem good quality to me, nice comfortable fabric well stitched and no defects that I could notice. May fit slightly tight in the waist, but it is probably just me getting fatter.

These taste great. I just compared this "hot" stick side-by-side with a couple regular-flavor Slim Jim sticks, and while this one is at about the maximum heat level I'd consider enjoyable it definitely tasted better. I could not notice any significant difference in texture; both types were pleasantly greasy. These Squatch sticks have got it all... saturated fat, cholesterol, salt, sodium nitrite... it's the perfect snack!

Wow, my feeling is really split about this one. It is colorful and musical and nice to touch, easily capturing the attention of our 8-month-old son. Our 3-year-old daughter loves it even more and has been watching the Dora and Diego cartoons so I think she can grasp that other languages besides English do exist. The problem is keeping this thing clean. We have a dog and two teenagers in the house, so the floors are pretty yucky. Our young daughter is not too fussy about what she touches or where she puts things. This toy is a natural dust mop, picking up dog hair and every type of dirt, yet due to the electronics inside your options for cleaning are pretty limited and ineffective. Then our baby boy wants to put every part of it in his slobbery little mouth, ingesting who-knows-what-kind of germs. In fact I was not going to bring this thing into our home initially, but my wife twisted my arm about it. The best compromise we have figured out is to strictly limit it to the crib where both little ones sometimes sleep. But then you know it is going to get tossed over the side sometimes.Well the thing has the heart button and buttons in each hand that each play 3 or 4 different tunes or whatever. Also one foot has a button that seems limited to giggling only. It is cute, it works great, the kids love it, but oh the cleaning issue!

I got my first Chromebook about a year ago, the Acer CB3-111-C670 which is currently the #1 selling laptop here on Amazon. And it ought to be. So sick of Windows computers taking forever to boot up, Windows computers getting hung up by viruses and whatnot, Windows computers slowing down to sub-snail speed after a couple years of use, I was absolutely stunned how quickly the Chromebook fired up and got down to business. Also the touchpad works far better than any touchpad I'd ever used before, not leaving me missing a mouse very much at all. And the battery life is mind boggling. Over the last year that Chromebook has been my go-to machine for checking email, for checking the weather, and for watching and bidding on eBay auctions in particular. Our 3-year-old daughter also thinks it is hers, carries it around the house a lot, and it has frequently been a lifesaver by keeping her busy watching cartoons while in hospital and dentist waiting rooms. My wife and older daughters also use it a lot, and -- no joke -- it has become the most beloved computer I or my family have ever owned. I have seen those Acers selling for between $150 and $170 in the last few months, and in my opinion they are a fantastic deal at those prices.So, here we have this Toshiba Chromebook 2, which costs a great deal more... currently $430. What does it offer for that higher price?The weakest spot on the "old" Acer is the screen clarity. It is not at all blurry, but just seems like there is thin fog between you and the image, paling things slightly. Viewing angle on the Acer is also very critical. Probably more critical than any other computer I ever used. Well this Toshiba has a really great screen, close if not equal to the screen on my teenage daughter's late-model iPod Touch. Colors are brilliant and vivid, text is sharp and clear, and viewing angle is not at all critical. The 13.3 inch Toshiba screen is also bigger than the 11.6 inch Acer screen, obviously.The Acer has very good speakers. This Toshiba has GREAT speakers... easily the best of any laptop I've ever tried. The sound just seems to rise out of the keyboard, bounce off the screen, and reach your ears in superb form.The only "bad" thing about this Toshiba is the lit keyboard buttons. The buttons on my specimen are lit so dimly that at first I did not think there was any light coming through the buttons at all, and only light leakage around the bottoms of the buttons. When viewing a bright screen the light through the buttons is both drowned out and rendered unnecessary by the light from the viewscreen. Eventually, by shading the buttons from the screen light, I realized they really were lit. Personally I would trade this lit feature to save power and get longer battery life, but hopefully the letter and number markings pass completely through the keys and will at least ensure that the markings do not wear off as eventually happens on all my other keyboards.I personally live on a tight budget. As a Vine member, Amazon sometimes sends me over-priced dog food for my dog to test, and I never can give it 5 stars no matter how pure or healthy it is claimed to be, if it costs twice as much as my regular satisfactory dog food. In this case I'm making an exception to that policy. No way around it, this Toshiba costs WAY more money than the well-proven Acer. But here you are getting something significantly and visibly better for that money, so if you can afford it and want a really great Chromebook then I whole-heartedly recommend this Toshiba Chromebook 2. It is all that my Acer is, plus much more.

There is lots to look at and do with this toy. This is something that both our 3-year-old and our 9-month-old can enjoy. Overall it seems pretty durable, though I am slightly concerned cranking on the trunk (as opposed to pulling it straight off) might break something inside the elephant.

This is a good simple toy. Our daughter went through a phase where she liked to put things one-by-one into and out of containers, and I think the slotted top for the bucket will encourage that. The printed card faces are stickers, but the stickers are applied into a recessed area so I think the edges will be protected somewhat and not so likely to peel up so soon. Flash cards of any type are a great educational way for parents to interact with young children, and I do want my kids to grow up feeling comfortable with people of different cultures and languages. Obviously the scope of this little set is limited, but it is an appropriate starting point.The one big problem about this set for me is, I do not know the proper pronunciations of the Spanish words printed on the cards. If only they included a battery-powered super computer that would pronounce either English or Spanish depending on which end of the card I swiped. Ah, well.

Wow. About the only bad thing I can say about this book is that you'd have to be a real maple fanatic to ever get through even half the recipes, there are just so many. I myself have spent many an hour feeding wood to improvised sap-boiling setups, but this book takes interest in maple syrup to a whole different level. It includes lots of great photos. I've sometimes given either home-made or store-bought maple syrup to friends who live in southern areas. This book would be a good thing to give along with syrup in such situations.

I had a low-end metal detector when I was a kid in the late 1970's. It probably cost the equivalent of $250 or more in today's dollars, it ate batteries like crazy, and the knobs needed constant re-tuning as the stone aged circuitry warmed up. I found quite a few rusty horseshoes around my grandpa's farm, and lots of bottle caps and pull tabs, but never anything of real value or interest.
