Distress paint is very fluid and reacts with water (while the paint is still wet) much like the distress inks. This pumice stone paint is the same color as the pumice stone distress ink pads.I highly suggest going to YouTube and seeing all the awesome things that you can do with this paint, and more of how it is different than other acrylic paints.Pro Tip:Play around with using Dylusions Ink Sprays with distress paints!

I use hemp cord for a lot of different things.  Why I chose this package of hemp cord is because it has the different sizes (thickness).  Hemp cord in general holds up to a lot of abuse, and this product is no different.  If you're looking for hemp cord in different sizes, then buy this one.

Dyan Reaveley came out with this journal block to fit her large couture stamps Ranger Dyan Reaveley's Dylusions Couture Clear Stamps, 9 by 5-Inch, Walk In The Park . She also wanted something different to set her block apart from the rest, so she added that really cool wavy design.  I highly suggest searching on YouTube for "Dyan Journal Block" and see all the different things that you can do with this block.  There is also a ruler on the straight side.  I have dropped, clotheslined, stepped on this journal block and it's held up to everything.  I drop things like it's my job, I'm a colossal klutz. I'm really happy with not only the sturdiness, but that I can hold the block better in my hands versus a regular block.Pro Tip:There's two holes at the top that are in the same position as her stamps.  What I do is use two rings to keep all of my Dylusions stamps together and add this block to that so I always know where it is.Sometimes, using her alphabet stamps (Ranger Dyan Reaveley's Dylusions Cling Stamp Collections 8.5 by 7-Inch, Dy's Alphabet ) , I choose the wavy part to put the letters on so they create a little bit of interest instead of them being in a straight line.

The pen is awesome. I like to write smallish so I really love this. Actually, these pens are one of my favorite pens and I have somewhere up in the 150 pen range. The glue stick is okay, but it's worth noting that it's best with just paper. It does dry clear.  What I end up using is my Scotch 085 ATG  Acid Free Advanced Tape Glider, 1/4-Inch by 36-Yard, Pinkinstead of the glue stick. This pen has a felt tip and writes beautifully. The pink isn't like pastel... I would say it's somewhere in between. It's mostly opaque. I've had it for a year, and hadn't used it in a good 6 months and it still wrote awesome.Pro Tip:-Store it at its side when not in use,-It goes without saying that put the cap back on immediately after use.

My dog Pia LOVES salmon treats. They are her favorite. These are soft, and they're the perfect size for training treats.  These treats are used as a "high value" treat in my house. Ingredients are very, very important when it comes to giving my dog anything. No meat by-products, no fillers, and real salmon. Zukes mini naturals also come in peanut flavor, and Pia loves peanut butter!Just like in real people food, there are tons of labels which tout being natural when they're not really healthy at all. Same for our four legged best friends. Read the ingredients on things for both you and your canine companion to help you both stay healthy.Pro Tip:-To keep the treats soft, there is a reclosable zip lock type of deal so make sure that the treat bag is fully zipped closed.

Some of these 5 star reviews are suspect. I highly recommend you read up on how to tell a review is fake. It can help.I got a facial at a spa and my esthetician recommended this to use a few times a week. I'm 26 and have had moderate to severe acne for about 14 years. I have ugly scars on my face and body (and I used to be a model). My skin is trashed. It's been a constant battle. Nothing works long term, and believe me I tried just about anything. I've even tried antibiotics...everything short of Accutane. Let's just say I'm not the ideal candidate for Accutane.I desperately needed something that,A) took away as much dead, flaky skin as possible without leaving horrid rednessB) Would leave no residueC) Wouldn't cause my skin to over-produce oil in less than 12 hours (aka be greasier)And this does all of it. To thoroughly get the dead and flaky skin off of my face (including the flaky skin on blemishes),  I wet my face with just a little bit of water. Then I use as much of the scrub I need to cover my face and work it in. I use a circular motion. I rub it in until the "grit" feels dry-ish on my skin, and if there are still some flakes, I'll wet my fingers and continue with the circular motion. And I do all of this gently and without pressure. I let the scrub do its work. After I am satisfied, I just rinse it off while continuing to do the light, circular motions. I'm always turned off by the "use this product for 1 minute, 2 minutes" ect but my skin is worth the extra few minutes to my routine.This isn't a magic bullet. It doesn't solve the problem, but it does help significantly.  I'm one of those people where nothing is "magic bullet", there aren't even two "magic bullets". This has earned a permanent place in my shower.P.S. As a woman, I highly recommend being open minded and not let something marketed to men close windows for you.

EDIT:12/10/2014I found something that DOES show through the paper in this notebook. The stamp pads in the colors Ranger AIP-30461 Archival Inkpad, Vermillion and Ranger AIP-30638 Archival Inkpad, Rose Madder both products from Ranger. The Ranger AIP-31468 Archival Inkpad, Jet Black did not show through. You can see it plain as day on the back of the page. My original review still stands. I even re-tested those things that I listed before, and the results are still the same. So I guess this is a "mostly no show thru" notebook.My Original Review:There's a lot of hype surrounding this and they've done a excellent job promoting these sketchbooks at some art shows, so I was excited to get this.  After I started my testing, I couldn't remember why I was excited in the first place.Here's my breakdown:These feather:-Pigma Microns (ALL of them, and by all I mean ALL that are currently on the market right now)-Sharpies, Ultra Fine Point and Fine Point (which usually feather)-Sharpie Metallics (actually the paper leaves this gross halo around them)-Pilot Varsity Fountain pens- Distress marker; Fine tip and brush tip-Zig-Dylusions just spread across the paper, soaking in, no control over itGelly Roll pens do not, and did not, feather, but as far as the Glaze and Souffle go it just soaked right into the paper and gives no raised effect at all. The Gelly Roll Moonlight pens spread out more on the paper than they do most others.My bottom line:It does as advertised for what I tested it with; there is zero bleedthrough and no shadowing even when held up to sunlight.I can't use this notebook. I have no control over where things feather. I can't draw anything from any of my utensils (unless it's pencil, at least that doesn't feather) because it turns out to be something that looks like I drew it on the crappiest copy paper and drooled on it before any of the above medium dries. This sketchbook is unusable. Nice to know I paid good money for a blank  book that will sit around unused.

UPDATE (November 13th, 2015):I still use and love this case. The leather is still soft, albeit a little scratched and a few worn spots. Only minor cosmetic wear and tear. I use this daily, and has been living on my couch since purchased. I have two dogs so you can imagine couch living with dogs.I am going to list what this case has been though:Hot pizza boxes, ricocheting 10 lb. dogs, drops to the floor, spilled on, condensating 2 liters of pop, and scratches.The stitching throughout has not moved, shifted, or loosened.The zippers and the zipper snaps are still in perfect condition; the zippers themselves are a little worn. Just a little though.My Pigma Microns, Jelly Roll, and pencil still fit perfectly and hasn't stretched out, plus I have 2 Microns per loop. I have the entire collection of Pigma Micron pens, Sakura 50050 59-Piece Pigma Ink Artist's Gift Set  To be honest, I didn't know how much abuse that this case could take since the leather was so soft and so nice to the touch. I am pleasantly surprised at how much abuse this case has put up with.Original Review from April 9th 2014:I asked questions to the owners on of many pencil cases here on Amazon about how well Pigma Microns fit in the case. Pretty much every pencil case fits Pigma Micron pens. This case comfortably fits 64 of my writing utensils (mostly Microns), and I try to leave one loop between each size tip for quicker selection. I really like that I can set this case up vertically, and stabley.This case is really nice. Kinda like 4 star hotel nice. The outside of the case is very soft, which was kinda a concern for me because I have two small dogs and I do my drawing and "art-ing" (that's right, I made it a verb) out in the living room; the case is normally on the couch. I've had this case on my couch for about 3 weeks now, and so far, so good. There are some little scratch marks on it but there really aren't any hardcore blemishes from it. The stitching is high quality, as are the zippers. The inside of the case is also very soft and reflects the high quality seen on the outside of the case.I make my own notebooks, and my  roughly 5.5" x 7" notebook with a 1 inch diameter binding coil with 40-50 pieces of 300 series smooth Bristol paper fits great in one side if there are no utensils in it. This case is really well made. I wouldn't really consider taking this out with me unless I'm going somewhere to DO drawing for two reasons. One: Afraid of all of the random crap that could happen to the smooth leather, and Two: it's on the big side. I carry a huge purse that my husband has nicknamed "the Tardis" (which I can now justify since I live in the Bay area, where re-usable bags are a necessity unless you want to pay 10 cents per paper bag) and this case wouldn't be easy to carry both weight wise and size wise.Pro Tip:- There isn't a special place for a pencil sharpener, so I have a small jewelry bag that I put the sharpener in (so the pencil sharpener debris doesn't infect everything it touches) and I place it where an unoccupied loop is and just shut the case. Same for my eraser. Caution while opening the case.-Keep drinks and other wet things away from the case. It will most likely stain. I spill things constantly, so that is why I keep it on my couch-Waterbrushes will not fit- Gelly Roll pens can fit 2 per loop- The loops do loosen up over time-The graphite from the pencils will mark up the inside of the case where the pencils are.

If you have an insatiable love affair of pens like I do, it's really, really hard to get this set out of your head. Can you hear it whispering your name?After I purchased my first set of Pigma Microns, Sakura 30062 6-Piece Pigma Micron Ink Pen Set, Black I fell in love with them and wanted more. So I purchased Sakura 30063 6-Piece Pigma Micron Assorted Colors 01 Ink Pen Set.  Then Sakura 38062 8-Piece Pigma Assorted Colors Brush Pen Set. When I came across this 59 piece set, I viewed it as Pigma Micron nirvana. These pens are great. They all came brand new, none of the pens were dry (I tested each one). In this set, all of the pens are the same quality that you would get in a blister package. They write smooth, don't skip, enough ink flow to the tip, but not so much that it pools and gets all yuckie and stuff, and doesn't get dry while you're writing or drawing. The colored pens are the same awesome quality of it's black ink pens. Quick Pro Tip: Don't press hard on the tip while you're writing or drawing. You don't need to. These aren't too  delicate, but if you put too much pressure at the right angle, that is the angle your tip is going to go to and might fray just a tiny bit. The pen may not produce the same tip size as it originally did. I've always been a bit heavy handed, and I learned this lesson the hard way.It is a big chunk of change to spend on a set of pens. There really isn't a concrete way of doing the math to decide how much savings you would have versus buying sets individually; sets come in different pen amounts, tip sizes, for different prices, and depending on where you get them from. I believe that there are worthwhile savings to be had getting them all at once like this. There may be pens that you can't get ahold of that are in this set. So it may look like a lot to spend on pens, but think about the savings. You are now totally justified in treating yourself to Micron heaven!The one hinderance of getting this set is that I already have some of the pens (which I shared above),. but now I have some back-ups. It's not like I have a significant enough amount of the collection before, so the doubles are minimal.On the back of the label you see in this picture that is inside of the case, there are circles in which you can do your own pen swatches for each color and nib size. Brilliant. The case that it comes in is alright, but I ended up putting them into my Leather Panel Style 120 Pencil Case Brown which I have reviewed and posted pictures of it (with my Microns in it) in that review.To the person who answered the question about what actually came in this set and provided the ink swatch: YOU ARE AWESOME!!

I own Totally Tangled: Zentangle and Beyond and Time to Tangle with Color.  The item description on this particular book says that there are 20 pages, and of those 20 pages, page #1 is the front cover, and page #20 is the back cover. It is bound together with 2 staples. When I received this book, I felt that it was more like a booklet. I definitely had the expression of "uhh... really??" on my face even though I was alone in my apartment when opening my package.14 tangles of the 40 are just different types of leaves. THAT was disappointing.Pages 4-11 are what the 40 new Zentangles are on. I'm not impressed with the tangles. There are "variations" to most tangles as an extra step that can elaborate on the tangle, which is something I do like about the book.On pages 12-17 there are examples of different ways and settings that that the tangles can be used in/as. There are also instructions on how to do some of the projects that are shown, which I think is cool and inspirational. I like page 13, it has circles featuring some tangles from the book (and some not in the book) and how different supplies can be used for different effects. I could have acquired the inspiration from Pinterest or something for free.

I've never bought a 12 x 12 paper pad online before. I prefer to see things like this in person to judge whether or not I should buy it, some paper pads have only 5 pages you love, and the rest gets put away and forgotten. Another reason why I was hesitant to get this online was because you can't see the WHOLE page(s) to see what they look like, only snippets. I prefer to look at paper as a whole. This is one of the only paper pads where I love almost every single page.The paper in this pad fall in-between the medium weight and heavy weight category. There are 48 pages, you get 2 pages of each design.I like to do paper piecing, like cutting out stamped images and layering them. The designs are wonderful. Instead of having just a repeated pattern throughout the pages, it has variations on each page design. It simulates mixed media, and there is the appearance of  depth with various complimentary things like crackle effects,watercolor effects, faded text that looks painted over, worn watercolored flowers with a subtle crackle over it, things like that.I love that if I stamp an image over a part of a page, cut it out, and stamp the same image in a different part of the paper (and cut out and add something to the first stamped image... an example is a stamp of a hat with a bow, I stamp on 2 different parts of the paper and on one stamp design I cut out just the bow and layer it on top of  a whole stamped image)  I'll still have coordination with different, complimentary, subtle differences that make it pop a little, on the same pages or different pages can compliment well too.If you are into mixed media-like designs, like subtle worn looks, and are looking for something truly different than other pads out there, this would be it.

EDITED ON JUNE 16TH 2015I repurchased this journal because I wanted to see if the quality had changed since March of 2014. It has significantly. This journal (which I had purchased from Amazon both times) can finally used and holds up to the same expected quality of the large journal. Both the large and small journals take Dylusions paint beautifully, and can even handle using spray inks on top of the paint. In fact, I (re) purchased this last month and it's almost full already. Thank you Ranger! Now on to the cover. The cover that they'e using isn't as smooth as the older journals, they definitely have a texture to them. This journal and the last 5"x8" both of the elastic bands broke on me in the same spot. I don't think it's me, because the larger journals don't have a problem with that. What I decided to do was paint the elastic black, then took the Elastic Loops by Tim Holtz Idea-ology, 6.5 Inches, Pack of 10 Loops, Black, TH93141 hitched to the old elastic so I have the elastic problem fixed.ORIGINAL REVIEW FROM March 5, 2014I concur with others about being disappointed.I'm a big fan of the original Dylusions Creative Journal (large) so I decided to get this one too. Most of the time I like to work in smaller notebooks.I find there is significant bleed through, so I can't  use the backs of the pages I do. So if I do a 2 page spread, the backs of both sides are unusable. If you so use ink sprays, or even plain water, it will be ruining your work on the other side. It's so wasteful.What I've been doing is using other paper (Bristol smooth 300 series) to do my things on then using washi tape (like if you were to insert pages back into the journal; a technique that Dyan Reaveley does) to insert in between the spread that has work done on either side so there's an extra page there even if it's not the same paper as the journal.You can use a little distress paint on the backs of the journal paper that has the bleed through from the other side.I own a lot of the Dylusions rubber stamps, and the images can take up a lot of space on a page(s) because they are on the larger side.

The instructions are on the back of the book. For me, the directions weren't specific enough. There is definitely a learning curve. I'm just now starting to get it on my 6th flower. There are 5 pages of each paper design.Merely just following the instructions won't give you the beautiful results that are on the cover and on the instructions in the back. It will take some finagling. It will take patience.Concerns I had before ordering:1. That the petals wouldn't have good enough perforation, causing the petals to tear and become useless2. Ease of extracting the rose petals from the paper3. The perforations not being “clean” enough and leaving behind ugly perforated bumps4. Crappy directions5. Having to buy an extra product that is suggested/needed that I didn't know about6. That the paper would be too thin/too thick7.The amount of excess paper left behind after the flower petals are removed from the sheet from the rose parts not being close enough togetherHow my concerns panned out:1. The petals do have good perforation2. I found it easy to extract the petals from the paper3.  The perforations are “clean” and don’t leave behind those ugly perforation bumps that often comes with paper that is perforated4. The directions are indeed crappy, and I have yet to find a tutorial (video or otherwise) online that can provide clarification on the instructions5. The instructions it says to use a kebab stick to roll the petals, but other than that there aren’t any extra things that you HAVE to buy to create the roses6. The paper isn’t too thin or too thick; the weight of the paper is good7. The petals are placed very well so there is minimal excess paper to wastePro Tip:*If you need to walk away from the project before you’re finished with a rose, make sure they stay together*Don't take out all the rose petal pieces off of a sheet at once. It’ll just make it hard to figure out which size of petals goes with which rose*There are vertical rows of the flower petals that go with each rose size*The top right hand corner of each page there are small petals for small roses

I'm a total Ranger enthusiast. These are great for a variety of techniques, search on YouTube to see all the ways that they can be used. They coordinate perfectly with the Distress Ink Pads. I did swatches of the Ink Pads and the markers and the colors were virtually the same.  There is a pen-ish side for writing and a brush end. The fine tip seems to have minimal bleedthrough with regular cardstock, but the brush tip bleedthrough will depend on pressure used and how many times you go over it.Pro Tip:-If you are using the brush end to color on your rubber stamps before stamping them, use the side of the brush, not the very tip or you will make it so there isn't a "tip" anymore. I know because I did it. So don't do that. It's instant sad.-If you are utilizing these markers with watercolor techniques, be prepared for it to have various kinds of shading/blending, or lack thereof, depending on your surface. Tim Holtz did a YouTube video on how the results of the watercolor technique vary on different surfaces, but the title escapes me at the moment. Basically, use watercolor paper if you're going to do that. I've found that Smooth Bristol 300 series paper also works great with the watercolor technique.

I ran out of one package of 12 x 12, so I purchased a second package. With some wet mediums, the backing will crinkle up and it takes some extra care to peel off the backing in such a way that the "sticky" part of the sticky back canvas stays mostly intact.Also, I've trimmed the canvas to 8 1/2" x 11" and printed out some images from my inkjet printer with awesome results!Pro Tip:Using Dylusions Ink Spray will make the canvas warp almost immediately, and the only way I've found to flatten it out again is to place something heavy on top of it (once canvas is dry) and sticking it to something; but carefully because enough of the sprays will have the aforementioned results of the backing separating of the backing and the sticky part. The backing may warp with the canvas, but the crinkling happens when you try to straighten it out.

I actually have a total of 13 pieces of Tim Holtz acrylic blocks; I had bought a small package to see if I liked them, then I bought the 9 piece package thinking that they would be of different sizes than the ones I already had, so I ended up having 3 pieces doubled. I would recommend just getting this 9 piece set.They do seem really flimsy, but seem to hold up well. Ballparking it, I've probably had these for a year and a half. I drop stuff constantly, so it's always important to me that things hold up well.They are easy to clean. If I get ink on them, I just wipe it away with an old t-shirt.One side is smooth, the other side have very slight bumps where the grid lines are, both sides are equally usable.Pro Tip:-When using a small-ish stamp, use one of the long-ish blocks placing your stamp at one end, and voila! You have a handle to press your stamp into the ink without getting your fingers inked up.-I don't think I've ever used the really small squares because personally I can't use them without getting ink on myself, the block, and some times even the outside of the stamp which shouldn't be inked. And most likely inking other things because I drop stuff.

These stamps are tiny, but beautifully detailed. I will stamp these in Archival Ink on Specialty Stamping Paper and use Distress Markers, or a craft nib to get ink from the Distressed Ink Pads onto my paper to fill it in with color. It looks great when you use a clear embossing pen and clear embossing powder over it after the ink is dry. They can be subtle, or you can make it a focal point if you're using a smaller surface. One technique I've done in the past was using leaf stamps/stencils and hanging the birdcage stamp from the stalks, and the birds randomly placed around. Another fun technique I've done is masking. For example, taking the teacup stamp, stamp it, put a mask over it (stamping it and cutting it out, and putting it over your stamped image so when you put other stamps on top of it, that mask will keep the stamps from overlapping) and stamping a clock with (LaBlanche) wings.These also stamp great with Distress Inks, it does capture the detail!

I bought the other (brighter) Glaze set a few months back and I absolutely love them. Unfortunately I pulled a stupid and left my cap off of the clear Glaze pen for a few weeks (I put my pens in a case), and I frowned when I went to use it and realized I had left the cap off of it. I couldn't find any open stock clear Glaze pens, and then I found these. I am a pen fanatic, I get excited when I get new pens, and since these had a WHITE Glaze pen AND a clear Glaze pen it was a no-brainer. I didn't have these colors. I have reviews on a few different writing utensils along with pictures of how they look from different angles on different kinds to paper, so I highly encourage you to view them. On the green colored pens, the one that looks darkest is actually the lighter green, and vice versa, so I highly recommend making a swatch; they don't come with the names of color on them either, so I made some up and labeled them (with a label maker, but you can always write it on a piece of paper and use clear tape to adhere it). It's a similar thing with the red and brown, they kind of look alike, but in good lighting you can make the distinction. They will take a bit to dry.I can't emphasize the love I have for the clear Glaze pen, it gives almost like an embossing effect, but without the powder mess that gets everywhere and a heat tool.

I love text stamps, text paper, just about any text that can be used in crafting and whatnot. Like others have said, this is a very delicate stencil. It is not easy to clean, even if you're just using spray ink. If you're using permanent paint, soft gel medium, matte medium ect. You must clean it right away. Because it is so delicate, I use dish soap and the yellow side of a sponge to gently press through the stencil while holding it with my other hand or at the bottom of my (clean) sink. A lot of rinsing too. If you try to rub it with the green scrubby side, prepare to have to pick out pieces of the green scrubby and possibly take part(s) of the stencil with it.That being said, I do love the stencil, I just don't use it as often as I would like because when I'm on a roll, I don't want to stop what I'm doing to thoroughly clean a stencil (if I'm using Dylusions spray, I spray the hell out of it with water on an old t-shirt and blot it dry).

I heard and saw a lot of good things about this tool, so I decided to pick one up. The one I got does not cut perfect corners, and I have to "chomp" it 5 or 6 times for it to go all the way though a normal piece of chipboard; and even more surprisingly it does this on a single piece of cardstock as well. Only 1 time out of 10 does it chomp on the first try. It's the same for both sides. I bought this tool because I've started a new venture of hand making the best journals possible. I wanted to be able to get round corners quickly with chipboard and maybe 3 pieces of paper at one time. I thought it was user error at first, but it's not. I really wish it was user error.You know what I'm using now? A Martha Stewart corner rounder punch. I've had it for about a year and a half and it still rounds corners as well as it did when I first got it; I've punched (approximately) 1,300 corners since July (same number of pages throughout the notebooks/journals I've been making). I still have to wrestle with this Crop-A-Dile to cut chipboard.

This brace is usable. I have really small hands (I'm only 5ft tall) so it fit when I used the velcro to it's maximum tightness. It's comfortable, and doesn't chafe my skin where the thumbhole is. It's soft, but I don't find this brace breathable. It's not thick or heavy, but it's not too thin. It looks like it would be breathable in the picture though, doesn't it?Seriously though, who is going to describe their product with the phrase "Is not breathable and will make you hot and sticky and consequently frown about it"?It took a few months for it to start getting noticeably dirty. I always take off my brace before I eat, before I go to the bathroom, when I wash my hands, when I'm cleaning, dishes, ect so it's just normal wear and tear. I do wear it throughout the day and all night except for the above events. Also, a week ago I noticed the Velcro to start to not work as well. It's like fabric Velcro or something. I've generally used the Futuro braces, and I do like them, but the one I have chafes my skin around the thumbhole a lot.Anecdotally, the whole "for women" crap is just that... crap. Marketing crap. If you're a dude and think that this would work, get it, it's gray and a neutral color.This brace isn't crap, but it's not great.

My husband needed white undershirts because his were old and not quite white anymore. Our anniversary was coming up, and we prefer to get each other practical gifts. They fit as expected, I got him a 5 XL. I didn't know this beforehand, but he loves the Beefy-T shirts. They are durable and breathable for him. When he needs new ones, I will definitely be buying these again!

I got these for my husband because most of the bags out here are girly and he didn't want to be seen carrying them out in public. It really is an easy fold bag. They are waaay bigger than expected, and that's a great thing! They seem to be very durable. Having them in the bag that comes with it is extremely useful. They are small, and I was worried that my husband would forget them and leave them in the house, forcing him to pay 10 cents per paper bag in ANY/ALL stores here because they made a plastic bag ban (which makes it extra fun to put your cart full of items loose in your cart and take them home that way because you forgot and are stubborn to pay the 10 cents like I am). The bag has a tie on it to keep the bags inside, and my husband uses that tie to hang it in the same places where he hangs his keys so he doesn't forget them when he leaves the house. Another reason why I'm happy I bought these bags was because ever since the plastic bag ban law was passed, the reusable bags being sold in the grocery stores got like 35% smaller for some reason.

**THIS REVIEW IS FOR THE SAMSUNG GALAXY S4 WHITE CASE**UPDATED ON MARCH 5TH 2014:My white case still doesn't "pick up dirt", but it is starting to have some discoloration. I work a lot with water based inks that can cause some staining on things here and there (skin mostly) and my phone is always nearby. The discoloration is minor, confined to the outside edges of the back of the phone case, and is transparent; the discoloration is only seen when looking close at it. My case has no dents, and there is only one miniscule scratch on the back of the case. The black silicone part has no cracks, no scratches, no tears. That still looks new, save for little specs of dirt here and here. There are no signs of the silicone wearing where the buttons are.UPDATED ON OCTOBER 17TH 2013:I have had this case for a while now. My white case has not picked up and dirt. There are no scratches, no dents, no discoloration, no stains. I was curious to see how long a white case would stay white. I think I speak for many when I say that white things don't remain white for very long. I've dropped my phone and everything is still good. I'm glad I got this case. The "lip" of the case where it curves over the sides toward the screen makes the perfect depth for the screen to not touch the surface that you put you phone down screen first on. I really can't believe, and pleasantly surprised, that my phone case is still as white and blemish free as the day I put it on my awesome phone.Original Review:Pros:- Perfect Fit -Stays on my phone the way it should -Doesn't slip around -White case is staying white and I've had it for a bit -Won't slide off a table -Looks bad ass with the white S4 -Buttons are protected -Buttons are still completely accessible; when I press them it responds like there wasn't a case at all. -The case doesn't interfere with the functionality of the phone. -All of the lights can be seen -Doesn't interfere with the camera or flash -Doesn't cover up the back speaker -The name of the case is small and unobtrusive; is a very light silver.Cons:-From the description, it sounds to me as if the charging port would be covered with a plug that you would put back in when not in use, but it isn't a con for me personally.*I intend to update this review if and when the white color starts to show signs of discoloration or anything like that to give more specific idea of longevity.You NEED to protect your phone, end of story. Especially if you paid the equivalent of a car payment for it. I've always been leary of purchasing things of the phone protector persuasion online. It's something I prefer to see and touch, you know?  I looked at the case in detail and did some tests to get an idea of how durable it was going to be. I drop stuff. All the time. This case fits perfectly snug. I don't foresee the case separating from the phone unless you have to do a battery pull.  You won't be able to get the case off easily but it's not impossible. Remember that it's kinda the point of having a case to begin withI have a huge purse. My purse is not dirty however. I have an inside pocket that I put my cell phone in so that I'm not digging around for it, but of course sometimes it will fall out of the pocket into the gaping hole that is my purse lol. I have two dogs and work with ink a lot, and there are no signs of wear and tear whatsoever. It still looks brand new. No spots, discoloration, knicks, it looks perfectly out-of-the-box brand new. It hardly adds weight to the phone. It feels great in my hand. It won't easily slide off a table like a flat plastic case would.

These pens are a really nice metallic blend with opaque color. It's not too over-metallic-y. I like the shine that it gives. What I'm trying to say is the metallic pens are really well balanced in my opinion. I'm very happy with the assortment of colors and how they show up on paper. The in stays pretty true in the paper tests I have swatched and posted here. You can write with these like you would with a normal pen, and of course doodle. One of the things I like best about these is the opacity of the pens, and that they somehow managed to make them vivid, but in a metallic-y way.The package of pens that I received write smoothly, don't feather, and the ink comes out perfectly.

is exactly my choice of words for this review. It's not that I don't like them, but I don't see myself using them a lot.Pro Tip: Don't expect to do any real writing with these like you would with other pens. You can spread your letters apart if you wanted to, but it can be a slow process.Pro Tip #2: If you do use regular paper or regular cardstock, don't expect these pens to give a 3-D effect. It really won't happen unless you layer the color on, even then not so much. They do take a few minutes to dry, but you can see the drying process happen. Using regular porous cardstock, the ink soaks right into the paper. They are nice, matte, soft colors, but in my comparison to the Glaze pens they don't raise hardly at all. I also tested them out on Ranger Inks Inkssentials Specialty Stamping Paper ATC's and got a more 3-D effect from the Sakura Glaze pens.Pro Tip #3: After waiting for the Souffle pens to dry, adding a Sakura Glaze pen (clear) Sakura - Glaze Pens 10/Pkg-Brights over the top of it gives an interesting result. Matte to Glaze!!

I knew I was going to enjoy and get heavy use out of the clear Glaze pen, but was unsure about the opaque pens in the rest of the package. I really love the effects of embossing powder. Using embossing powder in bound art journals (I'm currently using the Ranger - Dyan Reaveley's Dylusions Creative Journal) is a pain. For me, embossing powder is akin to sand... it ends up everywhere.These Glaze pens give an embossing powder-esque result. No bumps or pits or heat gun. They give a raised, glazed effect, but not quite like embossing powder. These are GLAZE and not shiny. Is there such a thing as semi-matte shiny? I am not disappointed by my purchase, and plan on using them as often as I can.Overall, I am happy with them.Pro Tip: Porous surfaces, like regular cardstock for example, absorb most of the ink, so you will get a more 'true' effect using something non-porous-ish. I did test them out on Ranger Inks Inkssentials Specialty Stamping Paper ATC's and got a more favorable result.Pro Tip #2: If you have Sakura 58350 10-Piece Blister Card Souffle Assorted Color 3-Dimensional Opaque Ink Pen Set , layering the clear Glaze on top of the DRIED Souffle ink gives an interesting result. The Souffle colors are matte, and these add a little bit of glaze to them.

I'm not an expert on chipboard/book board, but this definitely didn't seem like "medium weight" to me. It doesn't take that much to bend it. I was making a pseudo-notebook/binder to put cling rubber stamps ((Ranger Inks Dyan Reaveley's Dylusions Cling Stamp Collection Doodle Parts )) into using my CinchWe R Memory Keepers 71050-9 The Cinch Version 2, and the chipboard that the Cinch company  We R Memory Keepers Designer Book Board Chipboard, 8.5 by 11 Sheets is of significantly higher quality than this is. The chipboard WRMK is decent, heavy, can can put up with abuse.Back to what I was making.... I wanted something heavy duty-ish so I made front and back covers of my pseudo-notebook/binder using the WRMK chipboard, with this Grafix Medium Weight Chipboard adhered to the back of each of the covers (after decorating them with paper/embellishments) for extra reinforcement (and to hide where the paper is folded from the front side of the cover). It's done its job. I wouldn't use it for something that is going to actively be in use, or if you're planning on making a small little cheap notebook pad (like they sell at the grocery store or something), this would be an okay back cover for it.I read other reviews that suggested layering them... I would say do that if you don't want to waste money or return it. Or you can take gel pens and doodle on it.

I have most of the Distress Ink pads, and I love them and use them almost every day.This review is about the CLEAR EMBOSSING INK. I never gave it a thought because I thought that it would give a "Distressed" result or something. I went to online forums and brick-and-mortar stores and told them of my embossing woes. No matter what powder I used, what embossing ink, no matter the paper or heat gun, I *always* got bumps, pits, and general uneven embossing. I've always loved the embossing part and how it COULD look. I wanted as close to a glass-like finish as possible and I always got told that it's supposed to be  bumpy and uneven. I refused to accept this, I knew it would be possible, and I would find out how. That's where the scrapbook store came in. I shared with them my plight and that the only way I get what I wanted was using Colorbox pigment ink. My local scrapbook store suggested I try this Distress Clear Embossing Ink, and I did, and I wish I had found out about it earlier. By earlier I mean a year ago. My embossed images no longer have pits and bumps in them. When I use them side by side with the Ranger Inkessentials clear/black embossing pens and I amRanger Inkssentials Embossing Pens, 2-Pack, Black And Clear in embossing heaven.It was SO relieving to know that it was INK that was my problem, not me!

I've always loved DCWV papers. Especially the Matstack ones. I had been wanting the Mariposa for quite a while but couldn't decide on the size I wanted. The papers are beautiful! I'm glad I got it, and I'm glad I got it in Foil Marstack because I usually just go after the designs on paper anyway.

I was relatively new to Mod Podge at the time of purchase, and like another reviewer said, this set is perfect for trying out different ones without wasting money/time/materials and having a big bottle of something that is just going to sit there. If you're new to Mod Podge, definitely try out this set.Pro Tip:The sparkle one is REALLY sparkly.  What I did was thin it out a bit with matte Mod Podge. By itself, it's like semi-transparent. I love the sparkle one, but the amount of sparkle may not be necessary or wanted for some projects. So basically with the tip you could potentially get as much or as little sparkle your heart desires.

I love the little white light that this car charger has. I don't know why. Totally better than the classic red or green though. My favorite part is the fact that it takes USB cables! And two of them at that! This has been really durable for me. It seems like it wil last a long time, I got this like a year ago and still looks and acts brand new. Highly recommend!

These have saved my underwear. I prefer the skimpy kind, they're the most comfortable for me. I had tried other lingerie bag things in the past but they never worked right or my items got wrecked anyway. I've been using these for many months now and they still look and work like the day I got them. It's great to know that my underwear and bras and stuff don't come out of the washer wrapped around jeans or something that that bra hooks onto and rips apart.

I've always been a fan of Stampers Anonymous stamps, especially the ones from Tim Holtz. I love the designs and each stamp set really has infinite possibilities. They are deeply etched, and fit into the Advantus Binder perfectly. The downside some people may have is that on the actual grey clingy part of the stamp there is no design to see what it is if it's laying rubber side down on a table or something. You can tell which designs are which when you put each stamp "home" behind the cover that you see above that the cling part sticks to.To me though, having no design on the grey clingy part doesn't bother me at all, as I always keep them in my Advantus binder. As with most other cling stamps, if it's not sticky enough anymore, just take a soft paper towel or old t-shirt or something that is damp with water and just swipe it across the cling part and allow it to dry for a minute or two. Also make sure your acrylic block is clean by doing the same thing.

I have 3 other packages of Zig products, the scroll & brush, the calligraphy, and the writers markers. I love them all and use them almost daily. When I saw this package, I just had to order it. They have another package on Amazon that has less markers in the package, but if you're a pen/marker/writing with awesome materials fanatic like I am, go big or go home. And by home I mean somewhere dark where you will never see or experience the sheer awesome of these markers. If you're expecting a ton of glitter, this is not for you.  From my perspective, the "fine glitter dust" that they write on the box is accurate. You get the color of the marker and it isn't completely overrun by glitter.

I don't have a sewing machine, nor will I ever own one, but I think that this is a nice alternative. Remember to get the sew easy piercing mat We R Memory Keepers Piercing Mat, 7 by 12-Inch otherwise you will destroy your head and make the plastic points wear down in 5 minutes, learn from my mistake lol. On my package that I got my head in, there was NO directions whatsoever. Just basically what you see here on the front of this package and I had to figure out how to do it myself, no help anywhere online either...and keep in mind I don't sew and will never own a sewing machine.  Honestly though, it didn't take more than a half hour to figure out how to make the designs that I submitted for user images above. I found that I can do it in a way that was completely neat on the front, and completely neat on the back. I think trying to cover up the stitches makes things look lumpy and/or I don't like the feel of it. It turns out that I do like to have the back stitching visible because it adds to the whole, "Hey, I handmade this and this is how awesome it turned out. Oh, by the way, I stitched that b*tch. Myself."It would have been 5 stars if there were instructions and if the pokey things that are supposed to put holes THROUGH the paper, instead of making indents or not piercing the paper through. I have a Tim Holtz craft pick Tonic Studios Tim Holtz 372 Retractable Craft Pickso I just use that to finish the job. It works great too since the sew easy tool comes with BLUNT needles, which I absolutely love about it. A regular needle isn't needed, and wouldn't work anyway because you need to use floss (I use 6 strand floss that I've had for years and never used all of... the floss they make is SO expensive for what it is and nothing special. Get a package of 36 skeins of floss that YOU like instead. More colors, more length, less money spent in comparison for what you're getting.)

I stumbled upon this hole punch here on Amazon and it is perfect for what I needed it for, and it has a good capacity as well. It has a rubber bottom that not only keeps it from moving around, it stores your leftover "confetti." This is definitely a punch with a "comfort handle." I hardly have to apply any pressure.

I was searching for just a regular shaped heart with just a simple border with no words or crap on the inside. Believe it or not, it took a lot of searching to find just that. It sounds so simple, doesn't it? Just a plain heart, no detail.. I didn't care if it was acrylic, wooden, cling. I went to a few craft stores at the beginning and was like, "Why the F is this so damn hard to find?" Searched some scrapbook and stamping websites. No go. Of course, Amazon to the rescue. Still took a bit of searching though.In this stamp set, I saw the bottom heart and I was like, "YES finally!" The other 3 I love as well, the top one gets a lot of use. Good Quality.
There's quite a few corner rounders out there, so I went with the Martha Stewart brand because all of her other punches work perfectly and haven't failed me, even under heavy usage. I'm glad I did.

I saw this on sale here on Amazon, fell in love with the results in the picture and added it to my cart. When I got it I played around with it a bunch and I couldn't quite get anything to line up the way it should, there was always an extra space somewhere around the border. The corner punch was fine.So I read the directions and saw that"to create one continuous die-cut border, Punch your corners first and then then use the edge punch to connect the pattern from corner to corner using the guides printed on the tool's wings. Punches can be used separately"Just an FYI:"The page MUST BE A COMBINATION OF ANY TWO OF THE FOLLOWING MEASUREMENTS":4" , 6" , 8" , 10" , 12"Which isn't really an inconvenience, I'm just glad I know so that I don't end up making a card or whatever look like crap. (This is also my first border punch, so don't judge me monkey)

I avoided this because of the initial price, and the fact that it looks HUGE. I found that I was buying a lot of one of the little scotch dot roller things and was appalled at how much waste was happening with those refills having to do with the plastic. Yeah it was simple to pop open the casing where it says "push" take out the used up one and pop in a new one in 3 seconds...I took a closer look at this ATG gun, how long the rolls were, how long they would last me, and the amount of waste produced. In my point of view there isn't much waste, the ATG gun holds up pretty well (I drop things a lot), it's easy to use, easy to refill...but my favorite part is that if I get adhesive on something that I don't want it on, as long as it's not stuck between something, I can just roll it off with my fingers. Win.

When I first picked up perfect pearls pigments at a craft store, it was an impulse purchase. I didn't know anything about it. I followed the instructions on the back and followed it. When I was using it dry, it kept on rubbing off and getting shiny crap everywhere. Keep in mind I didn't know how to use them. After 3 days of playing around with it, I took it back to the store for a refund. About a week later, I saw a YouTube video that filled in the missing pieces for me, showing me a step that wasn't aware to be prior. I had a "Ohhh, THAT'S how you do it!" moment. I wasn't too keen on the colors of the powder that I returned to the store anyway, so here I come to Amazon.I love these colors, and love that I now know how to use them correctly. Unless you're using Distress Ink, it needs water to set it. Not a lot, just a spray or 3 with a mini mister. It's nice to have these stay on my paper and not all over my desk.

I love this cart, and I think it loves me right back. There's a place on top that is square and has little divider like things on it that reminds me of those plates that are sectioned off so your food doesn't touch, but without the plate. This cart is very sturdy... I have like 10 punches (in one drawer), 6 12x12 paper pads(in another drawer), a whole drawer full of wooden stamps, and a drawer FULL of all of my embellishments. The whole part that I can take out a drawer that has a sturdy, well made snap on lid is very nice. We have two 9 pound dogs, and one of them thinks it's cute to sit on my canvas bags that has my scoreboard, self healing mat, laptop bags ect. so naturally she thought it would be funny if she pounced and then sat on one of the snapped shut drawers that I had on the floor temporarily because I was in the middle of doing something. The top to that drawer didn't bend..crack..nothing. The first time she did that to one of my drawers I about had a heart attack. Well, she continues to do it, and fortunately she understands what "OFF!" means...which involves her jumping her little 9 lb butt off the drawer with her NAILS as a push off (like when swimmers push off the wall to get going). Not even a scratch, dent, nothing. She also likes sitting on my scrap paper when that drawer is open and on the floor (for my convenience, work space is limited sometimes).So yeah, sturdy and well made!Pro Tip: Put the heaviest stuff in the bottom drawer and work your way up with stuff that weighs less, I have had two occasions where I couldn't get a drawer out easily because I had something EXTREMELY heave above it (like my 10 Martha Stewart punches that I have in one drawer, for example). There are no "tracks" on it that you have to align the drawers with, just slide 'em in and out.

This review is for the ONE MODE VERSION.  I bought 3 of these lights and all 3 work great!  They are $3, so don't expect a $100 tactical flashlight with blinding light capable of signaling ships at sea during a squall. These lights are great for average, around the house illumination requirements.  They are plenty bright on a single AA battery, are pretty sturdy with a solid switch, and small enough to keep in a pocket, purse, or glovebox.  My shipment arrived in 11 days from the seller "One by One".  I am very happy with these lights and highly recommend them.  For those complaining about the light being less than 1,000 candlepower and not being compatible with a particular weapon platform, seriously, don't buy a $3 light next time!

I bought 5 of these lights to mount on the poorly illuminated sides of my house and have had them for a month.  I am glad I did!  The installation was simple.  I just drilled 2 pilot holes, screwed the bracket into the wood trim, and set the light onto the bracket.  The light is very secure once installed and can be easily removed if needed to use as a flashlight.  The lights turn on at dusk with just enough light to see where I'm walking and off at dawn.  When I walk near them they turn onto high and illuminate a large area which is great for security. They have all remained illuminated throughout the night and have never run out of power even on cloudy days.  For the price, they can't be beat.  My only suggestion to the manufacturer would be to add a mode that keeps the light off until it senses motion.

These were great for replacing my 60 watt incandescent bulbs in my ceiling fan.  The price of this 3 pack is cheaper than I can find at my local big box stores.  As others have mentioned, there is a very quiet hum when I turn them on, but it seems to go away after about 10 minutes.  I have cheap rotary dimmers in my house and they work fine with these bulbs.  The bulbs dim well, but be aware that they seem brighter when dimmed than incandescent bulbs because of the color of the light.  These lights at full brightness are slightly whiter than soft white incandescent bulbs.  When dimmed, these remain the same white color while incandescent bulbs give of an orange "fireplace" look.  That is fine with me but something to be aware of if you are new to LED lighting.  The best part is they definitely seem brighter than the 60 watt bulbs that I replaced which significantly brightened up our poorly lit family room.  I just bought 2 more sets.  If I find any problems with them, I will update my review

I am thrilled to finally be able to do chin ups while travelling at hotels.  These work great and I have had no problems with doors bowing or flexing at all.  My knees rub on my door, so I don't think I would use these at home regularly or I would probably see paint wearing on the door.  I use my regular bar at home for workouts, but this is outstanding for travel and weighs almost nothing in my suitcase.

Admittedly, I'm a novice with wireless cameras and was a little nervous about setting one up.  It was absolutely simple.  If you can install an app on your phone and plug a cord into the wall, you can set this up.  I have been using this for about 4 months now and it works well for my needs.  I love having the peace of mind of checking on my house and dog from wherever I am at any time.  Here's the big downside, the camera pans up toward the ceiling frequently by itself and stays there.  This causes the motion sensor to not pick up movement rendering the camera useless if you are using it for home security (I'm not).  There is no way of knowing this occurred until I open the app and see it is pointed at the ceiling and readjust it.  I have moved it next to my router thinking that would help but it didn't.Pros:1.  Very easy set up.  Install the free SightHD app on your device, plug camera into wall outlet, tweek app settings as desired. That's it.2.  Stores video and audio on microSD card.  No fees to use cloud storage.3.  Great image quality in daylight and absolute darkness.  Great video and still images if you want to save an image from footage.4.  Motion activation works well and sends notifications to my phone (when it stays pointing in the right direction)5.  Great WiFi connectivity across my house from the router.6.  Customer support was helpful answering questionsCons:1.  Instructions are fine for initial setup, but there is nothing explaining settings adjustments in the app. It is not very intuitive.2.  The app is a little clunky and basic.  Had to play with settings a lot and company had to help me activate push notifications.3.  Fairly expensive.  Purchased as a lightning deal for $79, but regular price is much higher than Foscam and other name brands.4.  MicroSD card can be easily removed by intruders if used for home security and your video is lost.  Try to hide it if possible.5.  Daily the camera turns up facing the ceiling all by itself which is a deal breaker if you're using it for home securityOverall, I am somewhat happy with it and would possibly buy it again (at the discounted price, not $149).  I was very happy with the initial easy setup.  I had problems getting the motion alert notifications, so here is what customer service said and it worked:  From the app, press "edit settings", press "settings", press "advanced settings", press "email setting" and enter your email address.  Then press the back arrow and press "save" in the top right corner.  Here's what wasn't clear to me... You need to go back to the main page, press "i" for info, press "notify", and enable the notifications.  It would be nice if there were instructions included or available online that explained some of this.  Hope that helped someone.

I bought this to replace my Asus tablet.  I have had it a week and have not experienced any problems, freezing, or bogging down (so far).  I was impressed with the condition of it.  There was not even a hint of it being a used/refurbished tablet, other than the sticker on the box.  Great price for a fast tablet.  The resolution is amazing compared to my Asus.  I charged it and immediately checked the headphone jack that a couple reviewers complained about, but it works great.  No problems with my microSD card either.  I love that I can plug it into a tv using my Samsung MHL adaptor to watch movies while at hotels.  You cant beat this tablet for the price.

I had a Smith sprayer before this that lasted a couple years and replaced it with this due to the cost.  I am very disappointed.  I have used it twice and the trigger pops off every couple minutes.  I can put it back on, but the plastic wears down a little each time.  The wand is also much shorter than others I have used forcing me to bend over the entire time I use it.  I would spend the extra $10-$20 and get a better made sprayer.
the story has an interesting premise and i was curious to see how it ended, but this is not the most developed or profound fantasy book. it lacks depth, becomes a little breezy, but is not boring.
Not a lot to say.  The price is much better than I find at sporting goods stores.  I checked the weight and it was almost exactly 40 pounds (39.7).  No complaints and I will order more soon.

I have had my watch for about a month now and I love it!  My wife does make fun of it and calls it my "dork watch", but it is really not that bad.  Setup was a breeze.  I turned it on, downloaded the Pebble app on my Droid, synced them, and was up and running in 5 minutes.Downloading watch faces was simple using "Pebble Apps" to personalize my watch, however, I found the selection to be lacking.  I decided to make my own using www.watchface-generator.de which was flawless.  In minutes, I selected a picture from my library and created my own watch face.  Other apps are available as well through Google Play, but Pebble actually released info that they will be creating their own app store in the first quarter of the year.  Another great app is RunKeeper which syncs flawlessly with the Pebble.  When I turn it on for my runs, it immediately displays my speed and time on my watch and records it to track my fitness goals.  Last but not least, the watch also syncs with my Pandora account allowing me to control my music without having to use my phone constantly.  Huge benefit when driving since I play my phone through my car stereo all day at work.Overall, this watch is absolutely a blast to play with.  The apps are great and will most likely improve over time with the new app store.  The watch looks pretty good (not too big and nerdy).  The display is easy to see in all light conditions.  The ability to display my contacts that call, text messages, and emails is a huge benefit.  The bluetooth connectivity works great and prevents me from missing important calls when I walk away from my phone up to about 50 feet away (I keep the ringer off).  Give it a try!

These anchors are definitely better quality than the ones I've purchased previously at large home improvement stores.  However, they still don't cut it for our hard Southern Arizona dirt.  I used 12 of them and gave up.  I could not get a single one to go more than an inch into the ground without bending.  I finally decided to just use 4 inch 16d nails which did the trick.  I am giving these anchors three stars to be fair because they are the best quality I have seen so far.  Just not good enough for hard desert landscaping (unless you need practice swearing).

I was a little skeptical when I purchased this because it was so inexpensive.  My doubts were completely unfounded.  The case really looks pretty sharp and it doesn't look like cheap quality by any means.  The Transformer TF700 fits in it perfectly and is well protected from small drops and somewhat rough handling.  The cutouts are all perfectly placed.  All of the ports are easily accessible, the speaker is not covered up, and the camera is not obstructed at all.  I also have the TF700 dock which also fits great while attached.  You really can't go wrong with this case.

This fan is like having my very own helicopter in my exercise room.  It definitely moves a lot more air than any fan I've owned.  That said, the massive amount of air that it moves is pretty loud and forces me to turn my tv/music up pretty loud to hear.  I am not complaining about it, but if you are worried about noise, look elsewhere.  The fan is made of aluminum so there are no plastic parts visible.  The base is sturdy and I have absolutely no movement or wobble when it is on high.  The cage has small enough holes that fingers should not reach the blades.  The fan works great!Wall mounting was a breeze.  It came with a pretty heavy duty bracket with two holes.  I screwed the bracket in to a stud with two 2" lag screws and it is very sturdy.  The fan rests inside the bracket and I can just lift it off the wall if I want to move it around the house.  It took less than 5 minutes from the time I opened the box to have it finished.I knocked a star off from the rating for 2 reasons. The fan arrived with one of the two locking buttons broken.  I can only lock one side of the base in place.  It isn't a big deal because of the way I mounted it, but I was disappointed with the cheaply made thin metal that arrived snapped in half.  The other gripe is that it tells you to use 2 lag screws (not included). Really? They couldn't spring for the extra 50 cents to include 2 screws? I instead had to wait a couple days until I had time to go to the hardware store before I could hang it.  Again, no big deal but a little annoying.

My lab immediately loved this toy, but within a few hours the claws were ripped off and so was the poor lobsters' head.  My dog is a chewer but I have bought other brands that can last him for months.  This one is just not very well made.  I purchased Kyjen Plush Puppies Water Bottle Buddy Dog Dog Toy and it is much better.  He chews it constantly and it is still going strong after a month.

I bought this for my 90lb lab who destroys most toys within a day.  This one has held up for over a month so far, and I just bought another one.  I also bought the ZippyPaws brand here on Amazon and it became a casualty within hours.  This one is durable and the water bottle can easily be replaced.  This is by far his favorite toy in the toy basket!

We adopted a 90lb lab recently that apparently was allowed on furniture in his previous life.  We tried everything to teach him to stay off the couches and bed, but he is a persistent bugger.  I was tired of piling suitcases, chairs, and stepladders on the furniture every day.  I was tired of my house looking like the Clampetts had just moved in.  Not only was it an eyesore, but he still managed to squeeze into little spots and sleep there anyway.  Of course he was ashamed of himself everytime I came home and found him there and had an adorable "I'm sorry" face, but he would be back up there as soon as I left again.  I bought 1 Tattle Tale to try before buying a bunch of them.  It seemed to work well for a week, so I bought 4 more.  He bumped into the couch the first day we had it, it beeped, and he walked away.  I have seen him walk up to the couches and inspect the Tattle Tales, but he just walks away everytime.  He has never jumped onto our furniture again in the last month.The Tattle Tale beeps loud enough to deter my dog, but it is not blaringly loud by any means.  I have one on my king size bed, two on my sectional, and one on each of my other couches.  I don't even turn them on most of the time now because he just leaves them alone when he sees them on the furniture.  I understand all dogs are different.  I have heard of some dogs chewing them up or burying them in the yard, but it definitely worked for my buddy.  He is finally using his plethora of dog beds we have bought him.Another cheaper alternative:  I bought Emergency Mylar Thermal Blankets (Pack of 10) to put on all of my furniture.  These emergency blankets are cheap and I wrapped them around my couch cushions and bed.  They actually worked really well at keeping him off the furniture.  Dogs typically do not like to lay on noisy crinkly material.  I just got tired of placing them on everything when I left the house.  I prefer the Tattle Tale for simplicity, but if you want something much cheaper, the emergency blankets did the trick too.

Ok, this is pretty expensive for a coffee mug, but it is by far the best mug I've ever owned.  I have put it through the paces.  First of all, this keeps beverages hot forever.  I filled it with hot coffee yesterday at 9:00am and brought it to work.  I forgot about it until 11:00pm and decided to drink it on my way home... Still HOT! I have never seen a mug that would keep drinks hot for at least 14 hours.  Secondly, I cannot get it to spill no matter how hard I try.  I shake it around and let it roll around the floor of my truck with not so much as a drop leaking.  I would feel confident with it in a backpack or purse, and it locks to keep the lid from inadvertently opening.The mug is very easy to clean.  All of the parts are easy to disassemble for washing and prevent funk from building up in hard to clean places.  This mug is incredible.  If I had to think of something negative, I would say the price is a little steep.  But you get what you pay for.  I also wish they made a larger size.  Then again, I could probably stand to drink a little less coffee and drink a little more water instead.

As a paramedic and outdoor enthusiast, I have used these and similar brands for many purposes.  First of all, I did receive 10 in a pack and have ordered them before and also received 10.  I am not sure why some people only received one.The blankets' uses are only limited by your imagination.  Yes, they work for emergency purposes if used correctly.  If you plan on buying these to warm you, you will be disappointed.  They are designed to preserve your body heat and prevent it from escaping.  They also keep the wind away to some degree.  Google them for more information about how bodies lose heat if you're interested.  I have used them a few times for medical purposes to prevent shock, but generally do not.  Nothing is better than actively rewarming someone with warm air and warm dry clothing or blankets.  However, these do help in a pinch if it is all you have. Ultimately, there is no replacement for proper planning when hiking/backpacking.For less than a dollar each, these have tons of uses. They can be used to cover furniture or as a drop cloth when painting etc.  I have used them as a ground cover while camping, but they are a little noisy and crinkly.  The best use I found recently was keeping my dog off my couches.  I adopted a lab and he wants to live on people furniture.  I cover the couches and bed with these and he stays off.  He does not like the crinkly noise and feel when he lays on them.  Problem solved!  Just buy a pack for $6 and keep them around the house, in the glovebox, and in your backpack.  Trust me, you will find plenty of uses for them.

There are enough reviews about how great this product is, so I'm not going to waste your time (Yes, it is great).  I just purchased Green Vibrance through Amazon and the product they are now sending is Version 14.0, which is the most current version as of 08/01/13.  Many reviewers have complained about receiving older versions in the past.  That is no longer the case.

I could not believe the price on these!  I bought these to replace my home alarm, smoke detector, and flashlight batteries.  They have worked great for a couple of months, including in my Surefire flashlight which I use daily at work.  The batteries seem to last as long in my flashlight as the Duracell batteries I used to use.  I am very impressed and will definitely purchase them again. This 10 pack costs about the same as 4 Duracells, and I see no difference in quality.

I bought this for my InFocus LP500 projector.  The cost from InFocus was $50.  I paid $15 with shipping for this one. This cable works exactly the same as the original.  This cable works for a variety of projectors that are not listed here.  If your model is not listed, look it up on the InFocus website.  If the InFocus cable has any of the same models listed on here it should work just fine.  The quality of the cable seems as good as my original and it works flawlessly. Thanks for the huge savings!

I have used this tool numerous times as a firefighter and it works flawlessly every time.  Prior to owning this, I used maglights and other tools to break windows, and it is much harder than you think.  It usually took multiple whacks and sprayed glass everywhere.  This tool just uses light pressure against the glass and is much less messy.  I admit, it is more "fun" to beat a window with a halligan, but this is safer.  Great compact tool to store close to your driver's seat so you know where it is in an emergency.  I carry one in my uniform, and one in each of my vehicles.  I have used the seatbelt cutter a couple times but typically just use trauma shears to do the job.

These rulers are much thicker than pocket rulers I've used in the past.  Heavy gauge steel.  The numbers are large and easy to read.  S.A.E. on one side and Metric on the reverse.  As other reviewers have mentioned, they are a little sharp.  I would not carry them in my pocket.  They are rulers, what more can I say.  Great price and top quality product.

I have used Bodum french presses for years, and it is the only coffee I like now.  I was tired of drinking hotel coffee on work trips, so I bought this.  It makes coffee just like at home and I love it.  The mug is well made and sturdy.  The lid fits nicely.  The seal is great between the mug and lid.  I get a little leaking from the drink spout if I shake it around, but not too bad.  Even if a little coffee sloshes out, it just goes back into the mug since the drink spout is recessed.  The mug keeps my coffee HOT for 2 hours and warm for about 5 hours.  The mug stays completely cool to the touch. The size is great and fits my cup holders nicely without moving around. The plunger and filter are great quality.  Very sturdy and easy to clean.  Makes a great non-bitter cup of coffee.Making coffee is a snap. Dump in a couple scoops of COARSE grounds, pour hot water in, stir and screw the lid on. Let it sit for 5 minutes and then depress the plunger.  You can pour cream/sugar in through the drink spout after you attach the lid if desired. Do not remove the lid after plunging to add things unless you like chewing your coffee.  I just swirl it around with the lid closed to mix it up.  Cleaning is easy even in a hotel bathroom sink.  Just like the regular Bodum presses, you can unscrew the mesh filter for easy rinsing.TIP: Make sure the filter screen is screwed on to the plunger tightly before pressing the coffee.  The filter can unscrew while screwing the lid on.  I had it detach once and it was not easy to get out of the mug (and you will definitely waste a cup of coffee).  As long as the screen is checked before you put the lid on you will not have any problems.

This inflator is top notch!.  Super small and lightweight to carry while cycling.  It's easy to use.  Just screw a CO2 cartridge on and you are all set.  You need to press the chuck onto the presta valve pretty hard to get a tube to fill.  The spring forces the little black piece on the back outward allowing air to flow.  If you have difficulty, you probably just need to push harder.  My wife had a hard time when she first used it, and thought it was broken. Now she loves it.  I carry one on each of my bikes with a couple cartridges. I only own presta tubes and it works flawlessly, but I have used it on my friend's schrader valve once and it worked just fine.

These socks are extremely comfortable, fit great, and have outstanding cushioning.  They are top quality and I have always loved Balega socks.  They really are the best running socks I have ever worn.  I actually ordered this pair by accident. They are a little too warm to wear for summer running and my feet get pretty sweaty.  They are probably great for colder climates, but I usually wear Balega Hidden Dry for running in AZ.  These socks are good but I recommend the Balega Hidden Dry if you are running in 80 degree or warmer weather.  They are cooler and much less sweaty.  Anyway, Balega socks rock!

These work extremely well.  I fastened the track into the wall studs easily.  I attached two bike hooks and an additional hook for a step stool.  It has withstood daily abuse for over a year and it is has shown no signs of pulling from the wall, even with my heavy MTB hanging.  I absolutely recommend these if you want more floor space. Super sturdy and easy to install.  I do recommend mounting a small piece of plexiglass/plastic where the bottom tires touch the wall to prevent scuffs as other reviewers have mentioned.

I am not a big fan of these boxer briefs.  They feel fine initially, but they start to bunch up in the groin after moving around for a while.  After they bunch up, they put a lot of pressure on the boys.  I have had a lot of pain a few times after wearing them all day.  The material is not very cool and doesn't wick moisture very well in the Arizona heat.  They tend to be soaked when I get home from work.  The waistband also rolls over which is not a big deal, but a little annoying. I finally threw these underwear away after the last time I wore them.I also bought a couple Champion Men's Tech Performance Boxer Brief.  I definitely prefer the tech ones after 6 months.  The tech briefs are much cooler and lighter weight.  No problems with them bunching either.  The ExOfficio Men's Give-N-Go Boxer Brief is my favorite though.  They feel great, stay cool and dry, and never bunch or pinch.  They are more expensive, but they are worth it. The ExOfficio briefs are the only ones I buy now.  I am slowly buying a couple at a time as I can afford them.

I bought this about a year ago to backup my computer occasionally.  It worked fine the first time I used it.  I was able to transfer all of my music and picture files easily.  I used it a second time about 8 months ago with no problems.  I tried to use it about two weeks ago, and it does not work now. I cannot get it to turn on at all.  I am past the warranty period, so I guess it is a loss.  When I used it, I plugged it in for the transfers and then unplugged it for storage until the next use.  I know hard drives can be hit or miss, but I expected it to last a while considering how infrequently I used it. This drive was probably plugged in for a total of 20 hours. I will probably replace it with a Passport.  Many of my coworkers use them with no complaints and they are much smaller.

I bought this to use while clicker training. It works great and holds plenty of treats for an outing. The drawstring pouch closes tightly and stays that way.  It clips easily to my pocket or waistband and does not move around much while jogging or playing with my pooch.  It also holds up well in the washing machine.  I have no complaints.

Let me first say, this is a great price for three clickers.  They work great and feel good in my hand.  People complained about it being too quiet, but I have not experienced that at all.  They are plenty loud for indoor use or a relatively quiet outdoor area.  If you are trying to train your dog on a subway platform, you may want a louder one.  There is not much else to say about the clicker itself.Now for the training.  I have never used clickers before, but tried it after reading a Karen Pryor book and information on the web.  I adopted a 2 year old boxer from a rescue and she had very little training or manners.  She was terrified to get into a crate, didn't know any commands, and has separation anxiety.  I was amazed how well this training worked.  I took a day off and decided to work on "crate", "sit", and "stay".  She initially would not walk near her crate at all. In one day, using baby steps, she actually wanted to be in her crate.  My wife came home and was stunned.  I said "crate" and she walked in immediately and layed down. Not only that, but she also showed off by trying to get into her crate when I shut the door. She isn't perfect about it yet, but there was a huge improvement in just one day.  The crate training is also slowly helping her anxiety.  She also sits on command very easily now.  I wish I could say the same for "stay", but we will get there.  Overall, I am completely sold on the clicker idea.  I was always raised to "train" an animal by yelling NO! over and over and sometimes giving swats on the butt.  This is not only quicker, but it is much less stressful and traumatic for the dog and the owner.  I am confident that yelling "NO!" would have just made her anxiety worse in a new home.  If you haven't tried it, give it a shot.  If you are already using clickers this specific set is a great value.  Take it from a beginner that experienced immediate results.

When my dad developed melanoma, I decided I needed to take better care of my skin.  I work outside almost all day in the AZ sun, and I have tried tons of sunscreens.  This one is definitely my favorite.  It offers great protection.  I never burn at all and many days I either forget to reapply or simply don't have the time to do it.  I put it on in the morning and it lasts all day even though I sweat like a pig.  Don't get me wrong, I still try to reapply it every few hours. This sunscreen is not greasy at all.  It applies easily and rubs in without leaving my face white. I love that it is dry almost immediately.  We get nasty dust storms here and I used to go home from work looking like a sugar cookie.  The dirt and sand does not stick to this at all. I love it!

Old Spice Swagger is terrific.  I wear undershirts daily at work and they always had crispy white armpit stains.  I switched to Old Spice and the problem stopped.  This deodorant also has a very pleasant smell that is not too overpowering.  It dries quickly and lasts all day outside.

This stuff is great for so many uses.  I frequently use it to sooth my sunburns when I forget to use sunblock.  Most people know about the many uses of aloe (bug bites, rashes, skin irritations, etc) so I am not going to beat a dead horse.  I primarily use this brand in particular to replace my hair gel.  I have tried various gels over the years and they all dried my scalp and some of them actually flaked.  It wasn't dandruff, but actually the gel flaking.  I learned aloe could be used, so I tried it.  It works great! No more flakes at all and I am sure it is much healthier for my scalp.  It is also cheaper than hair gel.  Look for it in the cosmetic aisle at Walmart for about half the price.
