They're short and relatively simple recipes, with the steps written in more of a paragraph format as opposed to a step-by-step list. There are desserts, drinks, and meals for both vegetarians and meat eaters alike. Crafts include Eggshell Plant Pots and Painted Garden Stones. These are largely family friendly and relatively easy crafts that are a fun way to spend the day. I'm not the craftiest person, so I was happy to see that these are things that (I think) I can actually do.The last chapter, "Rituals of Celebration" includes a ritual for a solitary practitioner, one designed for two people, and one designed for a group.All in all, I think this is a great place to start as a beginner, or a relatively quick way to brush up on things if you're not in the regular study habit. Reading this book made me request the next book in the series.I was provided a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.

I was really excited to read this book. I really like books that involve Japanese themes and culture. I also really enjoy fantasy. Plus on top of that, my father was (in his prime) a competitive ice carver. So I thought that this would be one that I loved. I enjoyed it well enough, but overall it was a really average read for me.I really liked the fantasy elements and how they were blended into the story. I also rather liked the writing style. It was very pretty and it flowed well to me, but it seemed a bit displaced. This book is for children, and the main character is a child as well. It came off as very adult- I don't know any children who would think or speak like this.This book was clearly written as a moral story, which is fine. But for me, this whole moral of being selfless was waaaay too prominent. It was blunt and forced in the reading, as opposed to letting the story unwrap the lesson to be learned from the story. It was hammering, to see the point of the story get across.The cover is absolutely gorgeous as well, and I think it is a fairly good representation of the story within its pages.This wasn't a bad book by any means, but it's not one that I'd read again. I don't have children, so I can't be a proper judge of how this story is received, but I think it may lend itself well to being read aloud and not for them to read on their own.I received a copy in exchange for my honest review.

I have to say, I think this is a great concept for a book. Most of the books that I get published by Cleis Press are fictional short stories, but this book isn't that kind of writing. This is a collection of scholarly articles, each written under the blanketed category of "sex". I'm currently in college and I'm getting a minor in Sexuality Studies. I can say with certainty that I will be citing at least some of these articles in my research in the future as I earn my degree.I'm not going to lay out all thirty-ish essays that are featured in this book (buy it and read it!), but I will talk briefly about some of the essays that I found the most interesting. One of these is entitled "I Am the Blogger Who Allegedly 'Complicated' the Steubenville Gang Rape Case- and I Wouldn't Change a Thing" written by Alexandria Goddard. As the title suggests, this as an article that reflects on the awful rape case that happened a few years ago, written by a blogger who had captured screenshots and tweets and posted them to spread some light on the situation of just how bad the case was. I'm pretty sure that there's not an adult or teenage American who hasn't heard of this case. It's fascinating to see the shitstorm unfold from such a perspective as Alexandria's, who was both praised and looked down on for her posting of content that the teens had willingly posted (rather stupidly) themselves to social media. I digress. Another essay that I found really interesting is called "When I Was a Birthday Present for an Eighty-Two-Year-Old Grandmother" by David Henry Sterry. Again, the title kind of sums it up, it's about the author's job, where he was hired as an escort for a woman's birthday. It's an interesting view of things, and you get an emotional and almost satisfaction hearing his story.This book is enlightening and brings a lot of unique voices to the table. It's definitely worth giving a read if you at all have sex- er go, all of you adults should read it. It's insightful and informative, and very smartly done. It's my understanding that this is the first edition of this, implying that there will be more. I definitely hope that's the case, because I think it fills a need that's lacking in modern publication.I received this book in exchange for my honest opinions.

I'll admit it to you here, the reasons why I picked this book up are more personal than anything. My girlfriend's name is in fact Emily H. I took it as a sign to read this one. In short, it's a cute, quick read that I think younger audiences than me would appreciate more.One of the big things that this book has going for it is the blending of realistic fiction and fantasy. It's really detailed and well-written as a realistic fiction. That is, there's a girl who is missing and a mystery to solve. Likewise, there's a clique-ish cast of girls who are mean bullies. It's a very real situation to believe, on the surface.But then there's Raine. Raine has these "sparkles" or little touches that were passed on through her family that allow her to see pieces of the past. She wants to use her gift for the greater good in order to help find out for once and for all what happened to Emily. This gift is a cool touch, but is one that I feel isn't very well explained. I got the overall concept and it works on some level, but lacked a bit of information. Regardless, it was this gift that gave this story a nice fantastical pop.There's also a little bit of romance, but I appreciated that it wasn't a main focus of the plot. It was sweet to read about though.This book tackles a lot, sometimes more than enough at once. Despite that overload, the theme of bullying in this book is an important and a clear one. It's a little sad how many books on bullying have come my way lately, but I understand their importance in the world. I've been Raine's age and it can be a nightmare. I think while it's dealing with tough stuff, the author keeps a good balance of serious and less serious, both of which balance well to create a well-paced, fairly cohesive story.I think that readers that are closer to Raine's age- that is, 8th grade- will really enjoy this one. It's got a well-written, well-paced story that deals with issues like bullying that are prominent throughout junior high. It has a nice blend of relatability and paranormal aspects, with a touch of romance and cuteness.I was provided a copy in exchange for my honest review.

4.5/5First of all, I have to say how much I absolutely love this idea. I'm a big fan of yoga myself and I think it's great that there exists a picture book series for young kids (and adults too!) to get started practicing it at a young age while maintaining a fun and safe atmosphere. This isn't a book I'd ever noticed missing in my life, but I can say that now that I know it exists, it's one that I'd definitely recommend to my parent friends and relatives who have small children.Let's start with the fundamentals: this is a practical but easy to use book from an adult standpoint. At the end of the book, there's a little guide that goes into a bit more depth about how each of the poses demonstrated throughout the story should be done, as well as tips for staying safe while doing them, breathing control, and communication with the kids.Now for the story part of the book. What's most striking to me about this book is the illustrations. They are simply stunning. They have bright, vivid colors that are perfect for springtime, and have this cool textured/layered look to them that I really enjoy. The illustrations of Rachel serve duel purposes. First, they highlight the story of Rachel's lovely spring day in the garden with her dog. Also, each time that Rachel is on the page, she is in a new yoga position. On each of these new pages, there is a bubble with the name of the pose as well as a highlighted word in the sentence of the story that best represents that pose. That key word is also correspondent to a color (like the yellow sun). It's a really simple book on the surface, but it teaches so much in a small space. It encourages fitness, imagination, and relaxation while simultaneously teaching the child about yoga and colors while also entertaining them with a story about a bright spring day. It's a pretty neat idea that is really well done, in my opinion.This is a book that I think any yogi, fitness fan, or even parent of a young child would definitely benefit from reading. This is, from my gathered knowledge, the first book of a series with each book representing a different season. I would definitely read more from Giselle Shardlow and can't wait to see the illustrations and poses in the next book.A copy of this book was provided to me in exchange for my honest review.

I was born and raised in the Midwest. Illinois, specifically, where even now in my adulthood is where I go to college and where I live. However, for a very brief time, I lived and vacationed in Massachusetts. This book made me homesick for the coast, even though I'm from the heartland. Each of the 57 recipes included in this book sounded absolutely fantastic, and had me wanting to book the next flight to Marblehead.At the front of the book, there's a nice guide on how to best use and handle the ingredients listed throughout this cookbook. This is an especially nifty little note, considering there are a lot of seafood chowders with ingredients that the average home cook probably isn't using each and every night (at least in Illinois).The recipes are very clear and concise, each one having numbered, step-by-step instructions. That makes this a really good book for beginners in the kitchen, because everything is laid out in a really helpful manner. There's also a lot of handy tips throughout this book, such as the 411 on mussels, and how to buy and clean clams. This is information that I wouldn't necessarily know off the bat, so I'm glad it was included. There's also lots of nice anecdotes and memories in this book, making it clear that the author is passionate about what she does. I also rather liked the "chowder wars" in this book, where different places claiming a better chowder were discussed.Each recipe also offers salad, side, or dessert pairings that are also found in this book, so the book is kind of a one-stop-shop for all your soup eating needs. There is a surprising amount of variety found in this cookbook, from fish to chicken, from shellfish to beef. There's something in here for everyone, whichever ingredient you may happen to favor. The book is divided by type of meal, so it's fairly easy to navigate to find what you're looking for. There's a lot of yummy looking pictures too, which definitely helps.As I mentioned before, everything in this book sounds awesome. That said, the dishes that I'm most excited to try include Dark and Sticky Candied Gingerbread, Day After Thanksgiving Chowder, and Northwest Salmon Chowder with Leeks and Peas.This book is a great burst of Americana, and I recommend it to any one who loves to eat soups and chowders as much as I do. Because of the detailed steps, I think this book is suitable to both experienced and beginner cooks.I received a copy of this in exchange for my honest review.

This bracelet is a really cute piece that goes perfectly with the Katy Perry Pearl MEOW necklace. Naturally, I had to buy them both together. This is a fake pearl bracelet with six silver charms on it. Four of them spell the word MEOW, and the "O" charm has a diamond in the middle for a little extra glam. Then surrounding the word meow is two silver heart charms. I really like this bracelet, especially when worn with the necklace. My issue is with sizing. I'm an adult, so it's a little bit more snug than I would like. It doesn't really hang lose much, so the charms don't get a fair chance to dangle. Other than that, I'm very happy with this purchase.

I adore this necklace. The chain length is adjustable. This is a fake pearl necklace with four silver charms on it, spelling the word "MEOW". In the middle of the "O" charm, there is a diamond for added bling to the silver and pearls. This is a necklace that I get complimented on all the time when I wear it. The only complaint that I have about this necklace is that some of the little "o" rings that keep the charms in place aren't closed all the way, so the "O" kept falling off, and the chain fastener kept coming off. This was nothing that a little bending with wire cutters couldn't fix, but still, be cautious about losing your letters.

I love, love, love this phone case. It is just as brightly colored as it appears in the stock photo, with a few gems adorning the back as well. It's made of a soft, silicon-ish material that makes it easy to slide onto the device. I've been using it on an iPhone 5c, and it fits just fine. It's a really adorable accessory that I get complimented on all the time. My suggestion, however, is not to put your phone in your pocket when you have this cover on. Because of the silicon/soft plastic, it is hard to slide it in and out of your pocket, and when you finally get it out it's covered in fuzzies that are a pain to get off. So heed that, and this is a perfect phone case for anyone with a sweet tooth.

This is the best body wash that I have used in a really long time. I'm not sure what it smells like, but it's really nostalgic for me. This body wash has a really clean, refreshing scent to it that lingers on the skin for quite awhile, without leaving that "I don't think I rinsed well" feeling. It's made my skin look healthier. I use it everyday, and I have absolutely no plan to stop using it in the future.

I really love this scent. It's really strong, and it easily fills a room while warming just one cube. It makes the house smell like freshly baked pies, even though you haven't even touched the oven. It's sweet with a nice, strong berry smell. This is really good for the fall, when everyone is baking, or for the summer because of the berries in this scent.

This smells like summer, in one tiny little wax cube. The cubes themselves are a very pale pastel yellow. They smell like tropical drinks and sun tan lotion, which makes for a nostalgic and familiar summer scent. The scent is strong, without being overpowering. There's a nice balance of coconut and other fruits, so the coconut isn't too overbearing of a note. I've been using this all winter long, to try and remember that it won't just be dreary and snowy forever.

This is my absolute favorite ScentSationals scent of wax cubes. The package describes it as "old time elegance", and that is completely accurate. This has a very antique smell to it. It's very, very floral and smells of an elegant vintage perfume. It's very nostalgic, and very VERY strong- you only need one cube of it to fill a room or two. It's good year round and not very seasonal, but is a very feminine scent. This is my go-to when looking at which wax I should warm.

I really like the overall concept of this pairing. The "Cheers to That" dual wax cube set includes five cubes of Mango Caipirinha and five cubes of Amaretto Sunset. I really like each of these separately, but together (as intended) I think they're a bit muddled and far too sweet. The Mango Caipirinha cubes are a light orange color and smell like a sweet and strong mango margarita mix. The Amaretto Sunset cubes are a tan color and smell just like amaretto. I much prefer the amaretto scent, but both of them have a nice smell to them. These would be good to use in the summer heat.

This is a great scent for the spring or summer when it's hot out, or even to warm in the winter when you're missing seeing green plant life and a warm sun. The scent is really strong, and there's a lot of different things happening that all come together really well. It smells like sweet grass and rain, with just a little hint of flowers. It's a really enchanting scent that lingers in the room pleasantly for quite a while.

I bought this scent because who doesn't love the smell of candy? The packaging is bright and enticing, and the cubes themselves are a pastel shade of pink. These cubes are very, very sweet smelling (as candy is) with no distinguishable fruits or notes. The closest scent that I could compare this to would maybe be pink lemonade. I like the smell, and I think it's a great summery burst of nostalgia. However, for me the cubes are just too weak. I used more than one at a time in my warmer, and still couldn't get the intensity that I get with other scents. So it smells good, I just wish it was a stronger scent.

The Ginger Peach Wax Cubes are a good scent to have around in the summer. They've got a very strong scent, but unfortunately for me, the only note I get is peach. I don't get any ginger at all when I warm this. If it had just been labeled as juicy peach or something, I'd be more happy, but as it stands now, I'm a little disappointed with how one dimensional this product's scent is.

The No Place Like Home Wax Cubes are a must have for anyone who loves fall, because this scent lets you have that one-of-a-kind autumnal scent all year long. They're pretty strong, only one cube in your warmer should do the trick. This scent is really nostalgic of falls in my childhood for me, which is part of why I love it so much. There's notes of spicy cinnamon and smokey fire in this scent, with just a hint of sweetness (pumpkin maybe?) If you love fall, this is the scent for you.

The Rainbow Fruit Wax Cubes have a really strong, tropical, fruity scent to them. You only really one cube in your warmer and it will waft through the room. It smells kind of sweet, almost like Popsicles. This is a scent that I'd get again, especially during the summer months when I'm in need of a nice, refreshing scent.

This is the first ever Living Dead Doll that I've ever received, and I'm really excited. This was a way better doll than I was expecting. I received this as a gift. Her arms and legs are easily posed, and while she is obviously fragile, she's not quite as delicate as I was expecting. (I mean, still don't give this to a little kid or anything, but you don't have to treat it like it's made of paper). This doll has soft pink hair and stitching over her mouth. Her outfit has a pale pink veil that matches a pink and black party dress with a black tulle flower on the hip, and lacey socks with pink Mary Janes. She comes with a party invitation scroll, and in the signature Living Dead Doll coffin box packaging (which I absolutely adore). She's equal parts creepy and adorable, and she's the start to what I hope is a new LDD collection.

I received this necklace as a Valentine's Day present, and I absolutely love it. I've grown to wearing it nearly every day. The crystals give an almost-rainbow range of colors of blues, green, yellow, orange and pink. It's a nice way to make the original silver kiss pop more, and because there's so many colors, silver included, it pretty much goes with anything. It doesn't irritate my skin as some other metals do, and I haven't had a problem with any of the gemstones falling off. It comes in a really pretty gift box, the bottom is black and the lid looks like it's been rolled in silver glitter. This is a great gift for anyone with a sweet tooth.  I get complimented on this piece all the time.

I absolutely love these cookie cutters! I got the Cursed Cookies Voodoo Doll cutters as a gift, and I love them. The outline is like a typical gingerbread man cookie, but it has details of seams on the hands, feet, and lips as well as a "sewn on" heart and button eyes. They take a little getting used to, but the overall point of them is really cute. They're best used with different colored frostings over the details, to better make the details pop on the cookie. They're one piece and easy to clean. These are great for any one on the Goth-er side of life (like moi) or for a Halloween party.

I got this plushie as a Christmas gift, and overall I really like it. It's a really big plushie, at 20 inches tall. I really like the detail put into her dress and outfit. Unfortunately for me though, her face was just really, really off looking. Like, if you didn't have the signature braid to go with it, I'm not sure that I would have known that it was supposed to be Elsa. It's pretty cute looking still, it just doesn't have a very Disney's Elsa-ish face to me, especially when comparing it to other plushes I have from Disney. It's worth getting for any Frozen fan, but it doesn't look exactly how you'd expect it to look, based on the animated movie.

I got these earrings as a Christmas gift and I love them. The gold is way less bright than the stock photo shows, which is a good thing for me because I don't like gold that much. The background of the logo is a bold green, with glitter in it to give it that extra sparkle. These are stud earrings, and aren't very big. They're a great feminine touch to any Packers game day outfit.

I received my unicorn plushie as a gift, and I absolutely love it. This plush is pretty small, I'd estimate about 5 inches or so tall. The coloring is awesome though, it's SO bright! The multicolored spots contrast well to the white fur, the horn is pink, and the mane, eyes, and hooves are all bright purple. This is my favorite Beanie Boo.

This compact mirror is absolutely perfect for any fan of Hello Kitty. I received this as a Christmas gift, and I absolutely love it. It's super sparkly, thanks to the diamond-looking gems that cover the kitty's entire face. Her signature red hair bow is adorned with ruby gems. I haven't had any problems with the gems coming off. This is a perfect gift. I carry it with me in my makeup bag, and I use it all the time. I'd definitely recommend it to other fans of Hello Kitty.

I got this mug as a birthday gift and I absolutely love it. The exterior of the mug is a slate gray color, and the inside is crimson. The mug is decorated with small illustrations, such as Poe himself as well as a mask and a mansion. Then of course, there are the quotes from his works in different shades of red, orange, and green. I really like the coloring, as well as the quotes that are included. I also really like the snark behind this mug that I found on accident. If you turn it over, there is a recommended tip that it works best when you're not holding it upside down, which made me snicker out loud. All in all, this is a perfect gift for any Poe, book, or horror fan.

Oddly enough, I got this Halloween decor as a Christmas gift, because it matches my gothic themed bookshelves. Overall, I really like this piece. It features a stack of three old looking books, the top one open to a page. On top of that is a skull, with a crow perched on top of that. What I wasn't expecting, when I was taking this out of the box, is that it lights up! The skull's eyes have LED colored lighting, which makes this statue a helluva lot creepier when your mother randomly comes into your room and flips it on without your knowledge. It's surprisingly light weight  considering it's a pretty tall statue. It's about a foot tall. While it's being sold as a Halloween decoration, honestly I think this is a great decoration for a study or library, and especially for anyone who enjoys Edgar Allan Poe.

I have an obsession with Hello Kitty, so I received these slippers as a Christmas gift. They quickly became my favorite pair of slippers. They're really soft and extremely comfortable. Because they're boots, they come up high which adds additional warmth. The pattern is of overlapping Hello Kitty faces with different shades of pink bows, and there's a light pink fluffy trim to the boots. The bottom of the slipper is a rubber, soft sole so that you can have traction and a little bit of support while wearing them around the house. I wear a size 8.5/9 and received these slippers in a size Large, which is for sizes 9-10. These are a bit big on me, so I think they run fairly true to size.

I have to say, this is one of my favorite mascaras. I got it in a standard black shade, and it goes on just as dark as I expected it to. As a good mascara should, it definitely fans out my lashes and makes them look longer. I really like the more rounded brush that this particular mascara comes with, I find it easier to work with and fuss with to get my lashes looking just right. The one complaint that I have about this product is that if you're not careful about what you're doing with the brush, it's pretty easy to clump and get the dreaded "spider lash" effect happening. It takes a little getting used to, but after that it becomes a piece of cake.

I love that Nyx cosmetics carries a line of colors that aren't considered standard for every day beauty and wear. I received this as a birthday gift, and I really like it. It's a dark teal color with a high pigment. I have paired it well with black lipstick. I didn't realize, however, until I looked online how bright Nyx is advertising this color to be. Maybe if you use a white or primer first. I didn't, and the lip color came out  darker than is showed in the product photo. I still love the shade that I got, but it's definitely not the exact same shade. It goes on smooth and doesn't need a lot of reapplications.

I am fussy when it comes to picking lip colors because I'm so pale. A lot of times, the pigment is way too dark or way too bright. I am absolutely in LOVE with the merlot shade of this matte lip color. It is the perfect maroon-ish shade. The application is a bit thinner than a normal lipstick, so if you're filling in full lips it takes a bit more effort than a normal sized lipstick, but it's not a major hindrance. If your lips have a tendency to dry out quickly, I would recommend a light clear gloss over this, as it can dry out. For me, this wasn't a big enough problem for me to stop using it or even for me to like it less. The pigment is strong, and it stays on for hours at a time, even if you're eating or drinking. It might just need a touch up every now and then. It goes on smooth and easy. I'll definitely be buying more lip colors from Lorac in the future.

I wasn't sure what to expect when I got this primer as a gift, but my surprise was definitely a pleasant one. This product does exactly what it advertises- it gives your skin a healthy, bright, "just cleaned" look to it that really does make all the difference when going through my beauty routine. It's oil-free, paraben-free, and fragrance free. It doesn't at all clog the pores, and it really has no scent (something I've been falsely promised before by other brands of cosmetics). You just need a little bit of this primer, so a bottle goes a long way. As someone with sensitive skin, this product doesn't cause any burning, irritation, or break outs. This is a must have for those who want just a bit of help with getting their skin to look healthier.

I received this foundation as a Christmas present, and I cannot be happier. Finding foundation is a fussy thing for me, because I'm so pale. It's really hard to find a "light" shade that is light enough. This foundation, in the NP1-Porcelain shade is absolutely perfect for my skin tone. It goes on really smooth and is easy to apply, and lasts for hours without reapplication. I have sensitive skin so I'm happy to say that this product doesn't at all cause irritation or break outs for me. I will definitely be purchasing more Lorac products in the future.

I got this Hello Kitty eye shadow palette for Christmas, and I'm really happy with it. The top of the palette is a metallic silver design with Hello Kitty, a red bow, and a red, white and blue heard in the corner. The palette itself pulls out like a little drawer with a red fabric bow as a handle. There are 20 solid eye shadows included. The pigment is pretty standard and easy to apply. The top part of the palette pops open to show a cute display of Hello Kitty having a little birthday party, which is absolutely adorable. This is a great gift and a must-have for Hello Kitty collectors.

This is one of the dolls that I received as a Christmas present, and I think she is the most unique of the dolls that I have. Avea is part harpy, part centaur. She has the bottom half of a purple horse. On the flank, there are lighter purple skullettes and polka dots. Each leg has a black bracer. She has a black harness with little horse shoes on it, and her tail is held in place with a black tie. The top half is harpy, her skin a lavender color. She has on a teal blouse with a pink and black shirt over it, and the black belt is attached to the harness. She has black and teal riding gloves on, and purple and magenta bracelets on her wrists. Her hair/mane is comprised of different shades of blue and teal. She has a black top hat with a magenta border and feather, that is strapped into place. Her lips are dark purple, and her eye makeup is rainbow colored and looks like butterfly wings. She comes with detachable wings that fade from black to teal. My only complaint is that I have problems getting these wings to stay into place.

I was so excited to find a comic book hero inspired line of Monster High dolls, and this doll didn't disappoint. Her purple hair is down, with a pink plastic headband in place that matches the pink "BAM!" comic bubble shaped earrings and the pink chain wings that attach to the collar on her neck. Her dress is one piece and is gray, black, and pink with silver trim and a silver skull on the front. Her belt is a wrapped set of a silver ball and chains. Her heeled boots are silver with pink designs, and a pink heel/platform. Her lips are a dark maroon color, and her mask is spray-painted on in a hot pink hue. Her wrists/hands and ankles/feet ombre from the white of her skin to see-through. I really like the way that hero and Monster High were blended in this design, and I like the pink and purple color scheme.

I really enjoy this doll. Her hair is purple and black, and comes groomed and down. My one complaint about this doll is that it becomes a rat's nest very, very quickly. Her eye and lip makeup consist of different shades of purple. Her dress is purple and black with ties up the front, and layered skirts. She has a light purple bracelet on her wrist. Her boots are black, and come to just below her knee. She comes with a cool trophy as well as a coffin shaped movie case. Plus, she comes with the standard Monster High doll hair brush and display stand. I really like the dark/Goth coloring of this doll.

I received this doll as a Christmas gift, and I adore it. My favorite colors are pastel pink and teal, and Rochelle follows this color scheme. Her hair is pink and teal, pulled back under a gray beret, with a fringe in front. Her makeup is also soft shades of gray, pink, and teal. Her dress is one piece, and the bodice is a pink and black pattern with pink lace up the front. The skirt is pink, and has a black Eiffel Tower on it, with ooze drips coming off of the tower. She comes in gray and black striped sheer tights, and a set of black and teal bracelets on her wrist. Her shoes are pink, swirly heels. She also comes with a gray and pink rolling suitcase, as well as the standard Monster High hair brush and display stand. Her wings are detachable, but stay in really well and snug.

I received this doll as a gift, and I absolutely love the details of this doll. Her body is molded differently than the other dolls- she's an actual skeleton. I thought this was a really cool touch. Her hair is black and orange, down over her shoulders. Her face makeup is blue, gold, and pink in the style of a sugar skull. Her dress is a black halter, with purple trim, and then there's a brightly colored skirt over it. As for accessories, she has a tan belt and matching bracelet, both of which feature tiny skullettes in their designs. She has a bright orange statement necklace, and tan and lime green wedge platform heels. Because she's from the Travel Scaris line, she also comes with a pink and white rolling suitcase. I love the details here, and the bright colors of her skirt.

I received this doll as a Christmas gift, and I love it. I was pleasantly surprised by Abbey's skin. It's a gorgeous baby blue color, but I wasn't expecting it to have glitter in/on it, which gives her a great frozen look to her. Her hair is platinum with streaks of glittery, pink, and blue, and is pulled in a side pony tail. She has light purple eye shadow, which matches her ice crystal earrings and necklace. She has a blue ice crystal belt as well. Her dress has one shoulder strap, and the design is shades of purple, pink, and blue that resemble ice caves. There's a white fur trim along the bottom of the dress.  Her shows match the ice crystal theme, and are heels that are a pearly white. Of course, there is a matching blue icy purse. I was overall really impressed with this doll, and I love the scheme of colors that this Abbey has.

I received this Monster High doll as a Christmas present. I love the color combination on this doll, the hot pink and lime green go together to create a visually stunning doll that this online photo doesn't do justice! Her curls are blended pink and green, and the other sidecut is soft/flocked hot pink hair. This is the first doll I've ever gotten that had a flocked style buzzed hair cut and I think it's awesome. I really love that she's so detailed, that she has vines wrapped around her wrists and calves, and has adorable leaf-shaped ears. This doll comes with a little green seedling inside of a plastic coffee mug. My one complaint about this doll is that the mug has three tiny pieces- the lid, mug, and seedling- and I have difficulty in getting the lid to stay on tightly. This version of the doll does not come with a display stand or brush.

This is the first Monster High doll that I ever received. I got it as a gift, and it kickstarted my whole collection of dolls. This Draculaura is really cute, and comes looking stylish for her picture at school. She's in her trademark pink and black, and comes with a hard-shelled pink and black heart shaped hand bag. She also comes with a hot pink trapper keeper/binder and a Fearbook that includes stickers of all her classmates and is "signed" by all her friends. In addition, she comes with the Monster High standard hair brush and display stand. This is one of the more basic Monster High dolls that I own, but she's still very pretty and is what started my collecting in the first place. She is easily moved and posed.

I absolutely adore this doll. Everything about this Draculaura doll screams candy overload. She has soft rubber licorice strands in her hair, and her forearms, one pink and one black, match her hair. She comes with a pink little hard candy version of her pet bat Count Fabulous and a black licorice purse. Plus, the standard Monster High hair brush and display stand. This is one of my absolute favorite Monster High dolls because it's insanely detailed, and it comes with lots of small pieces. I wish that they would come out with more dolls in this sweet-loving style, because it's absolutely adorable and definitely eye-catching.

I couldn't resist buying this one, and I'm more than pleased. This doll is way more striking in person than the picture online gives it credit for. Her black skin looks striking against the hot pink of her hair and dress. She has silver metallic boots on, and honestly I wish that I owned them in real life. She comes with a microphone that attaches to her hand. Her dress is really pretty, but because of its length and the "shreds" that it has, it can be a pain to get it to lay right or stay properly in its stand. Yes, this doll does come with a stand. This is a great addition to any collector's shelf.
I finally get some VC as it now works with NBA 2K14!I'm only giving it 4 stars as it really isn't good for much other than getting free VC randomly and there's no mini games left for the platform.
Quick enough to handle Bluray drives and those drives just slide right in the front without any tools needed.  It has a solid construction and I couldn't be happier with the enclosure.
Great robe but, only problem is the ears don't stay out like that.  Everything else about it was cool.  :)

Let me say, I was going to pass on the new generation of gaming consoles because, these consoles simply don't match up well with most of the mid-level gaming machines on paper. However, having played every generation of Console from the Atari 2600 to the present, made passing up the chance to buy one on launch day hard to resist. So, I got the email notification that the PS4 was now on sale and I pulled the trigger.First, I'm not a hardcore gamer by any means and my consoles are reserved for platformers, sports games, and racing games with FPS and RPGs being pushed to the PC. To me, the console is supposed to be fun first and foremost and if for any reason it fails to live up to that billing then, it fails as a console. With that said, let me get right into my review.ENGINEERING AND DESIGNThe console is slim, the graphics are fast enough, and the design is really sharp.It is a pretty nice piece of hardware and it delivers some pretty nice image quality but, in terms of computing power, most mid-range computers with discrete graphics are as strong or stronger but, that's now why you would buy a console.  You buy a console for simplicity and convenience and Sony manages to do fairly well with the design in these areas.CONTROLSYou know, I never had an issue with the past PlayStation controllers outside of the fact that they were too lite and felt more fragile than they actually were. The PS4 Dual Shock controllers feel really good and have a decent amount of weight to them in your hand.The touch pad on the controller is a little awkward in that it serves a function but, it was almost like they added it as a me too kind of feature when they saw the Wii U controller (it is better than people give it credit for). I guess we might see more use for it in the future but, I've only used it for Escape Plan (Indy Title) killzone Shadow Fall (Awkwardly too I might add).The options button, does just what it says, it brings up a menu of features or options for every aspect of the system. It just works and I find no fault with this other than it is a rebadged select button.The share button, I'm dumbfounded by this button, yeah it is cool but, really??? All I can do is share on Facebook or Twitter with it! It's baffling to say the least as I don't see either of those as being the place where people upload videos very often. Where is the YouTube or Daily Motion options Seriously, it is confusing at best unless you're going to live stream your game play (Let's not even talk about the added uselessness of the poor quality videos it records or the HDCP Copy Protection even when gaming).This voice control isn't very good on this console.  First, you won't even know it has the option if you don't plug the mic in to the controller or connect the camera.  Second, there are all of like 8 commands and those only accept a limited number of variables.  Third, I often had to say PlayStation twice even though the mic was literally right next to my mouth!The controller is decent overall but, the voice controls are average at best.The one caveat is that the Xbox One brought Kinect Interaction with voice commands in many 3rd party titles ad those developers actually left them in the Game for the PS4 versions of the games and these do work well.INTERFACE  This is one area where Sony has learned from the PS3.They broke the settings, messaging, and other features off to their own section of the main screen and that works great for me.  This is a big plus over the previous generation.The biggest downsides appear to be in their decision making process.They gave you the ability to upgrade the drive so, you can put a 3 TeraByte drive into the machine but, all of your apps install to the center line on the console and that could honestly become huge and unmanageable (Even if the most recently used are in the front).  What makes this even more bizarre is the fact that this very line has a folder called Library but, do they put everything in there?  Nope, just the digital stuff!  Why?  Seriously, move all the apps to this folder and let us choose what's on the main screen!Another flaw is in the Battery Meter implementation.  When you first sign in to the console, yhe meter is in the upper right hand side of the screen and disappears...  After that you tap the PS button and WTF??? nothing happens??? You then learn you have to hold the PS button in, go all the way to the log out screen and you find the meter again but, it isn't in the upper right as large as day!!! Nope, it is now a tiny icon in the lower right near your name.  Not sure what they were thinking here but, this is poor design.LAUNCH GAMESThis is a big area where I feel like Sony dropped the ball as most games are only slightly above average and none of them (even to this day) will blow you away or make you feel like you've gotten your money's worth from the system.Killzone: Shadow Fall  This is pretty much a straight up FPS where the opening cityscapes look very cool but, the game isn't free roaming at that point so you can look but don't touch...  As you get further into the game some of the visual quality degrades fast (The flowing river looks like it is from the Quake 1 days before the Monster 3D).  For the most part, I've found the game boring to say the least even if it does look stunning in parts.Knack  This is a pretty much a hack and slash 3/4 overhead platformer and honestly it has gotten mistreated by the media.  The game is actually a lot of fun but, not as visually pleasing as its other launch siblings.  This game represents the realization that good looking does not always mean most fun and to me, I'm relearning this with this generation of consoles.Resogun  This was a PSN freebie and while it is cool, it is pretty much a copy of the Classic title Defender on Steroids so, if you liked Defender, you'll likely love this game.  I had some fun playing it but, like Defender, I never really got into it.PLAYSTATION NETWORKThe PSN has only a fraction of the servers that Xbox Live has and this was something I hadn't realized when I purchased the PS4. While this hadn't been a big issue since launch, it became a much larger issue with the opening of all those Christmas consoles as the past week has had a lot of lag when trying to play games online and even making a connection is sometimes a challenge.The plus side to the network is that you can use Amazon Prime, Netflix, and other streaming apps without having a membership to PlayStation Plus where as Xbox requires a Live Gold membership to even use those apps.Another benefit is the fact that you get free games that are yours as long as you keep a membership with PS+.Also, game sharing is a feature of the PSN network but, you have to login to the other persons console to download the games to it is kind an awkward sharing feature that isn't very practical.A PS Plus membership does allow up to 5 accounts to play games online but, only the primary member has cloud sync capability and this creates an issue when a company like EA screws up and writes all saved campaign data to the cloud.  With the Xbox Live, you everybody gets access to your Live Gold service and all of its features so, everybody gets the cloud on Xbox One.INTERFACEThe Sony interface is pretty straight forward and familiar to most.There are two rows of icons where the first row is pretty much set and it will always be the same regardless of what is installed on the system. The second row is where your library and games are stored and honestly, this row is kind of annoying because you everything you install forms one giant horizontal row of apps and games and that to me is out of control!Overall it is pretty simple to use, in some ways it is easier than Xbox One but, not in others.For instance, they gave you the battery indicator but, it appears one place when launching the system and another entirely when using the system, that's really poor for continuity if you ask me.CUSTOMER SERVICEHere's where the wheels fall off the console! The previously mentioned issues with NBA 2K14 are a big enough issue that I approached Sony for a refund as I bought the game on a digital download... Not only did they refuse to help with the situation, they pretty much didn't even see the connection between me buying the game from them and their level of responsibility with that.I spent a good 30 to 40 minutes arguing with the Sony Support reps and pretty much left with the resolution that they're never going to help me and I'm not going to buy another digital download from them!Sony Support angered me so much, I actually did sell the console about 6 weeks later and while this wasn't the only reason I sold it, it was a big reason why.Of course, on a side note, 2K finally reached out to me and told me they would give me all my VC back if I delete my player and start over. That stinks but, it is either that or lose the money and the fact that it took them 3 weeks to even acknowledge my request with no help from Sony at all leaves me questioning Sony's commitment to their customers and I will never buy another digital item from Sony and I'll be passing on Take Two games in the future.MISSING FEATURESFirst, I had no idea the console didn't support 3D Bluray when I bought it and I also had no idea that DLNA and even playback of movies or music from USB Media wasn't allowed either!Let me just say that both this and the Xbox One are incomplete consoles. However, this is a pretty complete list of things this console cannot do.*No YouTube uploading*No YouTube App #1 Video sharing service and no support at all.*No Google+ Support (this affects YouTube or it wouldn't really matter)*No Streaming or Playing of MP3 or MP4 files (not even from your PC or USB drive)*No Support for external hard drives at all at this point (most of the list comes from Sony)*No Sony Support for apps purchased from their digital store (so buy the hard copies)*No Ability to rename your online account (MS does this but, it will cost $20)*No Promoting a Child Account to an adult account, they get to start over*No Suspending or Resuming Games or Apps*No Support for 3D BluraySome of you might be okay without these features but, some will no doubt not like this at all.CONCLUSIONI'm torn between love and hate for this console and its creator. I really do love the console but, I really hate Sony right now and unfortunately, you cannot have one without the other.Overall, the lack of DLNA support, 3D Bluray, Removable Media Support, Poor Sony Support, Poor game library,  and a console that is even less complete than the Xbox One are all factors as to why I decided to sell the unit.Maybe some day I'll revisit this console again but, Sony has a real problem on their hands in my opinion because they have a console that lacks all the best features of their previous generation (and many of those from their competition).  I know most people say, that Sony is really focused on gamin and they had better be because the Console doesn't do very much else!What you really get here is a console that is focused on games and yet doesn't have a single game that would make you run out and buy it at the moment.  Sony is presently selling these units based on a spec sheet but, when people start to realize it isn't very fun, those numbers might just drop off pretty fast!I would say, pass on this console until they get more games out because, what they have now isn't worth it!

While I have this card and use it a lot throughout the year, I'm disappointed with two things...First, my payments always shows as posted to the account but, they take forever to apply it towards available credit and during the holidays that can be a huge issue!Second, there are tons of digital items and Amazon Payments services that I cannot use this card for an that's bizarre to me considering they're on Amazon and this is an Amazon card!Over all, it can be okay but, it is not without problems that's for sure.

Having watched the launch of the Surface RT I was very impressed by what Microsoft had done as they had just served the rest of the industry notice that they weren’t going to let their market share slip away without a fight.  I genuinely wanted this tablet and would have bought it if it launched within a week of the press event.The first big blow against the tablet came of course, when they immediately blew their big debut by waiting 6 months to launch the Tablet and by then, better and faster devices were just around the corner.  The second blow came when Microsoft announced the Tablet would debut for $499 without a keyboard and $599 with the Touch Cover.  Now they were in iPad territory with an unproven product and had given the lower end to Android.  The third issue arose when the Tablet wasn’t 100% optimized at launch and reviewers noted the poor desktop mode for touch use and the poor performance of even the more low end apps and games.  All 3 of these lead to a 900 Million dollar write off by the RT Division by Microsoft and a Holiday purge of the original Surface RT.I’m outlining the story because, like many, I was never going to pay $500 for this tablet alone when it essentially was very close to the specs of my $199 Nexus 7 and had a lower screen resolution.  However, I purchased one from the holiday clearance event but, this time, it was half the launch price and included the touch cover.BUILD The Build of the Surface RT is very solid with the magnesium casing and the Gorilla Glass 2 display features one of the highest quality builds on the market.  The kickstand on the back is solid and cleverly hides the Micro SD Card slot.DISPLAY The display is measured around 400 nits which puts it ahead of many of the tablets from last year but behind the current crop of tablets but, don’t sweat this as it is very bright and you will have no issues reading it in most lighting.The resolution is 1366x768 at 10.6” and 147.4 PPI so, it is on par with many of the previous generations’ displays but, has fallen behind the current generation.Overall, the display is plenty bright, has good Contrast, good color, and competes very well all around with many of the current tablets on the market and it pretty much hands the iPad Mini a butt whooping and even outperforms the iPad mini retina in many areas.  This one aspect says, to me, that $250 to $300 is the right price range for the tablet with or without the cover.FEATURES This tablet has many of the features that people want standard in such a device.  It feature, Micro HDMI, a Full-sized USB, a Headphone Jack, Stereo Speakers, a Kickstand, Gorilla Glass 2, Magnesium Body, Optional Keyboard Covers, XBOX 360 Wired Controller Support, Bluetooth, Wireless N, Quad Core CPU, 2 Gigs of RAM, and a Magnetic Power Connector.  It literally is a virtual checklist of pretty much everything you would want in a tablet at a price you can afford.PERFORMANCE This is really tricky because I have to break the kit in two to make sure I’m fair all around.  So, let me start with the Touch Cover…  It’s horrible and has very poor response as well as flakey output.  At first, I was very disappointed with the Surface and then I noticed that interacting with the display itself was very quick whereas using the keyboard was very frustrating!  I would soundly say the keyboard should get a single star and that’s only because it provides protection for the display because it clearly wasn’t much good as a keyboard. The Tablets performance on the other hand has improved greatly since its launch and Windows RT 8.1 hasn’t negatively impacted the device in any way.  Touch is very responsive, apps launch quickly and almost never show any slowdown at all from their initial speeds.  Overall, it is a solid performing tablet and probably the best Tegra 3 tablet on the market.BATTERY I’ve been on this tablet for hours at a time and I’m positive you can get between 8 and 10 hours from this puppy.  It really is very good in this regard and I’ve used it for everything from Amazon Prime Instant Video, YouTube, and Web Surfing, to Email, and Word Processing.SOFTWARE The surface RT came with Windows RT 8 and out of the box it was sluggish to say the least.  Apps wouldn’t update and it just seemed to be lagging at random.  Microsoft Office RT was a prerelease version and didn’t even have Outlook installed.  Needless to say, I was very underwhelmed with this aspect of the tablet but, after getting all updates and upgrading to Windows RT 8.1 the performance of this software has been pretty much bug free and works as smoothly as I expected it to at launch.By pressing WIN KEY + X on the desktop you can launch the control panel and run Windows Update to get all the patches as this should be the first thing you do and then you should go to the Windows Store and tell it to upgrade to Windows RT 8.1 as this is the only way to get the full release version of Office 2013 RT.WHY SURFACE? The Surface RT has had a bit of a bad rap and most people have been asking why Microsoft did this.  Well, the Surface RT allowed Microsoft to release a tablet that could compete with the long battery life of the other tablets and would give them a position with the cool running, low powered chips that were going into billions of smartphones and tablets.The better question might be, who is this aimed at?  First, it isn’t going to be the big gaming tablet as it is underpowered for Console quality gaming but, having Office built in and compatibility with all the hardware that Windows supports means this might be the ultimate tablet for students and professionals that need a laptop that can do real work for long stretches at a time.APPS Apps might be a challenging area for most people but, it isn’t as bad as people believe.  Sure there aren’t as many native apps for the platform but, it has an advantage that makes that less of an issue.  Internet Explorer is the full desktop version and has Flash built in so, this means the Tablet can play Hulu, Amazon Prime Instant Video, Netflix, and YouTube videos without the need for an app (there are native apps for several of these).  It also means that I can read Nook, Kindle, and Google Play Books right from the browser (two of the three have native apps) so, there’s no limit to the most basic access you would need and even social networking works fine straight out of the browser.OPTIMIZATIONS These should be done after you’ve upgraded to Windows RT 8.1 as they will reset if you do them before the upgrade.This first optimization pretty much guarantees that your system won’t be loading down the graphics subsystem with useless fluff.On the Desktop, swipe, on the touchscreen, in from the right and select settings, and then choose PC Info.  When the System Window opens up click “Advanced System Settings” and on the “Advanced” Tab of the System Properties dialog box, click the “Settings” button (Under Performance) and set the “Visual Effects” to “Adjust For Best Performance” and then Check the Box Marked, “Smooth Edges Of Screen Fonts” and Click “Ok” and then “Ok” Again.This second optimization sets the keyboard and touch response to a short delay so you’re not likely to run into a wall while typing.Swipe in from the right and select the Search” option.In the search box type “Regedit” and click “Enter”.When prompted by the User Access Control to allow the application to run, click “Yes”.Browse to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\TouchPrediction and set the following settings…LATENCY = 2SAMPLETIME = 2Then close Regedit and reboot the tablet.Honestly, these are minimal improvements as the tablet already performs very well so, don’t feel like you have to do these but, if you’re looking for any edge you can get then, they’re a quick boost.CONCLUSSION The Surface is everything I had hoped it would be when Microsoft announced it and now it is at a price that I am willing to pay (I actually paid it over the holiday weekend).  If you’re on the fence over this, don’t worry about it but, I have to caution against getting the kit with the Touch Keyboard unless it is included for less than the Tablet runs alone.  Seriously, well worth the $249 I paid for it and I’m very impressed with it.

I bought the Fire HDX after seeing Apple raise the price of their iPad Mini by $70 if I wanted the Retina Display model.PERFORMANCEThe hardware is top notch in that it is a very solid build and seems to run almost flawlessly every day!The power of the CPU/GPU are honestly impressive and make for a very nice performance bump over previous generations of the Fire as well as other tablets. I honestly think the iPad Mini Retina and the Fire HDX are in a performance class all of their own!DISPLAYThe screen is super sharp and has incredible contrast all around, color accuracy is very high but, the backlight does have a soft blue glow around the edges.Now a note from my Eye Doctor, Increased intake of blue light into our eyes has raised the percentage of people who have degenerative disorders with their eyes and they recommend Yellow Filtered Lenses to protect your eyes.  Research Macular Degeneration and Blue Light to see for yourself and keep in mind, this is not exclusive to the Fire HDX but, their decision to use Blue Lighting makes it worth mentioning (this has always been an issue but, mobile devices and increased use of computers make it a much larger issue).SOFTWAREThe interface of the software only has one feature that bugs the check out of me and that's the Carousel, everything else with the OS and apps actually works very well and I'm pretty impressed with what I'm seeing! Oh and Silk works great if you stop it from accelerating page loading because, it crashes often with that on.Mayday is also a pleasant surprise and I've used it a few times for some quick answers. It was way easier than googling the answers and even my Apple friends were really impressed with it.Another issue was that Amazon noted that you could now download Prime Videos to watch on the go but, they neglected to mention that it is only a small selection of movies that can be downloaded so you're forced to stream them and that creates larger issues with Battery Life (see the Battery Section).Not having a YouTube App underscores a larger issue with the Fire line...  The App Store is severely lacking and many apps don't run right on the new tablets (Dead Trigger is upside down) and side loading apps often leaves you with apps that either don't work or don't work correctly 100% of the time!  This is a real issue and you would think that Amazon would want to stress the importance of getting these apps to work right out of the box!The Interface also has support for posting to Facebook and Twitter but, no Google+ and I'm not sure why Amazon is so intent on being Anti Google with their devices.BATTERY LIFEBattery is decent for every day tasks like Facebook, web browsing, emailing, reading books, playing a few games, and watching an occasional video clip.However, streaming movies from Prime resulted in a Net Battery Life of 5 Hours and that's half what Amazon claimed!OVERALLNo YouTube and using a blue back light has left me rating the Fire as average and I honestly think Amazon might have made a mistake with this screens back lighting. Everything else about the tablet is spot on and well worth the money they charge for it.For the record, even though I consider it an average offering, it is the best deal for the money and sadly, the other offerings might actually be worse than the Fire (the Nexus 7 FHD certainly is far less stable as is the iOS 7 based iPad line).Okay, two more notes that happened to me today...1st, the Tablet randomly decided to reboot itself while I was reading an ebook and that's twice it has done this in the kindle App.2nd, While I was tethering the device just decided it was going to download a very large firmware update without telling me it was doing it and needless to say, before I realized it my monthly data allowance was done!  I guess the only consolation here is that it might have actually fixed the first issue!--------------------------------------------------------------------------------Update 11/25/13The latest patch from Amazon appears to have remedied the lockup issue and I'm very pleased with it.Since the locks were happening however, I purchased an iPad Mini Retina and honestly, I find the fire HDX to be more responsive and fluid overall and the display is noticeably more vibrant on the Fire HDX.

Love the game and the graphics look great on the Fire HDX but, the controls are the worst I've seen on any tablet or phone.  Literally, the right arrow barely works and the left arrow is too close to the edge to be comfortable to use.I was really hoping the game would be more playable as it works 10 times better on the Nexus 7 2013 and while the controls are better on the iPad that isn't up to the Nexus either...  However, the Fire HDX has the worst controls of the bunch, literally almost unplayable.

The future of RAM is going to be Quad Channel and this RAM has that covered.  It can function in Dual Channel as well so it works with current medium and high-end main boards.  As of right now the only Desktop Mother Boards that support this RAM run the Intel X79 Chipset.I'm currently using this in a Gigabyte Z77 based Mother Board.  The Z77 only supports RAM upto 1600 MHz but, the Turbo-Mode of the board allowed the Memory to top out at 1866 and honestly it runs very stable at these speeds.Good all around RAM and my only disappointment is that it wasn't available in 8 Gig Modules at a reasonable price.

Okay, I bought this card from Newegg because the shipping times from Amazon were 2 to 4 Weeks Out!  Newegg got it to me in time for the BF4 launch.PACKAGINGThis box was a big square block and really was unlike any Graphics Card packaging I personally had seen before so, it immediately sets itself apart.  Inside the box are two cables, several documents, a driver's CD, and the Card itself.INSTALLATIONThe card went in fairly easily with my PSU having all the required connectors but, it is a very large card and it actually is slightly loner than an ATX mainboard is wide.  The only confusing part is that the Dongles included are obviously there for adapting your power supply connectors but, one of the notes told you not to use them...  I was a little baffled by this but, I didn't need them anyway so, it was all good.Oh and the biggest issue I had with installation was the fact that I don't have an optical drive and I couldn't even find reference to the website on the enclosed materials.  It's okay though as it turns out they used the stock AMD Drivers so, you can get those on the website.BUILDThe card itself seems very sturdy and it features Dual Fans (Double D is Dual Dissipation) as well as Copper Heat Pipes to effectively manage the heat better.  The design appears to be really well done and I'm not sure you're going to find a much better build than this.One note however, I do give the Asus a slight edge as it has a back plate to prevent it from suffering any sagging of the circuit board as that has been shown to be an issue on the Gigabyte R9-280x boards and the verdict is still out on the XFX but, so far so good.PERFORMANCEI've only tested two games so far but, BF3 and Tomb Raider both maintained frame rates between 80 and 90 on their highest settings while running at 1080P and if the new Mantle API covers BF4 with the same grace, the Card has done everything I've asked of it.  Just played BF4 for several days now and this beast will run the game, on Ultra, around 55 FPS and these aren't even finished drivers!  I'm not seeing a huge difference between this and the GTX 770 though so, I'm not sure what good Mantle is at this moment.Ripped an hour and forty minute bluray at 7000 bitrate in 45 minutes using AMD acceleration and PavTube to create the MP4.  My Nvidia cards were always over an hour for this quality so, I'm very happy with this!*** Another note, I never had any heat issues with this card so, I'm not sure why others are but, I don't Over Clock the card so, that might be an issue for some.OVERALLThe card is very good and if not for the few niggles, which really are mostly unrelated to the actual card,  it is well worth the $309 I paid for it.  What you're getting from this card is GTX 770 Performance for a GTX 760 price and that's really bad news for Nvidia!*** One more note, this card is said to be supported by OS X without any driver injection or kext loading. ***

Fight Club is the chaos created by one man with a dissociative personality disorder and it seriously shows the potential for Mental Illness to pervert the world as we know it.The acting was great, I never cared for Ed Norton before this movie but, I really like him as an actor now.  Brad Pitt was cool, reserved and in control or, as in control as the man who wasn't there could be.  Helena Bonham Carter was Marla in a reserved sense but, she still managed to pull it off well.  Meat Loaf Aday as Robert Paulson had a small role in the film but, it was well played and well used to support the story.The screen play was decent but, it lacked some details that helped you understand some things in the movie.For instance, the Mechanic had a larger role in the book than in this story and he helped to explain mind of Tyler Durden as well as being the man who would attempt cut off Ed Norton's Nuts (which wasn't in a police station by the way).  Also, Marla has a series of boyfriends with serious issues and she not only thought the whole split personality was cool but, actually helped Ed Norton stay awake so Tyler couldn't take over his body.  Another point is the fact that the main character realized he had multiple personalities a little more than halfway through the book as the two met in passing, and then he spent most of the rest of the book trying to undo the damage that Tyler had done.  And finally, they left out the fact that Tyler instructed them all to cut people's nuts off if they made any attempt to shutdown Fight Club in any way, and this lead to threats against police chiefs and a fridge full of frozen testicles from people attempting to stop the movement.Overall, they did do a really good job with the movie but, I still recommend you read the book as it builds upon the story and you will actually get a pretty good sense of how the story would really unfold.So, with that said, if you haven't seen this movie yet, you've been living under a rock for the past 13 years and really need to climb out from under there!
Bought this for the wife and this was honestly the most used gift in my whole family!  We've made so many breakfast sandwiches with this and they are better than McDonalds sandwiches that's for sure!

So many features, brushes, pencils, markers, airbrushes, layers, and other options are included in this app.  I cannot believe how well this fits the tablet market and how much they're giving you for $5!My favorite tool is the Mirror Tool that lets you draw in one spot and it is mirrored on the other side.  I cannot tell you how handy this is for drawing repetitive items or balancing out facial features but, I wish it let you have more control over the tool as it only works in Landscape and only on the exact same plane that you're drawing on.I highly recommend this tool as this can easily do for artists what Photoshop touch failed to do for Photographers.

Act 1 Scene 1 begins with silence and within seconds the sound trumpets loudly with the force of Beethoven's 5th symphony. We see a French Warship leaning to one side and at least half a dozen ropes running from it when the scene cuts to prisoners righting the ship and pulling it into dry dock.The singing begins and surprisingly, Hugh Jackman (As Jean ValJean) does a decent job with his vocals and can actually carry a tune, "Look Down, Look Down" and a cut to Javert standing on the side of the docking bay starring down at the convicts pulling the boat into the bay.Within Minutes, Javert is up and man, I have to say I am starting to question the casting of Russell Crowe in this part. I cannot tell you what Javert was singing because Crowe's voice was horrible at best and easily the worst in the movie, so bad in fact that I wanted to mute the movie (but, I resisted).The scene finishes with ValJean getting parole for the rest of his life. He served 20 years, 5 of which was for stealing a Loaf of Bread, 15 were for running from the law.Scene 2 is ValJean realizing his past is following him but, he gets taken in by the church, given food, and a bed. He repays them by stealing most of their Silver and is rounded up by the police and returned to the Church where, the priest corroborates ValJean's claim that the Silver was given to him. Later in the scene the priest tells him that his soul was purchased for God by that silver and he is now a changed man. ValJean struggles with the idea that somebody holds that much value in him and uses the Silver goods to start a new life.Without going much further into the story, a whole series of connected events lead up to ValJean taking on a new identity, violating parole, being exposed and adopting a child with whom he takes on the run with him. The whole time is set on a burgeoning Revolution and his whole life is spent running from Javert (maybe if he stopped singing ValJean would have stopped running) and raising his adopted Daughter.The highlight of the movie comes with Fantine's solo (Anne Hathaway) and is really one of the most powerful performances I've ever seen. I honestly believe that Anne Hathaway was feeling very deeply when doing that take as there was a point when she seemed truly distressed and she is easily what put the movie over the top.The lowlight was clearly with the casting and there's no way, I would have even considered casting Sacha Baron Cohen in any role of this nature and yet they did! There was one scene where the Inn keeper was peeing into the wine bottles of his patrons, no joke and it really seemed awkward. Also, as soon as Crowe started singing I would have found a replacement in a hurry!The biggest surprise in the movie, Samantha Banks as Eponine. She has a fantastic voice and really shouldn't have been playing second fiddle to Amanda Seyfried (Cosette) as far as continuity goes.Did I like the movie? Yeah, it was a very good and solid movie but, the lack of french accents in France, some poor casting choices, and set design that seemed to peak early on left you with an incredible begining and an average ending.Is it worth watching? Yes it is but, I preordered the movie and now I know why it was only $14 as it was good but, failed to live up to the hype so, rent it first and if you like it that much, then buy it.It is really a 3.5 star movie but, I'm giving it the benefit of a 4.

Bought this to use for my custom Hackintosh build and it does not disappoint.  The hardware is excellent quality and overall very good for the money.The best surprise was finding out it has an mSATA connector on board so there is no need for cables running all over the tower.The biggest negative is that the board claims support for the fastest DDR3 RAM but never clocks it fast enough.As I said before, this is a fantastic board for a Hackintosh and even 10.8.3 automatically updated only requiring an update to the audio driver.If you want a full size board for Windows7, 8, or OS X, this is a great board and my only with would be that it had thunder bolt support but, you can't always get what you want on a budget.
If I had known about this when I started playing Jetpack Joyride, I would have spent the $1.99 as it doubles the coin count and that makes the whole game go a lot smoother!

Let me start by saying this review will have spoiler information regarding both versions of this movie.PLOTCommunists invade the USA and start an occupation while freedom fighters use guerrilla warfare to expel the enemies from their land.  The Plot for both movies is pretty much identical.SETTING1984 Version is set in the mid western town of Calumet Colorado.2012 Version is set in Seattle and Spokane Washington but is said to encompass Oregon and Washington States as occupied by the North Koreans.ENEMIES1984 featured Cuban and Nicaraguan aggressors attacking the USA after a communist Coup in Mexico...  Russians later joined in by attacking Alaska and pushing down through Canada.2012 features North Korea attacking two states while other agressors like Cuba and Russia attack California and the East Coast...  Again, the Russians join the assault later and provide Intel to the North Koreans.REVIEWOkay, as you probably already know this film is more like a Reboot than a Remake.First, we are supposed to suspend belief in the 1984 version and assume that a group of kids with no real military training were able to fight off the Cubans and Soviets...  In the 2012 version, the lead character was an Iraq war veteran who provided the training for the kids so that is a major improvement over the original movie.Second, we're being told that the North Koreans are a less formidable enemy than the Nicaraguans and Cubans when this simply is not true; North Korea has the worlds 4th Largest Army and they have Nukes!  Both movies had the main aggressor receiving Russian backing so neither has an advantage there.  Bottom line, North Koreans in Spokane is a hell of a lot more believable than Cubans in Colorado.Third, the first movie alludes to an eventual purge of the occupiers by Americans but, we're left with no details about how or who finished the fight.  In the new movie, they're joined by 3 Marines looking for a communications device that will be used to crack the encrypted communication of our enemies and we're given a lot more information about what is happening in other parts of the country.  We also see more and more people joining the Wolverines as the resistance grows and we have a pretty good idea who expels the enemies and how they do it.Fourth, Where are all the actors from the original movie now?  Of the two most notable, one is dead and the other killed the number 1 comedy on TV only to create a second rate version of the show later on.  Most of the other, we likely will never hear from again.  The new cast has a few that have already been in big movies and are likely to have decent careers...  It also features new actors who could have a very bright future of their own.  The bottom line is that neither movie has any oscar winners as of this time but, the odds favor the new group of at least having one.MISCONCEPTIONSThere's an assumption that the kids planned to get their food from Subway, and this simply is not true...  They ducked into the subway sandwich shop and didn't even realize they where they were but, upon realizing it they robbed the place for food.Another assumption is that their feature phone wouldn't work even though the power is out...  Again, this isn't true as the Grid is the only thing that is down, if it were an actual EMP device many of the cars would have had issues with their electrical systems as well.  What actually happened was likely a Cyber Attack on the grid as all the news articles leading up to the power outage discuss that as the #1 threat to America.CONCLUSIONThe old movie was nostalgic and a cult classic but, lets not try to paint it as the best film ever, it simply was not!  The new film is actually an upgrade in many areas and perhaps the North Koreans couldn't develop some type of Non-Nuclear EMP device or even get close to our shore line but, they are infinitely more capable of wreaking havoc than the Cubans were in 1984 (Sorry but, the Cubans couldn't blink without us knowing which eye blinked first).  This movie stands as a decent movie all around and neither the acting nor the story is as bad as many are making this out to believe.Here's a little piece of trivia for you...John Milius (who directed and co-wrote the 1984 Screenplay for Red Dawn) created a videogame called Homefront in which those invading America were the North Koreans.  Funny that he would see it as plausible but, some second rate reviewers and nostalgia buffs dismiss the idea huh?
